From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running near the 400 Metres.  When questioned regarding the tactics adopted on the Home Turn and the reason he improved to the inside of POCHETTINO, H Bentley stated that whilst his mount was travelling reasonably well at that point, he elected to improve to the inside of POCHETTINO to save ground on the Home Turn and also to provide his mount with some confidence improving between runners.  He said his decision to shift in was also influenced by the fact that this would have allowed him to follow CALIFORNIA DEEPLY into the event, a horse he had considered to be a fancied runner.  The Stewards considered the tactics adopted by Jockey Bentley in the circumstances were reasonable.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 150 Metres became awkwardly placed close to YEAH BUDDY and was shifted to that runner’s inside to obtain clear running.  Near the 100 Metres was steadied to avoid YEAH BUDDY which shifted in.

M L Yeung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference after leaving the 150 Metres (see SUNDAY’S SERENADE).  When questioned, M L Yeung stated that from a wide barrier he was requested to follow MY WISH in the event as it was anticipated to take up a forward position.  He said when YEAH BUDDY commenced well, he was able to comply with his instructions which resulted in his mount racing in a more forward position than it had at its previous race starts.
No report.
Shortly after the start was crowded.
Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  M L Yeung (YEAH BUDDY) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after leaving the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to  shift in, resulting in CALIFORNIA DEEPLY, which had improved to the inside of YEAH BUDDY, being taken in and crowding the running of SUNDAY’S SERENADE, causing SUNDAY’S SERENADE to be checked.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 22 September 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding approaching the Home Turn and the reason he elected to improve to the inside of HARMONY N HOME, L Hewitson stated that after being positioned behind HARMONY N HOME, when he felt that runner could not take him into the event as it was not a fancied runner, he elected to improve to its inside with a view to following FAMILY JEWEL and SOLID WIN which were in advance.  He said after improving to the inside of HARMONY N HOME, that runner commenced to improve into the event and when FAMILY JEWEL became held up for clear running and BLAZING WIND commenced to give ground, this resulted in OWNERS’ PRAISE being held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres at which point he was able to shift to the outside to secure clear running.  L Hewitson agreed that in hindsight his better option would have been to improve to the outside of HARMONY N HOME given his mount was held up in the early part of the Home Straight.  However, the Stewards found the tactics adopted in the circumstances were reasonable having regard to his explanation.

B Thompson (BALLISTIC WIN) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out, resulting in PRINCE ALEX having to be checked to avoid the heels of BALLISTIC WIN.  B Thompson was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 25 September 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. He also stated that he was instructed to endeavour to take inside runs towards the rail if possible.  He added making the Home Turn when positioned behind RIGHTEOUS ARION he elected to improve to that runner’s inside when RIGHTEOUS ARION shifted out after the 300 Metres.  He said soon after when placed under pressure REWARD SMILE responded well to his riding and as a result he was required to make a quick decision to find clear running which he attempted to obtain to the inside of NEVER TOO SOON.  He said when NEVER TOO SOON shifted in, he was then obliged to steady to avoid that runner’s heels and shift to the outside where REWARD SMILE obtained clear running approaching the 150 Metres. K De Melo pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see SUGAR SUGAR).

Bumped at the start.  K De Melo (NEVER TOO SOON) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of SUGAR SUGAR, resulting in SUGAR SUGAR having to be checked to avoid the heels of NEVER TOO SOON.  K De Melo was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 25 September 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount raced keenly in the early stages but nonetheless was disappointing in the Home Straight in that it failed to respond to his riding.  Trainer P C Ng stated that after having to be ridden along in the early stages to hold a forward position KA YING CHEER was disadvantaged by the pace of the event easing which resulted in KA YING CHEER racing keenly and losing momentum during the middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount from a wide barrier to go forward.  He said as a result ONE FOR ALL failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  Noted to be making an abnormal respiratory noise after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.

After the event, H Bowman stated that it was not the intention to lead the event.  He said after taking up a forward position in the early stages HELENE WARRIOR raced keenly and as a result set a pace in the middle stages inside of standard time which was not his intention.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the early stages got its head up when being shifted across behind GALVANIC to obtain cover.  After the 300 Metres became held up for clear running behind HELENE WARRIOR and near the 250 Metres shifted to the outside of HELENE WARRIOR to obtain clear running and made contact with GALVANIC.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start.  Leaving the 1500 Metres got its head up when being steadied to avoid ROMANTIC LAOS.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to find a position with cover if possible.  He said as a result in the early stages he elected to shift across behind ROMANTIC LAOS to comply with his instructions.
Shortly after the start was crowded by ROMANTIC LAOS which was taken in by I CAN when that runner shifted in after making contact with ROMANTIC LAOS.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early stages raced keenly and making the first turn shifted out.  Lay in in the Home Straight.

Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  Noted to have sustained a laceration to the left front leg after the race.
After the 200 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of GALVANIC to secure clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
Bumped near the 250 Metres.

Crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 150 Metres was checked when crowded between I CAN (A Atzeni) which, after being taken in by COMET SPLENDIDO, shifted in and away from that runner and HAMERON (L Ferraris) which shifted to the outside of GALVANIC.  Both A Atzeni and L Ferraris were reprimanded.  After the event, K C Leung reported that his mount would derive benefit from tonight’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, Y L Chung stated that his mount travelled comfortably in the run but gave ground noticeably in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of LOVERO, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, LOVERO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, Y L Chung reported that his saddle slipped to the right during the event, placing him at some disadvantage.  When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer P C Ng stated that the intention was to endeavour to follow the leader. He said, in his opinion, the improved performance of TEAM HAPPY was due to the horse being more mature this preparation and had also pleased him in its barrier trials in the lead up to today’s race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was bumped by HANDSOME BOMB which shifted out, resulting in ENJOY GOLF being taken wider.
No report.
No report.

Near the 1200 Metres, when being crossed by MEANINGFUL DRAGON (L Hewitson), was steadied to avoid the heels of that runner.  L Hewitson was advised to ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that throughout the early and middle stages of the event his mount raced fiercely and refused to settle and as a result was checked away from the heels of MEANINGFUL DRAGON for some distance near the 1000 Metres.  He said as a consequence AEROINVINCIBLE failed to respond strongly to his riding in the Home Straight.  He further stated that he had recommended to connections that AEROINVINCIBLE may be better suited by being dropped back in distance for its next race start where it will be provided with the opportunity to settle with a more genuine pace.  Trainer P C Ng stated that although the hood had been removed from the horse today, he believed its racing manners were due to it racing first up when being fresh.  He said having regard to Jockey Purton’s comments, he would now look to drop AEROINVINCIBLE back in distance for its next race start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied to avoid MEANINGFUL DRAGON when that runner commenced to give ground and shift out slightly.
After the event, K C Leung stated that it was not his intention to lead, but when other runners did not show intent to hold the front, JOLLY COMPANION led without being pressured to do so.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that whilst his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event, it would derive benefit from today’s first up performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Making the Home Turn raced tight to the inside of AEROINVINCIBLE.

After the event, M F Poon reported that on pulling up his mount coughed.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, VANTASTIC CHOICE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, L Hewitson reported that making the Home Turn his mount became unbalanced and then gave ground noticeably in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  As this was the second consecutive occasion that MEANINGFUL DRAGON had finished tailed out, the horse will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to race again.

No report.

During its preliminary, another horse kicked out towards SHANGHAI STYLE and did not appear to make contact with it.  Out of precaution, SHANGHAI STYLE was examined by the Veterinary Officer at the Start and passed suitable to race.  After the event, K H Chan stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position, but his mount failed to show sufficient pace to do so.  He added, in his opinion, SHANGHAI STYLE resented the kickback from the All Weather surface and he also felt that in the middle stages his mount may have been galloped on.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the event, Z Purton stated that despite riding his mount along in the early stages, it was not able to take up a more forward position which resulted in AMAZING FUN being crossed by SONIC BOOM in the early stages.  He said throughout the middle stages of the event AMAZING FUN was disadvantaged when positioned behind SONIC BOOM because of his mount not being able to improve into the event.  He added however in the Home Straight AMAZING FUN did not respond to his riding.  Trainer C H Yip agreed with Jockey Purton that AMAZING FUN was disadvantaged when unable to improve in the middle stages whilst behind SONIC BOOM.  He added that AMAZING FUN had pleased him leading into today’s race and had displayed no signs of any lameness.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right hind leg.  The performance of AMAZING FUN was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous win.  Before being allowed to race again, AMAZING FUN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

C L Chau (TOP PEAK) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 1100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of HARMONY GALAXY, resulting in HARMONY GALAXY being taken in towards CHATER GOLD, causing CHATER GOLD to be unnecessarily crowded for room and to be checked.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Saturday, 28 September 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  From the 450 Metres until the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.

After the event, M F Poon stated that his mount travelled comfortably in the early stages, but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  He added that BULB EMPEROR may not have appreciated the seven-day backup from its last start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the event, H Bentley advised that he could offer no explanation for his mount’s poor performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 350 Metres, when under pressure, blundered.  The performance of GET SET WIN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GET SET WIN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
As the start was effected bounded and lost ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Shortly after the start was eased when crowded by CALIFORNIA MOXIE which shifted in slightly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

Slow to begin.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount jumped only fairly and as a result he was obliged to make use of RUN YES RUN to hold a forward position as instructed.  He added after being held up in the early part of the Home Straight RUN YES RUN did not respond to his riding which he attributed to the use he had to make of his mount in the early stages to hold a forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.
No report.

After the event, K Teetan stated that after enjoying a good run in the early and middle stages, SANTORINI failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  Trainer F C Lor expressed disappointment with the horse’s performance and stated that SANTORINI may not have appreciated carrying top weight of 133 lbs.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Near the 900 Metres raced in restricted room between SKYEY BLUE and SMART ZIPANG, both of which shifted ground slightly.  As a result, CASHISCASH then raced keenly for some distance thereafter.  Near the 200 Metres was checked when crowded between PATCH OF COSMO (L Ferraris) which shifted in slightly and SKYEY BLUE (M F Poon) which, after being taken out by WORLD HERO (K De Melo), then shifted out and away from that runner after making contact with CASHISCASH.  Both L Ferraris and K De Melo were advised to exercise more care.  M F Poon was reprimanded and advised he is required to make a greater effort to show due care to his fellow riders in similar circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have a continuous displacement of the soft palate.
Raced very wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

Near the 250 Metres became held up for clear running behind CIRCUIT SEVEN and after being shifted to the outside of that runner continued to be held up behind METRO WARRIOR and as a result could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.

After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount, which was having its second race start, raced greenly when there was no other horse positioned to its inside and as a result lacked concentration during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.  Approaching the 300 Metres raced tight to the outside of ALMIGHTY KICK which lay out at that point.   Was then held up for clear running behind SUPERSONIC until approaching the 200 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.

After the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded by HOLY POWER (M Chadwick) which shifted to the outside of METRO WARRIOR to obtain clear running after being held up on the heels of that runner.  M Chadwick was reprimanded.

Bumped at the start.  After the 150 Metres was crowded.<23/9/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that SUPERSONIC had sustained a right front tendon injury after racing. Before being allowed to race again, SUPERSONIC will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

At declaration time, C Y Ho was declared as the rider of both ALMIGHTY KICK and SPICY SPANGLE.  It was established that C Y Ho had a firm commitment to ride SPICY SPANGLE.  As such, the Stewards permitted Y L Chung to be substituted as the rider of ALMIGHTY KICK.  For this declaration error, Jockey Ho was fined $2,000.  Jumped only fairly.

Jumped awkwardly.  When questioned, C L Chau stated that from the inside barrier he was requested by his connections to stay towards the inside rail so it was not positioned racing amongst or behind horses to avoid any kickback as the event was run during rain falling.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in its trachea and also found the horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  The performance of VIGOR ELLEEGANT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, VIGOR ELLEEGANT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
For some distance near the 900 Metres raced keenly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, H Bowman explained that his intention in the Home Straight was to follow TURIN STARSPANGLED.  He said when that runner did not improve as quickly as he had expected, he shifted to the outside of FLAGSHIP WARRIOR to obtain clear running near the 150 Metres to avoid his mount losing momentum at that point.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the event, A Badel stated that after being caught wide in the early stages and when the early pace of the event was run outside of standard time, he allowed his mount to stride forward and take up a position behind the leaders to avoid racing wide.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied when crowded by TURIN STARSPANGLED which, when racing keenly, was taken in by AWESOME FLUKE (A Atzeni).  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.  For some distance after the 200 Metres was taken wider by ILLUMINOUS (H Bowman) which shifted out.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.

Apprentice E C W Wong was found guilty of a breach of Rule 100(2) in that he failed to ride PACKING HURRICANE, 8th placegetter, out to the end of the race to the satisfaction of the Stewards.  For this breach of the Rule, Apprentice Wong was fined a sum of $10,000.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 200 Metres was eased to avoid BEAUTY LIVE which was taken out.  After the event, C L Chau stated that his mount travelled well during the running of the event but was one-paced in the Home Straight.  He added his mount would appreciate being stepped up in distance for its next start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Noted to have blood in its mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event, A Badel stated that his instructions were to find cover.  He said approaching the first turn when he felt the pace of the event eased, he elected to allow CHIU CHOW SPIRIT to stride forward which resulted in it racing wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  He added in the Home Straight CHIU CHOW SPIRIT finished the race off only fairly which he attributed to the horse not appreciating the "Good to Yielding” track conditions.  After considering his explanation and the sectional times of the event, the Stewards found the tactics adopted were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

No report.

Near the 800 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by LUCY IN THE SKY (K Teetan) which shifted in before being corrected.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.  After the event, H Bentley reported that although the horse has raced well on rain affected going in the past, it did not appreciate today’s "Yielding” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping was taken wider by STORM RIDER.
Bumped on jumping.

Approaching the 300 Metres improved into a tight run between STRATHPEFFER and HIGHLAND RAHY and as a result had difficulty obtaining clear running for some distance thereafter when it made contact with STRATHPEFFER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 300 Metres was bumped by MASTER MASTERMIND as it endeavoured to prevent that runner from shifting out.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that he was instructed from a wide barrier to take up a forward position to capitalize on the horse’s light weight.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued to Jockey Chadwick in that he was to ride his mount positively.  He added that he issued these instructions as STRATHPEFFER has raced disappointingly when settling back in the field, particularly where it resented the kickback on rain affected surfaces.  He further added that it would be his intention to continue to ride STRATHPEFFER in the manner in which it was ridden today.
No report.
No report.

After the event, B Thompson reported that his mount obtained an advantageous position during the running of the race, but did not respond fully to his riding when under pressure in the Home Straight and finished the race off only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the 400 Metres until approaching the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.

Slow to begin.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions were to take up a forward position, but RAGNARR settled further back due to it being slow to begin.

After the 1300 Metres improved to the inside of SMASHING EXPRESS as that runner commenced to shift in.  A short distance later was steadied to avoid SMASHING EXPRESS.  After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount was coughing subsequent to the race.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, FAST AS ROCKET will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.  After the event, Y L Chung reported that his mount did not appreciate the "Yielding” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The performance of FORTUNE COOKIES, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FORTUNE COOKIES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Briefly crowded near the 900 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded by SKY SONG which was taken in by WOODFIRE CHAMP (M L Yeung) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  M L Yeung was reprimanded.  In assessing the incident, the Stewards also found that SPEEDY CHARIOT had lay out during the incident and contributed to the interference.  M L Yeung pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in when not clear of SKY SONG, taking SKY SONG in across the running of SPEEDY CHARIOT which was checked.   M L Yeung  was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 16 October 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.   Sent for sampling post-race.

M L Yeung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see SPEEDY CHARIOT).  After the event, M L Yeung stated that he was not instructed to lead, but after commencing well and when caught wide in the early stages, he elected to allow WOODFIRE CHAMP to stride forward and lead the event.
Bumped on jumping.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between CHEER FOR SOUTH and DAN ATTACK, both of which shifted ground.  Making the Home Turn raced tight to the inside of SPEEDY CHARIOT as it endeavoured to improve into a narrow run to that runner’s inside.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running before being shifted to the inside of TATTENHAM near the 300 Metres.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After  travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between SKY SONG and HERO WARRIOR, both of which shifted ground slightly.  BEAU GOSSE then over-raced in the early and middle stages and for some distance after the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid DAN ATTACK. After the event, H Bentley reported that his intention was to hold a more forward position, but ALLOY KING failed to show sufficient pace to do so and as a result settled further back than intended.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Lay in in the early stages of the Home Straight when being shifted to the outside of KYRUS UNICORN to obtain clear running.  When being shifted out, the whip of its rider M Chadwick became entangled in his reins as he endeavoured to pull it through to his right hand.

Approaching the 500 Metres was momentarily crowded by KYRUS UNICORN which lay in before being corrected by its rider.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that approaching the finish of the event he became unbalanced in the saddle as he was pushing his mount out.  He said as a result he was unable to fully test JOYFUL PROSPERITY to the finish of the event.  Whilst the Stewards recognized the explanation that H Bowman had provided, he was advised, wherever possible, he should fully test his mounts to the finish of the event.  When questioned regarding the performance, H Bowman reported that his mount travelled reasonably well during the event.  He added that near the 500 Metres after being crowded by KYRUS UNICORN, his mount lost momentum and then took some time to respond to his riding in the Home Straight before finishing the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages lay in.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Bumped at the 500 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  When questioned, K Teetan stated that his mount travelled well during the event although a little keenly as it was first up today.  He said in the Home Straight YOUNG CHAMPION was not entirely comfortable on the "Yielding” track conditions and did not respond to his riding over the final 200 Metres.  Trainer J Size stated that, in his opinion, YOUNG CHAMPION would derive benefit from today’s first up performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The Stewards deemed the performance of YOUNG CHAMPION to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG CHAMPION will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that his mount was able to obtain a position with cover behind the leaders in the early stages where it travelled well.  He said in the Home Straight FULL CREDIT initially responded to his riding but over the final 200 Metres was disappointing in its finishing effort.  He added he could offer no excuse for the performance of the horse, particularly as it had pleased him in its track work and barrier trials leading into today’s race.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed he had been pleased with the horse’s work and barrier trials leading into today’s race and other than being up in grade he could offer no explanation for the performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FULL CREDIT was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, FULL CREDIT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, C L Chau reported that his mount would derive benefit from tonight’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer M Newnham stated that at its first up run at Happy Valley on 11 September 2024, COLONEL was disadvantaged by having to be ridden along in the early stages to obtain the lead.  He said tonight from a more favourable barrier COLONEL was able to find the front without having to be ridden along in the early stages to do so and as a result finished the race off much stronger.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was steadied away from JOY COMING.  DENFIELD was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.

After the 700 Metres was steadied when crowded between SIGHT HAPPY which shifted out slightly and JOY COMING (C Y Ho) which shifted in slightly.  C Y Ho was advised to exercise more care.  When questioned, C L Chau stated that from an inside barrier his instructions were to endeavour to hold a more forward position. He said after riding his mount along to comply with his instructions, EMBRACES did not appreciate racing amongst horses.  He added in the Home Straight his mount lay in and for some distance after the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind AEROINVINCIBLE.  He said after shifting to the outside of AEROINVINCIBLE passing the 200 Metres his mount raced in restricted room to the inside of DENFIELD for some distance thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the 100 Metres, AEROINVINCIBLE again raced in restricted room between JOY COMING and EMBRACES which shifted in and away from DENFIELD.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and raced keenly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when racing in restricted room between AEROINVINCIBLE which was taken in by EMBRACES and SIGHT HAPPY which shifted out slightly.

Sustained an abrasion to the right hock whilst being transported to the course, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  As the start was effected lowered its head and lost ground.  Before being allowed to race again, MULTISUPER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  A warning was also placed on the barrier manners of the horse.  After the event, L Hewitson reported that his mount was disadvantaged by being slow to begin and, in his opinion, is better suited around the Sha Tin circuit.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Crowded on jumping.  When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his mount raced ungenerously throughout the event.  He said making the Home Turn DOUBLE BINGO hung out and became awkwardly placed close to the heels of EVER SMART when DENFIELD shifted to the outside of FAIRY HORSE to improve.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to ensure that he found cover on his mount as FLYING HIGH only has a short sprint when placed under pressure.  He said after initially obtaining cover behind PHOENIX LIGHT, he was reluctant to remain behind that runner as he felt PHOENIX LIGHT is not a horse that would provide him with an opportunity to improve into the event.  He added as a result he continued to shift out towards the stand rail to follow CARROLL STREET as he felt that runner would provide him with a better opportunity to improve into the event.  He said when CARROLL STREET did not quicken as he had anticipated and shifted in slightly near the 400 Metres, he then improved to that runner’s outside whereby he was able to place FLYING HIGH under pressure approaching the 300 Metres at which point it commenced to finish the race off well.
Bumped on jumping.

The performance of STRIVE FOR GLORY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable. Approaching the 900 Metres when the pace of the event was being run outside of standard time PRINCE ALEX improved forward to take up the lead near the 750 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in to ascertain if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection on behalf of FOREMOST TEDDY being declared the 3rd placegetter due to PRINCE ALEX shifting out and making contact with that runner over the concluding stages.  After viewing the videos and when no protest/objection was lodged by the rider or connections of FOREMOST TEDDY, the  Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds to proceed with the protest/objection and therefore weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between SUPER BABY and BEAUTIFUL WIN.  When questioned, A Badel stated that his instructions were to take up a handy position but after being crowded at the start settled further back than intended.  He said entering the Back Straight when PRINCE ALEX made a forward move, his intention was to follow that runner into the race, however, when PRINCE ALEX showed superior pace, he was unable to follow that runner and as a result remained racing to the outside of SMART CITY.  He said when caught wide in the Back Straight he then elected to follow SMART CITY to avoid racing wide and without cover.  When questioned regarding his decision to shift to the inside of SMART CITY after the 500 Metres, A Badel stated that with the rail in the "C” position, he thought it would be advantageous to save ground on the Home Turn and when he felt TURIN WARRIOR would take him into the race, he elected to shift in and follow that runner.  He said when TURIN WARRIOR did not improve into the event as expected, CAN’T GO WONG then had difficulty obtaining clear running in the early stages of the Home Straight between TURIN WARRIOR and SMART CITY and as a result made contact with SMART CITY for some distance.  He added after obtaining clear running approaching the 150 Metres CAN’T GO WONG finished the race off reasonably well.  After considering his explanations, whilst the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Badel were reasonable, he was advised, in the opinion of the Stewards, his better option would have been to continue a run to the outside of SMART CITY which would have provided his mount with clear and uninterrupted running in the Home Straight.

Bumped after the 300 Metres.  Lay out in the Home Straight. No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 300 Metres raced in restricted room between LO PAN SPIRIT and GREENWICH which shifted in slightly.
Bumped on the hindquarters at the start.

Apprentice P N Wong (MASSIVE ACTION) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1250 Metres she allowed her mount to shift in when not clear of SOLEIL FIGHTER, resulting in SOLEIL FIGHTER being taken in onto PRAY FOR MIR, causing PRAY FOR MIR to be taken in across the running of SWEET ENCOUNTER which was checked.  The Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered her excellent race riding record.  After considering submissions in relation to penalty and Apprentice Wong’s inexperience in riding in Hong Kong, she was issued with a severe reprimand.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 200 Metres struck the heels of SWEET ENCOUNTER and blundered when SWEET ENCOUNTER, which was laying in, was steadied away from FORTUNATE SON (B Avdulla) which shifted out slightly.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.  In assessing the incident, the Stewards also established that MASSIVE ACTION was laying in which prevented Apprentice P N Wong from being able to shift out to avoid SWEET ENCOUNTER.  Apprentice Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 1250 Metres (see SWEET ENCOUNTER).  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by HEROIC MASTER which shifted out and away from MIDORI GLORY.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Crowded shortly after the start between RED ELEGANCE and ETERNAL FORTUNE.  After the event, C L Chau stated that his instructions from a wide barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.
No report.
Raced very wide and without cover from after the 700 Metres.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  Trainer M Newnham stated that, in his opinion, YOUTHFUL SPIRITS was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead by ALLGREEKTOME and races best when able to dictate terms without being pressured.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  The performance of YOUTHFUL SPIRITS was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUTHFUL SPIRITS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Making the turn near the 1000 Metres, when racing ungenerously, was steadied when momentarily crowded between BRAVE WITNESS and MATSU VICTOR which shifted out slightly when it made the turn awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Bumped at the 250 Metres.
No report.
Crowded at the start by SUPER UNICORN which shifted out.

Near the 250 Metres was bumped by COURIER MAGIC and became unbalanced as COURIER MAGIC raced tight to the inside of ROCKET SPADE.  When questioned, C Y Ho stated that from the inside barrier his intention was to hold a more forward position to take advantage of the gate.  He said whilst MATSU VICTOR travelled comfortably throughout the event, it failed to respond strongly to his riding in the Home Straight.  He added, in his opinion, MATSU VICTOR may be better suited by being ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages to allow it to finish the race off.  Trainer K W Lui agreed with the assessment of Jockey Ho that MATSU VICTOR may not have appreciated being ridden in a more forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event, A Badel stated that, in his opinion, SERGEANT PEPPER may not have appreciated being stepped up in the Class 3 company tonight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M F Poon stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position, but not to make use of his mount to do so.  He said when BITS SUPERSTAR began only fairly he elected to settle further back than what it had at its previous race start.
Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (colic).  Before being allowed to race again, O’LINER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to lead tonight.  He said after travelling well in the lead, GALLANT CROWN was disappointing in its failure to finish the race off and he could offer no explanation in respect to its performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in on jumping and became unbalanced when it bumped with GALLANT CROWN.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of BRAVE WITNESS, a last start winner, was considered to be disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, BRAVE WITNESS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
In the Home Straight lay in, resulting in its rider B Thompson having to stop riding and straighten his mount on several occasions.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.   Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when awkwardly placed close to the heels of DAILY TROPHY (B Thompson) which shifted in as it was being corrected by its rider B Thompson.  Whilst the Stewards accepted B Thompson had stopped riding and straightened his mount, he was advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to make an effort sooner than what he did on this occasion.

For some distance near the 450 Metres raced tight to the inside of SMART LEADER when it obtained a narrow run to that horse’s inside.  After the race, M Chadwick reported that his mount began only fairly and after being ridden along in the early stages did not travel well during the event.  He said in the Home Straight SUPER JOY finished the race off fairly and did not appear to appreciate the loose surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER JOY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that over the concluding stages he did not continue to ride his mount out as he was concerned that REGENCY HAPPY STAR may shift in towards his mount.  Whilst the Stewards accepted that REGENCY HAPPY STAR had shifted in towards DIAMOND SOARS, they were satisfied that there was still comfortable racing room for Apprentice Wong to ride his mount out to the finish notwithstanding this fact.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of Apprentice Wong, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.

Noted to have blood at its mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event, Z Purton could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Slow to begin.
Bumped at the start.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

K C Leung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see COLOURFUL WINNER).  After the event, K C Leung reported that from the outside barrier and an expected lack of early speed, he had been requested to take up a forward position preferably with cover.  He said in the early stages he was obliged to continue forward and race outside the lead to attempt to comply with his instructions.

Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.   K C Leung (LIFE OF STONE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of COLOURFUL WINNER, resulting in COLOURFUL WINNER being checked to avoid the heels of LIFE OF STONE.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 16 October 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

Bumped shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  When questioned regarding the performance, A Badel stated that at its first race start when settling back in the field POCHETTINO was aided by a faster tempo in that event.  He said as today’s race was being run outside of standard time throughout the early and middle stages POCHETTINO had difficulty making up ground in the Straight but also would appreciate being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that as the start was effected his mount lunged forward slightly which resulted in HAPPY HUNK bounding on jumping and losing ground.  He said as a result HAPPY HUNK settled further back in the field than what had been intended and this was the principal reason for the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY HUNK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and was bumped.  In the early stages raced keenly and from the 1000 Metres was left racing wide and without cover.
Withdrawn on 27.9.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore).  Before being allowed to race again, HARRY’S HERO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the 200 Metres was held up for clear running between LIFE OF STONE and COLOURFUL WINNER which shifted in slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover in the early stages.  After the 600 Metres was taken wider by POCHETTINO, resulting in SEA AIR LEGEND being obliged to race very wide and without cover thereafter.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after the start was bumped by FLYING DRAGON (A Atzeni) which shifted in, resulting in SHANGHAI STYLE then having to be checked to avoid COSMO NAVIGATOR (Y L Chung) which shifted out slightly.  Both A Atzeni and Y L Chung were advised to exercise more care.  For some distance near the 500 Metres was unable to continue to improve when racing tight to the inside of SONIC BOOM which shifted in slightly.
No report.
On jumping was crowded by JOLLY COMPANION which shifted out.  In the early stages raced keenly.

After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead by JOLLY COMPANION and as a consequence did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to hold a midfield position.  He said in the Home Straight SONIC BOOM did not respond to his riding and may not have appreciated the loose surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Had its right hind plate replated in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

When questioned, A Atzeni stated that his mount jumped well and after travelling a short distance he was obliged to make use of his mount to hold his position.  He said FLYING DRAGON did not travel well thereafter and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FLYING DRAGON, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FLYING DRAGON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Briefly held up for clear running near the 400 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in in the Home Straight, resulting in its rider H Bentley changing his whip through to his right hand approaching the 150 Metres.

After the event, M L Yeung stated that with his mount stepping up in distance today and drawing an inside barrier, he had been instructed to take up a more forward position than previous race starts.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  From the 400 Metres until approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.

Bounded on jumping and lost ground.  Approaching the 1200 Metres, when being shifted across behind runners, became unbalanced when positioned close to the running rail.  Then continued to race ungenerously for some distance thereafter.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by MAJESTIC COLOUR which shifted in after being bumped by TAKE ACTION.  Approaching the 200 Metres was disappointed for clear running between VIVA GRACIOUSNESS and ACE POWER which shifted out when giving ground.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer K H Ting stated that at its last start on 14 July 2024, he had been encouraged by the horse’s improvement when blinkers were applied.  He said this preparation, he had also been pleased with DEAL COMPLETED’s barrier trial on 10 September 2024 and as DEAL COMPLETED is a one-paced horse and was stepping up to the 1400 Metres, he had instructed H Bentley to go forward.  He added DEAL COMPLETED was also assisted by being able to lead the event with the pace being run outside of standard time in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

When questioned, C Y Ho stated that his instructions were to endeavour to ride HAPPY DAILY with cover in a midfield position as his mount races best when ridden this way.  He said HAPPY DAILY jumped well today and as a result held a forward position in the early stages.  He said after travelling a short distance he looked to see whether he could obtain cover behind runners to his inside, but when unable to do so, this resulted in HAPPY DAILY being caught wide and without cover.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to go forward to avoid racing wide and without cover, having regard to the pace of the event being run outside of standard time, C Y Ho stated that he had ridden HAPPY DAILY in this manner previously and HAPPY DAILY did not finish the race off strongly.  He said for this reason he elected to remain racing wide and without cover to give his mount the best opportunity of finishing the race off.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 150 Metres was momentarily crowded by MY FLYING ANGEL which shifted in slightly when giving ground.  After the event, A Badel stated that his mount was disadvantaged by the pace of the event being run outside of standard time in the early stages and would be better suited from a wider barrier draw so that it would be provided with more comfortable racing room.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, Z Purton reported that his mount would derive benefit from today’s first up performance.  Trainer D J Hall stated that whilst NORTHERN BEAST had trialed on two occasions leading into this event, it had not been asked in those trials to do too much work.  He added he agreed with Jockey Purton that NORTHERN BEAST would derive benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages of the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that after racing outside the leader SUPER FORTUNE, when that runner was placed under pressure from the 450 Metres to improve into the race, BOTTOMUPTOGETHER lay out and also came under pressure itself.  He said as a result he elected to continue to encourage BOTTOMUPTOGETHER to improve past SUPER FORTUNE as his mount continued to be under pressure, particularly with its top weight of 135 lbs.  He added after improving past SUPER FORTUNE near the 200 Metres, he then commenced to fully push his mount out near the 150 Metres before drawing the whip as he passed the 100 Metres.  He said when placed under pressure with the whip BOTTOMUPTOGETHER showed little additional response to his riding although it continued to do its best to the end of the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Passing the 400 Metres was shifted to the outside of POLARIS to obtain clear running.  After the 300 Metres shifted out, resulting in its rider M L Yeung having to stop riding and straighten.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

After the event, A Hamelin reported that from a favourable barrier today he was able to obtain a more forward position than its last start.  He said ELEGANT LIFE travelled a little keenly in the early stages and he recommended to connections that ELEGANT LIFE may be better ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

When questioned, A Atzeni stated that in the Home Straight when positioned tight to the outside of AWESOME TREASURE, HAROLD WIN lay in towards that runner which restricted his ability to use the whip behind the saddle.  He said as a result he used the whip down the shoulder of HAROLD WIN on a number of occasions in an attempt to prevent it from shifting in whilst continuing to encourage his mount to win the event.  A Atzeni was fined the sum of $7,500 for using the whip on a number of occasions forward of the saddle in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Shortly after the start was steadied to avoid UNIVERSAL BLAZE which shifted in.  Approaching the 200 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a tight run between LUCKY TOUCH and KING OBERON which shifted out slightly.
No report.

Shortly after the start was bumped by WIN SPEED when that runner raced tight to the inside of UNIVERSAL BLAZE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the performance, Z Purton stated that whilst his mount travelled satisfactorily during the event, it would appreciate being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, EVERYONE’S CLASSIC will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with STRATHBARRY.  Near the 900 Metres lay in and away from AWESOME TREASURE, made contact with the running rail and became unbalanced.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her mount raced keenly in the early stages and when positioned to the inside of AWESOME TREASURE, she elected to stride forward and lead the event rather than having to excessively restrain her mount.  She added as a result of the manner in which GLORIOUS EXPERT raced in the early stages, it gave ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Bumped on jumping.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  As this was the second occasion that STRATHBARRY had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and was bumped by MIGHTY COMMANDER which shifted in and away from SILO.  From the 400 Metres until near the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  After shifting to the outside of THRIVING BROTHERS approaching the 150 Metres then made contact with PRINCE OF PORTY on a number of occasions thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the 400 Metres until approaching the 250 Metres was held up for clear running behind SILO.  After being shifted to the outside of SILO near the 250 Metres, NOT USUAL STAR then had further difficulty obtaining clear running from the 150 Metres until the 100 Metres when it was positioned behind PRESTIGE ALWAYS.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that with his mount stepping up to 1400 Metres today, he had been requested to take up a forward position but not necessarily lead.  He said in the early stages when other runners did not contest the lead, SILO was able to lead without being pressured to do so.

Had difficulty obtaining clear running from the 400 Metres to the 300 Metres.  Approaching the 150 Metres was bumped by LESLIE on a number of occasions, resulting in PRINCE OF PORTY becoming unbalanced.
No report.

After the event, C Y Ho reported that although his mount was obliged to race three wide, it had cover behind MIGHTY COMMANDER.  He added after initially responding to his riding in the Home Straight, KING MILES’ run ended near the 200 Metres and, in his opinion, would derive benefit from today’s first up performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 200 Metres became held up for clear running between NOT USUAL STAR and THRIVING BROTHERS and did not secure clear running until approaching the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
B Thompson stated that from a wide barrier the instructions were to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.

Approaching the 1100 Metres, when racing ungenerously, was crowded by MIGHTY COMMANDER which shifted in after initially being crowded by THRIVING BROTHERS (A Badel).  In this incident, MIGHTY COMMANDER over-reacted to the crowding which then resulted in SUPER GOLDI having to be steadied away from the heels of PRINCE OF PORTY.  A Badel was severely reprimanded and advised he must provide comfortable racing room for runners to his inside.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that after being crowded in the early stages SUPER GOLDI did not travel strongly and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Approaching the 1100 Metres was checked when it over-reacted to being crowded by THRIVING BROTHERS.  Then continued to race keenly throughout the middle stages.  Raced wide and without cover from the 1000 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly and was bumped.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Withdrawn on 27.9.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (tongue wound).  Before being allowed to race again, GREEN N WHITE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Passing the 50 Metres shifted out, resulting in its rider Y L Chung having to stop riding and straighten his mount.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.  Again approaching the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running for a short distance.

For some distance near the 1100 Metres was crowded by TSUEN WAN GLORY (M Chadwick) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  M Chadwick was reprimanded.  After the event, Z Purton stated that, in his opinion, AROMATICA may derive benefit from today’s first up performance. No report.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  When questioned regarding her riding, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions from a wide barrier were to ride ALWAYS AWESOME in a conservative manner in the early stages, but was given no specific instructions thereafter.  She said after commencing well she elected to restrain her mount in the early stages to comply with her instructions, however, ALWAYS AWESOME relaxed underneath her and as a consequence lost ground on the main body of the field.  She added throughout the middle stages she encouraged ALWAYS AWESOME to improve into the event and entering the Home Straight she shifted out to secure clear running.  She said, under pressure, ALWAYS AWESOME lay in and as a result she then changed her whip through to her right hand, however, as she did so, ALWAYS AWESOME lay out and shifted towards the grandstand rail.  She further stated that near the 250 Metres she was able to correct her mount and ride it out to the finish of the event thereafter.  Apprentice Wong agreed with the Stewards that in the early stages of the event she had misjudged her riding by restraining ALWAYS AWESOME which resulted in it losing contact with the field in the early stages.  Apprentice Wong was advised that in similar circumstances she would be expected to show better judgement than what she did on this occasion.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Crowded near the 1100 Metres.  After the event, A Badel reported that after being crowded near the 1100 Metres his mount did not travel well afterwards.  He said in the Home Straight LINK hung out, proved difficult to ride and he felt there may be something amiss with it.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the performance, M Chadwick stated that whilst his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages, it failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and lay in when giving ground. Before being allowed to race again, JUDY’S GREAT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

B Thompson was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see BIENVENUE).  Lay in in the Home Straight and over the concluding stages B Thompson dropped his right rein.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly. After assessing the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and having regard to Jockey Thompson’s very good record, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty to be a reprimand.  Passing the 400 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR to continue into clear running. Brushed a partition with its right hind leg in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 400 Metres was shifted to the inside of E GLORY to continue into clear running.

After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount anticipated the start just prior to it being effected and as a result jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  A warning was placed on the barrier manners of THE GOOD DEAL and it will be required to undertake a stalls test prior to being allowed to race again.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the barriers and found to be lame in its right front leg.  Was withdrawn by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice.  Before being allowed to race again, MORE RICE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 350 Metres raced tight between ENJOY GOLF and CHARITY FOR ALL which shifted in slightly when giving ground.  After the 100 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of VIEW OF THE WORLD to continue into clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Passing the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind RED ACLAIM and when being shifted out to obtain clear running made contact with MAJESTIC SPEED.  When questioned, M L Yeung stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position, but his mount failed to show sufficient pace to do so.  He added near the 1200 Metres he was steadied away from CHARITY FOR ALL which resulted in YUEN LONG ELITE settling further back in the field than what had been intended.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped only fairly. Both A Atzeni and B Avdulla were advised to exercise more care.

After the event, H Bowman reported that after being held up for clear running in the early stages of the Home Straight ENJOY GOLF responded only fairly to his riding and raced "flat”.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on CHARITY FOR ALL at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed the horse to have an epiglottic entrapment and a dorsal displacement of the soft palate.

After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount coughed after passing the winning post. Before being allowed to race again, AMAZING DUCK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding her tactics adopted and the reason she allowed her mount to improve into the lead after the 800 Metres, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to lead but not to place pressure on her mount to do so.  She said after PRAY FOR MIR and VOYAGE SAMURAI showed superior pace in the early stages, she was positioned behind those two runners.  She said near the 1400 Metres FRANTANCK commenced to race keenly where she attempted to maintain a position with cover behind VOYAGE SAMURAI.  She said as she endeavoured to do so, FRANTANCK continued to race keenly and commenced to make a respiratory noise.  She said rather than excessively restraining her mount, when VOYAGE SAMURAI shifted towards the rail, she allowed FRANTANCK to race outside that runner.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to maintain her position to the outside of VOYAGE SAMURAI rather than continuing forward to lead, Apprentice Wong stated that FRANTANCK continued to race keenly and whilst she was aware that the pace of the event had been run inside of standard time in the early stages, she felt her best option was to allow FRANTANCK to cross to the lead in an attempt to have it relaxed and also to control the respiratory noise her mount was making.  Assistant Trainer P H Lo, representing Trainer P C Ng who was not present at today’s racemeeting, confirmed the instructions issued and in particular not excessively restrain FRANTANCK.  Having considered the explanations provided by Apprentice Wong, the tactics she adopted were considered by the Stewards to be reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.

Slow to begin and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Y L Chung was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.

NERVOUS WITNESS was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer D A Hayes this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right hind leg. Before being allowed to race again, NERVOUS WITNESS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that after mounting STOLTZ in the enclosure he had some concern with its action.  He said upon entering the track and travelling a short distance he was concerned that STOLTZ was showing lameness in its left front leg and as a result STOLTZ was returned to the enclosure.  STOLTZ was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  A veterinary inspection immediately following unsaddling did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, STOLTZ will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments. <8/10/2024 Official Veterinary Examination (Additional Diagnostic Assessments)> A veterinary examination, which has included additional diagnostic assessments, of STOLTZ after being withdrawn at the Sha Tin racemeeting on 1 October 2024 has found the horse to have a stress fracture to its left fore upper limb. As previously advised, STOLTZ will be required to pass an official veterinary examination before being permitted to race again and must also compete in a barrier trial prior to its next race start.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

He said as he attempted to obtain this run, PATCH OF THETA shifted in slightly and DROMBEG BANNER (A Atzeni) shifted out which resulted in SUNLIGHT POWER being disappointed for clear running and not being able to be ridden out over the final 50 Metres.  A Atzeni was advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After establishing its position to the inside of HARMONY FIRE, MOTOMAN then raced keenly throughout the middle stages of the event, got its head up and refused to settle.  Apprentice Wong’s riding in the early stages was referred to the Chief Riding Instructor for remedial training.

Was fractious in the starting gates as the start was effected, then reared and lost ground.  Having regard to TATTENHAM’s previous unacceptable barrier history, the horse will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial before being allowed to race again.  After the event, K Teetan reported that although his mount jumped awkwardly and lost ground, he was able to obtain a midfield position where he had anticipated settling.  He said TATTENHAM was disadvantaged by the pace of the event being run outside of standard time in the early stages which made it difficult to make up any ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, B Avdulla stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages to allow it the opportunity to finish the race off.  He said throughout the event whilst he was aware that the pace was slow and being run outside of standard time and his mount was over-racing, he was reluctant to allow MISTER FOX to stride forward from the 800 Metres when KASA PAPA started a forward move as this would be contrary to his instructions.  He added after KASA PAPA obtained the lead in the Back Straight and the pace of the event quickened, MISTER FOX settled better but was still disappointing in its failure to run on in the Home Straight.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed that the instructions were to ride MISTER FOX back in the field from its outside barrier.  He said given that MISTER FOX had been racing out of form, he had instructed B Avdulla to provide the horse with every opportunity to finish the race off strongly and therefore was satisfied with the tactics adopted by Jockey Avdulla in not going forward in the middle stages of the event.
