After the event, Z Purton stated that, in his opinion, the horse would derive benefit from tonight’s first up performance, particularly only having one barrier trial leading up to tonight’s race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Trainer D J Hall confirmed that from an inside barrier he had instructed B Thompson to take up an on-pace position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Approaching the 150 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of CURRAHEE when disappointed for a run to the inside of that horse.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when crowded between NATURAL HIGH and CURRAHEE which shifted out.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier jumped awkwardly and then was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in.
No report.

Near the 200 Metres shifted out and away from UNISON.  After the event, L Ferraris and Trainer M Newnham confirmed that from a wide barrier the instructions were to ride SO TREASURE in a conservative manner in the early stages.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.
No report.

After the event, B Avdulla reported that approaching the 100 Metres his mount was held up for clear running between NEVER PETER OUT and SWEET DIAMOND which was giving ground and as a result was unable to be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.

Jumped awkwardly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 200 Metres was hampered when taken wider by SO TREASURE which shifted out and away from UNISON when that runner shifted out slightly.  After the event, H T Mo reported that when the pace of the event was run inside of standard time in the early stages, he then elected to shift WOOD ON FIRE across behind runners in the early stages to avoid racing wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Making the Home Turn raced tight to the inside of WORLD HERO.

Jumped only fairly.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the first turn near the 1000 Metres was eased when crowded between SKY SONG and YOU’REMYEVERYTHING which lay in and away from KING GLORIOSO.  Lay in in the Home Straight and near the 200 Metres shifted in and bumped GIMME FIVE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 200 Metres was bumped by SWIFT ASCEND which lay in despite the efforts of its rider.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  On the Home Turn was shifted to the outside of SMART FIGHTER to secure clear running and then raced tight between SMART FIGHTER and GIMME FIVE between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Thompson stated that other than SKY SONG being back up in grade for tonight’s event, he could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 200 Metres was shifted to the outside of KING GLORIOSO to continue into clear running.

Raced tight to the inside of LEAN MASTER near the 150 Metres and made contact with NEBRASKAN.  After the event, H Bowman confirmed that his instructions were if his mount commenced well tonight to endeavour to obtain a forward position.

When giving ground near the 150 Metres was bumped by KING GLORIOSO.  After the event, B Avdulla confirmed that his instructions were to take up a forward position.  He added after obtaining the lead NEBRASKAN failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NEBRASKAN was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, NEBRASKAN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages and anticipated taking up a position behind midfield.  He said SUPER INFINITY was slow to begin and as a consequence settled further back than intended.  When questioned regarding the tactics he adopted in the middle stages and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the inside of CAPTAIN WIN sooner than he did, L Hewitson stated that his plan was to follow CAPTAIN WIN during the event as he felt the horse had previously shown the ability to improve into the event on the Home Turn.  He said after the 600 Metres he remained racing behind CAPTAIN WIN, anticipating that runner would improve into the event, however, when it did not do so, he then shifted to its inside near the 500 Metres to commence to improve.  He added after improving to the inside of CAPTAIN WIN and commencing to make ground, he then shifted SUPER INFINITY out to obtain clear running after the 350 Metres where it commenced to run on well.  He further stated that after racing in restricted room between CAPTAIN WIN and ENTERPRISE ATTACK approaching the 300 Metres, SUPER INFINITY finished the race off well.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions were to ride SUPER INFINITY patiently, however, did not anticipate the horse settling at the rear of the field.  Whilst the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Hewitson were reasonable in the circumstances, they agreed with his assessment that he, in the circumstances, should have shifted to the inside of CAPTAIN WIN sooner than what he did to allow SUPER INFINITY to commence to improve into the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
For a short distance near the 200 Metres M L Yeung was restricted in using his whip when it became caught in the tail of SAVVY BRILLIANT.
Near the 750 Metres was shifted to the outside of SUPER FORTUNE when positioned close to that runner’s heels.

After the event, K Teetan stated that with blinkers on CANDLELIGHT DINNER raced keenly in the lead before failing to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between NORTHERN FIRE BALL and ETALON OR.  In this incident, PATCH OF COSMO shifted out and made contact with ETALON OR on a number of occasions.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped heavily by ETALON OR which shifted in, resulting in JUNEAU PRIDE becoming unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Near the 170 Metres jumped a mark on the track.
For a short distance approaching the 250 Metres lay in and was held up behind SANTORINI.

Shifted in at the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and as a result became unbalanced.  On a number of occasions between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres was bumped by PATCH OF COSMO.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration if there were grounds for a protest/objection against PATCH OF COSMO being declared the winner on behalf of the connections of ETALON OR due to contact being made on a number of occasions between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres.  As the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds due to both runners shifting ground and when connections did not lodge a protest/objection, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.

Fractious in the gates after being loaded.  Was removed from the barriers, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Before being allowed to race again, NORTHERN FIRE BALL will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test and a warning was placed on its barrier manners.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
In the early part of the Home Straight lay in and proved difficult to ride out.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When being shifted across behind runners in the early stages commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid PATCH OF COSMO which shifted out slightly.
No report.
Shortly after the start was bumped.

After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount was able to lead the event without being pressured and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  He said he could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that he had anticipated CIRCUIT JOLLY continuing forward to cross SANTORINI which would allow his mount to obtain a position one-off.  He said when CIRCUIT JOLLY remained racing to the outside of SANTORINI, RUN YES RUN was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and this was the reason for its failure to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between SMILING EMPEROR and CIRCUIT JOLLY which shifted out.  Leaving the 800 Metres when reluctant to hold its position to the inside of PATCH OF COSMO was steadied when racing tight to the inside of that runner.
Between the 300 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, A Badel advised that from his inside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount where comfortable but not lead the event.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions and said such instructions were issued as he felt it was advantageous to race off the pace having regard to the manner in which the earlier races of today’s racemeeting had been run.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between ENSUED and WINNING DRAGON (B Avdulla) which shifted out to improve into clear running, resulting in WINNING DRAGON making contact with SUPREME AGILITY and crowding that runner.  B Avdulla was reprimanded.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

In the early stages raced keenly.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that after being taken three wide near the 1100 Metres he was obliged to race without cover thereafter.  He said as a result PACKING HURRICANE was obliged to make a long sustained run in the middle stages of the event and as a consequence was left without a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded by MANYTHANKS FOREVER which was taken in by FIRE BALL (Y L Chung).  Y L Chung was advised to exercise more care.  K C Leung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the concluding stages (see JOYFUL LIFE).
No report.
Jumped awkwardly, then bumped with SO AWESOME and lost ground.
No report.

On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to JOYFUL LIFE was replaced.  K C Leung (SUPER WISE DRAGON) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of JOYFUL LIFE, resulting in JOYFUL LIFE having to be checked.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 30 October 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  After the event, H Bowman stated that, from his wide barrier, he was given no specific instructions where to settle other than not to pressure his mount in the early stages.  He said due to the pace of the event being run inside of standard time, JOYFUL LIFE settled further back than what it had at its previous race starts, however, he was able to find a midfield position one-off.

Lay in in the Home Straight and near the 200 Metres was eased when racing in restricted room between MANYTHANKS FOREVER and SUPER WISE DRAGON which shifted in slightly.  C L Chau, who weighed in at 122 lbs, was fined the sum of $3,000 for returning to scale 2 lbs overweight.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages over-raced and for some distance near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from MEDIC ELITE.
Bumped at the start.  Between the 250 Metres and the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.
For some distance near the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between JOYFUL LIFE and CHEER FOR SOUTH.

After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that she was obliged to make use of her mount in the early stages to cross and lead and as a result BEAT HOLLOW did not respond strongly to her riding when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

CHILLI BABA, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 12.10.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen right front leg).  Before being allowed to race again, CHILLI BABA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly.  Had some difficulty obtaining clear running near the 350 Metres before being shifted to the inside to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 800 Metres was checked when crowded between CALIFORNIATOTALITY and DEVAS TWELVE which shifted out after being checked to avoid MIDORI BURLY when that runner was steadied away from ACCOLADE START.  The Stewards found both the racing manners of DEVAS TWELVE and MIDORI BURLY were the cause of the interference, particularly due to the pace steadying at that stage, and therefore no action was taken.  H Bentley was warned in relation to using his whip above shoulder height over the concluding stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on the hindquarters near the 800 Metres and became unbalanced.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Checked near the 800 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding near the 50 Metres, Z Purton stated that after riding his mount along in the Home Straight, approaching the 50 Metres he felt both CHATER GOLD and CALIFORNIATOTALITY shift ground slightly and when he was concerned this may result in his mount being crowded for room, out of precaution he decreased his vigour for a short distance.  He said once he was satisfied his mount would continue to be afforded with clear running, he then was able to resume riding DEVAS TWELVE out to the finish of the event.  The Stewards were satisfied with the explanation provided by Jockey Purton.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to cross to the lead and this resulted in SATIRICAL GLORY not finishing the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
For some distance near the 800 Metres was steadied away from ACCOLADE START when racing keenly.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.

After the event, K De Melo reported that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to cross and race outside the lead.  He said in the Home Straight ACCOLADE START did not fully stretch out which he attributed to the "Good to Firm” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ACCOLADE START, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ACCOLADE START will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of TRUE GENIUS, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, TRUE GENIUS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Slow to begin.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount hung in throughout the event, but after the 800 Metres with more severity.  He added in the Home Straight he was concerned there may be something amiss with his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GALLANT HERO, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GALLANT HERO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After passing the 400 Metres was held up for clear running until near the 200 Metres.  After passing the 100 Metres, when finishing off strongly, shifted out to obtain clear running from behind AEROINVINCIBLE and in doing so made contact with GALLANT CROWN.  When questioned, K C Leung explained that he had specific instructions to ride his mount with cover with a view to ensuring MARKWIN could finish the race off strongly.  He said entering the Home Straight near the 400 Metres he was initially endeavouring to try and shift out to obtain clear running between FLYING LUCK and GOLDEN SAMURAI, however, was unable to do so without causing interference to SMASHING EXPRESS in the process as he was not sufficiently clear.  He further stated that after being held up for some distance he made the only other decision available to him which was to shift back in to secure a run to the inside of CIRCUIT FIERY.  He added that he then had difficulty again inside the final 100 Metres obtaining clear running between AEROINVINCIBLE and GALLANT CROWN.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the pre-race instructions.  The Stewards, having the benefit of considering his explanation and reviewing the patrol films, were satisfied that his explanation for his decision-making in the early part of the Home Straight was reasonable in this instance.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped very awkwardly and as a result stumbled.  After passing the 100 Metres was bumped by MARKWIN.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
Slow to begin.  Lay in for a major part of the Home Straight.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied away from AWESOME TREASURE (Apprentice P N Wong) which, after shifting in to the lead when not quite clear, then eased the pace.  Apprentice Wong was advised in similar circumstances she must ensure that she is sufficiently clear of runners to her inside before she eases the pace of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 500 Metres was bumped by LOVING VIBES.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 500 Metres was bumped and taken wider.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shifted out near the 500 Metres and was bumped.

For some distance approaching the 900 Metres raced ungenerously when racing tight to the inside of CAPITAL LEGEND.  After the event, A Badel reported that his mount resented racing amongst horses and in the Home Straight responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the first turn near the 800 Metres was shifted out when awkwardly placed on the heels of CAPITAL LEGEND.
Jumped only fairly.  After the 200 Metres was shifted to the outside of REWARDING TWINKLE to continue into clear running.
Near the 500 Metres was bumped and taken wider by CLASSIC CENTURY which shifted out to improve.
After the 450 Metres was shifted to the outside of WRITTEN CASA to secure clear running and then raced tight between WRITTEN CASA and CAPITAL LEGEND for some distance thereafter.

After the event, C Y Ho stated that it was not his intention to hold a forward position, but after jumping only fairly, he rode his mount along in an endeavour to hold a competitive position.  He said after improving to the outside of CLASSIC CENTURY and then THRIVING BROTHERS, he was obliged to continue to improve forward to avoid racing wide.  He said as a consequence LOVING VIBES settled more forward than anticipated.  He added that his mount raced greenly and on the Home Turn shifted out and away from REWARDING TWINKLE and made contact with THRIVING BROTHERS.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Sent for sampling post-race.
Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Tightened for room shortly after the start between KA YING CHEER and FLYING HIGH which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After passing the 300 Metres shifted out several horses under pressure.
No report.

Crowded for room shortly after the start as a result of CARROLL STREET shifting out.  Had some difficulty obtaining clear running after passing the 400 Metres before gaining a clear run passing the 300 Metres.

Jumped very awkwardly, resulting in H Bentley having to adjust his left side stirrup iron a short distance after the start.

Crowded for room shortly after the start between DASHING DRAGON and MIDORI GLORY (M F Poon) which shifted out.  M F Poon was warned for failing to make a greater effort to keep his mount straight shortly after the start.  Over-raced in the early and middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Passing the 400 Metres got unbalanced when being bumped by FAST NETWORK which shifted in in an attempt to obtain clear running and to avoid the heels of MIDORI GLORY.  Near the 150 Metres, when commencing to give ground, was steadied to avoid the heels of FAST NETWORK (Z Purton) which shifted in when improving quickly onto the heels of CHEVAL VALIANT which shifted out under pressure.  In all the circumstances, Z Purton was issued with a reprimand for his role in the incident.

Withdrawn on 5.10.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter MIDORI GLORY.  Before being allowed to race again, WE ARE HERO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount was able to lead in the early stages without being pressured, but gave ground in the Home Straight and, in his opinion, would derive benefit from today’s first up performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Leaving the 1400 Metres was eased to avoid BEAUTY ETERNAL which shifted in before being corrected by its rider Z Purton.  Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied to avoid VOYAGE BUBBLE when STRAIGHT ARRON was taken out by BEAUTY JOY (M Chadwick) which shifted out.  M Chadwick was advised to exercise more care.

After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount travelled well throughout the race, initially responded to his riding in the early part of the Home Straight and, in his opinion, would derive benefit from today’s first up performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Withdrawn on 12.10.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart abnormality).  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY TOGETHER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <17/10/2024 13 October 2024 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 7 (99)> Confirmed on specialist advice to be displaying an irregular heart rhythm after the pre-race veterinary inspection.  As previously advised, HAPPY TOGETHER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped heavily by PARTERRE which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He said although REWARD SMILE had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres when positioned to the inside of PARTERRE, it was still disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 900 Metres was crowded for room by SKY TRUST which had improved to the inside of the heels of MILES AWAY which had already established a position one-off the fence in front of SKY TRUST. After the event, K C Leung confirmed that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position but preferably with cover.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to allow his mount to stride forward and lead the event to avoid racing wide.

Near the 100 Metres, when commencing to give ground, was eased when momentarily crowded between TEAM HAPPY and DOUBLE WIN which shifted out.  After the event, M L Yeung confirmed that from an inside barrier he was instructed to take up a more forward position today.

Approaching the 150 Metres shifted in abruptly before being corrected by its rider.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that his intention was to hold a more forward position, however, SUNNY DA BEST failed to show sufficient pace to do so despite his efforts.  He added when caught wide in the early stages he attempted to find cover, but after being crossed by STRATHPEFFER was obliged to race very wide and without cover from the 1000 Metres when his mount was taken wider by JUBILANT WINNER.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Over the final 150 Metres lay out, resulting in its rider B Avdulla changing his whip back to his left hand near the 100 Metres.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his instructions were to endeavour to hold an on-pace position with cover.  He said in the early stages when caught wide he elected to shift in to follow GRACIOUS EXPRESS to avoid racing wide which resulted in SILO settling further back than intended.

Jumped only fairly.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, M F Poon viewed the Stewards’ patrol films to ascertain if there were grounds for a protest/objection against LUCY IN THE SKY and PRINCE OF PORTY being declared the winner and second placegetter when ACROSS DA UNIVERSE was crowded between LUCY IN THE SKY and PRINCE OF PORTY near the 100 Metres.  When Jockey Poon declined to lodge a protest/objection and the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  At a subsequent inquiry, it was established that when ACROSS DA UNIVERSE endeavoured to obtain a narrow run between PRINCE OF PORTY and LUCY IN THE SKY, it shifted out slightly and initiated a slight contact with PRINCE OF PORTY.  A short distance later, LUCY IN THE SKY then shifted out, crowding ACROSS DA UNIVERSE between PRINCE OF PORTY and LUCY IN THE SKY which resulted in ACROSS DA UNIVERSE not being able to be ridden out to the finish of the event.  In the circumstances, K Teetan, the rider of LUCY IN THE SKY, was advised to exercise more care when the Stewards found that ACROSS DA UNIVERSE had initially commenced to establish a tight run prior to LUCY IN THE SKY shifting out.
Passing the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between PRINCE OF PORTY which shifted out and GRACIOUS EXPRESS which shifted in.
No report.
Slow to begin.
No report.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between PRINCE OF PORTY and THE WAY WE WIN which was taken in by FIRST LOVE which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  After the event, Z Purton reported that when his mount was commencing to finish the race off well, it was disappointed for clear running near the 150 Metres when held up behind PRINCE OF PORTY and as a result he could not test his mount out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to try and hold a midfield position with cover.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and unable to comply with his instructions with the pace of the event being run outside of standard time, he allowed STORM RIDER to stride forward and race outside the lead to avoid racing wide.  He added in the Home Straight STORM RIDER failed to respond to his riding and gave ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

K Teetan pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 1400 Metres (see ROCKET SPADE).  Shifted in at the winning post and made contact with I CAN.  Sent for sampling post-race.

K Teetan (STAR CONTACT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of ROMANTIC LAOS, resulting in ROMANTIC LAOS being taken in across the running of ROCKET SPADE, causing ROCKET SPADE to check to avoid the heels of ROMANTIC LAOS.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 23 October 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
After the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of STAR CONTACT to continue into clear running.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start by ROCKET SPADE.  Approaching the 200 Metres L Hewitson dropped his left rein for a number of strides.  Lay in in the Home Straight.
Crowded approaching the 1400 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Very slow to begin.  The barrier manners of BEATO were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BEATO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.
After being crossed by SILVER KING passing the 1100 Metres commenced to race keenly and continued to do so in the middle stages.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, M Chadwick stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position but was not given any specific instructions to lead.  He said after his mount commenced well, he was obliged to make use of it in the early stages to cross runners to his inside.  He said passing the 1000 Metres he was obliged to continue forward to cross CALL ME GLORIOUS which resulted in him being slightly in advance of WUNDERBAR.  He said when Z Purton, the rider of WUNDERBAR, was positioned away from the rail and he was riding his mount with restraint, he elected to allow BOTTOMUPTOGETHER to continue to stride forward and cross to the lead.  He added although he was aware that this resulted in the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time, he felt, given the circumstances of the race, this was the best option for BOTTOMUPTOGETHER to obtain the best possible placing in the field as if he was to restrain his mount and race outside WUNDERBAR, this would have resulted in his mount racing keenly.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chadwick were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Approaching the 350 Metres shifted in and away from SUPERB CAPITALIST and became awkwardly placed behind BUNDLE OF CHARM, resulting in SING DRAGON being held up until near the 300 Metres.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded shortly after the start by SUPERB CAPITALIST which shifted in slightly.

The performance of CALL ME GLORIOUS was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, CALL ME GLORIOUS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, C L Chau reported that with the fast early pace SON PAK FU was under pressure throughout the event.  He said on today’s "Good to Firm” surface, he had concerns with his mount’s action and when not in a competitive position, he discontinued from riding it out in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SON PAK FU, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SON PAK FU will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 12.10.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart abnormality) and replaced  by Standby Declared Starter VICTORY MOMENTS.  Before being allowed to race again, WATCH BUDDY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <17/10/2024 13 October 2024 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 10 (102)> Confirmed on specialist advice to be displaying an irregular heart rhythm after the pre-race veterinary inspection.  As previously advised, WATCH BUDDY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 150 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of WOODFIRE CHAMP and in this incident made slight contact with VERBIER.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between E GLORY and PODIUM which shifted in and away from HERO STAR.  Leaving the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid HERO STAR (H Bowman) which shifted in when not quite clear.  H Bowman was reprimanded.  Brushed after the 150 Metres.  Over the concluding stages lay in and away from PODIUM and was checked to avoid the heels of E GLORY which was racing tight to the outside of WOODFIRE CHAMP.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Stewards issued a charge of careless riding against C Y Ho, the rider of WOODFIRE CHAMP, the particulars being that near the 1000 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in, crowding VERBIER in onto E GLORY, resulting in FALCON COURT having to be checked when unnecessarily crowded.  Jockey Ho pleaded not guilty to the charge and made further submissions in respect of his not guilty plea.  After considering those submissions, the Stewards did not sustain the charge issued against Jockey Ho when they could not be comfortably satisfied that he had shifted in to a position inside four wide at the relevant point.  However, Jockey Ho was advised that in similar circumstances he should ensure that he provides sufficient racing room for runners to his inside.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

When questioned regarding his riding, Z Purton stated that from the outside barrier he was asked if possible to take up a midfield position and that if circumstances permitted he was given the option of making an early move around the field.  He said on jumping SPEEDY CHARIOT blundered, lost ground and as a result he elected to shift his mount across behind runners in the early stages which resulted in SPEEDY CHARIOT racing towards the rear of the field.  He said along the Back Straight he shifted away from the rail to give him the opportunity of complying with his instructions to make a forward move around the field.  He said from the 500 Metres he observed THE CONCENTRATION, which was racing wide and without cover, and SUPER EAGLE, which was positioned behind THE CONCENTRATION, under pressure and when he felt that those runners would be taken out by PODIUM, he elected to shift to the inside to secure clear running.  He added after shifting to the inside, his initial intention was to obtain clear running to the inside of FALCON COURT, but when that runner shifted in slightly and he received a call from A Badel, the rider of WIND SPEEDER, he was unable to proceed into this run when there was insufficient room to do so.  He said as a result he then attempted to obtain clear running between FALCON COURT and GORGEOUS VITALITY near the 250 Metres, however, when both those runners shifted ground, SPEEDY CHARIOT was then held up for the remainder of the Home Straight and could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued and initially expressed dissatisfaction with Jockey Purton’s decision not to shift to the outside as instructed.  He added however after further considering the explanation of Jockey Purton, he could understand why he made such a decision to go back to the inside.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards advised Jockey Purton that he had made an error of judgement by not continuing to the outside of SUPER EAGLE making the Home Turn to comply with his instructions and also to allow SPEEDY CHARIOT the opportunity to obtain clear and uninterrupted running in the Home Straight.  However, the Stewards found that his riding was not culpable under the Rules having regard to the explanation he provided for shifting to the inside.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. After the event, H Bentley could offer no explanation for his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, ALLOY KING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his instructions were from a wide barrier to ride his mount in a midfield position with cover.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions and said such instructions were issued on the basis that STORMING DRAGON had not been finishing its races off strongly when racing in an on-pace position.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running between PERFECT GENERAL and GREENWICH.  Near the 200 Metres was then badly crowded between GREENWICH which commenced to give ground and PERFECT GENERAL which shifted in before being corrected by its rider H Bowman.  As a result, BEAUTY DESTINY did not obtain clear running until near the 150 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 100 Metres was brushed when racing in restricted room between GREENWICH and TOP SCORER which shifted out slightly.

Making the first turn passing the 1000 Metres raced keenly when crowded for room between GREENWICH and PERFECT GENERAL which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider when over-racing.  Lay out on the Home Turn.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 150 Metres shifted in slightly, resulting in its rider H Bowman having to stop riding and correct his mount.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that his mount jumped only fairly and then in the early stages he endeavoured to obtain a position with cover behind NEW POWER.  He said when PERFECT GENERAL commenced to race keenly, he was obliged to maintain his position to the outside of NEW POWER, however, PERFECT GENERAL over-raced through the early and middle stages and refused to settle.  He added as a consequence PERFECT GENERAL was unable to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  Trainer C Fownes concurred with the views of Jockey Bowman that PERFECT GENERAL was disadvantaged by the manner in which it raced throughout the early and middle stages of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the 400 Metres until the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running behind TAJ DRAGON.
Bumped at the start.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that his mount was able to obtain a position behind the leaders in the early stages where it travelled well.  He said approaching the 400 Metres he placed his mount under pressure, however, it responded only fairly to his riding and lay in from the 300 Metres when being ridden out.  He added whilst INVINCIBLE SAGE gave ground over the final 200 Metres he had no issue with its action.   Trainer D J Hall stated that, in his opinion INVINCIBLE SAGE had performed best on surfaces with more give and may not have appreciated today’s "Good to Firm” surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Had its right front plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

On the Home Turn was taken wider by TOP GUN which shifted out to attempt to improve.  After the event, H Bowman stated that his instructions were to take up a forward position and to obtain cover if possible.  He said in the early stages when TOP GUN remained racing away from the rail, this resulted in PATCH OF THETA being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
For a short distance near the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.   Was struck across the head by the whip of M Chadwick (TOP GUN) near the 150 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding, Z Purton stated that he expected to take up a position behind midfield from his wide barrier. He said from the 700 Metres he improved to the inside of KARMA to follow C P BRAVE into the event.  He said when KARMA was ridden forward by its rider C Y Ho, it did not immediately respond to Jockey Ho’s efforts and for this reason he elected to shift to the inside of C P BRAVE to secure clear running as he would have been required to ease his mount back to obtain clear running to the outside of KARMA on the Home Turn.  He added after being able to ride his mount along in the early part of the Home Straight, STUNNING PEACH became badly held up near the 250 Metres behind STAR CONTACT and when that runner then commenced to give ground, he was obliged to check to avoid STAR CONTACT approaching the 150 Metres.  He further stated that after improving to the outside of STAR CONTACT soon after STUNNING PEACH then lay out which restricted his ability to fully test his mount out to the finish of the event as he was concerned that had he elected to regather his reins STUNNING PEACH would shift out and he had already been racing in restricted room between PATCH OF THETA and C P BRAVE.  After considering his evidence, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton on the Home Turn were reasonable in the circumstances and were satisfied with his explanation for his riding out of  STUNNING PEACH.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Near the 50 Metres Apprentice P N Wong dropped her whip.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of STAR CONTACT to obtain clear running and as a result made contact with CHIU CHOW SPIRIT.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 50 Metres was bumped by THE BEST PEACH.  After the event, A Badel stated that his mount may not have run out a strong 1600 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Approaching the 150 Metres lay in and away from C P BRAVE and made contact with STUNNING PEACH.  A short distance later TOP GUN, which was giving ground, was steadied when crowded between C P BRAVE and STUNNING PEACH (Z Purton) which, after improving behind STAR CONTACT and being checked to avoid that runner’s heels, then shifted out.  After STUNNING PEACH improved to the outside of STAR CONTACT, it was then taken out when STAR CONTACT (Apprentice P N Wong) shifted out.  Both Z Purton and Apprentice Wong were advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  After the event, M Chadwick reported that with the early pace of the event being run inside of standard time, his mount was under pressure throughout the event and as a result did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 300 Metres raced tight between GREAT STATE which shifted out slightly and GOKO WIN which shifted in and made contact with SUPER INFINITY.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from SUPER INFINITY.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running for a short distance near the 400 Metres when positioned to the inside of GREAT STATE.  Approaching the 300 Metres again had some difficulty obtaining clear running behind I GIVE.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Approaching the 300 Metres was held up for a short distance for clear running behind PACKING HERMOD.

When questioned, M Chadwick stated that the intention was to find a position with cover.  He said when GOKO WIN commenced well today and was in advance of a number of runners to his inside, he elected to ride GOKO WIN forward to avoid racing wide.  He said as a consequence GOKO WIN settled more forward than what was anticipated.
Crowded leaving the 1000 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.

Was positioned in the starting gate next to YOUNG SUPERSTAR when that runner became fractious, was removed from the barriers, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.  Leaving the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded between ARMOUR WAR EAGLE and MAGNIFICENT NINE which was taken in by DASHING DRAGON (B Thompson) which, after initially shifting in and away from GOKO WIN (M Chadwick), then raced tight to the inside of that runner.  Both B Thompson and M Chadwick were reprimanded.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Became fractious in the barriers, lunged forward and got its head under the front starting gate.  Then became cast for a short time underneath the starting stalls before being removed.  Acting on veterinary advice that YOUNG SUPERSTAR was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG SUPERSTAR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Held up for clear running making the Home Turn and near the 350 Metres was steadied when disappointing for clear running between GOLDEN FAIRY and FRUITY WARRIOR which was giving ground.  As a consequence, GO GO GO did not obtain clear running until near the 300 Metres.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  After the event, C L Chau stated that his saddle shifted back shortly after the start, placing him at some disadvantage during the running of the event.

After the event, Y L Chung reported that his mount did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <24/10/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports> GO HERO, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. GO HERO was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer Y S Tsui this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left hind leg. Before being allowed to ace again, GO HERO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When under pressure making the Home Turn and in the Home Straight hung out and proved difficult to ride.  After the event, M Chadwick advised that from a wide barrier and his mount stepping up in distance, he was asked to take up a forward position.  He said after complying with his instructions, WINNING TURN was able to lead the event.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions issued and stated WINNING TURN had settled a little further back than intended at its last start.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount jumped only fairly and as a consequence settled a little further back than intended but he could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NICE BIRDIE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again,  NICE BIRDIE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that after obtaining a position outside the lead his mount came under pressure on the Home Turn and weakened noticeably in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from the left nostril.  An endoscopic examination confirmed the horse to be a bleeder.  Before being allowed to race again, FRUITY WARRIOR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From the 400 Metres until the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind ORIENTAL SMOKE.  When improving to the inside of ORIENTAL SMOKE after the 300 Metres raced tight to the inside of that runner for some distance thereafter and approaching the 200 Metres made contact with ORIENTAL SMOKE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration whether the horse had been afforded a fair start.  After interviewing Jockey C Y Ho, they established that as the start was effected KING MILES lowered its head and as a consequence missed the start.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence was simultaneous to the start being effected, KING MILES was declared a starter.
No report.
Bumped approaching the 200 Metres.
Slow to begin.

Bumped at the start.  In the Home Straight lay out and approaching the winning post became awkwardly placed close to KING MILES and as a consequence could not be ridden out to the finish.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but despite riding his mount along in the early stages BEAUTY GLORY failed to show sufficient pace to do so.
No report.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that his mount enjoyed a good run during the race but failed to quicken when asked for an effort in the Home Straight and he could offer no excuse for his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M L Yeung reported that from a wide barrier and his mount stepping up in distance, he was requested to take up a more forward position.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly and then bumped with BEAUTY GLORY.  Approaching the 800 Metres hung out and appeared to strike the heels of SUPER GOLDI, resulting in TIMES TABLE blundering, becoming unbalanced and dislodging its rider M Chadwick.  M Chadwick was treated by the medical officers and transported to hospital for further observation.  Before being allowed to race again, TIMES TABLE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong. <23/10/2024 20 October 2024 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 10 (120)> The Stewards finalized their inquiry into the reason for M Chadwick being dislodged from TIMES TABLE. After taking evidence from Jockey Chadwick, he confirmed that his mount hung out across the heels of SUPER GOLDI approaching the 800 Metres, resulting in it striking the heels of SUPER GOLDI, blundering badly and M Chadwick being dislodged. As previously advised, TIMES TABLE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start and raced keenly in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded on jumping between SUNSTRIDER and FORTUNATE SON which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Crowded at the start.  From the 800 Metres was taken wider by FLAGSHIP WARRIOR and in this incident made contact with FLAGSHIP WARRIOR.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.
No report.

Blundered on jumping.  After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount responded only fairly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and he could offer no explanation for its performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Crowded on jumping between FALLON and SWEET ENCOUNTER, both of which shifted ground.  Near the 1100 Metres commenced to race keenly and as a result got its head up when being checked away from FORTUNATE SON.  FLAGSHIP WARRIOR then continued to race keenly in the middle stages and refused to settle.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between SWEET ENCOUNTER and SUNSTRIDER.  In this incident, FLAGSHIP WARRIOR made contact with the hindquarters of SUNSTRIDER. As a result FLAGSHIP WARRIOR did not obtain clear running until near the 150 Metres.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions were to take up a forward position from its wide barrier.

Shifted out at the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that his mount, which is only lightly raced, did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

Bumped on the hindquarters at the start and became unbalanced.  After the event, A Atzeni reported that his instructions were to take up a forward position from the outside barrier.  He said when unable to obtain a position closer to the rail in the early stages, SWEET ENCOUNTER was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SWEET ENCOUNTER was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SWEET ENCOUNTER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

As the start was effected, simultaneously became fractious, jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  After the 900 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount was disadvantaged when it lost ground on jumping and this was the main reason for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 250 Metres was eased when momentarily crowded between EXCELLENT DADDY and VULCANUS which shifted out.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
Raced keenly in the early stages and lay out in the middle stages when making the turn.

Bounded on jumping, got its head up and lost ground.  After the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and shifted in when being steadied away from RATTAN WORLD and as a result made contact with HIGH RISE POWER which became unbalanced.  In the Home Straight lay out.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that after losing ground at the start his mount found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 150 Metres shifted out, resulting in its rider Apprentice E C W Wong having to stop riding and straighten.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was momentarily crowded.
No report.

Was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, K C Leung stated that it was not the intention to take up a more forward position, but ON THE LASH commenced well.  He added the horse was having its first race start on the All Weather Track and showed good pace on the surface.

After the event, H Bowman stated that he could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  Trainer C Fownes advised that GALVANIC had pleased him leading into the race and could provide no explanation for the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GALVANIC was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, GALVANIC will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount, which was having its first race start on the All Weather track, did not appreciate racing on the surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start, made contact with SNOWALOT and became unbalanced.
Jumped only fairly and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 900 Metres improved into a tight run between GOR MO TUEN and FLOOF.  A short distance later, ONLY U raced in restricted room to the inside of FLOOF when that runner shifted back in slightly.
No report.
Approaching the 350 Metres was shifted to the outside of FLOOF to obtain clear running and then raced tight for some distance to the inside of PERFECT PEACH.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that from his inside barrier he was requested to allow the speed to cross him in the early stages and take up a position behind those runners.  He said in the early stages FLOOF raced keenly, however, entering the Back Straight settled better.  He added near the 900 Metres his mount was obliged to race three wide when ONLY U improved to his inside, however, in his opinion, this did not affect his mount’s performance as he was able to remain racing with cover.  He further stated that in the Home Straight FLOOF responded only fairly to his riding and coughed on a number of occasions after the winning post.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of FLOOF was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, FLOOF will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Raced wide and without cover in the early stages and as a result near the 1100 Metres was allowed to stride forward where it obtained a position outside the lead near the 800 Metres.  After the event, M F Poon stated that after having to make use of his mount in the middle stages to avoid racing wide, VIVA HUNTER was then unable to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, L Hewitson reported that his mount enjoyed a comfortable run during the event, but failed to quicken in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, PERFECT PEACH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of GOR MO TUEN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GOR MO TUEN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

The performance of ORIENTAL TYCOON, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ORIENTAL TYCOON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed for running between SUGAR SUGAR and GUSTOSISIMO (Y L Chung) which shifted in.  Y L Chung was advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mounts.  KYRUS DRAGON was then shifted to the outside of GUSTOSISIMO after the 150 Metres to secure clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

At declaration time, M Chadwick was declared as the rider of both POWER KOEPP and GUSTOSISIMO.  It was established that M Chadwick had a firm commitment to ride POWER KOEPP.  As such, the Stewards permitted Y L Chung to be substituted as the rider of GUSTOSISIMO.  For this declaration error, Trainer A S Cruz was fined $2,000.  Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped on jumping.  Near the 150 Metres was bumped by NORDIC DRAGON which shifted in and then raced tight to the inside of NORDIC DRAGON for some distance thereafter which restricted M F Poon’s ability  to use his whip for a number of strides.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in in the Home Straight.  As a consequence, H Bowman had difficulty in fully testing his mount over the final 100 Metres when it shifted in towards EASON.
Shifted out after the 350 Metres and was bumped.
Near the 150 Metres was taken in slightly by EASON.

Shifted in shortly after the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong confirmed that from a wide barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position and cross to the lead if caught wide.
After the 350 Metres was hampered when bumped by SWEET BRIAR which shifted out.
Bumped at the start.

Shortly after the start was crowded between ARMOUR EAGLE and SUGAR SUGAR which shifted in.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that his instructions were to endeavour to find cover.  He said after jumping well and with blinkers on for the first time POWER KOEPP raced keenly and as a result settled outside the lead.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up on the Home Turn.  After the event, A Atzeni could offer no excuse for his mount’s failure to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that his instructions were to ensure that his mount maintained a comfortable rhythm throughout the event and not to unnecessarily restrain it.  He said although SONIC BOOM was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event, it did so as he was riding to the instructions issued.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions issued.
Jumped only fairly.

In the middle stages raced keenly and approaching the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid SONIC BOOM.  Approaching the 50 Metres raced tight to the inside of DAILY TROPHY which shifted in before being corrected.

After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses, particularly when racing tight on the first turn and this was the main reason for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HINOKAMI KAGURA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 400 Metres was eased away from DAILY TROPHY when that runner shifted out to improve.

Approaching the 900 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid ALWAYS FLUKE when being crossed by that runner.  MR VALIANT then continued to race keenly for some distance thereafter.   After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on MR VALIANT at the request of Trainer D J Hall.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, MR VALIANT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

L Ferraris was warned in relation to using his whip when held in a forehand manner forward of the saddle.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that after being able to lead the race, when placed under pressure in the Home Straight, ALWAYS FLUKE hung in and proved difficult to ride out to the finish.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied away from SHANGHAI STYLE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After being placed in the barriers reared and struck its head, resulting in blood being present in the nostrils.  Acting on veterinary advice that FUN N FUN TOGETHER was not suitable to start, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  FUN N FUN TOGETHER was subsequently found to have sustained an injury to the nasal bone.  An endoscopic examination also confirmed that the blood had not emanated from the lungs and was due to the injury and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled.  The Stewards ruled that FUN N FUN TOGETHER will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in a barrier trial and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before racing again.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

No report.
For a short distance near the 200 Metres Apprentice E C W Wong was unable to use his whip when he had difficulty changing it from his left to his right hand.

After the event, Apprentice P N Wong reported that her mount raced keenly in the lead and as a consequence was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  After the event, Z Purton stated that he was obliged to ride his mount along throughout the early and middle stages to maintain his position and in the Home Straight finished the raced off in a one-paced manner.  He added, in his opinion, HOLY POWER would be better suited by being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the concluding stages had some difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind FLYING DRAGON.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a small cut to the left hind leg.
No report.

Approaching the 250 Metres improved into a narrow run to the outside of TALENTS AMBITION and then raced tight between TALENTS AMBITION and FIGHTING MACHINE until passing the 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his mount leading, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that from an inside barrier he was instructed to hold a forward position and also to ensure that his mount commenced well as it had a tendency to begin only fairly in its recent starts.  He said with the hood being removed for tonight’s race PERFECT TEAM jumped well and responded to his urgings in the early stages which resulted in the horse being able to lead the event.

Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount enjoyed a comfortable run throughout the race and after initially responding to his riding in the early part of the Home Straight was left without a strong finishing effort over the concluding stages, but he could offer no explanation for the performance.  Trainer M Newnham advised that he was satisfied with the performance of TALENTS AMBITION and, in his opinion, would derive benefit from tonight’s second up performance, particularly with the horse stepping up 450 Metres in distance from its first up run.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped shortly after the start.

Bumped after the 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
