Shifted out abruptly on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn and the reason he elected to improve to the inside of VIVA A LA, K Teetan stated that his instructions were to endeavour to follow a horse into the race as SUPER ELITE had not finished its races off strongly when improving to the outside of runners.  He added that as a result when VIVA A LA shifted out slightly on the Home Turn, he elected to improve to that runner’s inside and follow SPICY SO SMART to ride in accordance with his instructions.  He further stated that after being briefly held up on the Home Turn, SUPER ELITE was able to follow SPICY SO SMART into the Home Straight where it finished the race off reasonably well.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions and the reason why such instructions were issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Badly crowded shortly after the start.  On the Home Turn was steadied when crowded.

Shortly after the start was severely checked when crowded between SAME TO YOU which shifted in slightly and CHEER FOR SOUTH which was taken out by SPICY SO SMART (M Chadwick) which shifted out abruptly despite the efforts of its rider.  The Stewards were satisfied that M Chadwick had endeavoured to correct his mount as it started to shift ground and therefore no action was taken.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that after being held up making the Home Turn he then commenced to ride his mount along to improve to the outside of VIVA A LA (M F Poon) approaching the 150 Metres.  He said as he endeavoured to shift to that runner’s outside, VIVA A LA shifted out which resulted in his mount being held up and having to be shifted out further to avoid that runner’s heels and making contact with THE KHAN which was taken wider.  Z Purton and M F Poon were advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, C L Chau confirmed that from a wide barrier and his mount racing first up today, he was instructed to ride it conservatively in the early stages.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions issued.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Approaching the 200 Metres was eased and shifted to the inside of WINNING HEART and THE KHAN to continue into clear running.  Again after the 100 Metres JOYFUL FRIENDSHIP continued to be shifted to the inside of VIVA A LA and CHEER FOR SOUTH to continue into clear running.

Shortly after the start shifted in slightly and bumped with THE KHAN.  A short distance later then raced tight between THE KHAN and WINNING HEART.  M F Poon (VIVA A LA) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of WINNING HEART, resulting in WINNING HEART being crowded and taken in onto SUNNY SHINES, resulting in SUNNY SHINES also being crowded and losing its rightful running.  After assessing the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and having regard to his excellent record, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty to be a reprimand.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Approaching the 150 Metres was hampered when taken wider.  After the event, H Bowman stated that after being contacted by COUNTRY DANCER approaching the 150 Metres his mount failed to finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Crowded approaching the 1000 Metres.  Near the 150 Metres shifted out and away from THE KHAN.  After the event, H Bentley reported that the intention was to settle a little closer on his mount, but after jumping well WINNING HEART took up a forward position and was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
M F Poon was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 1000 Metres (see SUNNY SHINES).

Shifted in slightly on jumping and a short distance later was bumped heavily on the hindquarters and became badly unbalanced.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance approaching the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from SUPER ELITE.  After the 600 Metres became unbalanced when racing tight between CHEER FOR SOUTH and THE KHAN which was racing tight to the inside of WINNING HEART (H Bentley).  H Bentley was advised to exercise more care and to ensure he provides sufficient racing room to runners on his inside.  After the 400 Metres was checked when crowded between THE KHAN (H Bowman) which shifted in slightly and CHEER FOR SOUTH which was steadied when crowded by SUPER ELITE (K Teetan) which, after improving into a tight run to the inside of VIVA A LA (M F Poon), was then taken in by that runner.  After considering all of the evidence, Jockey Bowman was advised to ensure that he leaves comfortable racing room for runners to his inside, Jockey Teetan was advised to ensure that there is sufficient racing room when he is improving and Jockey Poon was reprimanded for allowing his mount to shift back in after VIVA A LA initially shifted out on the Home Turn.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount raced tight for some distance after the 600 Metres and was then checked at the 400 Metres when crowded.  He said as a result SAME TO YOU did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 700 Metres was steadied away from SUPER WIN DRAGON.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid ONE FOR ALL.
No report.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 550 Metres shifted out when making the turn awkwardly and made contact with ONE FOR ALL.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  Making the turn approaching the 700 Metres was badly crowded between ONE FOR ALL and KA YING CHEER (Apprentice P N Wong) which, after being crossed by PACKING BOLE and racing keenly, was shifted out abruptly to avoid the heels of PACKING BOLE.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found that the racing manners of KA YING CHEER and the manner in which Apprentice Wong had positioned her mount and endeavoured to provide herself with sufficient clearance behind PACKING BOLE were the contributing factors for the interference occurring.  The Stewards, under the provisions of Rule 12(46) , referred Apprentice Wong to the riding skills panel for mentoring and remedial training in this area.  After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount took some time to respond to his riding in the early stages to hold an on-pace position.  He said after being crowded near the 700 Metres SUPER WIN DRAGON came under pressure and failed to finish the race off strongly thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 700 Metres was crowded between HONG KONG HALL and SUPER WIN DRAGON.  Bumped near the 550 Metres.  Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between VICTORY MOMENTS and HONG KONG HALL.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
On jumping was bumped by ALPHA ONE which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

After the event, M F Poon stated that his mount jumped awkwardly which resulted in him having to ride his mount along to take up a forward position.  He said due to the fast early pace HONG KONG HALL was obliged to race wide and without cover and as a result in the Home Straight was left without a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right hind leg.  The performance of HONG KONG HALL, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HONG KONG HALL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that as connections had not expected there would be strong pace in the race, he was given the option to take up a more forward position, particularly as VIVA GRACIOUSNESS is generally one-paced when placed under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Held up on the Home Turn before shifting to the inside of STURDY RUBY to obtain clear running. Approaching the 150 Metres lay in and brushed with TRADITION.
No report.
No report.

Was fractious whilst being transported to the course, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 900 Metres COURIER MAGIC and I AM THE BOSS contested a position behind BRAVE WITNESS when that runner commenced a forward move three wide.  When I AM THE BOSS (L Hewitson) maintained its position behind and slightly to the outside of BRAVE WITNESS, COURIER MAGIC was then checked when disappointed for this position.  In taking no action, the Stewards were satisfied that Jockey Hewitson had ridden his mount in accordance with the Rules and that COURIER MAGIC had not fully established the run behind BRAVE WITNESS.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the 200 Metres was shifted to the inside of GALLANT CROWN to attempt to obtain clear running and near the 150 Metres was disappointed and shifted to the outside of GALLANT CROWN to continue into clear running.  Over the concluding stages STAR LINE could not be ridden out when positioned close to VIVA CHALEUR.

Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to UNITED ENDEAVORS as that runner shifted out slightly.  After the event, H Bowman advised that he was obliged to make a wide run on the Home Turn and in the Home Straight CAPITAL LEGEND finished the race off fairly, but he was not too disappointed with the horse’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, A Atzeni confirmed that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions and said such instructions were issued as VIVA CHALEUR had raced below expectation when being ridden in a more forward position at its previous race starts.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

As the start was effected lunged forward and made contact with the front of the starting gates whilst being assisted by a starting gate handler.  As a result, BRAVE WITNESS lost considerable ground at the start.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such incident had occurred simultaneously to the start being effected, BRAVE WITNESS was declared a runner.  Before being allowed to race again, BRAVE WITNESS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  From the 800 Metres improved forward and raced wide and without cover thereafter before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a small wound to its left hind leg.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, made contact with THE PRIME, became unbalanced and lost ground.
On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to SPEED SWORD was refitted.  Jumped only fairly.
No report.

When questioned, H Bentley stated that his mount began only fairly and then he was able to improve in the early stages to the inside of VALHALLA and obtain the lead on the first turn.  He said LUCKY PLANET was able to control the lead at standard time, but in the Home Straight responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
On the first turn after the 1000 Metres was crowded for room and became unbalanced.
Made the first turn wide before being steadied to obtain cover behind FUNG.

When questioned, H T Mo stated that his instructions were to endeavour to hold a forward position, preferably behind the leaders.  He said when ridden along in the early stages FUNG was unable to cross the runners to his inside and as a consequence raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Making the first turn became badly unbalanced when crowded by FUNG (H T Mo) which shifted in when racing to the inside of SWEET DIAMOND which resulted in YEAH BUDDY then making contact with VALHALLA and YEAH BUDDY being turned in towards that runner.  H T Mo was reprimanded and advised in similar circumstanced he would be expected to leave comfortable racing room for runners to his inside.
On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to SMART FIGHTER was refitted.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A Badel pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 1000 Metres (see GOLDEN DARCI).  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

A Badel (TACTICAL COMMAND) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of GOLDEN DARCI, resulting in GOLDEN DARCI having to be checked away from the heels of TACTICAL COMMAND.  A Badel was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 13 November 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between INVINCIBLE DELIGHT which was taken out slightly by GIMME FIVE and TACTICAL COMMAND (A Badel) which shifted in.  A Badel was reprimanded.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that his mount, which was racing in blinkers for the first time, commenced to race keenly in the early stages after obtaining a position with cover behind INVINCIBLE DELIGHT.  He said as a consequence he was obliged to check to avoid the heels of INVINCIBLE DELIGHT approaching the 1000 Metres, shifted out and made the first turn wider.
Brushed a running rail in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.

When questioned regarding the disappointing performance of GIMME FIVE, Z Purton stated that with the pace of the event being run slightly inside of standard time in the early stages, his mount was under pressure to hold its on-pace position.  He said when SMART FIGHTER shifted away from the rail near the 500 Metres, GIMME FIVE commenced to improve into the event and then was awkwardly placed close to SMART FIGHTER, resulting in him having to steady his mount.  He said after this GIMME FIVE did not respond to his riding and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GIMME FIVE was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, GIMME FIVE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shortly after the start was hampered when tightened for room.

After the event, M L Yeung confirmed that from his wide barrier he was requested to take up a forward position and ride his mount in a similar manner when successful in a barrier trial on 5 October 2024.  Trainer K L Man confirmed the instructions and the reason why such instructions were issued.

Withdrawn on raceday morning after sustaining a wound to the head whilst being transported to the course.  Before being allowed to race again, DAY DAY VICTORY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between MA COMET and RUBY SAILING which shifted out and away from VICTORYTHIRTYTHREE after being taken out by that runner.
Jumped awkwardly and raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.

Hung out making the turn after the 600 Metres.  After the 50 Metres was disappointed for clear running between MA COMET and HAPPY TANGO, resulting in SIGHT HAPPY having to be steadied and shifted to the outside of HAPPY TANGO to continue into clear running.
No report.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that over the concluding stages his mount, when under pressure, shifted in and away from HAPPY TANGO and as a result, when awkwardly placed close to the heels of VICTORYTHIRTYTHREE, he elected to steady his mount.  He added that, in his opinion, MA COMET may derive benefit from today’s performance as it had been approximately 6 weeks since its last race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, H Bowman stated that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount responded satisfactorily to his riding and he was not too disappointed with the performance of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Crowded after improving to the inside of SIGHT HAPPY after the 600 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 24.10.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter MODEST GENTLEMAN.  Before being allowed to race again, COLOURFUL PRINCE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Crowded at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.
Jumped only fairly.
M L Yeung was warned in relation to raising his whip arm above shoulder height over the concluding stages.
Approaching the finish could not be ridden out when improving close behind ARTHUR’S KINGDOM.
No report.
When caught wide and without cover in the early stages was allowed to stride forward and obtain a position outside the lead approaching the 1000 Metres.
Shifted out at the start and lost ground.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount is better suited on the Sha Tin track and this was the main reason for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that in accordance with its usual racing pattern from wide barriers, he was asked to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He added that in the Home Straight HAPPY HERO did not respond to his riding and was somewhat disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Whilst being saddled fell over and took some time to regain its feet.  Acting on veterinary advice that INTREPID WINNER was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, INTREPID WINNER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Samples were taken from the horse.

Over the concluding stages lay in, placing its rider L Ferraris at a disadvantage in that he could not fully test the horse to the finish.  L Ferraris was warned for using his whip forward of the saddle in a forehand manner.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of YOUNG EMPEROR.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.
On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to RISING FROM ASHES was replaced.  Crowded on jumping.  After the 500 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied away from FIND MY LOVE.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by BRIGHT DAY which shifted in.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race and coughed post-race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, REWARD SMILE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Over the concluding stages lay in, resulting in its rider Z Purton having to correct and straighten his mount. Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, L Hewitson reported that the intention was to find a handy position with cover.  He said in the early stages when RED ELEGANCE was positioned to his inside, he was obliged to allow ETERNAL FORTUNE to go forward and cross that runner and race outside the lead to avoid racing wide.
Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of HORSEPOWER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Approaching the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of HAPPY UNITED to continue into clear running.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Jumped awkwardly.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between FLYING HIGH and HAPPY UNITED which jumped awkwardly and shifted in.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and was bumped on the hindquarters.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, A Badel reported that his mount failed to stretch out in the early stages despite his efforts to ride it along.  He added that he could not identify anything amiss with the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 250 Metres B Avdulla dropped his whip.  Approaching the 200 Metres lay in, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 200 Metres was bumped by D STAR which lay in.
Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped by D STAR which shifted out.  ESCAPE ROUTE was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.
No report.

Slow to begin.  Near the 1550 Metres was steadied when crowded between SUPER HONG KONG and D STAR (B Avdulla) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  B Avdulla was reprimanded.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <31/10/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>After the race, HAILTOTHEVICTORS was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. HAILTOTHEVICTORS was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer D Eustace this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, HAILTOTHEVICTORS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, A Atzeni reported that it was not the intention to lead, but due to the early stages of the race being run outside of standard time and when caught wide in the early stages, he was obliged to allow his mount to stride forward and lead.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
In the early stages raced keenly.

After being fractious in the Parade Ring made contact with a rail after exiting the Parade Ring.  ENSHINE was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse had sustained a wound to its left hind leg.  Acting on veterinary advice that ENSHINE was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, ENSHINE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a parade test and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Steadied near the 700 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  On the Home Turn was held up for clear running.  After the event, Y L Chung stated that the instructions were to endeavour to hold a more forward position, however, RED MAVERICK did not show sufficient pace in the early stages to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the early part of the Home Straight lay in and was awkwardly positioned behind SUPER WISE DRAGON.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from CHARMANDER.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Shortly after the start was crowded between SUPER WISE DRAGON and YEABOI which shifted in slightly.  After the event, H Bowman stated that after attempting a tight run to the inside of MERCHANT PRINCE on the Home Turn, his mount was checked when unable to obtain clear running which resulted in KASA PAPA losing momentum at that stage of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After arriving on course was found to have superficial graze above left eye, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event, Z Purton stated that the intention was to endeavour to find cover if possible.  He said in the early stages SUPER WISE DRAGON raced keenly and as the horse is a "roarer”, he was reluctant to excessively restrain his mount to obtain a position with cover.  He said as a result SUPER WISE DRAGON, which continued to race keenly, raced outside the lead before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  The performance of SUPER WISE DRAGON was considered disappointing as compared to its last race start.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER WISE DRAGON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

After the event, B Avdulla reported that after being obliged to race wide and without cover in the early stages his mount became under pressure in the middle stages and weakened in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of YEABOI, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, YEABOI will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and was checked shortly after when crowded between SING DRAGON and DANCING CODE which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Held up on the Home Turn.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly and was crowded shortly after the start.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by LUCKY ENCOUNTER which shifted out.  Shifted in approaching the 450 Metres and was bumped.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Near the 1150 Metres was placed in restricted room between SING DRAGON and WONDERSTAR which shifted out slightly.  Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied and crowded by DANCING CODE which was taken in by TOMODACHI KOKOROE (K Teetan) which lay in at that point.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care and to make a greater effort in similar circumstances to prevent his mounts from shifting in.  After the event, M F Poon stated that after his mount was crowded in the early stages, it was then obliged to race very wide and without cover thereafter.  He added as a consequence GORGEOUS WIN was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 450 Metres was bumped by SIX PACK which shifted in.

After the event, A Badel stated that after his mount commenced well, he was able to obtain a handy position, however, DANCING CODE travelled a little keenly and as a result did not finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

On jumping knuckled over, became unbalanced and lost ground.  Near the 900 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by DANCING CODE which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  After the event, H Bowman stated that after losing ground at the start SUPERB CAPITALIST settled further back than anticipated and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 250 Metres lay in and away from ACE TALENT as that runner shifted in slightly and as a consequence DAN ATTACK was awkwardly placed close to the heels of DIAMOND SOARS.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that over the final 150 Metres when he commenced to ride ACE TALENT along, his mount lay out and as a result shifted out a number of horses.  Apprentice Wong agreed with the Stewards that in the circumstances he should have stopped riding and straightened his mount sooner than what he did.  He added that when he recommenced riding ACE TALENT out towards the finish of the event, he dropped his left rein.  Apprentice Wong was advised he should ensure that he has proper control of his rein, particularly in circumstances when he commences to use the whip.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between PLENTIFUL which was taken out by OMAKASE and DAN ATTACK which shifted in after being contacted on its hindquarters.  Approaching the 300 Metres was steadied when racing tight to the inside of OMAKASE which shifted in slightly.
Crowded shortly after the start.  Approaching the 300 Metres lay in, resulting in its rider L Ferraris having to stop riding and correct his mount.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with the hindquarters of DAN ATTACK, resulting in DAN ATTACK shifting in and E GLORY having to be checked when crowded between CIRCUIT TEN and DAN ATTACK.  When commencing to finish the race off well was steadied and shifted to the outside of DIAMOND SOARS near the 50 Metres to continue into clear running.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, H Bentley reported that with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time, his mount was under pressure throughout that stage of the race and was disappointing in the Home Straight when it only responded fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Crowded shortly after the start.  Making the Home Turn was eased to avoid GOODMANSHIP when that runner shifted out to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding, H Bowman stated that the instructions were to find an on-pace position with cover.  He said after GLORY CLOUD commenced well, he settled outside the leader HAYDAY in the early stages, however, his mount raced keenly.  He added when TRIUMPHANT MORE improved to his outside, he elected to allow that runner to cross rather than contesting that position as he felt this would be detrimental to the chances of GLORY CLOUD settling in the middle stages of the event.  After considering his explanations, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman in the circumstances were reasonable.  Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance after the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid LOVING VIBES (C Y Ho) which shifted in when not clear.  C Y Ho was reprimanded.
No report.
Approaching the 150 Metres became held up for clear running behind HAYDAY and could not be ridden out until leaving the 100 Metres.
Raced wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.
No report.
Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between TRIUMPHANT MORE which was taken out by RAGNARR and GLORY B which raced tight to the inside of GOLDEN RISE which shifted in slightly.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when  positioned behind HAYDAY.
From the 200 Metres until the 100 Metres was held up for clear running behind TRIUMPHANT MORE.
After travelling a short distance became unbalanced when crowded between GLORY B and GOLDEN RISE.

After the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid RAGNARR.  After the event, H Bentley reported that after being badly crowded and becoming unbalanced shortly after the start, his mount did not travel comfortably thereafter.  He said when he was concerned with his mount’s action in the Home Straight, he did not continue to ride it out when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GLORY B, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GLORY B will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 550 Metres was briefly crowded by ENJOY GOLF which lay in at that stage.  After the event, M F Poon advised that from an inside barrier his instructions were to endeavour to hold a forward position.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover until the 800 Metres where it was allowed to stride forward and race outside the lead.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages raced tight between NINJA DERBY and STRONGEST BOY.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 600 Metres bumped with MASTER TORNADO as that runner commenced to give ground and shift in.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  At the 600 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from SIXTH GENERATION.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied to avoid ENJOY GOLF when that runner commenced to give ground.
Near the 600 Metres was bumped and taken wider by STERLING WONGCHOY.

After the event, H Bowman could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ENJOY GOLF was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, ENJOY GOLF will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, A Badel stated that when he felt there was something amiss with his mount, he eased it down in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, MASTER TORNADO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 29.10.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right hind) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter HIGHLAND RAHY.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER BABY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the winning post lay in and was steadied away from the heels of KINGLY DEMEANOR.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 800 Metres was briefly crowded to the inside of PAKISTAN FRIEND.  After the 500 Metres was bumped by PAKISTAN FRIEND which shifted out and away from E TALENT.
After the event, M Chadwick advised that he was instructed to take up a forward position.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.
Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping.  Passing the 400 Metres A Badel dropped his whip.
Slow to begin.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 170 Metres was shifted to the inside of TURTLE AGAIN to continue into clear running. <4/11/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that SUNNY BABY was lame in its right front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, SUNNY BABY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped after the 500 Metres.  After the event, Z Purton could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was bumped by OFFROAD MASTER which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was bumped.  Bumped near the 400 Metres.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that when he placed his mount under pressure in the Home Straight it responded well to his riding, but near the 170 Metres identified a mark on the track which resulted in it shifting in and crowding OFFROAD MASTER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M F Poon stated that, in his opinion, the horse may not have run out the 1800 Metres of today’s event.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed that he had been pleased with the work of CASA LEGEND leading into today’s event and agreed with Jockey Poon that CASA LEGEND did not run out the 1800 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of CASA LEGEND was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.   Before being allowed to race again, CASA LEGEND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
On jumping was crowded between HARRY’S HERO and CASA LEGEND which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Shifted in shortly after the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Near the 400 Metres shifted out and made contact with PACKING ANGEL when obtaining a run to the outside of COLONEL.  Near the 170 Metres was steadied when crowded by PACKING ANGEL (Z Purton) which shifted in when it identified a mark on the track.  Z Purton was advised to exercise more care.
K C Leung was fined $2,000 for initially presenting himself to be weighed out with the incorrect saddle cloth number.  Slow to begin.  Was bumped approaching the 450 Metres when being shifted out.
No report.

On jumping blundered badly and became unbalanced.  Was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from the outside barrier.  Approaching the 450 Metres was held up for clear running for a short distance behind BEAUTY MISSILE.  Near the 50 Metres bumped with BEAUTY MISSILE when that runner shifted in slightly.

Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that after racing in the lead SPICY SPANGLE did not respond to his riding over the final 200 Metres and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Made contact with the right side of its barrier on jumping.  Approaching the 450 Metres was bumped by WINNING LION which shifted out.  Near the 50 Metres shifted in and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
On the Home Turn raced tight to the inside of GENEVA.

After the event, L Ferraris stated that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount lay in.  He added that, in his opinion, COLONEL is better suited at Happy Valley and when being able to dictate the lead.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of COLONEL, a last start winner, was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, COLONEL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 2.11.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter GOOD LUCK WIN.  Before being allowed to race again, VICTOR THE RAPID will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the early stages. Approaching the 600 Metres was brushed by CHATER GOLD which shifted out slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

For some distance approaching the 100 Metres was held up for clear running between CORLEONE and CALIFORNIATOTALITY and near the 100 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running.  SOARING BRONCO was then shifted to the outside of CALIFORNIATOTALITY for a short distance later to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  When the pace steadied after the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was checked to avoid CORLEONE.

When questioned regarding his riding from the 800 Metres and the reason the pace slackening noticeably from that point, M F Poon stated that after being challenged in the lead by CALIFORNIATOTALITY, his mount relaxed making the first turn.  He said whilst he did not excessively restrain his mount, he encouraged it to settle during the middle stages to allow it to have a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  He added he was of the opinion that when he allowed his mount to relax, it did ease the tempo more than he would have liked.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards advised Jockey Poon that he should ensure, whenever possible, that he does not reduce the tempo too quickly so as to avoid disadvantaging other runners positioned behind his mount.

Between the 300 Metres and the 100 Metres raced tight between DRAGON FOUR SEAS and SOARING BRONCO (C Y Ho) which endeavoured to improve into a narrow run between CORLEONE and CALIFORNIATOTALITY.  Near the 100 Metres CALIFORNIATOTALITY (B Avdulla) then shifted in, crowding SOARING BRONCO and contributing to CORLEONE being steadied.  Both C Y Ho and B Avdulla were reprimanded.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that with his mount stepping up in distance, he was asked to take up a more forward position than at its first race start.   He added after being steadied to avoid DRAGON FOUR SEAS when the pace of the event slackened after the 700 Metres, CORLEONE then hung in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and raced tight from the 300 Metres to the 100 Metres between DRAGON FOUR SEAS and SOARING BRONCO.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have a small abrasion to the right front fetlock.

Raced keenly in the early stages.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 1100 Metres.  Near the 100 Metres was steadied when crowded between JUMBO FORTUNE and SOARING BRONCO (C Y Ho) which shifted out.  C Y Ho was advised to exercise more care.

After travelling a short distance H Bentley was obliged to re-position his foot in the stirrup iron.  After the event, H Bentley reported that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight CHATER GOLD responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, CHATER GOLD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly.  Due to the pace steadying after the 700 Metres was shifted to the outside of TRIPLE BLISS and then raced tight between CALIFORNIA BANNER and TRIPLE BLISS when that runner shifted out whilst racing keenly.

Bumped shortly after the start and from a wide barrier was then was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When the pace steadied after the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was crowded near the 650 Metres.  Approaching the 500 Metres was tightened between MISTER DAPPER and SMASHING EXPRESS which was taken out by TRIPLE BLISS (K C Leung).  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care.

Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position and when caught wide was then shifted across to obtain cover behind SPECIAL HEDGE near the 1200 Metres.  MISTER DAPPER raced keenly for some distance thereafter.

Shortly after the start was crowded between CALIFORNIATOTALITY and CALIFORNIA BANNER which shifted out and away from CORLEONE.   From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When the pace of the event steadied approaching the 650 Metres was checked when crowded between MISTER DAPPER and CALIFORNIA BANNER which, after improving to the outside of SMASHING EXPRESS, was then taken out when SMASHING EXPRESS was checked and shifted to the outside of TRIPLE BLISS.  As the Stewards found the incident was attributable to the pace of the event steadying, no action was taken.

Near the 1400 Metres was steadied when crowded by SOARING BRONCO which shifted in and away from CORLEONE (H Bowman) after being taken in by that horse.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  When the pace steadied after the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was checked to avoid ALP’S AFFECTION.

As the start was effected stood flat-footed and as a consequence was slow to begin.  BEER PALACE then reared shortly after and lost further ground.  The barrier manners of BEER PALACE were considered unacceptable.  The Stewards ruled that BEER PALACE will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in a barrier trial before being allowed to race again.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that FLYING DOUBLE anticipated the start and as a consequence bounded on jumping and became unbalanced.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that his initial intention was to follow VANTASTIC CHOICE into the event, however, when VANTASTIC CHOICE did not improve, he then elected to shift back to the inside of that runner to continue to follow COMMANDING MISSILE near the 300 Metres.  He said after shifting to the inside of COMMANDING MISSILE near the 250 Metres he was then able to place his mount under full pressure, but when improving between COMMANDING MISSILE and TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR, his mount reacted adversely when it was accidentally struck by the whip of C Y Ho, the rider of TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR.  He added after this his mount responded well to his riding but over the concluding stages shied at the winning post and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.
Jumped awkwardly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount hung in when placed under pressured in the Home Straight and responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Made contact with a rail in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.
Shortly after the start was crowded between LUCKY GOLD and THRIVING BROTHERS which shifted out.
In the middle stages raced keenly and after the 800 Metres got its head up when being positioned close to YODA’S CHOICE.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after the start was steadied away from LUCKY GOLD.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance approaching the 900 Metres was steadied away from MARKWIN.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.

After the event, M F Poon stated that with his mount stepping up in grade, it did not appreciate the stronger pace in the event and was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover for the majority of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 200 Metres was disappointed for clear running to the inside of THRIVING BROTHERS and was steadied and shifted out to obtain clear running at the 150 Metres.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event, A Badel reported that his mount travelled satisfactorily behind the pace, but responded only fairly when asked for an effort in the Home Straight, weakened over the concluding stages and was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 400 Metres attempted a narrow run between SWORD POINT and MOMENTS IN TIME.  When MOMENTS IN TIME shifted out, LA CITY BLANCHE was then disappointed for clear running before being shifted to the inside of MOMENTS IN TIME near the 300 Metres to obtain a clear run.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  When questioned, C Y Ho stated that after obtaining a position behind FLAMING RABBIT in the early stages, when FLAMING RABBIT was then steadied to obtain a position on the rail, CHANCHENG GLORY commenced to race keenly, struck the heels of FLAMING RABBIT and blundered.
No report.
No report.

When questioned regarding the performance of the horse, Z Purton stated that his mount was disadvantaged by the early stages of the event being run slightly outside of standard time, but due to the pace increasing from the 1000 Metres MASSIVE SOVEREIGN took some time to respond to his riding from the 600 Metres.  He added in the Home Straight MASSIVE SOVEREIGN finished the race off fairly and its run might have peaked close to the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced wide and without cover in the middle stages.
Crowded shortly after the start between ALL FOR ST PAUL’S and CHANCHENG GLORY which shifted out.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  Lay out on the Home Turn and in the Home Straight.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When finishing the race off well could not be ridden out to the winning post when improving close to CHANCHENG GLORY.
Jumped only fairly.
When caught wide in the early stages was allowed to stride forward near the 1100 Metres when it was able to take up a position outside the lead.
No report.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay out over the final 300 Metres when under pressure.

Was fractious in the barriers, was removed and examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was suitable to race.  Before being allowed to race again, MAJESTIC EXPRESS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Had some difficulty obtaining clear running approaching the 350 Metres.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with THUNDER PRINCE.  A short distance later was then steadied when crowded between THUNDER PRINCE and LADY’S CHOICE which shifted in slightly.  When commencing to finish the race off well over the concluding stages was held up behind LADY’S CHOICE and as a consequence was unable to be ridden out to the finish of the event.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that on jumping his mount made contact with the left side of its barrier and as a consequence lost some ground.  He said this resulted in PACKING TURBINE settling further back in the field than what had been intended.  He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount responded satisfactorily to his riding, but, in his opinion, would be better suited by being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING TURBINE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly and was crowded shortly after the start.  In the middle stages raced keenly and leaving the 900 Metres got its head up and shifted out when being steadied away from YOUNG ARROW.

Shortly after the start was crowded for room between SUPER FORTUNE and AWESOME TREASURE (Apprentice P N Wong) which shifted out whilst being ridden along.  Apprentice Wong was reprimanded and advised that she must correct her mounts when they shift ground on jumping.  In this incident, M Chadwick had his right foot dislodged from his stirrup iron, resulting in Jockey Chadwick becoming unbalanced and PHOENIX LIGHT losing ground.  Leaving the 900 Metres improved to the inside of THUNDER PRINCE when that runner shifted out.  When THUNDER PRINCE was corrected and resumed its position, PHOENIX LIGHT was then steadied to avoid THUNDER PRINCE.
No report.

Was fractious in the barriers, was removed and examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was suitable to race.  Before being allowed to race again, PRESTIGE RICKY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres was steadied away from MAJESTIC EXPRESS.
No report.
Crowded shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After travelling a short distance raced in restricted room between MR ENERGIA and MILES AWAY which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Making the turn after the 900 Metres shifted out when racing tight between YUEN LONG ELITE and MR ENERGIA and as a result was steadied away from MR ENERGIA.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid ARIEL (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  Briefly held up approaching the 300 Metres.
Crowded near the 900 Metres.
Shortly after the start was crowded between SUNDAY’S SERENADE and SOLID WIN, both of which shifted ground.

Had some difficulty obtaining clear running between the 300 Metres and the 250 Metres.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that his mount was fractious in the barriers just prior to the start being effected when being assisted by a starting gate handler. He said as a consequence YUEN LONG ELITE jumped awkwardly and lost ground at the start.  He added that after obtaining a midfield position behind FLYING LUCK, YUEN LONG ELITE finished the race off satisfactorily.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, YUEN LONG ELITE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that from an inside  barrier he was instructed to hold a position with cover behind the leaders.  He said when no other runner in the race showed the intent to lead, this resulted in EVER SMART improving in the early stages to race in the lead.

After the event, M F Poon stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount with cover in the early stages.  He said as a result SATIRICAL GLORY settled behind midfield in order to comply with his instructions.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions as SATIRICAL GLORY had not finished its race off when holding a more forward position at its previous race start.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the 600 Metres was momentarily crowded by HELENE WARRIOR which lay in before being corrected by its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 300 Metres was steadied away from GALLANT WAKING and shifted out to continue into clear running.
In the early stages raced keenly when being shifted behind SUPER UNICORN to obtain cover.  Checked to avoid SAMARKAND near the 350 Metres.
After improving to the inside of SUPER UNICORN leaving the 1500 Metres then raced tight to the inside of that runner for some distance thereafter.  Hung in in the Home Straight.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
Bumped on jumping.  After the 350 Metres was steadied to avoid SAMARKAND and as a result was taken wider.

K Teetan was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 350 Metres, when positioned too close to the heels of HELENE WARRIOR, he attempted to improve to that runner’s outside for some distance when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in his mount striking the heels of HELENE WARRIOR, blundering badly and becoming unbalanced, also resulting in HELENE WARRIOR becoming badly unbalanced when galloped on and causing I CAN, which was following SAMARKAND, to be checked to avoid the heels of that horse.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 13 November 2024 at Happy Valley.  In addition, Jockey Teetan was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 3 and also considered his very good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres was struck on the heels by SAMARKAND and as a result became badly unbalanced and lost ground.  H Bowman stated that he eased his mount down after this incident when he felt there was something amiss.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  In the early stages got its head up when being shifted across behind runners from a wide barrier.  Leaving the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being crossed by LO PAN SPIRIT.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start.  Near the 450 Metres was steadied when BEAUTY CRESCENT shifted to the outside of STEPS AHEAD to obtain clear running.  As a result, THE HEIR shifted out and away from BEAUTY CRESCENT.

Shifted in at the start, bumped heavily with NAMJONG KINGDOM and lost ground.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that after settling towards the rear of the field, with the early pace of the event being run inside of standard time, MIGHTY STRIDE travelled comfortably in that position.  He said making the Home Turn when asked for an effort, he shifted MIGHTY STRIDE to the outside of the field, however, it responded only fairly and in the Home Straight lay in under pressure.  He added that he was not entirely satisfied with the manner in which MIGHTY STRIDE responded to his riding and reported to connections that he had some concern with the manner in which the horse finished the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount was disadvantaged by the race being run inside of standard time during the early stages, particularly when being pressured by SOVEREIGN FUND.  He said as a consequence AEROINVINCIBLE was unable to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between MIGHTY STRIDE which, after shifting in and making contact with NAMJONG KINGDOM, then raced tight to the inside of PRINCE OF PORTY and SIMPLE HEDGE which was also checked after being taken out by THE HEIR (Apprentice E C W Wong).  Apprentice Wong was reprimanded and advised he must attempt to straighten his mounts when they shift ground.
No report.
Near the 750 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from THE HEIR.

After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race. Before being allowed to race again, SOVEREIGN FUND will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Checked when crowded shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After being loaded into the starting gates became fractious, resulting in the front gates opening and MY WISH breaking through and its rider L Ferraris being dislodged but was able to be restrain the horse.  MY WISH was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to start.  Before being allowed to race again, MY WISH will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, L Hewitson confirmed that from an inside barrier he was requested to take up a forward position on the horse.  Noted to have sustained a small wound to the left front leg.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 150 Metres raced tight between HO HO STAR and THE GOOD DEAL which was giving ground.  Near the 50 Metres H Bentley dropped his left rein for a short distance.
Raced wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages raced keenly.  After the 300 Metres proved reluctant to shift to the outside of JOYFUL LIFE when it lay in.  As a result, HO HO STAR was shifted to the inside of JOYFUL LIFE approaching the 200 Metres to obtain clear running.  HO HO STAR continued to lay in and near the 150 Metres improved into a tight run between WINNING HEART and WOODFIRE CHAMP which shifted in slightly.  Over the concluding stages HO HO STAR could not be ridden out when improving into a tight run between WINNING HEART and GORGEOUS VITALITY which shifted in.

Raced wide and without cover until the 600 Metres.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to the heels of GORGEOUS VITALITY and racing tight between HO HO STAR and JOYFUL LIFE.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found it to have sustained a small laceration to the left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, JOYFUL LIFE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Stewards found that the pace of the event steadying at that stage was the reason for the incident occurring.

Shifted out abruptly at the start and was bumped on the hindquarters.  In the Home Straight lay in.  A Atzeni was warned in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle on one occasion near the 100 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was crowded between EXUBERANT which shifted out slightly and CALIFORNIA DEEPLY which shifted in before being corrected by its rider B Avdulla.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that the intention was to hold a forward position if his mount was able to commence well.  He said after being crowded at the start his mount was then unable to hold a forward position.  He said as a consequence he allowed CIRCUIT DUFFY to take up a trailing position behind WORLD HERO in the early stages.  He added in the Home Straight, under pressure, his mount raced greenly, however, was disappointed for clear running near the 200 Metres between WORLD HERO and TOP SCORER which shifted in.  He said as a consequence he then was obliged to ease his mount to shift to the  outside of TOP SCORER and after continuing to shift out, he was able to obtain clear running to the outside of FATAL BLOW where CIRCUIT DUFFY finished the race off reasonably well.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the 300 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between HAPPY FEELING and ALLOY KING which shifted out slightly.  As a result, JOYFUL FRIENDSHIP was shifted to the inside of ALLOY KING to obtain clear running.

Over the concluding stages was steadied when crowded by SUPER EAGLE (K Teetan) which shifted in.  K Teetan was severely reprimanded and advised he must stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.  Noted to have sustained an abrasion to the left front fetlock after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 100 Metres B Avdulla dropped his left rein for a short distance and then dropped his whip.  A short distance later, SAME TO YOU was then steadied when it shifted out towards ISLAND GOLDEN (M F Poon) as that runner shifted in.  M F Poon was advised to exercise more care.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Slow to begin.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start between SUPER EAGLE and SPEEDY CHARIOT which shifted out slightly.  After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount settled further back in the field when it commenced awkwardly.  He added over the concluding stages he could not fully test SUPER ELITE when positioned behind SAME TO YOU and in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with the run of his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the 600 Metres made contact with HARMONY FIRE and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  Held up on the Home Turn.

Jumped only fairly and was bumped shortly after the start by HARMONY FIRE which shifted out.  Approaching the 300 Metres improved into a tight run between SUGAR SUGAR and HARMONY FIRE and made contact with SUGAR SUGAR.

After the event, C L Chau advised that from the outside barrier and with the expected fast early pace, he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages and also to attempt to race on the rail.  Assistant Trainer H W Cheung confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.
No report.

After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead by DIVANO and as a consequence gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Again bumped after the 600 Metres and became unbalanced.
Raced wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up for clear running for a short distance after the 400 Metres.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the 300 Metres made contact with APOLAR FIGHTER when it was attempting a tight run to the outside of SURE JOYFUL.  Noted to have been galloped on the left hind cannon after the race.  After the event, an endoscopic examination was conducted on KIMBERLEY at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, KIMBERLEY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Noted to have sustained a minor abrasion to the right hock, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover until the 700 Metres.  Bumped after the 300 Metres.

After being crossed by WAH MAY WAI WAI near the 1300 Metres commenced to race keenly and was shifted to the outside of WAH MAY WAI WAI to avoid that runner’s heels.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount raced too keenly in the early stages and as a consequence was left without a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was crowded by APOLAR FIGHTER which shifted in slightly.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.

Taken wider after the 1300 Metres.  After the event, K Teetan stated that his mount did not travel well during the running of the race and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

POCHETTINO, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 5.11.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart irregularity).  Before being allowed to race again, POCHETTINO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Slow to begin and then was crowded by STORMING DRAGON which shifted out.  Between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres was held up for clear running between REGENT GLORY and KING ECCELLENTE.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping.  After the event, B Avdulla advised that from a wide barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  Lay out on the Home Turn.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount raced a little too keenly during the race with blinkers being reapplied tonight.  He added that together with KING ECCELLENTE carrying the top weight of 135 lbs, it was unable to finish the race off when under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by FUN N GLORY which shifted in.  Over the concluding stages became unbalanced when racing in restricted room between DRAGON AIR FORCE and KING ECCELLENTE which shifted out when giving ground.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.  Near the 150 Metres was taken in by GIANT LEAP.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Between the 250 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running when endeavouring to obtain a narrow run between PRIME MORTAR and JOY COMING and as a result made contact with JOY COMING.

After the event, A Badel reported that his mount raced in a three wide position with cover but in the Home Straight finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly, shifted out and bumped GANGNAM STAR.
Bumped near the 200 Metres when racing tight to the outside of EXCELLENT PEERS.
No report.
No report.

When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to endeavour to find cover from the outside barrier.  He said as a result in the early stages he did not ride his mount along in an attempt to comply with his instructions.  He said entering the Back Straight he had anticipated JOY COMING would shift to the rail, but when that did not occur, LYRICAL MOTION was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to allow LYRICAL MOTION to stride forward to prevent JOY COMING from shifting out near the 600 Metres, Apprentice Wong stated that his focus has been on endeavouring to obtain cover and as a result he did not position his mount in a more forward position at that point which had allowed JOY COMING to take LYRICAL MOTION out.  He agreed with the Stewards in retrospect he should have placed LYRICAL MOTION in a more competitive position at that stage of the event to prevent JOY COMING from shifting out.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued and in the circumstances expressed satisfaction with the manner in which Apprentice Wong had ridden LYRICAL MOTION.  From the 600 Metres raced very wide and without cover.

Jumped only fairly and was then crowded between TACTICAL COMMAND and FOOLISH HEART.  K Teetan was warned in relation to using his whip on a horse that was out of contention and not responding to his riding.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley, did not appreciate racing on the Happy Valley track.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded by RIDING HIGH which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
C L Chau was fined the sum of $5,000 for using his whip in a manner where his whip arm was raised above shoulder height on several occasions in the Home Straight.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Throughout the early and middle stages raced keenly and refused to settle.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  Near the 300 Metres raced tight as it endeavoured to improve into a narrow run between LUCKY ARCHANGEL and LUCKY EIGHT.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between CHATEAUNEUF and AURORA LADY which shifted out. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
No report.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  At the 300 Metres K Teetan dropped his whip.  When questioned, K Teetan stated that from a wide barrier he was requested to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages as the horse had raced disappointingly at its last start when ridden in a forward position.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions and the reason as to why he issued those instructions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1400 Metres was steadied away from MR ASCENDENCY when positioned close to that runner. After the event, M L Yeung reported that his mount came under pressure at the 600 Metres and failed to respond to his riding thereafter.  He added that WOODFIRE BRO made a respiratory noise after the winning post.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of WOODFIRE BRO, a last start winner, was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, WOODFIRE BRO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
