Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier, shifted in and then made contact with BEAR CHAMP.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running behind SOMELOVEFROMABOVE.

After the event, Z Purton stated that after holding the lead, when under pressure in the Home Straight CIRCUIT JOLLY jumped a mark on the track near the 170 Metres and from that point responded only fairly to his riding.  He added that, in his opinion, CIRCUIT JOLLY might be better suited with the addition of blinkers and racing at Happy Valley.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 700 Metres became unbalanced when being steadied away from LUCKY BLESSING.  From the 450 Metres until after the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind CASHISCASH.
Held up making the Home Turn.

Was noted to have sustained an abrasion to the right front leg, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by SOMELOVEFROMABOVE which shifted in slightly.

Jumped awkwardly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 950 Metres commenced to over-race and got its head up when being steadied away from NORTHERN FIRE BALL.  Approaching the 600 Metres, when racing keenly, shifted out when being steadied to avoid NORTHERN FIRE BALL.
No report.
Knuckled over on jumping and became unbalanced.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied when crowded by JUNEAU PRIDE which was taken in by REWARDING BUDDY (K C Leung).  K C Leung was reprimanded.

Jumped only fairly and was crowded by THE DOUBLE EAGLE which shifted in and away from DRAGON SUNRISE.  Over-raced in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Over-raced in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Held up making the Home Turn and for some distance after the 400 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between TELECOM BULLET and SUPERB MOVE.  When questioned, Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to hold a midfield position from a wide barrier.  He said from the 1000 Metres he felt the pace of the event increased which resulted in VULCANUS losing touch with the leading division.  He said he was reluctant to place too much pressure on his mount at that point as VULCANUS was stepping up in distance for today’s event and this may have impacted upon its ability to run out a strong 1650 Metres.  He added after being held up for clear running in the early part of the Home Straight VULCANUS was able to finish the race off well.  After considering his explanation and the sectional times of the event, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chung were reasonable in the circumstances.

On jumping was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, C L Chau reported that after obtaining a midfield position behind VULCANUS, he was obliged to make a forward move on his mount near the 900 Metres when VULCANUS lost its position behind the leading division.  He added as a result of making a forward move in the middle stages, SUPERB MOVE did not finish the race off when under pressure in the Home Straight and would derive benefit from today’s first up performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  H Bowman was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 1400 Metres (see BEAU GOSSE).  H Bowman, rider of the 7th placegetter, was fined the sum of $10,000 for failing to ride his mount out to the finish of the event to the satisfaction of the Stewards.

After the event, H T Mo confirmed that from the outside barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position.  He added when unable to cross runners to his inside in the early stages TELECOM BULLET raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer Y S Tsui confirmed the instructions and said such instructions were issued as TELECOM BULLET had not been performing well when being ridden in a conservative manner in the early stages at its previous race starts.

Jumped awkwardly and shortly after was checked when crowded by SMART ZIPANG which shifted out abruptly.  H Bowman (NOT A FEW) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of BEAU GOSSE, resulting in BEAU GOSSE losing its rightful running and being checked.  In assessing the carelessness as grade 1, the Stewards determined that NOT A FEW initially raced tight inside JOYFUL CHAMPION and that BEAU GOSSE had reacted adversely to the crowding.  Having regard to this finding and the consequences being grade 2 and his excellent race riding record, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty to be a reprimand.
Shifted out abruptly on jumping and was bumped.

FAIRY HORSE, which was fractious in the barriers, was removed from the starting gates, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to start.  Before being allowed to race again, FAIRY HORSE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Jumped only fairly.  After the event, A Atzeni reported that his mount was fractious in the gates, over-raced during the early and middle stages of the event and as a consequence did not finish the race off when under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The performance of WINNING TURN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, WINNING TURN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards viewed the patrol films to ascertain if the horse had been denied a fair start.  When the Stewards were satisfied that SUPER JOY reared simultaneously as the start was effected, they were of the opinion that SUPER JOY should be declared a runner.  The barrier manners and performance of SUPER JOY, which finished tailed out, were considered unacceptable.  The Stewards ruled that SUPER JOY will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in a series of consecutive barrier trials and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

From the 350 Metres until after the 50 Metres was badly  held up for clear running.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event when placed in restricted room between ROMAN CROWN and PATCH OF TIME which shifted out.  After the event, L Hewitson confirmed that from the inside barrier he was instructed to endeavour to hold a more forward position.  He said when CITY THUNDER commenced well, he was able to comply with the instructions issued.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped. When under pressure in the Home Straight lay out and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between MEANINGFUL DRAGON and HE WAS YOU, both of which shifted ground.  Approaching the 100 Metres became held up when disappointed for clear running to the inside of PATCH OF TIME. As a result, GOLDENTRONICMIGHTY did not obtain clear running until the concluding stages.

Shifted in at the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by LIFE OF STONE (K De Melo) which shifted in and away from PATCH OF TIME.  K De Melo was advised to exercise more care and make a greater effort to prevent his mounts from shifting ground.  Approaching the 100 Metres, when racing greenly, was steadied when positioned close to MONARCH COUNTY as that runner commenced to give ground quickly.  After being shifted to the inside of MONARCH COUNTY, HE WAS YOU was then held up for clear running over the concluding stages when CITY THUNDER shifted out.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied when tightened between HE WAS YOU and GOLDENTRONICMIGHTY which shifted out.  After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount did not appreciate racing amongst other horses and, in his opinion, would be better suited racing in blinkers.  A   veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, H Bowman stated that after taking up a forward position his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover when unable to cross runners to his inside and as a consequence failed to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Slow to begin.  Near the 200 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of AFFORDABLE to continue into clear running.
No report.

Shortly after the start was steadied and got its head up when being bumped by PRINCIPLED which shifted in and away from HAPPY HERO.  BILLIONAIRE SECRET was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that the preference was to ride HAPPY HERO conservatively from its wide barrier, but if the pace of the race was not quick he had an option to hold a more forward position.  He said after his mount commenced well, HAPPY HERO was able to obtain a handy position, however, was obliged to race wide and without cover.  He further stated that he was reluctant to allow HAPPY HERO to stride forward in the middle stages as he was of the opinion that this would result in the pace of the event increasing as he felt the leaders would resist his attempts to cross to the front.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued.

Near the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between CONFRINGO and HAPPY HERO.  After obtaining clear running shortly after lay in and away from HAPPY HERO over the concluding stages and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he shifted out to obtain clear running rather than following JOYFUL PROSPERITY into the event, H Bowman stated that on straightening he was of the opinion that JOYFUL PROSPERITY would have difficulty obtaining clear running when it was positioned behind JUBILATION.  He said as a result he then elected to shift to the outside of JOYFUL PROSPERITY in an attempt to obtain clear running, however, became held up behind SILVER KING and LITTLE FAIRY for some distance near the 400 Metres.  He further added that from the 350 Metres he was unable to fully test his mount when positioned behind CONFRINGO and did not obtain clear running until approaching the 150 Metres where he shifted his mount to the outside of STORM WINNER to obtain clear running.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Held up making the Home Turn and near the 400 Metres improved into a tight run between JOYFUL PROSPERITY and SILVER KING which was commencing to give ground.  As a result, LITTLE FAIRY became unbalanced when racing tight between those two runners.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.

Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping.  After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between PRAY FOR MIR and SWEET ENCOUNTER which was taken in by SPEED DRAGON. Taken wider after the 350 Metres.  Y L Chung was issued with a warning for using his whip in a manner where he failed to provide his mount with an opportunity to respond to his whip use over the final 200 Metres.

After the event, M L Yeung reported that he was instructed to ride his mount where comfortable.  He said FLAGSHIP WARRIOR raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 900 Metres was steadied away from CHING.

After travelling a short distance was bumped and became unbalanced.  Taken wider after the 350 Metres.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount made an respiratory noise.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of TURIN STARSPANGLED was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, TURIN STARSPANGLED will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
K Teetan was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see GOOD VIEW GLORY).  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  C Y Ho was warned in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle in a forehand manner.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping and lost ground.  Approaching the 200 Metres was directed to the inside of TATTENHAM to continue into clear running.

For some distance after the 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between COUNTRY DANCER and COSMO NAVIGATOR.  Passing the winning post was checked when crowded by COSMO NAVIGATOR (Y L Chung) which, after initially shifting in, was then taken in by VULCANUS (C Y Ho) which was racing tight to the inside of SPEEDSTAR (K Teetan) which shifted in.  Jockeys Chung, Ho and Teetan were advised in similar circumstances they would be expected to stop riding and straighten their mounts.

Approaching the 100 Metres endeavoured to obtain a tight run between COSMO NAVIGATOR and VULCANUS.  A short distance later, VULCANUS (C Y Ho) shifted in and crowded the running of TATTENHAM, resulting in TATTENHAM having to be steadied and not being able to be ridden out to the finish of the event.  C Y Ho was reprimanded and advised that he must stop riding and straighten his mounts.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in, bumped with COUNTRY DANCER and became unbalanced.  Was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.   K Teetan (SPEEDSTAR) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of GOOD VIEW GLORY, resulting in GOOD VIEW GLORY losing its running and being checked to avoid the heels of SPEEDSTAR.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 27 November 2024 and to expire on Monday, 2 December 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.
Jumped only fairly, shortly after shifted in and made contact with GOOD VIEW GLORY.  Was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded by URBAN TRIUMPH (K C Leung) which, after improving into a tight run to the inside of COSMO NAVIGATOR, was then taken in slightly by that runner.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care and to ensure there is sufficient racing room when he is improving into runs.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that from an outside barrier he was requested to ensure that his mount began well and use the horse’s pace if circumstances permitted. He said after jumping well he was able to obtain a position outside the leader HERO STAR but COUNTRY DANCER raced keenly in the middle stages and as a result was left without a finishing effort.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued and agreed with the assessment of Jockey Purton that COUNTRY DANCER raced too keenly during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, A Hamelin reported that his mount did not travel well at any stage of the event and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  On the Home Turn improved into a narrow run between NEBRASKAN and SUNNY DA BEST, made contact with SUNNY DA BEST and became unbalanced.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
