Shortly after the start was crowded.

Had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres and passing the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between FIGHT TIME and FASHION LEGEND (A Atzeni) which shifted out.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.

After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount over-raced when positioned outside the leader NEBRASKAN and after being bumped by LEGEND ST PAUL’S on the Home Turn failed to quicken in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  Passing the 200 Metres was bumped.  After the event, A Badel reported that his mount was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  When caught wide and without cover near the 1000 Metres was steadied where it obtained cover behind FIGHT TIME.

Slow to begin.  When the tongue tie was unable to be fitted on SKY DEEP, which was having its first race start, the Stewards permitted the horse to race without that gear.  A public announcement was made to this effect.  The performance of SKY DEEP, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SKY DEEP will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, B Thompson reported that he was not satisfied with the horse’s action over the final 200 Metres and eased it down when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MASTER STROKE, which had finished tailed out on the third consecutive occasion, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MASTER STROKE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in two consecutive barrier trials in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly, got its head up and lost ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping.

Jumped only fairly.  For a short distance near the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving to the inside of SUPER INFINITY.  Approaching the 100 Metres became held up for clear running when disappointed between FLYING FORTRESS and SUPER INFINITY and then shifted to the outside of SUPER INFINITY to obtain clear running.
No report.
From the 400 Metres until the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind SOLID IMPACT.

Near the 900 Metres was bumped by HE WAS ME which shifted in.  For some distance after the 400 Metres was held up for clear running.  Near the 250 Metres was then disappointed for clear running between ENTERPRISE ATTACK and BLESSED NATION and was shifted to the outside of BLESSED NATION to secure clear running.
Was left racing wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Slow to begin.  After the 500 Metres, when being shifted to the outside of TRUE GENIUS, blundered.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between VIVA HUNTER and ATOMIC BEAUTY which shifted out slightly.
Raced wide and without cover until the 1000 Metres where it was able to obtain a position outside the lead.
Jumped only fairly and was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Had difficulty obtaining clear running for some distance near the 300 Metres.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that he was instructed to obtain cover on his mount and as a result allowed HIGHLAND RAHY to cross ATOMIC BEAUTY and improve to the lead near the 900 Metres.  He added in the Home Straight ATOMIC BEAUTY was held up for clear running behind HIGHLAND RAHY at which point it lost momentum and in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with the performance of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount was coughing on pulling up.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to ride his mount forward to cross runners to his inside to avoid racing wide.  He said as a result HIGHLAND RAHY was not able to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HIGHLAND RAHY was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, HIGHLAND RAHY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Over the final 200 Metres lay in.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.

After the event, Apprentice P N Wong reported that she was instructed to take up a forward position.  She said after riding her mount along in the early stages she was unable to cross runners to her inside, resulting in SOLID IMPACT racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in near the 900 Metres and was bumped.
From the outside barrier shifted out on jumping and lost ground.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Near the 500 Metres was steadied when crowded between ACA POWER and FOREVER FOLKS (B Thompson) which shifted to the outside of TRUE GENIUS to improve.  B Thompson was advised to exercise more care.  After the event, C L Chau reported that his mount hung out and in the Home Straight did not respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The performance of TRUE GENIUS, which had finished tailed out on the second consecutive occasion, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, TRUE GENIUS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 1500 Metres was steadied away from TIGER AND GOLD.  When questioned, A Atzeni stated that his instructions were to hold a position behind midfield and to allow his mount to commence to improve into the event from the 600 Metres. He added that he was not privy to the instructions that were issued to Jockey Y L Chung and making the Home Turn he was able to improve to the inside of TIGER AND GOLD to obtain clear running.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued to Jockey Atzeni.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages raced tight between KINGLY DEMEANOR and GOLDEN FAIRY.

Near the 50 Metres, when giving ground, was steadied when crowded between PALACE PAL which was taken out slightly by KINGLY DEMEANOR (M L Yeung) and FURY AND GOLD (A Atzeni) which shifted in.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care and A Atzeni was reprimanded.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by NICE BIRDIE which shifted in after making contact with KINGLY DEMEANOR.  After the event, H Bowman reported that he was unable to improve on the Home Turn when he was positioned behind NICE BIRDIE.  He added however that after shifting to that runner’s inside on straightening SUPER HONG KONG did not respond to his riding and was somewhat disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, C L Chau reported that his mount was disadvantaged by the pace of the race being run inside of standard time throughout the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Stood flat-footed as the start was effected and lost ground.  The barrier manners of SPLENDID STAR was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPLENDID STAR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres. When questioned regarding the tactics adopted, Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to attempt to hold a forward position with his mount stepping up in distance.  He said he was also given the option to make a mid-race move if circumstances permitted as TIGER AND GOLD is one-paced.  He said due to the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time, TIGER AND GOLD settled further back than instructed.  He said although he was aware the early stages of the event were run inside of standard time, he was of the opinion that near the 800 Metres the pace had reduced and as a consequence he elected to make a forward move in accordance with the instructions issued.  He said from the 600 Metres TIGER AND GOLD lay out and as a consequence made the Home Turn wider which allowed FURY AND GOLD to obtain clear running to his inside.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the manner in which TIGER AND GOLD was ridden.
Crowded near the 1400 Metres.  Near the 250 Metres raced tight to the inside of THE AZURE which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

K C Leung (THE AZURE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of LUCKY TOUCH, resulting in LUCKY TOUCH being taken in across the running of VIVA CHALEUR, causing VIVA CHALEUR to be checked to avoid the heels of LUCKY TOUCH.   K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 1 December 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 5 December 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.   Near the 300 Metres was hampered when taken in by SOLAR GOGO which hung in despite the efforts of its rider.  Approaching the 200 Metres VIVA CHALEUR then became held up for clear running between SOLAR GOGO and THE AZURE and made contact with SOLAR GOGO on a number of occasions before obtaining clear running near the 200 Metres.

Shortly after the start raced tight between DURHAM STAR and D STAR which shifted in slightly.  A Atzeni (ESCAPE ROUTE) pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 50 Metres (see D STAR).

K C Leung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1400 Metres (see VIVA CHALEUR).  In the early part of the Home Straight lay in before being corrected by its rider.  After the event, K C Leung stated that whilst his instructions were to be more forward due to the expected lack of early speed, he did not anticipate leading the event.  He said when THE AZURE jumped well, he was able to cross to the front.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions issued.
Raced tight to the inside of D STAR for some distance near the 150 Metres. Raced tight over the concluding stages.

Over the concluding stages was steadied when crowded between THE AZURE and AMAZING AWARD.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on TRADITION at the request of Trainer Y S Tsui.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
Crowded over the concluding stages.

Near the 1200 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by ESCAPE ROUTE which was taken out by DURHAM STAR (L Hewitson) when that runner shifted to the outside of VIVA CHALEUR.  L Hewitson was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  Near the 700 Metres was steadied when crowded by SOLAR GOGO (C L Chau) which lay in as its rider commenced a forward move.  C L Chau was reprimanded and advised he would be expected to make a greater effort to prevent his mounts from shifting ground. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. A Atzeni (ESCAPE ROUTE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 50 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of DURHAM STAR, resulting in DURHAM STAR being taken in and crowding the running of D STAR which was checked when it lost its rightful running and also contributing to TRADITION being checked to avoid the heels of THE AZURE.  A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 4 December 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Hung in in the Home Straight and near the 200 Metres shifted in, made contact with VIVA CHALEUR and became unbalanced.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 300 Metres was steadied away from VICTORYTHIRTYTHREE.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight and the reason he did not apply full pressure to his mount until near the 200 Metres, Z Purton stated that at its last race start Trainer J Richards was of the opinion that the horse lacked concentration when it was in the lead soon after straightening.  He said tonight he was issued with the instruction not to place his mount under full pressure too soon in an attempt to have MA COMET finish the race off in a strong manner.  He said in accordance with those instructions he remained racing behind NOTTHESILLYONE until near the 200 Metres where he then placed his mount under full pressure.  He further stated that, in his opinion, once MA COMET improved into the lead it once again lacked concentration and did not fully respond to his riding over the concluding stages.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions and expressed satisfaction with the manner in which Jockey Purton had ridden MA COMET.  He added that he would now apply blinkers to MA COMET for its next race start to assist with its concentration over the concluding stages.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out, was bumped and became unbalanced.
Shortly after the start was badly crowded between HAPPY HORSE which jumped awkwardly and shifted out and SIGHT HAPPY which shifted in.  In the Home Straight lay in and proved difficult to ride out.
No report.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded between HAPPY TANGO and HAPPY HORSE.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, VICTORYTHIRTYTHREE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  Passing the 50 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded between HAPPY TANGO and CIRCUIT SEVEN which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  After the event, C Y Ho reported that his mount raced greenly during the race and in the Home Straight proved difficult to ride out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in on jumping and became unbalanced when it made contact with CIRCUS REEL.  In the middle stages making the turn lay out.  When commencing to finish the race off well approaching the 50 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between HAPPY TANGO and HAPPY HORSE which shifted out and away from CHAMPION METHOD.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
K Teetan was warned in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle in a forehand manner on one occasion near the 150 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and was then crowded shortly after the start between QUANTUM PATCH and FORTUNE SUPERSTAR, both of which shifted ground.  Was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.  From the 250 Metres until the 200 Metres was held up for clear running before being shifted to the outside of FORTUNE SUPERSTAR.
From the 200 Metres was taken out by ROCKET SPADE (A Badel) and near the 150 Metres made contact with NOBLE PURSUIT when crowded between NOBLE PURSUIT and ROCKET SPADE.  A Badel was reprimanded.
Near the 150 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced when racing tight between ILLUMINOUS and WINNING STEPS.
No report.
After the 500 Metres became held up for clear running behind GOOD LUCK BABE and near the 400 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between GOOD LUCK BABE and NOBLE PURSUIT.

After the event, M L Yeung stated that his mount was disadvantaged in the early stages with the pace of the event being run inside of standard time and as a result was left without a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, C Y Ho advised that he was instructed to hold a forward position but preferably behind the lead.  He added when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to allow his mount to stride forward to cross RED MAJESTY and PACKING HURRICANE to avoid racing wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Near the 1300 Metres was momentarily crowded by RED MAJESTY which was taken in by QUANTUM PATCH (C Y Ho).  C Y Ho was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping.  Was noted to have sustained a minor laceration to the left front leg after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After the 250 Metres was taken in slightly by HAPPY DAILY which shifted in.
Making the first turn near the 1300 Metres commenced to race keenly and shifted out when being steadied away from HAPPY DAILY.  SMART CITY then continued to race keenly for some distance thereafter.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and was bumped.

Shortly after the start was crowded between ON THE LASH and LUCKY BANNER, both of which shifted ground.  Making the Home Turn near the 350 Metres improved into a narrow run to the inside of MASSIVE ACTION (K C Leung) as that runner attempted to improve to the outside of LUCKY BANNER.  When MASSIVE ACTION then lay in, HAKKA RADIANCE was checked to avoid MASSIVE ACTION.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that HAKKA RADIANCE was endeavouring to improve into a tight run and Jockey Leung had made some effort to correct his mount, he was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  When questioned regarding his riding out over the concluding stages, Z Purton stated that after improving behind LUCKY BANNER when that runner shifted in towards the rail, he became positioned close to its heels and as a consequence was unable to test his mount over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 200 Metres was momentarily crowded for room between ON THE LASH and YOUTH POWER which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.
In the early stages raced keenly when being shifted across behind runners to obtain cover.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
In the Home Straight lay in and proved difficult to ride out.
Jumped only fairly, shifted in and made contact with the hindquarters of HAPPY DAILY.
Bumped heavily at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was steadied when crowded between CALIFORNIA DEEPLY and YOUNG HORIZON which jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  Shifted in between the 200 Metres and the 50 Metres when being ridden out.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  In the early stages raced ungenerously when being shifted across behind runners.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.  Near the 150 Metres improved into a tight run between CIRCUIT DUFFY and TEAM HAPPY and as a result made contact with TEAM HAPPY.  Over the concluding stages raced in restricted room between CIRCUIT DUFFY and TOP TIME which shifted in.

Leaving the 100 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by KOKUSHI MUSOU which was steadied when taken in by TOP TIME (K De Melo).  K De Melo was severely reprimanded and advised that he must stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.
Bumped near the 150 Metres.
Steadied leaving the 100 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount hung out in the middle stages around the turns and as a result during that section of the race ran wide.

Bumped heavily at the start.  Had some difficulty obtaining clear running approaching the 300 Metres.  After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount raced too keenly in the early and middle stages and as a consequence did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped after travelling a short distance.  Raced wide and without cover from the 550 Metres.  Steadied near the 50 Metres.  After the event, H Bowman reported that his mount raced too keenly in the early and middle stages and as a consequence did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced greenly during the event and lay in making the Home Turn and in the Home Straight.  After the event, B Thompson reported that his intention was to hold a forward position from the outside barrier, but his mount bounded on jumping and lost ground and as a result settled further back.
When giving ground near the 100 Metres was eased when crowded between TEAM HAPPY and THE PERFECT MATCH, both of which shifted ground.
After travelling a short distance shifted in and made contact with THE PERFECT MATCH.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after was checked when crowded between SHINKANSEN and ROARING BEBE which shifted in abruptly before being corrected by its rider.  Approaching the 250 Metres was disappointed for clear running between STREET CONQUEROR and BOWSER which shifted in.  As a result, MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE was steadied and shifted to the outside of BOWSER to obtain clear running near the 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.
No report.
Bumped at the start.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that his saddle shifted forward approaching the first turn, placing him at some disadvantage.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.

After the event, M L Yeung reported that whilst he was asked to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages, when it commenced well, he elected to capitalise on the good start and as a result rode his mount forward in the early stages.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions.

When questioned, A Hamelin stated that in the middle stages his mount was racing ungenerously.  He said when positioned between DECRELOT and HAPPY SOUL, he elected to allow HAPPY SOUL to cross his mount so that he could encourage it to travel more comfortably which it did once being crossed by that runner.
Bumped at the start.
In the early stages raced keenly and got its head up and when being steadied to allow BOWSER to cross, over-reacted and continued to race keenly thereafter.
Jumped only fairly.  After the event, M F Poon stated that his mount hung out making the Home Turn and as a result travelled wider.
Between the 500 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind MY FLYING AGNEL.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 900 Metres was steadied when crowded between ORIENTAL SMOKE which shifted in slightly and CALIFORNIA MOXIE which shifted out when being steadied away from GOOD LUCK WIN.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped only fairly and was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by CONCORDE STAR (A Badel) which shifted in and away from BALLISTIC WIN before being corrected by its rider.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  Near the 400 Metres was held up behind SUPER LOVE DRAGON and when being shifted to that runner’s outside to obtain clear running bumped with GOOD LUCK WIN.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the 900 Metres was taken wider when BALLISTIC WIN shifted out.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
When placed under pressure in the Home Straight lay in and passing the 400 Metres made contact with the running rail.

After the event, M F Poon reported that his instructions were to take up a forward position.  He said when unable to cross WIN SPEED in the early stages, MARIO was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued.

Jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  Near the 1100 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by WIN SPEED (M Chadwick) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that Jockey Chadwick had corrected his mount to relieve the pressure to GOOD LUCK WIN, he was issued with a severe reprimand.  Approaching the 350 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by BEAUTY ALLIANCE (H Bowman) which shifted to the outside of SUPER LOVE DRAGON to improve.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  After this, GOOD LUCK WIN then lay out and away from BEAUTY ALLIANCE before being corrected by its rider.

Approaching the 300 Metres was hampered when it shifted out and away from GOOD LUCK WIN.  When questioned, A Badel stated that from the outside barrier and with blinkers being applied to his mount and stepping up in distance, his intention was to hold a forward position.  He said when his mount jumped only fairly and when there was good pace to his inside, he elected to shift CONCORDE STAR behind runners in the early stages to avoid racing wide.
Jumped only fairly and then was steadied when crowded between BALLISTIC WIN and GOOD LUCK WIN which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event and gave ground noticeably in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GREENWICH, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GREENWICH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, H T Mo reported that he was instructed to hold an on-pace position.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions due to a number of first starters being engaged in the event and to avoid having to race inside or behind those runners.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the Home Straight raced greenly and proved difficult to ride out.
Bumped shortly after the start.
For some distance after the start raced tight between KING SHOW and ORIENTAL TYCOON.
No report.
No report.
After travelling a short distance was steadied when racing tight to the inside of MULTIBINGO.  ORIENTAL TYCOON was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

When questioned, J McDonald stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but on jumping BLAZING WIND made contact with the right side of its barrier.  He said in the early stages when SKY VINO held its position three wide and he was to that runner’s outside, he elected to come back and follow SKY VINO to avoid racing wide which resulted in his mount settling further back.  He said after shifting to the outside of SKY VINO on straightening, BLAZING WIND responded only fairly to his riding and, in his opinion, raced in a disappointing manner.  Trainer C S Shum stated that the only explanation he could offer for the performance was that BLAZING WIND was unsuited by settling further back in the field than he had anticipated.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of BLAZING WIND was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, BLAZING WIND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, A Atzeni reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight, particularly when LUCKY IMPACT had not raced since 15 September 2024.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between SKY VINO and NEWBORN MIRACLE, both of which shifted ground.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Trainer D A Hayes confirmed that from the outside barrier he instructed L Hewitson to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.
No report.

Withdrawn on 16.11.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by second Standby Declared Starter SPICY SPANGLE.  Before being allowed to race again, EXCEED THE WISH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 15.11.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by first Standby Declared Starter CIRCUIT VICTORY.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP SCORER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
M L Yeung was fined the sum of $3,000 for initially weighing out with two girths and surcingles which required his saddle being returned from the saddling area in order for him to be re-weighed.
No report.

After the event, C Y Ho could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to finish the race off over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding from the 600 Metres and the reason his mount shifted in and away from the outside rail, L Ferraris stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position but not to make use of his mount to do so as YOUTHFUL SPIRITS had not finished its races off well at its previous starts.  He said after sharing the lead in the early stages, from the 600 Metres he endeavoured to encourage his mount to change its lead leg as it was laying in.  He added when YOUTHFUL SPIRITS failed to change its lead leg, it continued to lay in which resulted in it shifting in and away from the stand rail and allowing FAST NETWORK to improve to its outside.  Having considered his evidence, the Stewards accepted the explanation provided by Jockey Ferraris.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that after holding an on-pace position, his mount was unable to finish the race off over the concluding stages when placed under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

BABY CRYSTAL, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 16.11.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore).  Before being allowed to race again, BABY CRYSTAL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  For some distance after the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind AMAZING RUN.
No report.
Approaching the 150 Metres lay in and had some difficulty obtaining clear running.  PEARL OF PANG’S continued to lay in and over the concluding stages was awkwardly placed close to AMAZING RUN.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped only fairly and then bumped with FAMILY FORTUNE.

Raced keenly in the early stages and for some distance near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from HAPPY UNIVERSE.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to PEARL OF PANG’S.

Near the 300 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 300 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between OWNERS’ PRAISE and HAPPY UNIVERSE.  In this incident, YEE CHEONG RAIDER made contact with the hindquarters of OWNERS’ PRAISE.  After the 200 Metres was shifted to the outside of HAPPY UNIVERSE to secure clear running.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of SPONGE BABE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPONGE BABE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Trainer D J Hall was fined the sum of $10,000 for breaching Trainers’ Handbook Regulation 40 in that he entered GOLDEN DARCI for a barrier trial at Sha Tin on Friday, 15 November 2024 when that horse was the second Standby Declared Starter for this race.
Near the 150 Metres L Ferraris dropped his left rein for a number of strides.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  When questioned, C Y Ho stated that his instructions were to settle his mount where comfortable.  He said GALAXY PATCH jumped only fairly and as a result settled further back than he anticipated.  He further stated that in the early stages GALAXY PATCH raced a little keenly and when he observed HAPPY TOGETHER was caught in a three wide position without cover, he was of the opinion his best option was to obtain a trailing position behind that runner.  He said whist acknowledging the early stages of the event were run inside of standard time, when a number of runners were racing keenly to his inside, this had also influenced his decision to obtain the trail behind HAPPY TOGETHER.  He added that after improving behind HAPPY TOGETHER near the 900 Metres, BEAUTY JOY then commenced to race keenly and shifted out when being steadied away from TAJ DRAGON which resulted in GALAXY PATCH being taken four wide where it raced without cover thereafter.  He said whilst he had attempted to prevent BEAUTY JOY from shifting out, he was not in a position to do so and was concerned that had he persisted, BEAUTY JOY would have been placed in an awkward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Passing the 1300 Metres was steadied when crowded between CHANCHENG GLORY and TAJ DRAGON (A Atzeni) which shifted in and away from VOYAGE BUBBLE (J McDonald) after racing tight to the inside of that runner.  Both A Atzeni and J McDonald were advised to exercise more care.  For a short distance after this HAPPY TOGETHER raced keenly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 900 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from TAJ DRAGON.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Approaching the 150 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind HAPPY TOGETHER.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that his mount raced keenly in the lead and would not settle.  He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight he had some concerns with the action of BEAUTY ETERNAL near the 300 Metres and from that point the horse did not respond to his urgings.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of BEAUTY ETERNAL was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY ETERNAL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report
No report.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the winning post was steadied when crowded between ISLAND BREEZES and MEEPMEEP (B Avdulla) which shifted out.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.

Bumped at the start and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 400 Metres was briefly held up for clear running behind ISLAND BREEZES.  Approaching the 250 Metres was then shifted to the outside of ISLAND BREEZES to obtain clear running.  Over the concluding stages L Hewitson dropped his right rein for a number of strides.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Near the 1100 Metres was bumped when racing tight to the inside of COLOURFUL WINNER which shifted in before being corrected by its rider. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped awkwardly.  Passing the 800 Metres was steadied when it was crowded by ISLAND BREEZES (K Teetan) which shifted in and away from HEALTHY GOLF when racing greenly.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between COLOURFUL WINNER and GALLANT EPOCH which shifted out.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight, K C Leung stated that after having a wide run behind SUPER LEGENDS, he elected to remain racing behind that runner as SUPER LEGENDS was a favoured runner in the event and it would provide his mount with the opportunity to improve into the Home Straight with cover.  He said when SUPER LEGENDS responded better to the urgings of its rider near the 250 Metres, DAY DAY VICTORY was unable to continue to follow SUPER LEGENDS and finished the race off only fairly.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Leung were reasonable in the circumstances.

After the event, A Hamelin reported that his mount came under pressure from the 600 Metres and although crowded near the 150 Metres ERNEST FEELING did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Raced keenly in the early stages. Near the 1100 Metres became unbalance when it bumped with GALLANT EPOCH when that runner was racing tight to the inside of COLOURFUL WINNER. After the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid VANTASTIC CHOICE which shifted out when being crossed by COLOURFUL WINNER.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between DAY DAY VICTORY which shifted in slightly and ERNEST FEELING which was taken out by BIENVENUE (L Hewitson) when that runner improved into doubtful room between ERNEST FEELING and GALLANT EPOCH (A Atzeni) which then shifted out.  L Hewitson was reprimanded and advised he must ensure there is sufficient room when he is improving into runs.  A Atzeni was severely reprimanded and advised he must stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst he is not clear to do so.
Shortly after the start became unbalanced when bumped by BIENVENUE and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped only fairly and was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was bumped by CALIFORNIATOTALITY which shifted out.  Was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.  When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn, J McDonald stated that rather than shifting to the outside of BRAVEHEARTS after the 500 Metres, he elected to follow that runner as he felt that was the best horse to take him into the event.  He said after being held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres, FAMILY JEWEL responded well to his riding.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Briefly held up near the 400 Metres before being shifted to the inside of BRIGHT INHERITANCE to secure clear running.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when held up between BRAVEHEARTS and SUNSTRIDER which shifted out.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that his instructions were to try and lead the event.  He said when a number of runners to his inside elected to go forward and the early stages were run inside of standard time, he was unable to comply with his instructions and this resulted in CALIFORNIATOTALITY racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped only fairly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping was crowded between BRIGHT INHERITANCE and EIGHTEEN CARAT which shifted in.
No report.
After the event, Y L Chung reported that with his mount stepping up in distance and from an inside barrier, he was instructed to hold a more forward position than its previous start.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 150 Metres momentarily raced tight to the inside of VICTOR THE WINNER as that runner was commencing to give ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.
No report.
No report.

Approaching the 100 Metres was steadied to avoid INVINCIBLE SAGE (L Ferraris) which shifted in.  L Ferraris was advised to exercise more care.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount was unable to lead as he had intended due to the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time.  He added when under pressure in the Home Straight CALIFORNIA SPANGLE finished the race off only fairly and performs best when able to dictate in front.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, K Teetan could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
A Atzeni pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see ENCOUNTERED).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1900 Metres was steadied away from MONEY CATCHER when being shifted behind that runner.
K Teetan was warned for using his whip in a manner where his whip arm was raised above shoulder height.

A Atzeni (KA YING GENERATION) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of ENCOUNTERED, resulting in ENCOUNTERED having to be checked away from the heels of KA YING GENERATION.  A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 18 December 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start raced tight between ENCOUNTERED and WINNING DRAGON.  Near the 1200 Metres shifted out to start a forward move and raced wide and without cover thereafter.
No report.
Near the 250 Metres raced tight to the inside of YODA’S CHOICE and made contact with that runner.  Lay out over the concluding stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 1400 Metres when racing tight to the inside of HARMONY GALAXY commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid UNITED ENDEAVORS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
On jumping was crowded between HARMONY GALAXY and YODA’S CHOICE which jumped awkwardly and shifted in.

Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running to the inside of DOUBLE WIN.  As a result, WINDICATOR FAMILY did not obtain clear running until approaching the 200 Metres.

Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, DOUBLE WIN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and was bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped.
Jumped awkwardly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after was crowded between SNOWALOT and UNITED ENDEAVORS which shifted out.  Near the 600 Metres was bumped by YEAH BUDDY which lay in.  After the event, J McDonald stated that whilst he had expected to take up a forward position, it was not his intention to lead.  He said after obtaining the lead in the early stages HARMONY GALAXY was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead in the middle stages when YEAH BUDDY went forward.  He said as a consequence HARMONY GALAXY gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover in the early stages and was then ridden forward leaving the 900 Metres where it was able to take up a position outside the lead approaching the 700 Metres.  When giving ground near the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between HARMONY GALAXY and TAKE ACTION which, after improving to the inside of YODA’S CHOICE, shifted in when making contact with that runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  K C Leung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see PACKING POWER).  Sent for sampling post-race.

Taken out at the start by FAST RESPONDER and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding out of LIFELINE EXPRESS and as to whether he had ridden his mount out fully to the end of the race, A Badel stated that when riding his mount out, he had received a call from L Ferraris, rider of PATCH OF COSMO, when that runner was racing tight to his inside.  He said as a consequence over the final stages of the event he did not fully ride his mount out to ensure that it did not cause interference to PATCH OF COSMO.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that his actions had not affected his finishing position, he was advised that, wherever possible, he should ensure he rides his mounts out to the finish of the event.
Jumped only fairly.  Over the final 50 Metres raced tight between VICTORY SKY and LIFELINE EXPRESS, both of which shifted ground slightly.
Momentarily crowded near the 900 Metres.  Between the 400 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running.
After the 900 Metres became unbalanced when racing in restricted room between POSITIVE SMILE and PATCH OF COSMO.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1200 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from SUPERB MOVE.  K De Melo was questioned in relation to his riding out of the horse to the finish.  He said over the concluding stages when he put his whip away, he reduced the vigour for a short period before recommencing when he observed INVINCIBLE MISSILE improving quickly to his outside.  Jockey De Melo was advised that at all times he should ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race so that he does not compromise his placing in the field.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running on the Home Turn.  H Bowman pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 100 Metres (see TRIPLE BLISS).
No report.
Jumped awkwardly. Approaching the 100 Metres was hampered when taken in.

Approaching the 100 Metres was hampered when taken in.  When questioned, A Badel stated that after being held up on the Home Turn behind TRIPLE BLISS, he was able to improve to that runner’s outside near the 300 Metres.  He said after obtaining a narrow run between WINNING SEVEN and TRIPLE BLISS, his mount was crowded near the 100 Metres and in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with the performance of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, MEDIC ELITE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.

Near the 350 Metres was checked to avoid FALCON COURT.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, RIGHT HONOURABLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

H Bowman pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of WINNING SEVEN, resulting in WINNING SEVEN being taken in onto MEDIC ELITE, taking MEDIC ELITE across the running of TRIPLE BLISS, resulting in TRIPLE BLISS having to be checked.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 11 December 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

When giving ground on the Home Turn was steadied when crowded between RED MAVERICK and WINNING SEVEN which shifted out slightly to improve.  After the event, Z Purton reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and came under pressure on the Home Turn before weakening in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FALCON COURT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FALCON COURT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shortly after the start was bumped by CHAMPION INSTINCT which shifted in slightly.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid PACKING POWER (Z Purton) which shifted in when not clear.  Z Purton was reprimanded.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards were of the opinion that Apprentice P N Wong had persisted for too long in endeavouring to hold a position to the inside of PACKING POWER notwithstanding the fact that PACKING POWER was not sufficiently clear.  Apprentice Wong was advised she would be expected to show better judgement than what she did on this occasion.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.

K C Leung (VICTORY SKY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of PACKING POWER, resulting in PACKING POWER being checked to avoid the heels of VICTORY SKY and also contributing to DIVANO being checked when crowded between EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS and PACKING POWER.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 11 December 2024 and to expire on Monday, 16 December 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to take up a position outside the lead.  He said with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time, PACKING POWER did not travel strongly when in this position.  He added in the Home Straight PACKING POWER commenced to give ground and although crowded near the 150 Metres was under pressure prior to that incident.  He further stated that when PACKING POWER continued to shift ground over the concluding stages he did not ride the horse out to the finish as he was concerned something may have been amiss.  Trainer C S Shum concurred with the views of Jockey Purton and stated that PACKING POWER had pleased him leading into today’s race including its most recent barrier trial on 4 November 2024.  He added that at its next race start PACKING POWER would be stepped up in distance and would be ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The Stewards determined the performance of PACKING POWER to be disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING POWER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When commencing to finish the race off well was held up for clear running behind PACKING POWER approaching the 100 Metres when that runner commenced to give ground.  As a result, PRESS LINK was steadied and shifted to the inside of PACKING POWER and THESIS to obtain clear running.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when improving close to POSITIVE SMILE.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Near the 900 Metres shifted in and was steadied when awkwardly placed close to DIVANO.  Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.

Bumped at the start.  After being held up for clear running endeavoured to obtain a tight run between PACKING POWER and EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS near the 250 Metres, resulting in DIVANO making contact with EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS and being steadied when disappointed for clear running.  J McDonald was advised to exercise more care and to ensure there is sufficient room to improve.  Near the 150 Metres DIVANO was checked when crowded between EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS and PACKING POWER.  After the event, J McDonald stated that his mount was travelling well in the Home Straight before being interfered with and, in his opinion, would have finished the race off had it been afforded clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly, got its head up and shifted out and as a result became unbalanced.  In the early stages raced keenly and got its head up as its rider L Hewitson endeavoured to obtain cover.

Withdrawn on 16.11.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right hind) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter CASA ROCHESTER.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER INFINITY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After being crossed by GRACIOUS EXPRESS near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from that  runner.  BEAUTY CRESCENT was then shifted to the outside of GRACIOUS EXPRESS and raced wide and without cover thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
For a short distance near the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining a narrow run between JOHANNES BRAHMS and BEAUTY CRESCENT.
Bumped at the start.
Approaching the 50 Metres was steadied away from KING MILES and shifted to that runner’s inside to obtain clear running.

When questioned, C Y Ho stated that he had not intended on leading the event but had anticipated taking up a more forward position than previous starts due to a lack of pace in the event.  He said KING MILES jumped well today and when other runners around him did not show the intent to lead, KING MILES led without being pressured to do so.  When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn, he stated that when JOHANNES BRAHMS commenced to improve to his outside, he allowed KING MILES to shift away from the rail slightly to ensure his mount was afforded with clear running.  He added he was not of the opinion that he had left sufficient room for a runner to improve to his inside and after the 400 Metres was surprised when he received a call from K Teetan, rider of SILVERY BREEZE when that runner improved to his inside.  C Y Ho was advised that, wherever possible, he should attempt to ride his mounts in a more competitive manner.

Jumped awkwardly.  Approaching the 1200 Metres MAGNIFICENT NINE (A Badel) shifted out when being corrected by its rider, resulting in MASTER MASTERMIND, which was racing keenly, being checked away from MAGNIFICENT NINE.  A Badel was reprimanded.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  As this was the second occasion that MASTER MASTERMIND had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Crowded at the start and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 1200 Metres was steadied to avoid MASTER MASTERMIND when that runner was taken out.
Bumped at the start.
Passing the 1300 Metres was momentarily crowded by MAGNIFICENT NINE which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.
Shortly after the start was bumped by HYPER DRAGON BALL which shifted in.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

M Chadwick was questioned in relation to his riding out over the concluding stages.  He agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he had desisted from riding his mount out too soon.  He was advised that at all times he should ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race so that he does not compromise his placing in the field.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then bumped with U S S CONSTITUTION.  Making the Home Turn near the 400 Metres became unbalanced when improving into a tight run to the inside of GLUCK RACER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the event, H Bowman confirmed his instructions were to lead the event.  He said despite riding his mount along in the early stages it failed to show sufficient pace to do so.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to obtain a trailing position behind FOREMOST TEDDY and as a result SUPER BABY settled further back than had been intended.
No report.

Near the 1500 Metres was steadied to avoid VIVA GRACIOUSNESS (M Chadwick) which shifted in when not quite clear.  M Chadwick was advised to exercise more care.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when placed in restricted room between SMART CITY and SUPER BABY which shifted in slightly.  After the event, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to settle his mount where comfortable.  He said in the early stages he was obliged to make some use of his mount to cross U S S CONSTITUTION which resulted in STRONGEST BOY having to be ridden slightly more forward than what he had anticipated.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly, got its head up and as a consequence lost ground.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped at the start.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.
Bounded on jumping and lost ground.
Sent for sampling post-race.
H Bentley pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 100 Metres (see COUNTRY DANCER).  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  Raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 800 Metres was steadied away from RUBY SAILING.
K C Leung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 800 Metres (see RUBY SAILING).  Hampered and taken out near the 100 Metres.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  K C Leung (COSMO NAVIGATOR) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 800 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of RUBY SAILING, resulting in RUBY SAILING having to be checked away from the heels of COSMO NAVIGATOR.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Thursday, 26 December 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 2 January 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Leung was fined $55,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his poor race riding record.  Passing the 50 Metres was eased when placed in restricted room between VERBIER and COSMO NAVIGATOR which was taken out.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that his mount, which is a reported "roarer”, raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages of the event and made a respiratory noise in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was crowded between JOYFUL FRIENDSHIP and E GLORY which shifted out slightly.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 700 Metres made contact with the running rail when racing tight to the inside of JOYFUL FRIENDSHIP.  H Bentley (WINNING HEART) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of COSMO NAVIGATOR, resulting in COSMO NAVIGATOR being taken out and crowding the running of COUNTRY DANCER which was checked.  H Bentley was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 4 December 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount did not travel well during the event and may not have appreciated the "Good to Yielding” track condition.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was bumped.  Passing the 50 Metres was checked to avoid COUNTRY DANCER.  After the event, J McDonald reported that after settling back in the field his mount was under pressure from the 600 Metres and in the Home Straight was unable to make up any ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

After the event, J McDonald reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the race and as a result did not respond to his riding when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

For some distance near the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a narrow run between FUN N GLORY and SPICY SO SMART.  Noted to have blood in its mouth after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
Near the 600 Metres made contact with the running rail.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
In the early stages raced tight between MOTOMAN and TELECOM DRAGON which shifted in slightly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded by FUN N GLORY which shifted in as it hung in.  Near the 600 Metres became unbalanced when it shifted away from the running rail after FUN N GLORY, which was racing in advance, made contact with the rail.  After the event, Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 900 Metres, when racing ungenerously, shifted in and was steadied away from HAYDAY when that runner shifted out slightly at the same point.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

On jumping was steadied when crowded between MIU FA FA and SPICY SO SMART which shifted out.  Near the 200 Metres was steadied when it shifted out towards the heels of LUCKY PLANET when that runner shifted in after making contact with MIU FA FA which shifted in slightly.  As the Stewards were satisfied that the racing manners of LOVING VIBES was the main reason for the incident occurring, no action was taken.
On arrival at the Start, the tongue tie applied to STORMING DRAGON was refitted.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Made contact with the right side of its barrier on jumping and became unbalanced and then shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between SPORTIC WARRIOR and CAMP FIRE which shifted in.  After the 900 Metres commenced to race fiercely and got its head up when positioned close to STORMING DRAGON.  TRIUMPHANT MORE then continued to race fiercely for some distance thereafter.
Bounded on jumping.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Making the turn in the middle stages lay in and made contact with FUNG after the 500 Metres.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
For some distance after the 500 Metres raced tight to the inside of MACANESE MASTER and was bumped by that runner.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  In the early stages got its head up and raced keenly when being shifted across behind runners to obtain cover from a wide barrier.  Near the 100 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between SPORTIC WARRIOR and FUNG, both of which shifted ground slightly.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in as they observed an incident had occurred approaching the 50 Metres when LOVERO was bumped and taken in by SUPER UNICORN (Z Purton) which placed doubt as to whether SUPER UNICORN should be declared the winner of the race.  Subsequently Y L Chung, rider of LOVERO, second placegetter, lodged a protest/objection against SUPER UNICORN being declared the winner alleging interference over the concluding stages of the event.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found that near the 50 Metres SUPER UNICORN shifted in and made contact with LOVERO, taking that horse in and resulting in LOVERO losing momentum during that incident.  As the Stewards were comfortably satisfied that had that interference not occurred LOVERO would have finished in advance of SUPER UNICORN, the protest/objection was sustained and the placings amended to read No. 4, LOVERO, 1st; No. 12, SUPER UNICORN, 2nd; No. 6, ROMANTIC LAOS, 3rd; and No. 8, I CAN, 4th.  Z Purton was advised to exercise more care and that he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mounts.  When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer A S Cruz stated that the horse benefited from its first up performance on 11 September 2024 and had pleased him in a barrier trial at Conghua on 25 October 2024 and this was the principal reason for the horse’s improved performance tonight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in near the 50 Metres and bumped with LOVERO.  Relegated to second on protest/objection (see LOVERO).  Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 1500 Metres was checked when crowded by SUPER UNICORN which, after shifting in despite the efforts of its rider Z Purton, then raced tight to the inside of SOLEIL FIGHTER (M F Poon) which shifted in.  M F Poon was reprimanded.  Approaching the 250 Metres was bumped and taken out by I CAN.
For some distance near the 250 Metres was shifted out to obtain clear running and made contact with ROMANTIC LAOS.
Jumped awkwardly and from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Approaching the 1500 Metres was steadied to obtain cover behind ROMANTIC LAOS when racing tight to the inside of SUPER UNICORN.

After the event, M F Poon stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to cross runners to his inside and as a result SOLEIL FIGHTER was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between SILO and LOVERO which shifted out.
No report.
No report.

Near the 250 Metres was steadied to avoid ROMANTIC LAOS when that runner was taken out by I CAN (A Badel) which shifted out when not quite clear.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong reported that from a wide barrier he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to lead.  He said as a result HELENE WARRIOR was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Knuckled on jumping.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied and shifted out to avoid JAMES TAK.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 150 Metres L Hewitson dropped his left rein for a short distance. When questioned, L Hewitson stated that when his mount commenced to lay out approaching the 150 Metres, he pulled the whip through from his right to his left hand. He said as he did so he dropped his left rein for a short distance. He added over the concluding stages when being ridden out WONDER KIT then lay in towards the running rail which required him to correct his mount and stop riding with the whip near the 50 Metres before he was able to recommence fully testing his mount to the finish. L Hewitson was advised that as this was the third occasion he was noted to have dropped his rein, he should, wherever possible, ensure that he maintains control of his reins. Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Making the Home Turn near the 350 Metres became unbalanced when positioned close to SING DRAGON.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up making the Home Turn and near the 300 Metres was shifted to the inside of WONDER KIT to secure clear running.
Raced keenly in the early stages.  Approaching the 600 Metres was taken wider by LUCKY ENCOUNTER which shifted out.  GORGEOUS WIN then raced wide and without cover thereafter.
Jumped only fairly.

Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of M F Poon, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
After the 900 Metres shifted in to obtain cover behind GLORY ELITE and then commenced to race keenly and was awkwardly placed close to the heels of that runner for some distance.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 250 Metres was checked when crowded between GORGEOUS WIN (J McDonald) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider and GLORY ELITE (K C Leung) which shifted out and away from I GIVE.  In this incident, GLORY ELITE was contacted on the hindquarters, resulting in that runner being turned out further into the running of JAMES TAK.  As the Stewards were satisfied that the shifts from Jockeys McDonald and K C Leung were only of a minor nature, they were both asked in similar circumstances to exercise more care. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Near the 250 Metres was steadied away from BEAUTY CHARGE when that runner shifted out abruptly to avoid JAMES TAK.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY ENCOUNTER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Making the first turn after the 1000 Metres was bumped by ROMANTIC SON.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He said after being inconvenienced near the 700 Metres when PRAWNS ELEVEN shifted out, his mount, under 134 lbs, did not finish the race off. Was fractious whilst being transported to Happy Valley and sustained a small abrasion to the right hind leg.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the event, Z Purton stated that the only explanation he could offer for the horse’s performance was that ROMANTIC SON did not appreciate the "Good to Yielding” track conditions. B Thompson was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference after the 1100 Metres (see SKY PROPHET).  Leaving the 100 Metres shifted in and away from HONG LOK GOLF, resulting in its rider B Thompson having to stop riding and straighten his mount.  When questioned regarding his riding, B Thompson stated that after being crossed by BINGO BABE in the early stages, that runner steadied the pace once it obtained the lead which resulted in NEW FUTURE FOLKS commencing to race keenly.  He said as a result he shifted out to follow PACKING ANGEL near the 700 Metres, however, NEW FUTURE FOLKS continued to race keenly and would not settle.  He added as a result near the 600 Metres he was obliged to shift to the outside of PACKING ANGEL to avoid that runner’s heels which resulted in NEW FUTURE FOLKS racing wide and without cover thereafter.

Approaching the 800 Metres BLUE BARON, which was racing greenly, was checked when crowded between SKY PROPHET (A Badel) which shifted in slightly and SIKANDAR which lay out on the turn.  Whilst the Stewards found that the racing manners of SIKANDAR and BLUE BARON were the principal reasons for the incident, A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  Approaching the 400 Metres was bumped on a number of occasions and taken wider.
Near the 170 Metres attempted to jump a mark on the track and became unbalanced.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Approaching the 400 Metres made contact with BLUE BARON on a number of occasions when improving to the outside of SKY PROPHET.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

B Thompson (NEW FUTURE FOLKS) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 1100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of SKY PROPHET, resulting in SKY PROPHET being checked away from NEW FUTURE FOLKS.  B Thompson was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 4 December 2024 and to expire on Monday, 9 December 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Approaching the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid ANOTHER WORLD (L Hewitson) when that runner shifted to the outside of HONG LOK GOLF to obtain clear running.  L Hewitson was advised to exercise more care.

Approaching the 500 Metres was eased when taken wider by NEW FUTURE FOLKS which shifted to the outside of PACKING ANGEL.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount raced greenly throughout the race and responded only fairly to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by ROMAN CROWN.  Lay out near the 800 Metres.

After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, was ridden along in the early stages to hold the lead from the outside barrier and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.
