When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that near the 200 Metres he attempted to shift to the outside of ROBOT KNIGHT to secure clear running, however, his mount did not respond to his efforts and was reluctant to shift out.  He said as a result he then elected to shift in to obtain clear running between ROBOT KNIGHT and GOLDEN LONG, however, when those runners shifted ground, DRAGON AIR FORCE was then held up for clear running until passing the 50 Metres where it shifted to the outside of GOLDEN LONG.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable in the circumstances.

When questioned regarding his riding out over the concluding stages, K Teetan stated that after shifting his mount to the outside of SKY TRUST near the 100 Metres, he then attempted to pull his whip through to his right hand.  He said as he commenced to do so he dropped his left rein for a short distance before regaining it and being able to continue to ride his mount out fully to the finish of the event.  K Teetan was advised that he should, wherever possible, ensure that he maintains proper control of his reins.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between ARMOUR WAR EAGLE and PRESTIGE ALWAYS, both of which shifted ground slightly.  NAMJONG KINGDOM then lay in over the final 100 Metres and proved difficult to ride out.

When questioned, A Badel stated that the instructions were to endeavour to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages with cover. He said after travelling a short distance he attempted to restrain his mount to comply with his instructions, however, ARMOUR WAR EAGLE raced keenly and as a result he was unable to obtain cover.  He said when ARMOUR WAR EAGLE continued to race keenly in the early stages he allowed it to stride forward to take up a position outside SKY TRUST, however, his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added having regard to the manner in which ARMOUR WAR EAGLE raced in the early stages and the fact that it was obliged to race wide and without cover, it was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  He further added that, in his opinion, ARMOUR WAR EAGLE would be better suited by being dropped back in distance for its next race start where it would be able to settle on a more genuine pace.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, H Bowman reported that his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, C L Chau stated that as the blindfold was removed prior to the start being effected, MODEST GENTLEMAN then lunged forward when the start was effected, resulting in it making contact with the front of the starting gates and losing ground.  He said after being crowded shortly after MODEST GENTLEMAN settled back in the field.  He further stated that near the 400 Metres he endeavoured to obtain a narrow run to the inside of CIRCUIT TEN which he anticipated would continue to shift out.  He said when CIRCUIT TEN did not shift out, he was obliged to check his mount to avoid CIRCUIT TEN.  He added in the Home Straight he elected to shift to the inside of SPEEDY FORTUNE to obtain clear running as he had observed that runner shift out near the 350 Metres and he felt this would provide his mount with the best opportunity to continue to improve into the event.  He said after improving to the inside of SPEEDY FORTUNE, that runner then shifted in which resulted in MODEST GENTLEMAN being badly held up for clear running over the final 200 Metres when it also blundered when it struck the heels of HAPPY HORSE leaving the 150 Metres.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chau in the Home Straight were reasonable in the circumstances.

Approaching the 400 Metres was taken wider by MILES AWAY which shifted out to improve.

Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running and approaching the 300 Metres raced tight to the inside of HAPPY AGAIN which shifted in slightly.  Over the final 50 Metres could not be ridden out when positioned close to ATOMIC BEAUTY.

Shortly after the start was bumped and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, J McDonald stated that his mount settled back and found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight due to the early pace of the event being run outside of standard time in the early stages.  He added in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with the performance of ESCAPE ROUTE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

In the early stages raced keenly.  After the event, C L Chau stated that with his mount having its first race start at Happy Valley, he was instructed to ride HANDSOME BOMB in a midfield position.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions issued.

When caught wide in the early stages was allowed to stride forward where it obtained a position outside the lead near the 1200 Metres.  Leaving the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between SILVER KING and DRAGON DELIGHT (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted out.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.
When commencing to give ground after the 350 Metres was steadied when awkwardly placed between SILVER KING and HAPPY AGAIN which shifted out when it made the turn awkwardly.

Shifted in shortly after the start and bumped NEW POWER.  Approaching the 100 Metres lay in, resulting in its rider H Bowman having to stop riding and straighten his mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Approaching the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind ROARING BEBE when that runner shifted out to improve.  Near the 200 Metres was then shifted to the outside of KING ECCELLENTE to secure clear running.
After the event, C Y Ho reported that from an inside barrier when his mount commenced well, it was able to hold a more forward position than it had at its previous race starts.

Approaching the 250 Metres was shifted to the outside of VALHALLA to secure clear running and raced tight between VALHALLA and KING ECCELLENTE for a short distance after the 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.

Knuckled over badly on jumping, resulting in Y L Chung becoming unbalanced.  A short distance later was then bumped by GALLANT VALOUR which shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by GOOD PROSPECT which shifted in.

Jumped awkwardly.  In the early stages raced keenly when being shifted behind GALLANT VALOUR to obtain cover.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that with the horse having its first start for Trainer D Eustace, he was instructed to ride SEA SAPPHIRE in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said in the Home Straight SEA SAPPHIRE finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that after being shifted across behind runners from the outside barrier in the early stages, SO TREASURE did not travel well during the event and ran on only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, B Thompson stated that his instructions were to endeavour to find a position with cover.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and unable to comply with those instructions, he allowed TOY SOLTERO to stride forward to avoid covering additional ground and as a result raced outside the lead in a more forward position.
Shortly after the start shifted in and was bumped.  Near the 450 Metres was bumped by ILLUMINOUS which shifted out to improve.
No report.
Jumped only fairly. For some distance near the 150 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when racing tight to the inside of ROCKET SPADE.

Near the 300 Metres improved into a narrow run between SHARPEN BRIGHT and HAMERON and then raced tight between those runners in the Home Straight.  Over the concluding stages was steadied when crowded between SHARPEN BRIGHT and HAMERON which was taken in slightly by ROCKET SPADE (H Bowman).  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When placed under pressure  in the Home Straight lay in.  After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount finished the race off in a satisfactory manner and in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with its performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 450 Metres shifted out and made contact with SHARPEN BRIGHT.  Near the 150 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running between SHARPEN BRIGHT and TOY SOLTERO and in this incident made contact with SHARPEN BRIGHT. Jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Slow to begin.
No report.

Shifted out abruptly at the start.  When questioned, M Chadwick stated that after shifting out abruptly at the start, his mount hung out across the heels of BUNTA BABY near the 600 Metres and as a result was checked and lost ground.  A warning was placed on the racing manners of RED ELEGANCE.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, M Chadwick stated that his mount continued to lay out and proved difficult to fully test.  He said as a result over the concluding stages he was unable to ride his mount out with full vigour.  The Stewards advised Jockey Chadwick that, wherever possible, he should ensure that he rides his mounts out to the best of his ability.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After travelling a short distance was checked when crowded between HAPPY UNITED and RED ELEGANCE which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after was checked when crowded between CHARMING BABE and RED ELEGANCE which shifted out abruptly despite the efforts of its rider.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount hung out throughout the event and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  When questioned, Trainer D A Hayes stated that he was of the opinion that ALLGREEKTOME would perform well tonight although it had not impressed him when it barrier trialed on the All Weather surface on 19 November 2024.  He said as he felt the performance of the barrier trial was due to the All Weather surface, he was of the opinion that ALLGREEKTOME would still be able to perform well tonight.  He added that ALLGREEKTOME was disadvantaged by YOUTHFUL SPIRITS showing superior pace in the early stages and the early stages being run inside standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of ALLGREEKTOME was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, ALLGREEKTOME will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 600 Metres ALLGREEKTOME hung out and made contact with HAPPY UNITED.
Jumped only fairly.

Examined on arrival at the Start by the Veterinary Officer and found to be lame in the left front leg and was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice, HORSEPOWER was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, HORSEPOWER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, THE PERFECT MATCH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
In the middle stages raced keenly and for a short distance near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid VIGOR ELLEEGANT.

Slow to begin.  Approaching the 100 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of SWEET DIAMOND to obtain clear running and then raced tight to the inside of SWEET DIAMOND for some distance near the 50 Metres.

No report.

He said with the early pace of the event being run inside of standard time GLORY CLOUD did not travel well and he was obliged to encourage his mount to maintain its position in the middle stages.  He added after shifting GLORY CLOUD to the outside of HAPPY DAY near the 400 Metres, GLORY CLOUD finished the race off only fairly.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He said in accordance with those instructions he rode his mount along in the early stages in an attempt to cross CALIFORNIA ICON.  He said when unable to clear that runner he continued to encourage his mount forward although he agreed with the Stewards that in the circumstances he had set too fast a pace in the early stages of the event.  As this was the first occasion that Jockey Pouchin had ridden in Hong Kong, he was advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to show better judgement than what he did on this occasion. Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The performance of STERLING WONGCHOY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, STERLING WONGCHOY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

He said as a result he rode his mount along in the early stages to comply with those instructions, but was unable to obtain the lead in the early stages.  He said when positioned to the inside of YODA’S CHOICE he continued to encourage his mount to hold its position to the inside of that runner, but at the 1400 Metres when he was of the opinion he would not be able to hold that position, he restrained his mount to allow that runner to cross.  He added from the 1400 Metres his mount raced keenly and would not respond to his efforts to allow YODA’S CHOICE to cross which resulted in the pace of the event being quicker than what he would have liked.  Trainer A S Cruz confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of CALIFORNIA ICON, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA ICON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

As the start was effected became fractious and as a result was slow to begin.  Near the 1400 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to allow VERBIER to cross.  After the event, H Bentley reported that when his mount commenced to give ground quickly and he felt there may be something amiss with it, he did not continue to fully ride it out over the concluding stages of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MAGIC TRAVELLER, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable. On jumping was bumped by LUCKY MAN which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, L Ferraris stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily throughout the early and middle stages and after initially responding to his riding in the Home Straight gave ground over the final 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, CHEERFUL WORLD will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 850 Metres was checked when crowded between ISLAND BUDDY which shifted out slightly and GOOD CHAP which was racing tight to the inside of SUPER LEGENDS (J McDonald) which shifted in slightly.  J McDonald was advised to ensure that he leaves sufficient racing room for runners to his inside.  In taking no direct action, the Stewards found that the racing manners of GOLDENTRONICMIGHTY, which was having its second race start, contributed to the incident in that it shifted out towards the heels of GOOD CHAP prior to being checked.
Near the 1100 Metres was eased when placed in restricted room to the inside of GOOD CHAP.  Approaching the 800 Metres was steadied away from THE BOOM BOX.

Proved difficult to load.  The barrier manners and performance of GOOD CHAP were considered unacceptable. Jumped only fairly and then raced tight to the inside of FANCY STAR for a short distance after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

No report.

Noted to have blood at the right nostril after the race.  An endoscopic examination conducted on SPEEDSTAR found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled. <2/12/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>The Veterinary Officer reported that SPEEDSTAR was lame in its right front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, SPEEDSTAR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was bumped and became unbalanced when crowded between SONIC BOOM and PATCH OF WATCH which shifted out abruptly.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied away from PATCH OF WATCH.

After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that the instructions were to lead, but her mount jumped awkwardly, shifted out abruptly and lost ground.  She said as a result PATCH OF WATCH settled further back in the early stages, then raced keenly and refused to settle throughout the early and middle stages of the event when caught wide behind GORGEOUS VITALITY.  She said as a consequence in the Home Straight PATCH OF WATCH failed to respond to her riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, PATCH OF WATCH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 900 Metres was checked when crowded between PARTERRE which shifted in slightly and BABY CRYSTAL which shifted out and away from HEALTHY HEALTHY.  After considering all the evidence, the Stewards found that the incident occurred due to minor shifts from both horses and therefore no action was taken.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that after commencing awkwardly his mount then raced in restricted room shortly after the start between PARTERRE and BABY CRYSTAL.  He said when both runners then shifted ground approaching the 900 Metres, he was obliged to check his mount and as a result KA YING VICTORY got its head up and lost ground.  He added that this resulted in KA YING VICTORY settling further back in the field than anticipated.  He further stated that he elected then to follow BABY CRYSTAL in the race as he felt this would provide his mount with the best opportunity to improve into the event.  He said when BABY CRYSTAL did not quicken from the 500 Metres KA YING VICTORY became badly held up for clear running behind that runner at which point he was anticipating CARROLL STREET, which appeared to be under pressure, to give ground.  He added that when CARROLL STREET maintained its position to the inside of BABY CRYSTAL, his mount continued to be held up for clear running until near the 100 Metres where he was able to commence riding his mount along.  He said again over the concluding stages KA YING VICTORY could not be ridden out when placed in restricted room between O’LINER and CARROLL STREET.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Before being allowed to race again, SKY DEEP will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong.

She added that as a consequence her mount did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Avdulla reported that his mount stumbled badly on jumping and as a result lost ground and settled at the rear of the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with FRANTANCK.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Had its right front plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.  Held up for a short distance on the Home Turn.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that when caught wide in the early stages he elected to continue to allow his mount to stride forward to avoid covering additional ground.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running when improving into a narrow run between FRANTANCK and MUST GO and as a result did not obtain clear running until after the 200 Metres.

Bumped on jumping.  After the event, L Hewitson reported that his mount did not show its usual early pace and as a result took some time to be able to race outside the lead.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

At declaration time, A Hamelin was declared as the rider of both JOLLY RULER and FUN TOGETHER.  It was established that A Hamelin had a firm commitment to ride JOLLY RULER.  As such, the Stewards permitted M Chadwick to be substituted as the rider of FUN TOGETHER.  For this declaration error, A Hamelin was fined $2,000.  After the event, M Chadwick reported that his mount raced too keenly in the lead and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Knuckled on jumping.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between FORTUNE WHISKEY and INVINCIBLE DELIGHT which shifted out after making contact with CARRYON SMILING.  After the 600 Metres became unbalanced when it shifted in towards the running rail and was corrected by its rider A Atzeni.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1000 Metres blundered when it struck the heels of INVINCIBLE DELIGHT (B Thompson) which was racing tight to the inside of SPEEDY SMARTIE (L Hewitson).  As the Stewards were satisfied that INVINCIBLE DELIGHT had maintained a three wide position to the outside of RACINGRACE, no direct action was taken, however, both Jockeys Thompson and L Hewitson were advised, wherever possible, to ensure runners to their inside have comfortable racing room.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
On the Home Turn was held up for clear running and on straightening near the 300 Metres shifted out towards SPEEDY SMARTIE, resulting in its rider M L Yeung becoming unbalanced.
Jumped awkwardly and shortly afterwards bumped with LIGHTNING BOLT.  After the 200 Metres was shifted out a number of horses to continue into clear running.

Proved difficult to load.  Before being allowed to race again, FORTUNE WHISKEY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of SPEEDY SMARTIE which shifted in slightly.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, J McDonald reported that his mount raced "flat” tonight and he could offer no excuse for the horse’s disappointing performance.  Trainer C S Shum stated that the horse had pleased him leading into the event and, in his opinion, had performed similarly to its previous race starts.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Trainer C Fownes confirmed that from the outside barrier he had instructed H Bowman to ride the horse conservatively in the early stages.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, Z Purton reported that with the race being run inside of standard time in the early stages, GENEVA did not travel comfortably and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped shortly after the start.
Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between STEPS AHEAD and HE WAS ME which, after making contact with SPANISH FLAME, shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.
Jumped awkwardly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start shifted in, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.
Made contact with the right side of its barrier on jumping and as a result was slow to begin.

After the event, H Bentley reported that he had some concern with his mount’s action in the Home Straight and as a result he eased it down over the concluding stages when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of TOP PEAK, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP PEAK will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Bumped on jumping and became unbalanced and from a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Near the 150 Metres shifted out and away from FASHION LEGEND and made contact with HE WAS YOU.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and was bumped.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between YOUNG HORIZON and BEAUTY MISSILE.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

L Hewitson was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  Shifted in at the start and was bumped and from a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped at the start.  Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.

Shortly after the start was crowded between MEEPMEEP and SUNDAY’S SERENADE which shifted in after being bumped by BRILLIANT FIRE.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that he was instructed to obtain a midfield position with cover.  He said when RUN RAN RUN jumped well, he was unable to comply with his instructions and when caught wide in the early stages he elected to allow his mount to stride forward where it travelled in a more forward position than instructed.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions issued.

A Badel was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  After the event, A Badel reported that his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a result was unable to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

As the start was effected reared simultaneously and lost ground.  Before being allowed to race again, KASA PAPA will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Near the 300 Metres shifted out slightly and was bumped.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 200 Metres was briefly held up for clear running behind SUPERB MOVE.

On jumping was bumped by MANYTHANKS FOREVER which shifted out.  After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded by FLYING ROMANTIC which shifted in after making contact with COOL BLUE. Bumped at the start.

After the event, L Hewitson reported that after leading in the early stages SUPER GLORY failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M F Poon stated that after being held up in the early part of the Home Straight SUNNY SHINES lost momentum and as a consequence did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He said when RED MAVERICK commenced well, he was obliged to allow it to stride forward but the horse raced keenly when positioned outside the lead in the early stages.  He said as a consequence RED MAVERICK did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, RED MAVERICK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Withdrawn on 3.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (fever).  Before being allowed to race again, IVICTORIAM will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

In the early stages raced keenly when being steadied to obtain cover behind MIGHTY STRENGTH.  When questioned regarding his riding, Z Purton stated that after following MIGHTY STRENGTH in the event, when that runner shifted out approaching the 450 Metres he elected to improve to its inside to obtain clear running.  He said after being briefly held up on the Home Turn he was able to place his mount under full pressure on straightening where LUCKY TOUCH ran on well.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out a short distance later and made contact with DURHAM STAR.
Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions were to ride the horse in a midfield position as YEAH BUDDY had been racing keenly when ridden forward at its previous race starts.

Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Slow to begin.
Bumped shortly after the start.  On the Home Turn was steadied when momentarily crowded by LUCKY TOUCH which shifted to the inside of ORIENTAL TYCOON to obtain clear running.

The performance of ORIENTAL TYCOON, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ORIENTAL TYCOON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between SOLEIL FIGHTER and NEVER TOO SOON.  When finishing the race off well over the concluding stages raced in restricted room between SOLEIL FIGHTER and SILO.

SUPER UNICORN then lay out in the early part of the Home Straight and after being corrected by its rider shifted in towards SILO, resulting in its rider M Barzalona having to stop riding and straighten his mount near the 150 Metres.  Noted to have sustained a small abrasion to the left hind pastern.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Before being allowed to race again, DARING PURSUIT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the race, C Y Ho reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have an epiglottic entrapment.

After the event, H Bowman stated that although his mount jumped awkwardly, it was able to lead the event.  He said in the Home Straight LOVERO did not respond to his riding and weakened over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of LOVERO, a last start winner, was considered disappointing as compared to its last race start.  Before being allowed to race again, LOVERO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Slow to begin.  Shortly after the start was hampered when taken in by MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE (Z Purton) which shifted in when not clear.  Z Purton was reprimanded.  In the Home Straight lay in and over the concluding stages was positioned close to PRIME MORTAR.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, H Doyle confirmed that from the outside barrier she was instructed to ride her mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  She added with the blinkers removed for tonight’s race WORLD HERO did not travel well during the event and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.

C Y Ho (LUCKY BANNER) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the first turn he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of FOREVER GLORIOUS, resulting in FOREVER GLORIOUS being taken in onto PRINCE ALEX, resulting in PRINCE ALEX being taken in across the running of GOLDEN DARCI which was checked.  C Y Ho was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Thursday, 26 December 2024 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when placed in restricted room between JUMBO FORTUNE and SURE JOYFUL which shifted in slightly.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 50 Metres shifted in towards SURE JOYFUL and was steadied when SURE JOYFUL shifted out slightly.
No report.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between LUCKY BANNER and CHATER GOLD, both of which shifted ground.  In this incident, SIXTH GENERATION blundered and lost ground.
Bumped on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, R King reported that her mount was pressured in the early stages by LUCKY BANNER and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  C Y Ho was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the first turn (see GOLDEN DARCI).  After the event, C Y Ho stated that his mount raced keenly in the early stages when positioned outside the lead but settled entering the Back Straight.  He said from this point LUCKY BANNER did not travel well and gave ground in the Home Straight.
After the event, Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1600 Metres was checked and shifted to the inside of STUNNING PEACH when that runner lost ground.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that the intention was to ride MOMENTS IN TIME conservatively in the early stages as the horse had a tendency to race keenly in its most recent race starts.  He said as the start was effected MOMENTS IN TIME shifted in abruptly and made contact with STAR CONTACT and then shortly after was steadied when crowded to the inside of FLAMINGO TRILLION which shifted in.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions as MOMENTS IN TIME had raced disappointingly when ridden in a forward position in its most recent starts when it raced keenly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
In the early stages raced tight between STUNNING PEACH and MOMENTS IN TIME.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
No report.

After the event, C Y Ho reported that he was instructed to settle his mount where comfortable but after jumping well KARMA raced in a more forward position than it had at its most recent starts.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping was checked when crowded between STAR CONTACT which was taken in and STUNNING PEACH which was taken out slightly by KARMA.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that after being shifted in behind MR ASCENDENCY, STUNNING PEACH reacted adversely and, in his opinion, attempted to jump a section on the track at the 1600 Metres.  He said as a result STUNNING PEACH lost ground when it became badly unbalanced.  He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight STUNNING PEACH became held up for clear running behind RED HARE KING for some distance after the 300 Metres and approaching the 150 Metres was obliged to steady his mount when disappointed for clear running between RED HARE KING and FLAMINGO TRILLION when both runners shifted ground slightly.  He said as a result his mount lost momentum when it could not be tested for some distance thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners of STUNNING PEACH were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, STUNNING PEACH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial amongst other runners.  In addition, before STUNNING PEACH is permitted to race at Happy Valley again, it will also be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial at Happy Valley.  Sent for sampling post-race. <5/12/2024 Additional Veterinary Report> After the race, STUNNING PEACH was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. STUNNING PEACH was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer A S Cruz this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, the racing manners of STUNNING PEACH were considered unacceptable and the horse will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial amongst other runners before being allowed to race again. STUNNING PEACH will now also be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Held up making the Home Turn.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to MR ASCENDENCY.
No report.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Notwithstanding this advice, W Buick was advised that, wherever possible, he should ensure that he continues to ride his mounts out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Over the final 300 Metres was held up and did not obtain clear running.

Bumped on jumping.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind GIANT LEAP.  After being shifted to the outside of GIANT LEAP, CHATEAUNEUF then became held up for clear running between the 150 Metres and the 100 Metres where it obtained a narrow run to the inside of LUCKY EIGHT. Sent for sampling post-race.

From the 450 Metres until approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running and when being shifted to the outside of FORTUNE BOY made contact with DAY DAY VICTORY.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 250 Metres was disappointed for clear running between LUCKY BLESSING and HAPPY PARK and was shifted to the outside of HAPPY PARK to secure clear running near the 200 Metres.
Shortly after the start was bumped.   Approaching the 300 Metres was taken wider by RUN RUN TIMING.  Lay in the Home Straight.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  When questioned, B Shinn stated that his instructions were to position his mount where comfortable, but after jumping awkwardly MONARCH COUNTY settled towards the back of the field.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight MONARCH COUNTY raced greenly and was one-paced and after the 200 Metres he was obliged to shift to the inside of CITY THUNDER to obtain clear running.  He added from that point on MONARCH COUNTY continued to race greenly and approaching the winning post shied out which resulted in him having to correct his mount slightly at the finish of the event.
From the 400 Metres until the 300 Metres was held up for clear running before being shifted to the outside of MR ENERGIA to secure a clear run.
No report.
No report.

H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping and became unbalanced.  When questioned, C Y Ho stated that his mount raced keenly in the early stages and as a result maintained its position to the inside of BRILLIANT EXPRESS.  He said near the 800 Metres when BRILLIANT EXPRESS (H Bowman) shifted in and crowded his mount, SONIC PURSUIT then hung out across the heels of BRILLIANT EXPRESS and as a result was checked.  H Bowman was advised in similar circumstances to exercise more care.  Continued to race keenly and hang out in the middle stages. From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 300 Metres, when giving ground, was steadied away from INVINCIBLE LUCKY which shifted out.

Jumped only fairly. <9/12/2024 Additional Veterinary Report>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that SUPER STRONG MAN was lame in its right front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, SUPER STRONG MAN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

For some distance near the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from PATCH OF TIME.  Approaching the 300 Metres was bumped by BRILLIANT EXPRESS.  A short distance later was then steadied when crowded between BRILLIANT EXPRESS and RUN RUN TIMING which shifted in and away from MR ENERGIA.
