A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
C Y Ho pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 350 Metres (see DRAGON FOUR SEAS).
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Near the 850 Metres was bumped.  For a short distance near the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.
Near the 850 Metres when it commenced to race keenly got its head up when being steadied away from KING SHOW.  As a result, MIGHTY COMMANDER shifted in and made contact with JUBILANT WINNER.

When questioned, K De Melo stated that his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages to offset the wide barrier and to assist BEAUTIFUL WIN in finishing the race off today.  He said after shifting his mount behind runners in the early stages BEAUTIFUL WIN raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to shift to the outside of JUBILANT WINNER approaching the 400 Metres to commenced to improve, K De Melo stated that he was content in following JUBILANT WINNER as he felt that runner would provide his mount the best chance to improve into the event with a trail.  He said when JUBILANT WINNER did not immediately improve near the 400 Metres, he then attempted to start to shift out to look for clear running, but became held up when disappointed between JUBILANT WINNER and BIENVENUE when those two runners shifted ground.  He said as a result BEAUTIFUL WIN was held up for clear running between the 350 Metres and approaching the 200 Metres when it shifted to the inside of JUBILANT WINNER.  He said after this he was able to commence to ride his mount along, but again over the concluding stages had some difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind JUBILANT WINNER.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions issued and stated that it was open to Jockey De Melo to shift to the outside of JUBILANT WINNER to secure clear running.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards advised Jockey De Melo that he had made an error of judgement in not shifting out to improve to the outside of JUBILANT WINNER approaching the 400 Metres which would have availed him with clear running behind the winner PACKING ANGEL.  He was further advised that in similar circumstances he should ride his mount in a more decisive manner to ensure that it is able to obtain the best possible placing in the field.

Jumped only fairly.  C Y Ho (MASTER PHOENIX) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 350 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when insufficiently clear of DRAGON FOUR SEAS, resulting in DRAGON FOUR SEAS losing its rightful running and being steadied.  C Y Ho was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 29 December 2024 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  After the event, J McDonald reported that his mount did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses, particularly in the middle stages when positioned to the inside of KING SHOW which was racing greenly.  He said after being crowded near the 350 Metres DRAGON FOUR SEAS failed to run on in the Home Straight thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was eased when placed in restricted room between MIGHTY COMMANDER and MULTIBINGO which shifted in slightly.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.  Approaching the 400 Metres was again held up for clear running behind PHANTOM CYCLONE and near the 250 Metres was shifted to that runner’s inside to secure clear running.  Approaching the 150 Metres was disappointed between MULTIBINGO and PHANTOM CYCLONE before being shifted to the outside of PHANTOM CYCLONE shortly after to secure clear running.
No report.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between MIGHTY COMMANDER and JUBILANT WINNER which shifted out.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from JUBILANT WINNER when racing keenly.
After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount raced greenly throughout the race and did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.
After the event, Y L Chung reported that from a wide barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position.  Trainer A S Cruz confirmed the instructions issued.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by LEGEND ST PAUL’S (K C Leung) which shifted in  before being  corrected by its rider.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  After the event, A Badel stated that his mount, which was having its second race start, raced greenly when obliged to race wide and without cover.  He said as a consequence in the Home Straight KING SHOW did not respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of KING SHOW, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, KING SHOW will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance near the 200 Metres was taken in by DIVANO when that runner shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 250 Metres was shifted to the outside of LIFELINE EXPRESS to obtain clear running.
No report.

Jumped only fairly, shifted in and made contact with NOT USUAL STAR.  After the event, A Badel stated that after settling back in the field his mount ran to the line in a satisfactory manner and he was not too disappointed with the horse’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the event, K C Leung reported that from an outside barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position.
Bumped at the start.

Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between WONDERSTAR which was giving ground and CHAMPION INSTINCT which shifted in slightly.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that the instructions were to attempt to lead the event.  She said EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS was a little fractious in the barriers, jumped only fairly and despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to lead as instructed.

On jumping got its head up, became unbalanced and lost ground. A warning was placed on the barrier manners of SAVVY BRILLIANT.  After the event, Z Purton stated that after settling back in the field SAVVY BRILLIANT did not finish the race off in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Trainer F C Lor stated that SAVVY BRILLIANT was disadvantaged by losing ground at the start but he attributed today’s performance to the horse having to make up too much ground in the Home Straight and that it was reported to have a substantial amount of blood in its trachea.  The performance of SAVVY BRILLIANT was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, SAVVY BRILLIANT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and raced keenly.  He said as a result HALO OF SUCCESS did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After being crossed by YOUNG SUPERSTAR near the 900 Metres then commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from the heels of YOUNG SUPERSTAR when its rider Y L Chung steadied the pace.  Y L Chung was advised to exercise more care and reminded of his obligation to be sufficiently clear when shifting ground and not to steady the pace too quickly.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 300 Metres was disappointed for clear running between RECOMMENDATION and FLYING ACE and was shifted to the inside of FLYING ACE to obtain clear running.  For some distance approaching the 150 Metres HELIOS EXPRESS had further difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SATONO REVE as that runner shifted out slightly under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
No report.
No report.

When questioned, A Badel stated that his instructions from the outside barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said when the early and middle stages of the race were not run as quickly as he had expected, BEAUTY WAVES raced keenly in the middle stages.  When questioned as to why he elected to shift out on entering the Home Straight rather than following SATONO REVE, Jockey Badel stated that as he was concerned that the leaders would continue to improve due to the slower than expected pace of the early and middle stages, he elected to immediately shift to the outside of HELIOS EXPRESS when he saw that runner having difficulty obtaining clear running.  He said after shifting to the outside of HELIOS EXPRESS and LUCKY WITH YOU, BEAUTY WAVES became held up for clear running behind those runners and as a result near the 200 Metres he shifted his mount back to the inside where he secured clear running to the inside of HELIOS EXPRESS and his mount ran on well.  The Stewards advised Jockey Badel that, in their opinion, his better option would have been to improve to the inside of HELIOS EXPRESS in the early part of the Home Straight to follow SATONO REVE, but were satisfied that his actions in shifting out were not unreasonable in the circumstances having regard to the explanation provided.

M F Poon was fined the sum of $5,000 for raising his whip arm above shoulder height on a number of occasions over the concluding stages.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards considered that Jockey Poon had been issued with a number of warnings in relation to this breach.
Between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.
Bumped at the start.  From the 400 Metres until the 250 Metres was held up for clear running behind LUGAL.
No report.

On jumping was checked when crowded between STARLUST and RECOMMENDATION which shifted out abruptly after jumping awkwardly.  Approaching the 150 Metres was taken in slightly by INVINCIBLE SAGE which shifted in.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out abruptly and was bumped. In the early stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres got its head up when being checked away from KA YING RISING.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Withdrawn on 5.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (blood abnormality) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter FLYING ACE.

Near the 450 Metres was checked when disappointed for clear running between LA CITY BLANCHE and KA YING GENERATION which shifted out and away from WITHOUT A FIGHT when giving ground.  As the Stewards were satisfied that GIAVELLOTTO had not established the running, no action was taken.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was bumped by CONTINUOUS which shifted in.  Making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight made contact with FIVE G PATCH (B Avdulla) on a number of occasions as both runners contested a position behind WITHOUT A FIGHT and to the inside of KA YING GENERATION which was giving ground.  B Avdulla was advised that in similar circumstances he should exercise more care to ensure runners positioned around him have comfortable racing room.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 150 Metres raced tight between STELLENBOSCH and MARQUISAT and made contact with  MARQUISAT.
Was left racing wide and without cover from the 1200 Metres.
Near the 450 Metres raced in restricted room between STELLENBOSCH and ENSUED which shifted out to improve.  Near the 300 Metres M Barzalona dropped his whip.  Bumped near the 150 Metres.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn and made contact with DUBAI HONOUR on a number of occasions when it contested a position behind WITHOUT A FIGHT.
Jumped only fairly.  From the 450 Metres until the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.

Bumped at the start.  In the Home Straight hung in.  After the event, W Lordan reported that he was given no specific instructions other than to allow his mount to settle where comfortable.  He said in the early stages CONTINUOUS did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.
Near the 450 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, M Chadwick confirmed his instructions were to take up an on-pace position with cover.

After the event, C Demuro stated that when he was concerned with the action of his mount under pressure in the Home Straight, he eased it down when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, M Zahra stated that the intention was to ride the horse in a midfield position.  He said from the inside barrier WITHOUT A FIGHT jumped well and held a more forward position than he had anticipated.  He added in the Home Straight WITHOUT A FIGHT hung in and he had some concerns with its action.   Co-trainer S Freedman stated that the only explanation he could offer was that WITHOUT A FIGHT races best on surfaces with more give in it.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING GENERATION will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was crowded between SUNSTRIDER and EIGHTEEN CARAT which shifted out.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, K Teetan reported that after settling back in the field his mount found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount was making a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  After the 250 Metres was directed to the inside of GOOD LUCK BABE to continue into clear running.
No report.
No report.
After the event, A Pouchin reported that from the inside barrier he was instructed to hold a more forward position as SO WE SING is one-paced.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions issued.
Jumped only fairly. From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in near the 400 Metres and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by A Badel, rider of 6th placegetter, HAPPY TOGETHER, against CHANCHENG GLORY being declared the 4th placegetter alleging interference in the early part of the Home Straight.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found that making the Home Turn CHANCHENG GLORY shifted to the outside of BEAUTY ETERNAL to obtain clear running and a short distance later then made contact with HAPPY TOGETHER, resulting in HAPPY TOGETHER being badly crowded between JANTAR MANTAR and CHANCHENG GLORY.  As the Stewards were satisfied that had this incident not have occurred that HAPPY TOGETHER would have finished in advance of CHANCHENG GLORY, the protest/objection was sustained and the placings amended to read No. 2, VOYAGE BUBBLE, 1st; No. 1, SOUL RUSH, 2nd; No. 5, BEAUTY JOY, 3rd; No. 4, BEAUTY ETERNAL, 4th; No. 8, HAPPY TOGETHER, 5th; and No. 10, CHANCHENG GLORY, 6th (Also see ANTINO).

After the 400 Metres shifted out and made contact with HAPPY TOGETHER for some distance.  K Teetan pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference after the 400 Metres (see ANTINO).  Relegated to 6th placing on protest/objection (see HAPPY TOGETHER).

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  On the Home Turn was held up for clear running behind ANTINO.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres GALAXY PATCH lay in and was steadied away from ANTINO when positioned close to the heels of that runner.  Between the 200 Metres and the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between ANTINO and BEAUTY JOY which shifted in slightly.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration if there were grounds for a protest/objection on behalf of the connections of RED LION due to RED LION being taken out near the 350 Metres.  When the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds having regard to the manner in which RED LION finished the race off and the degree of interference, they elected not to lodge a protest/objection on behalf of the connections.

Jumped only fairly.  After the 400 Metres was hampered when taken wider by RED LION.  After the event, C Demuro stated that his instructions were to endeavour to lead.  He said LAZZAT jumped only fairly and did not stretch out in the early stages despite his efforts to comply with his instructions.  He said, in his opinion, LAZZAT would appreciate a surface with more give in it.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 400 Metres was bumped by SOUL RUSH which shifted in.  K Teetan (CHANCHENG GLORY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out, resulting in CHANCHENG GLORY making contact with HAPPY TOGETHER and HAPPY TOGETHER being crowded between CHANCHENG GLORY and JANTAR MANTAR.  Due to the contact HAPPY TOGETHER was taken out which resulted in JANTAR MANTAR making contact with RED LION and RED LION being taken out towards LAZZAT, resulting in LAZZAT shifting out, crowding the running of ANTINO which was checked when crowded between SOUL RUSH and LAZZAT.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 18 December 2024 and to expire on Friday, 27 December 2024 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Teetan was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  After the event, B Shinn stated that after having a comfortable run during the race ANTINO commenced to respond to his riding in the early part of the Home Straight, but after striking interference near the 300 Metres was unable to finish the race off thereafter.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied to avoid JANTAR MANTAR and then shifted in to obtain clear running.

After the 1000 Metres was bumped and taken out by VOYAGE BUBBLE which shifted to the outside of BEAUTY ETERNAL.  As a result, JANTAR MANTAR raced wide and without cover thereafter.  For some distance approaching the 400 Metres bumped heavily with HAPPY TOGETHER and became unbalanced shortly after when crowded between HAPPY TOGETHER and RED LION.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out shortly after the start and then was steadied when crowded by ENCOUNTERED which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  When caught wide in the early stages was steadied to obtain a position with cover.

Near the 1500 Metres was taken wider by ROMANTIC WARRIOR which shifted to the outside of ENCOUNTERED.  As a result, STRAIGHT ARRON was steadied to obtain a position with cover behind ROMANTIC WARRIOR.
Jumped only fairly.
Over the concluding stages was held up behind STRAIGHT ARRON and could not be ridden out to the finish.
After the 1500 Metres was steadied to avoid STRAIGHT ARRON and as a result shifted out and was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.
No report.
No report.

On the Home Turn lay in and brushed the running rail.  After the event, H Bowman stated that the intention was to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said ENCOUNTERED jumped well today and went forward without being pressure to do so.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Briefly held up for clear running approaching the 400 Metres behind PACKING HERMOD.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  From the 350 Metres to the 150 Metres was held up for clear running when endeavouring to improve to the inside of PACKING HERMOD.
Raced keenly in the early stages.  Between the 450 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.

After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount blundered shortly after the start and became unbalanced and in the Home Straight he was concerned with its action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
After the event, Y L Chung confirmed that he was instructed to hold a forward position.
When giving ground near the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded by SON PAK FU which was taken in by SING DRAGON (A Badel).  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.
Rounding the Home Turn lay out.

After the event, A Pouchin reported that his mount raced erratically throughout the event and was checked near the 600 Metres when racing to the inside of RUBYLOT.  He said ALLCASH continued to race erratically thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners and performance of ALLCASH, which finished tailed out, were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ALLCASH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Withdrawn on 5.12.24 after obtaining a run in Race 5 and replaced by Standby Declared Starter HARMONY GREAT.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped heavily on jumping and blundered.  In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 700 Metres was steadied away from MAGNIFICENT NINE.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between MAGNIFICENT NINE and BEAUTY CRESCENT which was bumped heavily by BRIGHT DAY, blundered and shifted in abruptly.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
No report.

Trainer Y S Tsui confirmed the instructions issued to K Teetan today were to find cover in a midfield position.  He said he issued such instructions because LUCY IN THE SKY had finished its race off only fairly when ridden in a forward position carrying the same weight on 24 November 2024.
Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
For some distance near the 200 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
Held up for clear running for some distance after the 400 Metres.  Approaching the finish raced in restricted room between BRIGHT DAY and SUPER LOVE DRAGON which shifted in.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a small cut to the left front fetlock.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that it was not his intention to lead but with the pace of the event being run outside of standard time in the early stages his mount led the event without being pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

For some distance near the 600 Metres raced tight to the inside of SAME TO YOU (B Avdulla) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced keenly.

In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance approaching the 700 Metres got its head up when racing between DAN ATTACK and LIFE OF STONE.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that RUBY SAILING jumped only fairly and as a consequence settled further back in the field than instructed.  He said making the Home Turn when following LIFE OF STONE, he elected to shift to that runner’s inside to secure clear running as he felt RUBY SAILING was not travelling well enough to improve to the outside on the Home Turn.  He added after being briefly held up RUBY SAILING was able to secure clear running on entering the Home Straight.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount was unsuited when the pace of the event was run outside of standard time which resulted in MODEST GENTLEMAN racing keenly throughout the early and middle stages.  He said as a result MODEST GENTLEMAN then was unable to run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After being placed in the barriers, when PHILOS broke through the front of the starting gates, ACE TALENT then reacted to that incident and made contact with the front of the starting gates before breaking through and completing the course thereafter when unable to be restrained by its rider.  ACE TALENT was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, ACE TALENT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

Shortly after being placed in the barriers lunged forward as the blindfold was removed, made heavy contact with the starting gates and broke through, completing the course thereafter when unable to be restrained by its rider.  PHILOS was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  The Stewards ruled that PHILOS will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in consecutive barrier trials before being allowed to race again.  Was subsequently noted to have sustained a wound to the left nostril.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres was checked when crowded between KOKUSHI MUSOU which was racing tight to the inside of BOWSER and  BEAUTY LIGHT which was taken out by SOLAR RIVER when that runner hung out making the first turn.  After the 300 Metres was directed to the outside of KOKUSHI MUSOU to obtain clear running.  J McDonald pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the concluding stages (see SPEEDY SMARTIE).  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced wide and without cover until the 600 Metres.  Hung in in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.  A Pouchin pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see BOWSER).

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, Jockey K Teetan and Trainer T P Yung viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection following SPEEDY SMARTIE being checked over the concluding stages.  When they declined to lodge a protest/objection and the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds to do so, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  J McDonald (TELECOM DRAGON) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of SPEEDY SMARTIE, resulting in SPEEDY SMARTIE being checked.  Having regard to the special circumstances of this matter, he was fined the sum of $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A Pouchin (THRIVING BROTHERS) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he made insufficient effort to prevent his mount from shifting in, resulting in BOWSER losing its running and having to be checked.  After assessing the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and having regard to his excellent race riding record, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty to be a reprimand.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that his intention was to hold a forward position with cover behind the leaders.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to allow BOWSER to stride forward and race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.

Near the 1000 Metres shifted out when being checked to avoid TELECOM DRAGON.  Approaching the 100 Metres was checked when disappointed for clear running between SPEEDY SMARTIE and BOWSER and as a result was unable to be ridden out fully until passing the 50 Metres.
No report.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between SMART LEADER which shifted out slightly and BOWSER (B Avdulla) which shifted in slightly.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after was steadied when crowded between JOYOUS LILY and ISLAND GOLDEN which shifted in and away from THRIVING BROTHERS.  Crowded leaving the 1000 Metres.  After the 300 Metres was taken wider by TELECOM DRAGON which shifted out to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <12/12/2024 Additional Veterinary Report>SPICY SO SMART, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. SPICY SO SMART was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer W K Mo this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, SPICY SO SMART will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shortly after the start was crowded by THRIVING BROTHERS and then shifted in and away from that runner, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Leaving the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded between THRIVING BROTHERS which shifted in slightly and SPICY SO SMART which was taken out by SMART LEADER when that runner made the turn awkwardly after being checked.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly, got its head up and then was crowded shortly after the start.

Withdrawn on 10.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter SPEEDY SMARTIE.  Before being allowed to race again, BULB EMPEROR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On jumping shifted in, made contact with MR ALADDIN, got its head up and lost ground.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn behind TIGER AND GOLD and after the 350 Metres was shifted to the inside of that runner to secure clear running.  Noted to have sustained a cut to the right front leg after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Slow to begin.
No report.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped at the start.  After the event, A Pouchin reported that his mount, which was racing first up tonight over 2200 Metres, did not run out the distance of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.

When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer K H Ting stated that since being transferred to his stable he had identified that GOOD LUCK WIN was not comfortable racing around other horses and for this reason he reapplied blinkers to the horse.  He said this together with GOOD LUCK WIN being assisted by the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time were the reasons for the horse’s improved performance tonight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover in the middle stages until it was ridden forward where it obtained a position outside the lead near the 500 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with THE PRIME.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, J McDonald stated that with the early and middle stages of the event being run outside of standard time, when the race developed into a sprint home from the 500 Metres, TAKE ACTION was left flat-footed at that stage and took some time to respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, A Badel stated that his instructions were to obtain a position with cover.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and the pace of the event being run outside of standard time, he elected to allow his mount to stride forward and race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.
Bumped at the start.  From the outside barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover from the 550 Metres.

In the early stages raced keenly and after the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from HAPPY TRIO.  Near the 850 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid HAPPY TRIO (A Pouchin) which shifted in when not quite clear.  A Pouchin was advised to exercise more care.  Near the 500 Metres, when continuing to race keenly, got its head up when being steadied away from BITS SUPERSTAR.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 500 Metres was steadied away from SIGHT HAPPY.  Briefly held up on the Home Turn.  Near the 250 Metres became held up for clear running behind BITS SUPERSTAR and shortly after was shifted to that runner’s outside to secure clear running.  Near the 150 Metres then became unbalanced when crowded between SIGHT HAPPY and BITS SUPERSTAR which shifted out and away from FATAL BLOW.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and lost ground.  Made contact with the running rail after the 600 Metres.  Near the 50 Metres shifted in and away from AFFIRM, resulting in its rider having to correct his mount.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 500 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid KA YING POWER.
Near the 50 Metres momentarily raced tight to the inside of KA YING POWER which shifted in and away from AFFIRM.
No report.

Near the 550 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from VALHALLA.  After the 250 Metres was disappointed for clear running between BITS SUPERSTAR and FATAL BLOW and did not obtain clear running until after the 50 Metres.

Shifted out abruptly at the start and was bumped on the hindquarters.  Near the 150 Metres shifted out and away from FATAL BLOW after being taken out by that runner slightly and made contact with HAPPY SOUL and became unbalanced.

After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after was checked when crowded between FATAL BLOW and BITS SUPERSTAR which shifted out abruptly.  Near the 1000 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid SIGHT HAPPY.  MIU FA FA then continued to race keenly and near the 800 Metres shifted out and away from SIGHT HAPPY and as a result raced wide and without cover thereafter.

Crowded at the start.  Passing the 250 Metres was checked to avoid CANDLELIGHT DINNER which, after laying in in the early part of the Home Straight, then shifted out abruptly away from YOUTHFUL SPIRITS as it was being corrected by its rider K Teetan.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on the hindquarters at the start.  Near the 800 Metres Jockey L Ferraris was required to reposition his foot in the stirrup.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded between CELESTIAL HARMONY and MIDORI GLORY, both of which shifted ground.  Approaching the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind MIDORI GLORY.
Approaching the 350 Metres raced tight to the inside of DO YOUR PART after obtaining a narrow run between DO YOUR PART and CELESTIAL HARMONY.
No report.
No report.
After the 300 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by ATOMIC FORCE which shifted out slightly.
On jumping was checked when it shifted in and away from SPORTS LEGEND, resulting in it making contact with the hindquarters of YOUTHFUL SPIRITS.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped on the hindquarters, resulting in MIDORI GLORY and A Pouchin becoming unbalanced.  After the event, A Pouchin reported that his intention was to be more forward in the race, but after jumping awkwardly and becoming unbalanced at the start, his mount settled further back and found it difficult to respond when asked for an effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight and passing the 250 Metres ran out as it was being corrected by its rider.  The racing manners of CANDLELIGHT DINNER were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CANDLELIGHT DINNER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial where it is required to be ridden out to the finish of that trial.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Apprentice E C W Wong, who weighed in at 115 lbs, was fined the sum of $3,000 for returning to scale 2 lbs overweight.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions were to ride DRAGON DELIGHT with cover.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.   Held up making the Home Turn.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 300 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Near the 100 Metres was disappointed for clear running between DRAGON STAR and DRAGON DELIGHT and was then shifted to the outside of DRAGON DELIGHT where it raced tight over the concluding stages to the inside of FLYING SILVER.
No report.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the event, B Thompson reported that his mount began well today and as a result settled in a more forward position than its previous race starts.  He said, in his opinion, COURIER MAGIC did not run out the 1800 Metres of tonight’s event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start shifted in and away from SATIRICAL GLORY and bumped NORTHERN BEAST.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after was steadied away from KINGLY DEMEANOR which shifted out slightly.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that soon after the 300 Metres his mount hung in and as a result made contact with ME TIME which shifted out slightly.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, SATIRICAL GLORY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Slow to begin.

After the event, M L Yeung reported that his instructions from the outside barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer K L Man confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.

After the event, C Y Ho reported that approaching the finish his mount shifted out when it shied at the winning post, resulting in him having to stop riding, straighten his mount and being unable to ride it out to the finish.

After the event, Z Purton reported that from a wide barrier he was obliged to make some use of his mount in the early stages to go forward.  He said with CIRCUIT DUFFY carrying an additional 6 lbs tonight, it was not able to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.
Over the concluding stages was steadied when BRAVE JOY shifted out.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount hung in throughout the event.

Near the 200 Metres was bumped by UNISON which shifted out.  After the event, J McDonald could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  Trainer C S Shum stated that he had been pleased with the horse since its last start win on 20 November 2024 and added that YEE CHEONG SPIRIT may have been disadvantaged by settling back in the field with the pace in the middle stages being run slightly outside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of YEE CHEONG SPIRIT was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, YEE CHEONG SPIRIT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  Shifted out near the 200 Metres and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, M F Poon stated that he had some concerns with his mount’s action during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running when attempting to improve between MIDORI FUJI and GLORIOUS JOURNEY.
Jumped only fairly and was crowded.

Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of B Avdulla, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, Z Purton reported that his mount, which was fractious in the barriers, shifted its hood as the start was effected.  He said as a result he repositioned the hood soon after the start.  He added that, in his opinion, CHAIN OF GOLD raced in a disappointing manner as it did at its most recent start and may need a short break before its next race start.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed that the horse will be given a short let-up.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Tongue tie replaced at the Start.
Sent for sampling post-race.
In the early stages raced keenly and approaching the 1000 Metres got its head up when being checked away from MANYTHANKS FOREVER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 1000 Metres, when racing keenly, was crowded by SO AWESOME when that runner shifted in, resulting in GLUCK RACER having to be steadied.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping shifted in, made heavy contact with FAMILY FORTUNE and became unbalanced.  From the outside barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped on jumping.
No report.
For some distance after the 600 Metres raced tight between SUPREME WINNER and HOSS when improving into a narrow run between those two horses.
Near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from SO AWESOME.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.

Bumped heavily on jumping and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned to the inside of GANGNAM STAR which shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the right side of its barrier.

After obtaining cover near the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly for some distance thereafter and was steadied away from SUNNY SHINES.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, UNIVERSAL BLAZE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Crowded shortly after the start.  Bumped after the 500 Metres.  After the event, L Hewitson reported that with the pace of the race being run outside of standard time throughout the early and middle stages his mount raced keenly after the 800 Metres and was steadied to avoid NEWBORN MIRACLE.

After travelling a short distance made contact with SKY SONG when racing tight to the inside of COLOURFUL WINNER.  ELEGANT LIFE was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  From the 450 Metres until the 350 Metres was held up for clear running when being shifted to the outside of CURRAHEE.  Near the 350 Metres made contact with TACTICAL COMMAND as it obtained a narrow run between CURRAHEE and TACTICAL COMMAND.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start between SKY SONG and TRIUMPHANT MORE which shifted out slightly.  Over-raced in the middle stages.  Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between COSMIC SPURS which was taken in by CURRAHEE which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider and KING OBERON which was taken out by VANTASTIC CHOICE which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  When under pressure in the Home Straight lay in and raced greenly and passing the 150 Metres was held up for clear running behind VANTASTIC CHOICE.

When giving ground near the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between KING OBERON and NEWBORN MIRACLE (C L Chau) which shifted out when not quite clear.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  After the event, M L Yeung reported that his mount travelled satisfactorily outside the lead in the early stages.  He added near the 400 Metres when VANTASTIC CHOICE improved to his outside, his mount was reluctant to race inside that runner and as a result changed stride and became unbalanced.  He said from this point COLOURFUL WINNER did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out shortly after the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  Near the 500 Metres was bumped by KING OBERON which shifted to the outside of COLOURFUL WINNER to improve.  After the event, A Pouchin stated that he had to make some use of his mount in the early stages to hold a forward position and as a result in the Home Straight VANTASTIC CHOICE did not finish the race off strongly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 350 Metres was bumped and taken wider by ELEGANT LIFE.  After the event, A Badel reported that whilst his mount was obliged to race wide, it had cover throughout the early and middle stages.  He said in the Home Straight TACTICAL COMMAND responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded shortly after the start.  For some distance after the 200 Metres raced tight between CURRAHEE and ORIENTAL SURPRISE which shifted out.

Shifted in shortly after the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  Approaching the 800 Metres commenced to race keenly and was checked to avoid VANTASTIC CHOICE.  As a result, CURRAHEE shifted out abruptly before being corrected by its rider, however, was then obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount made a respiratory noise on pulling up.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded by SUPER CHARIZZARD which jumped awkwardly and shifted out abruptly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  Shifted out near the 600 Metres and made contact with HIGH RISE POWER.
No report.

Shortly after the start was bumped by MARIO which shifted in.  When questioned, A Atzeni stated that after being held up between TSUEN WAN GLORY and YODA’S CHOICE in the early part of the Home Straight, near the 300 Metres he commenced to improve to the outside of YODA’S CHOICE when he felt that runner was maintaining a straight course.  He said after commencing to shift to the outside of YODA’S CHOICE, that runner then shifted out which resulted in REGENCY HAPPY STAR not being able to obtain clear running until near the 200 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly and shifted out abruptly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 100 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between MARIO which was taken out by REGENCY HAPPY STAR and SUPER CHARIZZARD which shifted in and away from HARRY’S HERO.
Jumped awkwardly and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For some distance near the 300 Metres was shifted to the inside to secure clear running.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between MULTIDARLING and REGENCY HAPPY STAR (A Atzeni) which shifted out.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.

HIGH RISE POWER, which was fractious in the starting gates, jumped only fairly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 600 Metres was bumped and taken wider by THE KHAN which shifted out to improve.  Noted to have blood in both nostrils after the race.  A subsequent endoscopic examination conducted on HIGH RISE POWER confirmed the horse to be a bleeder.  Before being allowed to race again, HIGH RISE POWER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the event, H Bentley reported that although his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event, it was still disappointing in that it gave ground noticeably in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of AROMATICA was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, AROMATICA will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

For a short distance approaching the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of TOURBILLON PRINCE.
Blundered on jumping and lost ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  From the 400 Metres until the 250 Metres was held up for clear running when being shifted to the outside of SOVEREIGN FUND.
Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind SECOND TO NONE.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running between CHAMPION INSTINCT and MIGHTY STRIDE.

After the event, J McDonald stated that he was instructed to hold a more forward position than its previous race starts with the visor being applied for the first time.  He said when unable to obtain a position close to the rail MIGHTY STRIDE was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions issued and attributed today’s performance to the fact that MIGHTY STRIDE was caught wide and without cover.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping was taken out by SECOND TO NONE which shifted out.  From the outside barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

On jumping was steadied when crowded by CHAMPION INSTINCT which shifted in abruptly despite the efforts of its rider.  From the 600 Metres was taken wider by KAHOLO ANGEL when that runner shifted out to improve.  FRANCIS MEYNELL then hung out making the Home Turn.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, A Badel stated that his mount raced "flat” today.  After the race, it was noted that the horse had its tongue over the bit on return to the unsaddling area.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.

Withdrawn on 13.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (blood abnormality) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter FIND MY LOVE.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING POWER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1200 Metres after being crossed by MOTOMAN commenced to race keenly, shifted out and made contact with YUEN LONG ELITE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
No report.

Near the 1200 Metres was crowded between LUCKY GOLD and BALLISTIC WIN which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover between the 900 Metres and approaching the 600 Metres where it was able to obtain a position behind BALLISTIC WIN when that runner shifted out.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and lost ground.
Near the 800 Metres was checked and blundered when it struck the heels of WISDOM STAR (see WISDOM STAR).

After the 1200 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from BALLISTIC WIN.  SMILING COLLECTOR continued to race keenly for some distance thereafter.  Near the 900 Metres raced tight inside LUCKY GOLD.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 800 Metres was taken wider by NEW FUTURE FOLKS when that runner was shifted to the outside of LAKESHORE HERO shortly after being crossed by that runner.  When WISDOM STAR then attempted to obtain a position in behind NEW FUTURE FOLKS, WISDOM STAR became positioned close to the heels of NEW FUTURE FOLKS and as a result was checked and lost ground.  The Stewards found the manner in which WISDOM STAR shifted in to obtain cover was the main reason for it having to be checked.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Slow to begin.  Approaching the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid YUEN LONG ELITE which shifted out.  A short distance later CALIFORNIA STAR then commenced to race keenly and got its head up and shifted out when being positioned close to LUCKY GOLD.  As a result, CALIFORNIA STAR was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after was steadied when crowded between FANTASTIC TREASURE and BUNDLE OF CHARM which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 900 Metres was eased when placed in restricted room between CARROLL STREET and JAMES TAK which shifted out and away from STELLAR EXPRESS.

After the event, A Atzeni reported that his mount hung out throughout the event and proved difficult to ride out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
For some distance after the 800 Metres raced tight to the outside of JAMES TAK and brushed the outside running rail.
Held up from the 400 Metres until the 250 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance leaving the 1100 Metres was restrained from the heels of YEE CHEONG RAIDER. From the 450 Metres to the 150 Metres was badly held up for clear running.
A Hamelin was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference after the 1300 Metres (see GOLD MASTER).  Near the 250 Metres A Hamelin dropped his whip.

Bumped at the start.  For some distance approaching the 300 Metres lay in and was reluctant to shift to the outside of ATOMIC BEAUTY and as a result had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when FLYING LUCK was shifted to the outside of BEAUTY ALLIANCE to obtain clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the 900 Metres raced wide and without cover.

A Hamelin (I AM THE BOSS) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 1300 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of SOLID WIN, resulting in SOLID WIN being taken in onto VIVA CHALEUR, resulting in VIVA CHALEUR being taken in towards GOLD MASTER which resulted in GOLD MASTER losing its rightful running between YEE CHEONG RAIDER and VIVA CHALEUR, striking the heels of VIVA CHALEUR and blundering badly.  A Hamelin was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 5 January 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  Near the 1000 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied away from BEAUTY LIVE.  Approaching the 600 Metres raced tight between ORIENTAL SMOKE and YEE CHEONG RAIDER which shifted out slightly.
Jumped only fairly.  After the 1300 Metres was steadied when taken wider by WINDICATOR FAMILY.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind ORIENTAL SMOKE.  After being shifted to the inside of GOLD MASTER approaching the 150 Metres again had difficulty obtaining clear running over the concluding stages when racing tight between GOLD MASTER and BEAUTY LIVE.
After the 1300 Metres bumped with GOLD MASTER.
Noted to have lost its left hind plate after the race.

After the 1300 Metres was checked to avoid GOLD MASTER and lost ground.  For some distance thereafter in the middle stages raced keenly.  Near the 200 Metres K Teetan had his whip knocked from his grasp by the whip of L Ferraris, rider of SILVER UP.

L Ferraris was warned in relation to using the whip in a forward manner forward of the saddle on two occasions in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that the intention was to endeavour to find a position with cover on his mount.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he allowed ATOMIC BEAUTY to stride forward to avoid covering additional ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding SUMMIT CHEERS racing in a more forward position today, A Badel stated that with his mount dropping in grade and racing in blinkers, the intention was to hold a more forward position.  He said when a number of runners did not jump well, SUMMIT CHEERS was able to race in the lead without being pressured to do so and this resulted in an improved performance today.

As the start was effected lunged forward and made contact with the starting gates.  As a result, FUN ELITE became unbalanced when it shifted in and made contact with SNOWTHORN, resulting in its rider L Hewitson becoming unbalanced.
Over the final 200 Metres lay in.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of its barrier and then shortly after made contact with FUN ELITE and lost ground.  Hung in throughout the event and over the concluding stages M F Poon had difficulty testing his mount as a result.
As the start was effected reared and lost ground.

After the event, A Hamelin reported that after missing the start and settling further back in the field his mount found it difficult to make up ground over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

HAPPY SHOOTER, which was fractious in the starting gates, jumped awkwardly.  After the event, M L Yeung reported that his mount raced greenly and hung out throughout and made it difficult for him to ride his mount out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The barrier manners and racing manners of HAPPY SHOOTER were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY SHOOTER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

M F Poon was fined the sum of $5,000 for using his whip in a manner where his whip arm was raised above his shoulder height on a number of occasions in the early part of the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Entering the Back Straight near the 1100 Metres shifted away from the running rail which resulted in GO GO GO, which was racing keenly, improving into a tight position to the inside of PRECISION GOAL.  When PRECISION GOAL shifted back towards the running rail near the 800 Metres, GO GO GO was steadied away from PRECISION GOAL.
After arriving behind the barriers was resaddled when the stirrup leather required replacing.

Withdrawn on 17.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (inappetence).  Before being allowed to race again, HARRY’S HERO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  For a short distance was held up for clear running on the Home Turn.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, A Badel; advised that from the outside barrier he was instructed to attempt to have the horse settle and race in a similar pattern to its most recent race starts.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was checked when crowded between RACINGRACE and MARK THE MOMENT which was taken out by ROMANTIC NOVELIST.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. Before being allowed to race again, ROMANTIC NOVELIST will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. As a result, SUPER INFINITY took no further part in the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <16/12/2024 Additional Veterinary Report> SUPER INFINITY, which was severely checked near the 450 Metres, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. SUPER INFINITY was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer M Newnham this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, SUPER INFINITY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

J McDonald (SWIFT ASCEND) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 450 Metres he directed his mount out to the outside of CHARMING BABE when not clear of LUCKY ARCHANGEL, resulting in SWIFT ASCEND making heavy contact with LUCKY ARCHANGEL and taking that horse across the running of JOYFUL HUNTER, resulting in JOYFUL HUNTER falling and L Hewitson being dislodged.  Jockey Hewitson was transported to hospital for treatment.  J McDonald was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Thursday, 26 December 2024 and to expire on Thursday, 16 January 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (7 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey McDonald was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 5 and also considered his very good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported. <16/12/2024 Additional Veterinary Report> JOYFUL HUNTER, which fell near the 450 Metres, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse was found to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported. JOYFUL HUNTER was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer K W Lui this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right hind leg. Before being allowed to race again, JOYFUL HUNTER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Near the 1500 Metres was hampered when taken wider by LUPO SOLITARIO.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was bumped by DILBAGH and became unbalanced.  CAP FERRAT then shifted in and was bumped on the hindquarters by TOY SOLTERO.  Between the 400 Metres and 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind AMAZING VICTORY.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Stewards acceded to an application from Z Purton to allow him to ride 2 lbs overweight.  The explanation provided by Jockey Purton for the overweight was accepted by the Stewards.  Public announcements were made to this effect.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 1 January 2025 and to expire on Monday, 6 January 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.

C L Chau pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference after the 900 Metres (see NOBLE DELUXE).  C L Chau was warned for using his whip in a manner where his whip arm was raised above his shoulder height on a number of occasions over the concluding stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

C L Chau (SKY JOY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 900 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of NOBLE DELUXE, resulting in NOBLE DELUXE losing its running and being checked to avoid the heels of SKY JOY.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 22 January  2025 and to expire on Monday, 27 January 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Chau was fined $25,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, H Bowman reported that he was obliged to make some use of his mount in the early stages to hold a position outside the lead.  He said WIN SPEED did not settle during the early and middle stages and gave ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer M Newnham agreed with the comments made by Jockey Bowman but also indicated that WIN SPEED would derive benefit from today’s performance as it had had over four weeks from its last race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of WIN SPEED was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, WIN SPEED will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Lost its right front plate in the saddling area and made contact with a rail.  This plate was refitted.  BEAUTY INVINCIBLE was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. BEAUTY INVINCIBLE lay out for the remainder of the event.  The racing manners of BEAUTY INVINCIBLE were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY INVINCIBLE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial in Hong Kong. Withdrawn on 21.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart irregularity) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter KNOW AT HEART.
