Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Near the 1000 Metres MAJESTIC KNIGHT was awkwardly placed close to the heels of BOTTOMUPTOGETHER which maintained its position away from the rail.  As a result, MAJESTIC KNIGHT shifted out, making contact with HARMONY N BLESSED, taking HARMONY N BLESSED wider, resulting in FAST NETWORK being steadied to avoid HARMONY N BLESSED.  Near the 750 Metres was steadied to avoid WUNDERBAR which shifted in.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount was obliged to race wide, however, obtained cover approaching the first turn.  He said in the Home Straight his mount responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start shifted in, made contact with MAJESTIC KNIGHT and became unbalanced.  A short distance later SING DRAGON was then steadied when crowded between HARMONY N BLESSED which shifted in and MAJESTIC KNIGHT which raced tight to the outside of BOTTOMUPTOGETHER which lay out.
On jumping bumped with CALL ME GLORIOUS and blundered.  Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped near the 1000 Metres.
Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, K C Leung stated that with the pace of the event being run inside of standard time his mount was under pressure throughout the race and as a result did not finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 1000 Metres was steadied, shifted out and was bumped.

Hung out throughout the event and as a result made the Home Turn wide.  In this incident, SUPERB CAPITALIST was then eased down from the event. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. The racing manners and performance of SUPERB CAPITALIST, which finished tailed out, were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPERB CAPITALIST will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was retired from the event on the Home Turn.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY CHARGE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
C L Chau was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 450 Metres (see ALSONSO).
Near the 400 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became badly unbalanced.
After the 200 Metres lay out before being corrected by its rider.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 400 Metres attempted to obtain a run between BUNTA BABY and AURORA PATCH and was checked when disappointed for this run.  Was then held up for clear running until near the 300 Metres.
No report.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped and shortly after raced tight to the inside of MAGNIFICENT NINE.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
Crowded making the Home Turn.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

Near the 400 Metres became badly unbalanced when crowded between MAGNIFICENT NINE and SUGAR BALL (K C Leung) which shifted to the outside of BUNTA BABY where there was not sufficient room to do so.  K C Leung was severely reprimanded.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was bumped by DASHING DRAGON which shifted in.  C L Chau (LUCKY EIGHT) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 450 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when there was insufficient room for runners to his inside, resulting in RIDING TOGETHER being taken in and crowding the running of ALSONSO, resulting in ALSONSO losing its running and being checked.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 12 February 2025 and to expire on Monday, 17 February 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Chau was fined $25,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that after receiving interference on the Home Turn his mount was unable to finish the race off thereafter, however, made a respiratory noise towards the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was steadied to avoid CIRCUIT TEN which shifted out when being corrected by its rider.  EVER SMART was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  On the Home Turn was briefly held up for clear running.  After the event, H Bowman reported that his instructions were to endeavour to hold a midfield position.  He said after jumping only fairly and then being crowded shortly after the start EVER SMART raced further back in the field than intended.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by CIRCUIT TEN which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and shifted in.  Approaching the 300 Metres was briefly held up for clear running.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that with the hood and pacifiers being removed tonight, CIRCUIT TEN raced too keenly.  He said, in his opinion, CIRCUIT TEN would be better suited by being taken back in distance and the hood and pacifiers being reapplied to the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Approaching the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded between SPEEDY CHARIOT and E GLORY, both of which shifted ground slightly.  After the event, M F Poon stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but after being bumped shortly after the start settled further back than anticipated.
After the 600 Metres was checked when momentarily crowded by WINNING HEART (H Bentley) which shifted in quickly before being corrected by its rider.  H Bentley was advised to exercise more care.
After FAIRY HORSE became fractious, HERO STAR which was in the adjoining stall, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

After being loaded into the starting gates became fractious, reared and got both front legs over the front of the gates.  Acting on veterinary advice that FAIRY HORSE was not suitable to race the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  The Stewards ruled that FAIRY HORSE will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in consecutive barrier trials and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 150 Metres shifted in and made contact with NATURAL STORM.

On jumping was crowded for room between CALIFORNIA VOCE and STELLAR GRANDE which was positioned tight to the inside of FRANTANCK.  Bumped near the 150 Metres.  Noted to have sustained a minor abrasion to the right front leg.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 250 Metres raced tight between SIMPLE HEDGE and WINNING STEPS.  Approaching the 100 Metres improved into a narrow run between SHARPEN BRIGHT and CALIFORNIA VOCE and raced tight for a short distance thereafter between those two runners.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that his mount failed to run out the 2200 Metres of tonight’s race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <27/12/2024 Additional Veterinary Reports>After the race, CALIFORNIA VOCE was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. CALIFORNIA VOCE was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer A S Cruz this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA VOCE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
After the event, A Atzeni reported that his mount failed to run out the 2200 Metres of tonight’s race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded shortly after start.  In the Home Straight lay in.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to lead the event, but he was advised not to excessively restrain the horse as it has a respiratory condition and has been reported as a "roarer”.  He said after leading the event in the early stages, near the 1600 Metres FRANTANCK raced keenly and lay in which resulted in it making contact with the running rail near the 1200 Metres.  He said whilst he was aware he was setting a fast pace, having regard to his instructions not to excessively restrain his mount, FRANTANCK set a faster pace than he would have liked despite his best endeavours to restrain his mount in accordance with his instructions.  He added that as a result of the manner in which FRANTANCK raced throughout the early and middle stages it gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer’ which had previously been reported.

Withdrawn on 25.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left front suspensory ligament injury).  Before being allowed to race again, SO WE SING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

Shifted out on jumping and made contact with the hindquarters of MR VALIANT, resulting in MR VALIANT then being turned in and crowding VIGOR ELLEEGANT for a short distance thereafter.  After the 1100 Metres was checked when crowded between OWNERS’ PRAISE (L Hewitson) which shifted out slightly and MR VALIANT which raced tight to the inside of PRIME MORTAR (Y L Chung) when that runner lay in and away from CRYSTAL POWERFUL (A Atzeni) when CRYSTAL POWERFUL was commencing to shift in.  L Hewitson, Y L Chung and A Atzeni were all advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.
No report.
After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between VIGOR ELLEEGANT and OWNERS’ PRAISE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and was bumped shortly after.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from PRIME MORTAR which shifted out.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that the instructions were to ride his mount in a more conservative manner in the early stages, however, OWNERS’ PRAISE jumped well and raced in a more forward position without being pressured to do so.  He added, in his opinion, OWNERS’ PRAISE would be better suited by being ridden further back in the field.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  As this was the second occasion that HIGH PERCENTAGE had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.

On jumping was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the 1100 Metres was crowded for room when racing keenly and as a result became unbalanced.  In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from OWNERS’ PRAISE.

Jumped only fairly and then bumped with YOUNG HORIZON.  After the 1100 Metres, when racing keenly, was shifted in, made contact with MR VALIANT and then was steadied to avoid CRYSTAL POWERFUL for some distance thereafter.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 350 Metres was bumped by RED MAJESTY which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start.  Bumped near the 350 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
On jumping was crowded between WINDICATOR FAMILY and HAPPY TRIO which shifted out.

After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on CLASSIC CENTURY at the request of Trainer M Newnham.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, CLASSIC CENTURY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Y L Chung (SILVER KING) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1500 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of TURIN WARRIOR, resulting in TURIN WARRIOR losing its rightful running and being checked to avoid the heels of SILVER KING.  Y L Chung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 8 January 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Y L Chung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1500 Metres (see TURIN WARRIOR).
No report.

Crowded shortly after the start.  After the event, M F Poon stated that the instructions were to take up a forward position.  Assistant Trainer S T Lee, representing Trainer D J Hall who was not present at tonight’s meeting, confirmed the instructions.  He said such instructions were issued as WINDICATOR FAMILY had been racing in a disappointing manner when settling further back in its races.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and was bumped on the hindquarters.  Near the 400 Metres was eased when crowded between SILVER KING and TO INFINITY (A Badel) which, after shifting to the outside of RED MAJESTY and having HAPPY TRIO tight, was then taken out by RED MAJESTY.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  The performance of HAPPY AGAIN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY AGAIN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

L Hewitson pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see HAPPY DAY).  After the event, L Hewitson stated that the intention was to find cover on his mount.  He said with the hood being removed tonight, GLORY B jumped well and was able to go forward and race outside the lead, particularly in circumstances where the early pace of the event was run outside of standard time.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

At declaration time, H Bentley was declared as the rider of both STORM RUNNER and LUCKY GENERATIONS.  It was established that H Bentley had a firm commitment to ride LUCKY GENERATIONS.  As such, the Stewards permitted M F Poon to be substituted as the rider of STORM RUNNER.  For this declaration error, H Bentley was fined $2,000.  Crowded shortly after the start.  M L Yeung (TOGEPI) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in, resulting in SKY FOREVER, which was racing keenly to its inside, being taken in, crowding the running of ZETTA FORE, resulting in LUCKY GENERATIONS being badly crowded for room and having to be checked.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 15 January 2025 and to expire on Monday, 20 January 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.

Bumped on jumping, shifted out and became unbalanced when it made contact with LUCKY GENERATIONS.  Taken wider near the 150 Metres by GLORY B which shifted out.  Noted to have sustained mild abrasions to the left hind leg.
Hampered near the 150 Metres.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between SKY FOREVER and LUCKY GENERATIONS which was taken out by GIMME FIVE which shifted out after making contact with STORM RUNNER which shifted out slightly.  Crowded near the 1000 Metres.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on ZETTA FORCE at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, ZETTA FORCE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.
No report.

M L Yeung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1000 Metres (see LUCKY GENERATIONS).  Hampered near the 150 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

L Hewitson (GLORY B) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of GIMME FIVE, resulting in GIMME FIVE being taken out onto TOGEPI, resulting in TOGEPI taking TOP TIME out and causing HAPPY DAY to be checked to avoid the heels of TOP TIME.  L Hewitson was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 15 January 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  For some distance in the early stages over-raced and refused to settle.  Crowded near the 1000 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  As this was the second occasion that SKY FOREVER had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
For some distance near the 700 Metres raced keenly and leaving the 700 Metres was steadied away from UNITED ENDEAVORS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Approaching the 1400 Metres raced tight to the inside of HAPPY UNIVERSE before that runner was corrected by its rider.  Passing the 1300 Metres was steadied to avoid EMBRACES.  For some distance approaching the 700 Metres raced keenly and after being steadied away from HAPPY UNIVERSE near the 700 Metres commenced a forward move thereafter where it raced very wide and without cover. For some distance approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.

After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount enjoyed a comfortable run during the race but finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped on jumping.

After the event, Z Purton stated that the instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to continue forward to avoid racing wide.  He said as a result of this SMART CITY was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then raced tight between HAPPY UNIVERSE and SMART CITY which shifted out slightly.  In the early stages, when caught wide, was allowed to stride forward where it obtained a position outside the leaders, however, ISLAND GOLDEN was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.  For some distance approaching the 300 Metres raced tight between TAKE ACTION and TEAM HAPPY (A Pouchin) which shifted to the outside of SMART CITY.  A Pouchin was advised to exercise more care.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping was badly crowded for room.  Near the 1300 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid PHANTOM CYCLONE.  As a result, THE AZURE shifted out and made contact with GOLDEN DARCI.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, L Hewitson reported that his mount lay in when under pressure in the Home Straight and as a result proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Lay in in the Home Straight and over the concluding stages shifted in, resulting in its rider M F Poon having to stop riding with the whip approaching the winning post to straighten his mount.  After the event, M F Poon stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued.

Shifted in abruptly on jumping and made heavy contact with AMAZING AWARD.  Near the 1300 Metres was momentarily crowded between YOU’REMYEVERYTHING and AMAZING AWARD, both of which shifted ground slightly.
No report.
On jumping was severely checked when crowded by LUCKY TOUCH which ran in despite the efforts of its rider.
On jumping raced tight to the inside of PHANTOM CYCLONE which shifted in and as a result made contact with GALE SAGA.  Raced keenly in the early stages.
Bumped on the hindquarters shortly after the start.  Bumped near the 1300 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 150 Metres raced tight between HARMONY GALAXY and GOLDEN DARCI which shifted out and away from LUCKY TOUCH.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that the intention was to hold a slightly more forward position but when runners to his inside showed superior pace in the early stages he was obliged to settle a little further back.  He said in the Home Straight GOOD GOOD finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was kicked by another runner when proceeding to the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Approaching the 150 Metres was steadied when racing tight between ALLGREEKTOME and PRAWNS ELEVEN when both runners shifted ground.   In this incident, YOUNG ARROW was accidentally struck across the head by the whip of L Ferraris, rider of ALLGREEKTOME.

Jumped only fairly. He said entering the Home Straight, when racing greenly, FLYING FORTRESS was eased away from NORDIC DRAGON when that runner shifted out and continued to race greenly for some distance thereafter.  He added in the Home Straight FLYING FORTRESS lay in and as a result he pulled his whip to the right hand near the 100 Metres but over the concluding stages could not ride his mount with full vigour when it was positioned close to NORDIC DRAGON.

Jumped only fairly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind COSMO NAVIGATOR.

After the 400 Metres was bumped by ACE TALENT which shifted to the inside of HAPPY HORSE.  HO HO STAR then lay in for the remainder of the event, resulting in its rider Z Purton changing his whip through to his right hand after the 300 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HAPPY HORSE was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts. Bumped on jumping.  After the 1300 Metres was steadied when being crossed by GALLANT CROWN (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when not quite clear.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Kicked a rail with both hind legs on entering the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. After the event, M L Yeung reported that the intention was to find cover on his mount, but when caught wide in the early stages RUBY SAILING was allowed to stride forward and lead.  He added that RUBY SAILING raced too keenly in the lead and as a consequence gave ground when under pressure in the Home Straight. Approaching the 1200 Metres shifted out and away from STAR LINE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 28.12.24 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart irregularity) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter MIU FA FA. The Veterinary Surgeon reported that CLEAR COURAGE was lame in the left hind leg after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, CLEAR COURAGE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid SUNNY DARLING. Had its right front plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Crowded making the first turn between FORTUNE WARRIOR and CONCORDE STAR which shifted out.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that after being crowded making the first turn his mount failed to travel thereafter and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Avdulla reported that in the early and middle stages his mount resented racing in amongst other horses and as a result near the 600 Metres shifted out and made heavy contact with SOVEREIGN FUND.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained an abrasion to the left hock.  The racing manners of NEBRASKAN were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, NEBRASKAN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong inside other horses.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between SUNNY DARLING and SHANGHAI STYLE, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Making the first turn lay out and as a result was steadied when positioned close to OFFROAD MASTER.  In this incident, CONCORDE STAR made contact with SUNNY DARLING.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 600 Metres was bumped heavily by NEBRASKAN and became badly unbalanced when taken wider.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

On jumping was bumped by FORTUNE WARRIOR which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection of UNISON, which became detached from the field in the middle stages, immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, UNISON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 450 Metres, when racing greenly, was steadied away from GOOD PROSPECT which was taken out slightly by DAN ATTACK.  MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE then lay in in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  From the 300 Metres until the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.

After the event, B Thompson confirmed that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a position outside the expected leader LUCKY BLESSING.  Trainer D Eustace confirmed the instructions issued to B Thompson and said at its first up run on 27 November 2024 he had asked the horse to be ridden in a conservative manner in the early stages with the expected fast early pace.  He added today he was of the opinion that SEA SAPPHIRE would be able to hold a more forward position when he expected the early pace of the event not to be run as quickly in the early stages as compared to its last start.
Apprentice P N Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 100 Metres (see CALIFORNIA BLITZ).

Bumped at the start.  Lay in in the Home Straight.  When questioned, K Teetan stated that his instructions were to hold a forward position preferably with cover.  He said in the early stages FUN N GLORY was unable to cross runners to its inside and as a result raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added due to the wide run he then in the early part of the Home Straight held his mount together before riding it along near the 300 Metres, however, FUN N GLORY did not respond to his riding and gave ground thereafter, which he attributed to the horse racing wide and without cover.
Jumped only fairly.  Making the turn after the 900 Metres, when racing greenly, shifted out and was steadied to avoid DAN ATTACK.

Began awkwardly.  When questioned, C L Chau stated that on straightening his intention was to shift to the outside of LUCKY BLESSING to secure clear running.  He said when LUCKY BLESSING shifted out, he then elected to improve to that runner’s inside in an attempt to secure clear running.  He added after being positioned to the inside of LUCKY BLESSING from the 350 Metres, NEWBORN MIRACLE was then taken in for some distance thereafter by that runner and as a consequence near the 150 Metres was steadied when held up on the heels of SEA SAPPHIRE and he was unable to recommence riding his mount out until near the 50 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the event, Y L Chung confirmed the instructions were to hold a more forward position today.

After the event, L Ferraris stated that his mount jumped only fairly and as a result settled further back than intended.  He said when under pressure in the Home Straight TRAVEL GOLF lay in and was still somewhat disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Apprentice P N Wong (LUCKY BLESSING) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 100 Metres she allowed her mount to shift in when not clear of NEWBORN MIRACLE, resulting in NEWBORN MIRACLE being taken in across the running of CALIFORNIA BLITZ which lost its rightful running and was checked.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 19 January 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered her excellent race riding record.
Slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 200 Metres lay out under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the concluding stages made contact with HEALTHY HEALTHY due to both runners shifting ground.

When giving ground near the 100 Metres was bumped by CARROLL STREET (L Hewitson) which shifted out.  L Hewitson was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her mount, which was having its first run in 84 days, raced keenly in the lead and as a result gave ground over the concluding stages.  She said, in her opinion, CHEVAL VALIANT would derive benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, K Teetan reported that the instructions were to endeavour to find a position with cover. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He added in the Home Straight PANDA shifted ground on a number of occasions, resulting in him having to stop riding and correct it on each occasion. Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with HAPPY TANGO.  When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his instructions were to endeavour to lead and obtain a position on the rail as PARENTS’ LOVE races best in this position.  He said in the early stages when unable to cross NOTTHESILLYONE he elected to race outside that horse but in the Home Straight PARENTS’ LOVE hung in and proved difficult to ride out.  He added that over the concluding stages when he was concerned that PARENTS’ LOVE may shift in and crowd the running of NOTTHESILLYONE he was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount to avoid causing interference.  He said as a consequence he was unable to ride PARENTS’ LOVE out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, Y L Chung stated that the instructions were to hold a more forward position but despite riding his mount along in the early stages HAPPY TANGO did not show sufficient pace to do so.

Jumped awkwardly, got its head up, shifted in and made contact with BEAUTY THUNDER.  A short distance later, CHILL MASTER was then checked when crowded between BEAUTY THUNDER and BITS SUPERSTAR which raced tight to the inside of SUPER SIXTY.  Near the 800 Metres, when racing keenly, was checked when it improved close to the heels of WISDOM STAR.  Making the turn after the 600 Metres was steadied when it lay out towards BEAUTY THUNDER.  After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, raced greenly throughout the race.

Bumped shortly after the start.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that his mount jumped only fairly and as a result he rode it along in the early stages to hold a forward position.  He said throughout the early and middle stages KA YING RESILIENCE was not comfortable racing between CLUB ACE and LEAN MASTER and was under pressure throughout these sections of the race.  He said on the Home Turn KA YING RESILIENCE failed to respond to his riding and gave ground from that point onwards.  Trainer D A Hayes stated that he had been pleased with KA YING RESILIENCE in the lead up to tonight’s race and in particular the horse had barrier trialed well on 16 December 2024.  He added that he had expected KA YING RESILIENCE to perform well but agreed with Jockey Purton that KA YING RESILIENCE was not comfortable racing in amongst other horses but also would be better suited over 1200 Metres at Happy Valley where there is usually less pressure in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of KA YING RESILIENCE was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING RESILIENCE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Became fractious in the barriers, was removed from the starting gates, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. Over the concluding stages lay in, resulting in its rider L Ferraris changing his whip to his right hand near the 50 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He said after obtaining cover leaving the 900 Metres, the pace of the event quickened and as a result he was obliged to start riding his mount along to make up ground. As a consequence, YUEN LONG ELITE made contact with SANTORINI which became unbalanced.  Z Purton was advised to exercise more care and to ensure that there is sufficient room when improving into runs. When the Stewards were satisfied there were not sufficient grounds, having regard to the beaten margin and the manner in which both horses finished the race off, they declined to lodge a protest/objection when connections also did not seek to do so.

H Bentley (OUR LUCKY GLORY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of GLORIOUS JOURNEY, resulting in GLORIOUS JOURNEY striking the heels of OUR LUCKY GLORY and blundering.  H Bentley was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 12 January 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 16 January 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Bentley was fined $25,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good riding record. When questioned, L Ferraris stated that with his mount stepping up in distance to 1600 Metres and a number of noted leaders in the race, he was instructed to find a position behind the lead with cover.  He said in the early stages he was able to comply with those instructions when crossed by VOYAGE SAMURAI where MY WISH travelled comfortably.  He said entering the Home Straight when positioned between VOYAGE SAMURAI and PRESTIGE ALWAYS he commenced to look for a run to the outside of PRESTIGE ALWAYS when there was no other option available to him.  He said as he commenced to shift out, PRESTIGE ALWAYS then shifted out which resulted in a run becoming available between VOYAGE SAMURAI and PRESTIGE ALWAYS.  He added as he was committed to continue to the outside of PRESTIGE ALWAYS, he continued to do so but experienced difficulty obtaining clear running for some distance near the 300 Metres when PRESTIGE ALWAYS continued to shift out.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Ferraris were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that in the middle stages she considered shifting her mount out to join the main body of the field, but when SUMMIT CHEERS was not travelling well enough she remained racing in the middle of the track to prevent SUMMIT CHEERS covering additional ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, K C Leung stated that his instructions were to endeavour to find cover on his mount as SWORD POINT had raced best when ridden in this manner.  He said as a result entering the Back Straight he elected to shift in behind CALL ME GLORIOUS to trail that runner with cover. He said approaching the 700 Metres he observed TELECOM FIGHTERS commence a forward move and as a result he attempted to shift to the outside of CALL ME GLORIOUS to obtain a position one-off.  He added that SWORD POINT responded only fairly to his urgings under its top weight of 135 lbs and when CALL ME GLORIOUS lay out slightly and TELECOM FIGHTERS held its line, he was unable to maintain that position and was steadied to avoid CALL ME GLORIOUS.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions were to find cover on the horse.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Crowded shortly after the start by SWORD POINT which shifted out slightly.  The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by A Atzeni, rider of CAPITAL DELIGHT, 2nd placegetter, against SWORD POINT being declared the winner alleging interference approaching the 300 Metres.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards determined that near the 400 Metres SWORD POINT commenced to shift out when clear of CAPITAL DELIGHT to do so.  As SWORD POINT continued to shift out, CAPITAL DELIGHT improved into a tight run between BUNDLE OF CHARM and SWORD POINT, lay in and a short distance later then blundered when it struck the heels of SWORD POINT.  As the Stewards were satisfied that SWORD POINT was clear to shift ground when it commenced to do so and that CAPITAL DELIGHT had contributed to striking heels when it lay in, they overruled the protest/objection and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  At a subsequent inquiry, the Stewards confirmed their decision in the protest/objection that SWORD POINT was clear to shift ground when it commenced to do so and that CAPITAL DELIGHT had lay in and this was the principal reason for CAPITAL DELIGHT striking heels and blundering.  As a result, no action was taken.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, A Atzeni stated that the instructions were to hold a forward position but preferably with cover.  He said when SKY DEEP jumped well he was obliged to go forward and cross runners to his inside which resulted in SKY DEEP racing in a more forward position than what he had anticipated.  When questioned regarding his riding out, A Atzeni stated that when his mount shifted in near the 200 Metres it took some time to respond to his efforts to correct.  He said as a result passing the 100 Metres SKY DEEP shifted out which presented a run to the inside for the winner ANOTHER WORLD.  The Stewards were satisfied that Jockey Atzeni was riding in a manner to look after the safety of his fellow rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding, A Atzeni stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position.  He said in the early stages he rode his mount along to comply with his instructions, however, AFFIRM did not show its usual pace and was unable to cross runners to his inside.  He said in the Back Straight he was of the opinion that the riders of GOLDEN RISE and PRIME MORTAR were looking to obtain cover and for this reason he continued to ride AFFIRM forward in an attempt to cross runners to his inside.  He added AFFIRM continued to not respond to his efforts to go forward and came under pressure at the 600 Metres before giving ground badly from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, AFFIRM will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding out over the concluding stages and the reason he lost balance to the inside, M F Poon stated that approaching the winning post he commenced to push his mount forward with his right arm in order to encourage PODIUM over the line.  He said as he did so PODIUM changed stride passing the winning post which resulted in him losing balance when his weight shifted to the inside.  Jockey Poon was advised that he must ensure, wherever possible, he does not ride his mounts in a manner that causes him to lose balance and compromise his own safety and the safety of his fellow riders.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out when under pressure over the final 150 Metres.  Apprentice E C W Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 100 Metres (see SOLAR GOGO).

Near the 300 Metres became held up for clear running between GALLANT CROWN and SO AWESOME and shortly after attempted to take a run when there was insufficient room to do so, resulting in CERVIN making contact with SO AWESOME for some distance thereafter before being disappointed for clear running near the 150 Metres.  CERVIN then obtained clear running to the inside of GALLANT CROWN when that runner shifted out after the 150 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 200 Metres raced in restricted room between SO AWESOME which was taken out by CERVIN and PEGASUS GENERAL (K C Leung) which shifted in.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care.  Apprentice E C W Wong (GALLANT CROWN) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when insufficiently clear of SO AWESOME, resulting in SO AWESOME being taken out from its rightful running and also resulting in SOLAR GOGO having to be checked when crowded between SO AWESOME and PEGASUS GENERAL.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 19 January 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.

Between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres was bumped on a number of occasions by CERVIN (K De Melo) when that runner attempted to obtain clear running to the outside of GALLANT CROWN.  K De Melo was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure that there is sufficient room when improving into runs.  Lost its rightful running near the 100 Metres.
Near the 1500 Metres was eased to avoid SOLAR GOGO which shifted out slightly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When being shifted across behind runners near the 1500 Metres was steadied to avoid PODIUM.  A short distance later, RED MAVERICK then made contact with INVINCIBLE MISSILE when that runner held its position behind PODIUM.  Over-raced in the early and middle stages and near the 1100 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from heels.  Near the 500 Metres got its head up when being held up for clear running behind IVICTORIAM.  After the event, A Pouchin reported that from a wide barrier he was given no specific instructions.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to shift RED MAVERICK across behind runners to avoid covering additional ground.

Slow to begin.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount did not travel well throughout the event and failed to run on in the Home Straight but he could offer no explanation for the disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <9/1/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> INVINCIBLE MISSILE, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. INVINCIBLE MISSILE was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer C Fownes this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, INVINCIBLE MISSILE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The Stewards ruled that TATTENHAM will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in consecutive barrier trials in Hong Kong and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 250 Metres was shifted to the outside of PATCH OF COSMO to secure clear running.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in over the final 200 Metres, resulting in its rider H Bowman changing his whip through to his right hand near the 150 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in over the final 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out approaching the winning post and was bumped.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages and the reason his mount did not hold the lead, C L Chau confirmed the instructions were to show intent in the early stages and ride his mount in a manner to lead the event.  He said after making some use of GOOD LUCK WIN shortly after the start he observed SUPER BABY improve to his outside and when he was of the view he would not be able to hold that runner out, he commenced to allow SUPER BABY to cross his mount approaching the first turn.  He said as he allowed SUPER BABY to cross, GOOD LUCK WIN got its head up when he eased and made the first turn awkwardly.  He added making the Home Turn GOOD LUCK WIN hung out towards NINJA DERBY and as a result he was obliged to correct his mount to avoid that runner before being able to ride GOOD LUCK WIN out in the Home Straight.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards advised Jockey Chau that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages in conceding the lead too soon when SUPER BABY improved to his outside and he should wherever possible, ensure that he rides his mounts in accordance with the instructions issued by connections.
Approaching the winning post made contact with GOOD LUCK WIN which shifted out slightly.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 300 Metres and approaching the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.

Approaching the 1500 Metres was steadied when crowded between GOOD LUCK WIN which shifted out slightly and APOLAR FIGHTER which shifted in and away from SUPER BABY.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on FOREMOST TEDDY at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, FOREMOST TEDDY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on HYPER DRAGON BALL at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HYPER DRAGON BALL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and was bumped.  After the event, Z Purton reported that his instructions were to endeavour to obtain cover. He said when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to continue forward to avoid racing wide which resulted in NINJA DERBY racing outside the lead.  He said due to the effort that the horse made in the early stages to cross runners, it was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NINJA DERBY was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, NINJA DERBY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly, then shifted out and made contact with TALENTS SUPREMO.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped. Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and the reason he did not shift to the outside of HAPPY PARK to obtain clear running, K Teetan stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to allow TALENTS SUPREMO to settle where comfortable and to take up a position behind midfield.  He said he was also instructed to save the horse up for a run in the Home Straight over the final 250 Metres as TALENTS SUPREMO has a short sprint.  He said making the Home Turn when following HAPPY PARK, TALENTS SUPREMO was travelling only fairly and for this reason he encouraged the horse to hold its position behind HAPPY PARK.  He said as he did so TALENTS SUPREMO commenced to travel strongly and when HAPPY PARK shifted out slightly, this resulted in TALENTS SUPREMO improving to that runner’s inside and then being held up for clear running behind MEGA BONUS until approaching the 200 Metres.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions issued and advised that TALENTS SUPREMO races best when ridden in this way.  Mr Mo expressed satisfaction with the manner in which Jockey Teetan had ridden the horse on the Home Turn.  After considering the evidence and the explanation provided by Jockey Teetan, the Stewards found that he had made an error of judgement on the Home Turn in not positioning his mount to the outside of HAPPY PARK which would have resulted in TALENTS SUPREMO obtaining clear running sooner than what it did on this occasion.  However, the Stewards were satisfied, having regard to the instructions particularly, that it was not blameworthy in the circumstances.

After the 200 Metres was bumped heavily by SPIRIT OF PEACE (Z Purton) when that runner endeavoured to obtain clear running to the outside of CIRCUIT DUFFY.  As a result, LAKESHORE HERO became unbalanced.  Z Purton was reprimanded and advised he should have desisted from attempting to obtain the run sooner than he did when LAKESHORE HERO held its ground.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that he was of the opinion that LAKESHORE HERO was under pressure and for this reason  he endeavoured to shift that runner out to obtain clear running to the outside of CIRCUIT DUFFY.  He said prior to commencing this move he was of the opinion that there was not clear running available between ONE FOR ALL and CIRCUIT DUFFY and this was his only option to obtain clear running when he made such decision.   As a consequence SPIRIT OF PEACE made contact with LAKESHORE HERO on a number of occasions and was badly held up behind CIRCUIT DUFFY for some distance after the 200 Metres.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when crowded between TALENTS SUPREMO and KA YING POWER (C L Chau) which shifted in.  C L Chau was reprimanded.
On jumping was crowded between ONE FOR ALL and CIRCUIT DUFFY which shifted out.  For some distance after the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind LUCKY PLANET which shifted out slightly.

In the early stages, when racing keenly, got its head up when being crossed by MEGA BONUS.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between LA MOMENTO and MEGA BONUS.  LUCKY PLANET was then shifted to the inside of LA MOMENTO where it secured clear running near the 250 Metres.  After the 200 Metres LUCKY PLANET was eased and shifted to the inside of SPIRIT OF PEACE to continue into clear running.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When giving ground near the 100 Metres the whip of K C Leung became entangled when racing tight to the outside of ICONICAL.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover until near the 700 Metres when ridden forward to cross MEGA BONUS.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
On jumping was crowded by ATOMIC BEAUTY which shifted in and made contact with TRADITION.  TRADITION was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 750 Metres was steadied away from FIREFOOT.  Over the concluding stages raced tight between ATOMIC BEAUTY and YOUTH POWER which shifted in slightly.  As a result, H Bowman was unable to fully test his mount to the finish of the event.
Had its left hind plate refitted in the holding stables, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

In the middle stages raced keenly and after obtaining cover behind HAPPY TANGO near the 800 Metres was steadied away from that runner’s heels.  As a result, JUDY’S GREAT raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer C S Shum advised that the instructions were to settle JUDY’S GREAT where comfortable.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Became fractious whilst being transported to the course, sustained minor abrasions to both front legs, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped at the start.  Briefly held up on the Home Turn and lay in under pressure in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped only fairly.  In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 700 Metres was steadied away from THE PRIME.

Lay in in the Home Straight, resulting in its rider A Pouchin having to correct his mount approaching the 150 Metres.  After the event, A Pouchin reported that from a wide barrier the instructions were to endeavor to find cover.  He said as a result he elected to obtain a trailing position behind midfield to comply with his instructions.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up on the Home Turn.  Near the 250 Metres raced tight to the inside of BRAVE JOY, made contact with that runner and became unbalanced.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 150 Metres was checked when crowded between SHINKANSEN (A Pouchin), which after shifting in, was then corrected by Jockey Pouchin and DRACO (C L Chau ) which shifted out whilst being ridden along.  A Pouchin was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances and to stop riding and straighten his mounts sooner than what he did on this occasion.  C L Chau was reprimanded and advised he must ensure that when his mounts shift ground he is clear to do so.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

On jumping was bumped by PERPETUAL POWER which shifted out.  After the event, A Badel stated that due to the pace of the race being run outside of standard time throughout the early and middle stages TO INFINITY found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on jumping.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start shifted out and made contact with BEAUTY LIGHT.  Near the 150 Metres became held up for clear running behind CIRCUS REEL and could not be ridden out for some distance thereafter.

When giving ground near the 250 Metres lay in and away from BEAUTY LIGHT and made contact with BULB EMPEROR, resulting in BRAVE JOY becoming unbalanced.  After the event, C Y Ho stated that the intention was not to lead the event but from an inside barrier and with the pace of the race being run outside of standard time BRAVE JOY led without being pressured to do so.  He added BRAVE JOY raced greenly throughout the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Making the Home Turn had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a narrow run between STAR CONTACT and HELENE FEELING.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay out in the Home Straight and near the 150 Metres M Chadwick was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Bumped near the 150 Metres.

On jumping was bumped by ENCOUNTERED which shifted out.  Approaching the 1400 Metres raced in restricted room between WOODFIRE BRO and THE GOLDEN SCENERY and commenced to race fiercely.  As a result, MOMENTS IN TIME was then checked to avoid STAR CONTACT for some distance thereafter when it refused to settle.  Raced keenly through the early and middle stages and as a result was allowed to stride forward near the 800 Metres to take up a position outside the lead.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 150 Metres made contact with ENCOUNTERED when being shifted to the outside of STAR CONTACT.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid MOMENTS IN TIME (H Bowman) which shifted in when not clear.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.
No report.

Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when racing in restricted room between MONEY CATCHER and WOODFIRE BRO.  After the event, A Pouchin stated that the instructions were to hold a forward position but not necessarily lead.  He said in the early stages when caught wide and when the pace of the race was run outside of standard time he elected to allow THE GOLDEN SCENERY to stride forward and settle outside the early leader FLAMINGO TRILLION.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 300 Metres was shifted to the outside of THE GOLDEN SCENERY to obtain clear running.  Approaching the 150 Metres became held up for clear running when disappointed between MONEY CATCHER and STAR CONTACT and as a result could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
A Badel was warned in relation to raising his whip arm above shoulder height on a number of occasions over the concluding stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Over the concluding stages had some difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a narrow run between HAPPY FAT CAT and SPICY GOLD.
No report.
Lay out on the Home Turn.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and lost ground.  For some distance after the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind ALLGREEKTOME which was giving ground.
No report.

Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres shifted in and became unbalanced when being corrected by its rider C L Chau.  After the event, C L Chau advised that he was instructed to go forward on his mount from a wide barrier.  He said after obtaining a position outside ALLGREEKTOME making the first turn SUPER JOY N FUN raced keenly and refused to settle.  He said as a result SUPER JOY N FUN was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  Trainer T P Yung confirmed the instructions and stated he issued such instructions as he was of the opinion SUPER JOY N FUN races best when able to use its natural early pace in races.  He added that he had also expected the race not to be run at a fast pace in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Briefly crowded after the 1000 Metres.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  C Y Ho pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see SUNSTRIDER).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

<12/1/2025 8 January 2025 Happy Valley Racemeeting – Race 9 (336)> H Bowman was interviewed relative to the tactics he adopted in the early stages where he shifted to a position one-off the rail near the 1500 Metres to follow SUNSTRIDER.  H Bowman stated that due to the pattern of racing during the meeting, he felt it was advantageous to endeavour to get his horse to the outside, particularly as NOBLE PURSUIT races best when in this position.  He said for this reason he elected to shift out to follow SUNSTRIDER after the 1500 Metres as he felt such manoeuvre would allow SUNSTRIDER to shift to the rail and provide NOBLE PURSUIT with a trailing position behind DILBAGH.  He said when SUNSTRIDER remained racing one-off, SIMPLE HEDGE was able to improve to that runner’s inside and as a result NOBLE PURSUIT settled further back in the field than what he had anticipated.  He added along the Back Straight whilst the opportunity was available to shift in and follow SIMPLE HEDGE, he elected to shift out to attempt to position his mount to the outside but was prevented from doing so when SPEED DRAGON held its position to his outside.  He said as a result near the 550 Metres he was forced to go back to the inside to start a forward move and follow SIMPLE HEDGE.  H Bowman reinforced his views that NOBLE PURSUIT was disadvantaged by racing to the inside and also was not assisted by the track pattern on the night as it was forced to make a run on the inside.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event, K C Leung reported that when the pace of the event eased in the middle stages his mount raced keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from SAMARKAND.  He said as a result SUPER UNICORN was one-paced to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
C L Chau will be warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where his whip arm was raised above shoulder height on several occasions over the concluding stages.

Crowded shortly after the start by NOBLE PURSUIT which shifted out.  C Y Ho (SPEED DRAGON) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of SUNSTRIDER, resulting in SUNSTRIDER having to be checked to avoid SPEED DRAGON.  C Y Ho was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 12 January 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 16 January 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.
No report.
Near the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid SUPER UNICORN.  For some distance near the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

On jumping was crowded by CALIFORNIATOTALITY which shifted in.  After the event, M Chadwick reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions were to lead tonight’s event.  He said TOY SOLTERO had pleased the stable leading into the race but may not have appreciated leading and this was the only explanation he could offer for TOY SOLTERO weakening in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of TOY SOLTERO was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, TOY SOLTERO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shortly after the start was badly crowded.  B Thompson (GROOVY FEELING) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 800 Metres he placed unnecessary pressure on DRAGON FOUR SEAS, resulting in DRAGON FOUR SEAS being crowded for some distance thereafter and being awkwardly placed on the heels of POSITIVE SMILE.  B Thompson was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 5 February 2025 at Happy Valley.  In addition, Jockey Thompson was fined $15,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 1 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  K C Leung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 300 Metres (see ROBOT KNIGHT).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out on jumping despite the efforts of its rider, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Held up making the Home Turn.

Between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running.  When being shifted to the outside of SOLAR RIVER near the 150 Metres to attempt to obtain clear running made contact with INNO CENTURY.
Jumped only fairly.  B Thompson was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 800 Metres (see DRAGON FOUR SEAS).

Bumped on jumping and then shortly afterwards shifted in, was contacted on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount raced greenly, hung in throughout and in the Home Straight proved difficult to ride out.
Crowded on jumping.

Near the 150 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount, which was having its first race start, would derive benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was severely checked when crowded between VIEW ALL THINGS which was taken in by PERFECT PEACH when that runner shifted in after making contact with ROBOT KNIGHT and LITTLE SQUID which was taken out by DRAGON FOUR SEAS when that runner was crowded by JOYFUL TREASURE which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  Approaching the 600 Metres was checked to avoid LITTLE SQUID.  Between the 450 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted out.

Crowded shortly after the start.  Near the 600 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by VIEW ALL THINGS which shifted in when racing greenly.  Over the final 50 Metres could not be ridden out when awkwardly placed behind INNO CENTURY which was giving ground.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages and the reason his mount lost ground from the main body of the field, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions from the outside barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said TACTICAL COMMAND jumped well and when it was travelling strongly soon after the start, he elected to restrain his mount to comply with his instructions and to ensure that it did not hold a forward position.  He said as a result he lost ground on the main body of the field and agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he had restrained his mount too long in the early stages which resulted in it losing ground.  Apprentice Wong was advised that in similar circumstances he must show better judgment to ensure that his mounts are given every possible chance to win and obtain the best possible placing.

Prior to declaration time, the Stewards were informed by Jockey Y L Chung that he had inadvertently accepted to ride both ROBOT KNIGHT and CAMP FIRE.  In the subsequent inquires made between the respective trainers and jockey, it was established that Jockey Chung had first committed to ride ROBOT KNIGHT.  As such, the Steward permitted K De Melo to be substituted as the rider of CAMP FIRE.  For this error, Jockey Chung was fined $2,000.  K C Leung pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of ROBOT KNIGHT, resulting in ROBOT KNIGHT losing its running and having to be checked.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 5 February 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 13 February 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Leung was fined $110,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very poor race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Making the Home Turn raced tight to the inside of FUNG as that runner commenced to give ground.  Over the concluding stages was taken in and near the winning post was eased to avoid EXCELLENT DADDY (L Ferraris) which shifted in.  L Ferraris was advised to exercise more care.  Approaching the finishing line the whip of Apprentice E C W Wong became caught in the whip of B Thompson, the rider of FALCON COURT.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, B Thompson stated that the instructions were to settle in a midfield position.  He said after commencing well and when caught wide in the early stages he elected to allow FALCON COURT to stride forward to cross runners to his inside to avoid racing wide.  He said as a result his mount raced in a more forward position than anticipated.

Shortly after the start was eased when crowded between FALCON COURT and EXCELLENT DADDY which shifted out slightly. <13/1/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that CURRAHEE was lame in its right front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, CURRAHEE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Approaching the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of EXCELLENT DADDY and as a result made contact with FLYING DRAGON which shifted out slightly.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 200 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running between DIAMOND SOARS and CHEER FOR SOUTH and as a result made contact with CHEER FOR SOUTH.
Jumped only fairly.  Over the concluding stages was eased when crowded between CHEER FOR SOUTH and SMART LEADER which shifted in slightly.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount resented the kickback on the All Weather surface and in the Home Straight gave ground under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FUNG, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FUNG will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Hung out in the middle stages. Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping blundered, became unbalanced and lost ground.

He said in the early stages he settled slightly further back due to the pace of the event being run inside of standard time.  He added, in his opinion, COLOURFUL WINNER would be better suited racing on the turf.

Over the concluding stages shifted in towards YEAH BUDDY when that runner shifted out slightly, resulting in FUN N FUN TOGETHER being steadied when awkwardly placed close to YEAH BUDDY.   Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Approaching the 600 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from KA YING WARRIOR.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount did not travel strongly throughout the event due to the early stages of the race being run inside of standard time.  He added as a result his mount finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping was bumped and became unbalanced.  Near the 700 Metres hung out towards the heels of FUN N FUN TOGETHER and was steadied.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.

Slow to begin.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of JOLLY COMPANION was considered disappointing as compared to its last start.  Before being allowed to race again, JOLLY COMPANION will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that his mount, which was having its first race start on the All Weather surface, did not show early pace despite being ridden along.  He said AEROINVINCIBLE did not travel well thereafter and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Slow to begin.  A warning was placed on the barrier manners of the horse.  When commencing to finish the race off well was held up for clear running between GIANT LEAP and VICTORY MOMENTS which shifted out when giving ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount responded to his riding in the early part of the Home Straight.  He added near the 200 Metres VICTORY MOMENTS then came under pressure before giving ground from that point and he had some concern that there might be something amiss with it over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
No report.

Bumped on jumping by ISLAND BUDDY.  Shortly after the start was then checked when crowded by ISLAND BUDDY (M Chadwick) which shifted in and away from NOBLE DELUXE (A Hamelin) which shifted in.  Both M Chadwick and A Hamelin were advised to exercise more care and make a greater effort to prevent their mounts from shifting ground in similar circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that the intention was to find a position with cover but in the early stages when runners to his outside did not show intent to lead INVINCIBLE LUCKY maintained the lead without being pressured to do so.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions were from an inside barrier to hold a more forward position than at its previous race starts, particularly with blinkers being reapplied but had not expected INVINCIBLE LUCKY to lead the event. Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when positioned close to SUNNY DA BEST.
