From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 450 Metres was taken wider.  In the early part of the Home Straight hung in and proved difficult to ride out, resulting in its rider H Bowman changing his whip through to his right hand near the 300 Metres.
Approaching the 450 Metres was hampered when taken wider by RIDING HIGH which shifted out to improve.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Near the 150 Metres, when giving ground, shifted out after being eased to avoid RIDING HIGH when that runner lay in and away from SUNNY DA BEST.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

BIG RED, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 11.1.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore).  Before being allowed to race again, BIG RED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and was steadied to avoid FATAL BLOW.  After the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid FASHION LEGEND.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid MASTER TRILLION.

Crowded near the 350 Metres.  When questioned, K C Leung stated that he was not instructed to go forward but in the early stages when caught wide he allowed MASTER TRILLION to cross runners to his inside to lead rather than being caught wide.  He said making the first turn MASTER TRILLION hung out slightly and as a result lost ground when being crossed by PEARL OF PANG’S.  K C Leung was advised, wherever possible, he must ensure he sets a consistent pace.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

Delayed the start when proving difficult to load.  The barrier manners were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA STAR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Slow to begin.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shortly after the start was eased when crowded by BLING BLING GENIUS which shifted out.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping.  After the 900 Metres was steadied away from QUICK QUICK WIN.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that his mount hung out making the Home Turn and failed to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced keenly in the early stages.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied when crowded between MASTER TRILLION which, after improving to the outside of BLING BLING GENIUS, was then crowded when taken out slightly by that runner and JOLLY JUMPER (A Badel) which shifted in before Jockey Badel made some effort to correct his mount.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care and make a greater effort to correct his mounts when they shift ground.
No report.
Near the 350 Metres shifted out to obtain clear running and made contact with OUTGATE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped by ANOTHER ZONDA.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Lay in in the Home Straight.

After being crossed by ANOTHER ZONDA near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid that runner for some distance thereafter.  Near the 350 Metres endeavoured to obtain a narrow run between AWESOME TREASURE and CALL ME GORGEOUS.  When AWESOME TREASURE shifted out slightly, GOKO WIN then had difficulty obtaining clear running until near the 250 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 400 Metres improved into a tight run between OUTGATE and TOURBILLON PRINCE and as a result made contact with TOURBILLON PRINCE for some distance thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bounded on jumping and lost ground.  Shortly after the start was then eased when crowded between FANTASTIC TREASURE and SUNLIGHT POWER.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied away from YOUNG CHAMPION when racing tight to the inside of SUNLIGHT POWER.  Passing the 400 Metres was disappointed for clear running between DANCING CODE and TOURBILLON PRINCE and as a result made contact with DANCING CODE.  JOHANNES BRAHMS was then held up for clear running until near the 200 Metres when it improved into a tight run between YOUNG CHAMPION and TOURBILLON PRINCE.

Bumped near the 50 Metres.  After the event, L Hewitson stated the intention was to hold a more forward position.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to restrain his mount to settle at the rear of the field to avoid racing wide.
Bumped at the start.

In the early and middle stages raced keenly and was left racing wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.  Near the 400 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and as a result shifted out.  Near the 50 Metres was bumped by PACKING HERMOD which shifted in.
Bumped near the 400 Metres.
Over the final 450 Metres was held up for clear running and as a result could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.

Bumped on jumping.  Near the 400 Metres C L Chau dropped his left rein for a number of strides.  After the 400 Metres was hampered when taken wider by DANCING CODE (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted out.  Near the 250 Metres SUNLIGHT POWER was eased when crowded between PACKING HERMOD and DANCING CODE which continued to shift out.  Apprentice Wong was reprimanded.  After being shifted to the inside of DANCING CODE near the 200 Metres then became held up for clear running between TOURBILLON PRINCE and DANCING CODE which shifted back in.  As a result, SUNLIGHT POWER could not be ridden out for the remainder of the event.
Bumped on jumping.  Approaching the 350 Metres was bumped by RUBYLOT and taken wider when RUBYLOT shifted to the outside of SING DRAGON to obtain clear running.
Bumped at the start.
Bumped at the start.

Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid LUCKY EIGHT.  Raced ungenerously in the Home Straight.  Approaching the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between AWESOME TREASURE and ANOTHER ZONDA.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and was steadied away from LUCKY EIGHT.  After being shifted behind MATTERS MOST near the 1100 Metres then raced keenly near the 1000 Metres and was steadied when positioned close to MATTERS MOST.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind CALL ME GORGEOUS.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, GREAT STATE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped on the hindquarters.  Over the concluding stages shifted in and was steadied away from GOKO WIN when that runner shifted out slightly.  After the event, M Chadwick reported that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, would derive benefit from today’s race experience.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between AWESOME TREASURE and CALL ME GORGEOUS which shifted in and away from SUGAR BALL despite the efforts of its rider.

Near the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between SUGAR BALL and GREAT STATE (M L Yeung) which, when being steadied away from CALL ME GORGEOUS, shifted out.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from STORM RIDER.  Briefly held up near the 300 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Bumped near the 900 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 900 Metres, when racing keenly, shifted out when being steadied away from TOP GUN, made contact with SILVERY BREEZE and became unbalanced.
After the event, A Atzeni reported that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  Over the final 100 Metres was held up for clear running and could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.
Slow to begin.  Over the concluding stages had difficulty obtaining clear running and could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.

Slow to begin.  Near the 900 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid FAST NETWORK.  Near the 450 Metres raced tight between FAST NETWORK and MARKWIN which shifted out.  Crowded near the 200 Metres.  Again crowded near the 100 Metres.

Near the 200 Metres was checked when crowded between TOP GUN which was taken out by HELENE WARRIOR when that runner shifted out and away from MARKWIN whilst giving ground and KING MILES (A Pouchin) which shifted in slightly.  A Pouchin was advised to exercise more care.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A Pouchin pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 100 Metres (see HELENE WARRIOR).

A Pouchin (KING MILES) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in, taking TOP GUN in onto HELENE WARRIOR, resulting in HELENE WARRIOR losing its running and being checked.  A Pouchin  was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 5 February 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
When the pace steadied approaching the 500 Metres shifted out when positioned close to the heels of GOLD TACK.   Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running to the outside of GO GO GO which shifted out slightly.  As a result, GOLD TACK was shifted in to obtain clear running after the 200 Metres.

Approaching the 600 Metres was bumped by NICE BIRDIE which shifted out.  In the early part of the Home Straight hung in, resulting in its rider A Pouchin changing his whip through to his right hand.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in.
Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping.  Near the 500 Metres was taken wider by CONFRINGO.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between GO GO GO and FURY AND GOLD, both of which shifted ground.  Near the 500 Metres when the pace steadied was severely checked to avoid NICE BIRDIE.

Trainer C W Chang confirmed that from the outside barrier the instructions were to take up a forward position on the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 600 Metres shifted to the outside of RED MAVERICK in an attempt to make a forward move and as a result made contact with RUNNING AHEAD.  NICE BIRDIE was then prevented from continuing forward from the 600 Metres when held up behind ON THE LASH and inside RUNNING AHEAD.
Shortly after the start made contact with AMAZING VICTORY, shifted in and bumped FALLON.  Near the 200 Metres C L Chau dropped his left rein for a number of strides.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between AMAZING VICTORY and GLORIOUS SUCCESS.
Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.  Lay out in the Home Straight.
For some distance near the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.

As the start was effected became fractious and as a consequence reared, jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  A warning was placed on the barrier manners of the horse.  Over the final 150 Metres was held up for clear running behind GLORIOUS SUCCESS and could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.
Between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  In the Home Straight lay in.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that his mount failed to travel during the running of the race and was disappointing in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 500 Metres when the pace steadied was checked to avoid WINNING SEVEN.  When questioned, Y L Chung stated that making the Home Turn his mount was disappointed for clear running to the inside of WINNING SEVEN and as a result was checked to avoid WINNING SEVEN near the 400 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that after placing his mount under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight it did not respond to his riding.  He said when he put the whip away near the 200 Metres and commenced to ride his mount out hands and heels, soon after CHING commenced to respond to his riding before making good ground over the concluding stages.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 250 Metres raced tight between STELLAR SWIFT and IVY LEAGUE which shifted out.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that with the pace of the event being run outside of standard time in the middle stages, when the pace increased on the Home Turn, his mount came under immediate pressure and was unable to finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairy and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Leaving the 500 Metres was checked to avoid ARTHUR’S KINGDOM when that runner was giving ground quickly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 700 Metres was steadied away from DRAGON DELIGHT.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

When questioned, K Teetan stated that his instructions were to ensure that his mount led the event.  He said as a result he rode his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  He said after making the first turn near the 1200 Metres, whilst he was aware the pace of the event was being run inside of standard time, when DRAGON STAR was pressured by ARTHUR’S KINGDOM, this resulted in the pace of the race being run at a quicker tempo than he would have liked.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions were to lead on the horse.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that his mount did not run out the 1800 Metres due to the pace of the race being run inside of standard time during the early and middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a small laceration to the right hind leg.
Near the 250 Metres was taken wider by CHARITY GAIN which shifted out to improve.
Leaving the 600 Metres was checked to avoid ARTHUR’S KINGDOM as that runner commenced to give ground.
No report.
After the event, L Ferraris reported that the instructions were to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.

When questioned, H T Mo stated that his instructions were to lead on the rail as ARTHUR’S KINGDOM has a tendency to hang in and races best when able to find the rail.  He said in the early stages when caught wide he was obliged to make use of his mount to cross runners to his inside but was able to obtain a position outside DRAGON STAR near the 1200 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding between the 1200 Metres and the 900 Metres, H T Mo stated that ARTHUR’S KINGDOM hung in through that section of the race and as a result he was obliged to encourage his mount forward to maintain a position one-off the rail.  He said near the 800 Metres ARTHUR’S KINGDOM came under pressure before giving ground noticeably thereafter.  The Stewards advised Jockey Mo that in the circumstances he had made an error between the 1200 Metres and the 900 Metres by continuing to encourage his mount forward after having to make use of it in the early stages to cross runners to his inside.  Trainer Y S Tsui confirmed the instructions were to lead on the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ARTHUR’S KINGDOM, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ARTHUR’S KINGDOM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover until the 800 Metres.  Near the 600 Metres was steadied away from BOWSER.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by LUCKY TOUCH which shifted in.

In the Home Straight lay in and near the 150 Metres raced tight to the outside of EXCEL  WONGCHOY which shifted out slightly when giving ground.  After the event, K C Leung reported that his instructions were to endeavour to obtain a midfield position with cover.  He said in the early stages when caught wide he was obliged to settle towards the back of the field to comply with his instructions.  He said SILVER KING then relaxed underneath him and as a result he was obliged to make use of his mount to maintain his position.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions issued.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that with the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time BOWSER raced keenly and as a result did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  When giving ground near the 250 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by LUCKY TOUCH which shifted in slightly.  The performance of BRILLIANT FIRE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BRILLIANT FIRE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was examined upon arrival at the Start, was found to be lame in its right front leg and was withdrawn by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY DAILY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 600 Metres raced keenly when being steadied to allow YOUTHFUL SPIRITS to cross to the rail.  For some distance after the 150 Metres was taken out by YOUTHFUL SPIRITS which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start shifted out and was bumped.
Crowded shortly after the start.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between HEALTHY HEALTHY and MAJESTIC KNIGHT which was taken out by YOUTHFUL SPIRITS.  After the 100 Metres was shifted to the inside of WHIZZ KID to continue into clear running.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to YOUTHFUL SPIRITS.
Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount hung out on the Home Turn and as a result made that turn wider.
No report.
No report.

After the event, K C Leung stated that his mount was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event and also would be benefited by stepping up in distance for its next start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 200 Metres was bumped by LEAN MASTER which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Shifted out at the start, made contact with CIRCUIT SEVEN, got its head up and became unbalanced.  Near the 150 Metres was shifted to the inside of HARMONY FIRE to continue into clear running.  Near the 100 Metres was checked to avoid LEAN MASTER and as a result shifted to the inside of LEAN MASTER to obtain clear running.  Noted to have blood at the left nostril on arrival at Sha Tin.  An endoscopic examination confirmed the horse to be a bleeder.  As this was the second occasion that MR VALIANT had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
Bumped at the start.
When under pressure in the Home Straight shifted in near the 200 Metres, resulting in its rider Apprentice E C W Wong having to stop riding and straighten his mount.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event, H T Mo reported that the instructions were to hold a more forward position but SWEET DIAMOND failed to show sufficient pace to do so.  He said when under pressure in the Home Straight SWEET DIAMOND did not respond to his riding and over the concluding stages he had concerns with its action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SWEET DIAMOND was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, SWEET DIAMOND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that his mount was slow to begin and as a result settled at the back of the field.  He said throughout the event REWARDING TWINKLE raced greenly, lay out and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  After the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid SPICY SO SMART.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied away from SPICY SO SMART.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the first turn after the 1000 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by YEE CHEONG SPIRIT (H Bowman) which lay in and away from WINNING HEART despite the efforts of its rider H Bowman.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after shifted out and made contact with YEE CHEONG SPIRIT.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied when crowded between POLARIS and SUPER CHARIZZARD which shifted out when being steadied away from SPICY SO SMART.  Over the final 50 Metres was unable to be fully ridden out when positioned close to SUPER CHARIZZARD which shifted out slightly.
Shifted out at the start and bumped SUPER CHARIZZARD.  Approaching the finish could not be ridden out when positioned tight to the inside of SUPER CHARIZZARD.
After the 600 Metres bumped with MOTOMAN and became unbalanced.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Shortly after the start was crowded between WINNING HEART and WISDOM STAR which shifted out.  YOUNG HORIZON was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 600 Metres was bumped by WINNING HEART when that horse improved to the outside of TELECOM POWER.  As a result, YOUNG HORIZON raced wide and without cover thereafter.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

On jumping shifted in abruptly and shortly after the start was bumped and became unbalanced.  Approaching the 200 Metres was briefly held up for clear running when attempting a narrow run between SMART FIGHTER and SEA SAPPHIRE which shifted in slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from SILVER SPURS.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  After the event, A Badel stated that his mount jumped well and showed good pace in the early stages and as a result was able to cross to the lead approaching the first turn.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in in the Home Straight.
Jumped only fairly and then was checked shortly after by SKY JEWELLERY which shifted in abruptly.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by SILVER SPURS which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, L Ferraris stated that his mount enjoyed a good run during the race but was unable to finish the race off strongly over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After travelling a short distance was crowded for room between SKY JEWELLERY and GOOD PROSPECT which was taken out by OWNERS’ PRAISE.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Crowded shortly after the start.  After the event, C L Chau reported that his mount raced keenly in the early and middle stages.

After the event, B Thompson stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages but failed to respond to his riding when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

When questioned regarding the horse leading, K Teetan stated that with blinkers being applied tonight he was asked to ride the horse in the lead.  He said such instructions were issued as DEFINITIVE had raced well in the lead wearing blinkers when it raced in New Zealand prior to arriving in Hong Kong.  Trainer D Eustace confirmed the instructions issued and the reasons as to why such instructions were issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 800 Metres shifted out when being checked away from PRAY FOR MIR.  Shifted out near the 600 Metres and was bumped.  Over the concluding stages shifted in slightly and made contact with DEFINITIVE.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards viewed the patrol film to ascertain if there were grounds for a protest/objection.  When the Stewards were satisfied that the contact between DEFINITIVE and SOLEIL FIGHTER had occurred principally due to SOLEIL FIGHTER shifting in over the concluding stages, they declined to lodge a protest/objection and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.   Sent for sampling post-race.
After the 1600 Metres was steadied away from GLORIOUS JOURNEY.  After the 700 Metres was checked to avoid GOLDEN ARTIE.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and near the 600 Metres made contact with SOLEIL FIGHTER when that runner shifted out.
Near the 1600 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by PRAY FOR MIR which was taken out slightly by SOLEIL FIGHTER.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

On jumping shifted in, made contact with the right side of its barrier and shortly after was steadied when crowded by SOLEIL FIGHTER which shifted out.  Bumped near the 1600 Metres.  After the event, Z Purton stated that his mount raced too keenly in the early and middle stages and as a result gave ground in the Home Straight, particularly in circumstances where it was withdrawn from its previous engagement on 1 January 2025.  Trainer W K Mo stated that after being withdrawn from its engagement on 1 January 2025, PRAY FOR MIR had pleased him in its track work and he expected the horse to run well tonight.  Mr Mo agreed with the assessment of Jockey Purton that PRAY FOR MIR raced too keenly in the early and middle stages after being bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of PRAY FOR MIR was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, PRAY FOR MIR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the 1600 Metres was bumped by GLORIOUS JOURNEY.  Near the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid SOLEIL FIGHTER.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that he was asked to ride his mount where comfortable.  He said after commencing well he was able to obtain a position outside the lead in the early stages.  He added I CAN travelled satisfactorily during the race before failing to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping raced tight between CHATEAUNEUF and SPICY GOLD which shifted in slightly.  For some distance approaching the 1000 Metres became unbalanced when crowded for room between CHATEAUNEUF and SPICY GOLD.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.
No report.

For some distance approaching the 1000 Metres became unbalanced when buffeted for room between BRIGHT DAY and AURORA LADY and near the 1000 Metres was checked.  Near the 200 Metres was taken out slightly by HAROLD WIN which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shifted in at the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  A Atzeni pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 1000 Metres (see BRIGHT DAY).
Bumped on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Shortly after the start shifted out and made contact with WINGS OF WAR.
Near the 600 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by NORDIC DRAGON which lay in slightly despite the efforts of its rider.

After the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded between AURORA LADY which raced tight to the inside of SPICY GOLD and GUSTOSISIMO (Y L Chung) which shifted out slightly when being corrected to relieve the crowding to its inside.  Y L Chung was advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  After the event, K Teetan stated that his mount raced "flat” during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between GALLANT VALOUR and HAROLD WIN which shifted in.  Approaching the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid FLYING FORTRESS.  After the event, K De Melo stated that in the Home Straight he had concerns with his mount’s action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, TURF PHOENIX will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A Atzeni (HAROLD WIN) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of BRIGHT DAY, resulting in BRIGHT DAY being crowded for room and having to be severely checked and shifting in, crowding SPICY GOLD, also resulting in SPICY GOLD having to be checked.  A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 9 February 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 13 February 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Atzeni was fined $27,500.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 3 and also considered his good race riding record.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 250 Metres was momentarily crowded between TALENTS SUPREMO and I AM THE BOSS which shifted out slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event, A Badel stated that from a favourable barrier TACTICAL COMMAND was able to hold a more forward position than it did at its most recent start.
No report.
Shifted in abruptly at the start.  Near the 900 Metres was eased when crossed by DIVINE MOONLIGHT (B Shinn) which shifted in when not quite clear.  B Shinn was advised to exercise more care.

For some distance approaching the 250 Metres attempted a narrow run between DIVINE MOONLIGHT and FUN N GLORY.  When FUN N GLORY (K Teetan) lay in slightly near the 250 Metres, I AM THE BOSS was checked when awkwardly placed close to the heels of FUN N GLORY and as a result lost ground.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.  However, the Stewards found that the run I AM THE BOSS was improving into was tight which contributed to the incident.

Near the 400 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of FIT BEAUTY.  After the event, M F Poon stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to settle further back to obtain cover behind FIT BEAUTY.  He added that in the Home Straight his mount ran on fairly and attempted to jump a section on the track near the 170 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start blundered badly and as a consequence became unbalanced and lost ground.  He added that MEEPMEEP settled further back in the field than had been intended but finished the race off reasonably well and he was not too disappointed with the performance of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, B Shinn stated that after obtaining the lead DIVINE MOONLIGHT, which was having its first race start, did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight and, in his opinion, would derive benefit from today’s race experience.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by FUN N GLORY which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.
No report.

Throughout the event raced ungenerously and got its head up near the 1000 Metres when positioned close to TACTICAL COMMAND.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, FIT BEAUTY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After arriving at the barriers was kicked by another runner.  Acting on veterinary advice that CALIFORNIA BLITZ was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA BLITZ will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 900 Metres was bumped by RAGING RAPIDS and as a result was steadied.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
Near the 900 Metres was bumped when it shifted in.

Making the Home Turn was crowded for room by SKY JOY which, after being taken in slightly by NOBLE GO (A Atzeni), then shifted in and away from that runner slightly.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.  For some distance near the 450 Metres raced tight to the inside of SKY JOY which continued to lay in despite the efforts of its rider.  Over the final 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running and as a result could not be ridden out over the concluding stages.
No report.
Near the 800 Metres was briefly crowded by QUICK CONTRIBUTION which lay in.  From the 400 Metres until the 50 Metres was badly held up for clear running.

Approaching the 900 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by SPICY STANDARD which shifted in before being corrected by its rider B Avdulla.  After the event, C Y Ho stated that despite riding his mount along in the early stages SUNNY DARLING did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  He said in a recent barrier trial on 10 January 2025 SUNNY DARLING had performed in a similar manner and, in his opinion, shows better pace when racing on the All Weather surface.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 750 Metres and again after the 600 Metres became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of FLASH CURRENT.  Near the 350 Metres was shifted to the outside of FLASH CURRENT to obtain clear running.  Near the 200 Metres was steadied when unable to continue to proceed forward between SUNNY DARLING and FLASH CURRENT which shifted out.
Shifted out on jumping.

When commencing to give ground near the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded by FLASH CURRENT (K C Leung) which, after being held up behind SPICY STANDARD, then shifted in to obtain clear running to the inside of SPICY STANDARD as that runner also shifted in.  K C Leung was reprimanded.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up making the Home Turn.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of CHATER GOLD which lay in.
Jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start raced tight between FLYING LUCK and CARRYON SMILING which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Made contact with a rail on the way to the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Between the 500 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.
Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.

When questioned, J McDonald stated that the instructions were to hold a midfield position.  He said when MATSU VICTOR commenced well, he was caught wide in the early stages and initially endeavoured to obtain cover behind SMART BEAUTY.  He said when unable to obtain cover and when the pace of the event was being run inside of standard time, he was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, K De Melo reported that the intention was to hold a slightly more forward position than at its previous race start.  He said in the early stages when racing to the outside of STORM RUNNER and CELTIC TIMES, he was obliged to continue forward to cross those runners to avoid racing wide.  He said as a result he was obliged to make some use of his mount to do so which caused CARRYON SMILING to race keenly in the early stages.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Near the 300 Metres shifted out and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was bumped by WORLD HERO and became unbalanced.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  PATCH OF STARS, which had been held up, was disappointed for clear running after the 400 Metres between STRATHPEFFER and MR JUSTICE which lay in.  As a result, PATCH OF STARS made contact with MR JUSTICE and became unbalanced.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped and taken out by FORERUNNER which shifted out to improve.

Lay in shortly after the start and was bumped.  After the 400 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of FUN TOGETHER.  After the event, C L Chau confirmed that he was instructed to take up a forward position on his mount.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.
On jumping was crowded between FUN TOGETHER and LESLIE, both of which shifted ground.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped at the start.

After the event, C Y Ho reported that despite riding his mount along in the early stages it failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position as instructed.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SECOND TO NONE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Lay in near the 400 Metres, was bumped and became unbalanced.

Shortly after the start was crowded between STRATHPEFFER which shifted out slightly and FANTASTIC FUN which shifted in after making contact with PATCH OF STARS.  After the event, Y L Chung confirmed that from an inside barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position.
Shortly after the start was bumped by EURO ROCKS which lay in before being corrected by its rider.  When giving ground after the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of FUN TOGETHER .

After the event, L Ferraris stated that from a wide barrier he was obliged to make use of his mount to take up a position outside the lead.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight, under its top weight of 135 lbs, FUN TOGETHER did not respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SMILING COLLECTOR.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.  When being shifted to the outside of JOLLY RULER near the 200 Metres made contact with GALE SAGA.
No report.
Slow to begin.  After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount lay out in the Home Straight and as a result he pulled his whip through to his left hand near the 250 Metres.
Bumped at the start.
Near the 450 Metres was bumped when taken wider by NOBLE FANS which shifted out to improve.  Bumped near the 200 Metres.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the event, H T Mo stated that the horse had a tendency of being slow to begin in its recent starts and for this reason sheepskin cheek pieces were added to its gear.  He said CIRCUIT MAXIMUS jumped well today and when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to continue forward to avoid covering additional ground.  He said as a consequence CIRCUIT MAXIMUS raced in a more forward position than anticipated.  Noted to be lame in its right front leg after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, CIRCUIT MAXIMUS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Lay out in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.

Shifted out near the 450 Metres and was bumped.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between GALE SAGA (C L Chau) which shifted in slightly and GALVANIC (B Shinn) which shifted out when improving to the outside of JOLLY RULER.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  B Shinn was severely reprimanded.  After the event, B Avdulla could offer no explanation for the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 1000 Metres was taken wider by CIRCUIT MAXIMUS which shifted out when being corrected by its rider.  After the event, J McDonald stated that the instructions were to hold a forward position, however, JOLLY RULER raced wide and without cover for the majority of the race and as a result gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by PATCH OF TIME which shifted in after being bumped by NOBLE FANS.  After the event, A  Atzeni reported that when he felt there may be something amiss with his mount in the Home Straight he eased it down from the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SPORTIC WARRIOR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPORTIC WARRIOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 18.1.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart irregularity) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter SPORTIC WARRIOR.  Before being allowed to race again, SHAMUS STORM will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped by HOWDEEPISYOURLOVE which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Near the 1300 Metres, when racing keenly, was eased to avoid SUPERB BOY which shifted in.  Near the 1000 Metres was eased when racing tight to the inside of GRACIOUS EXPRESS.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded near the 1000 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 50 Metres became unbalanced when bumped on the hindquarters.  When questioned, Z Purton stated that making the Home Turn he had observed GRACIOUS EXPRESS come under pressure and lay out slightly.  He said as a result when his mount had been held up for clear running he endeavoured to improve into a narrow run between SUPERB BOY and GRACIOUS EXPRESS and as a result made contact with GRACIOUS EXPRESS between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  He further stated that near the 300 Metres when GRACIOUS EXPRESS shifted out slightly he then again endeavoured to obtain clear running between SUPERB BOY and GRACIOUS EXPRESS but was prevented from doing so when both runners shifted ground which resulted in his mount being held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and near the 150 Metres when it shifted to the inside of SUPERB BOY.  Whilst the Stewards accepted that Z Purton was riding in a competitive manner, he was asked to exercise more care in similar circumstances and not to attempt to force running for a prolonged distance.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid ARMOUR WAR EAGLE.  Near the 50 Metres shifted in and away from ARMOUR WAR EAGLE and made contact with GRACIOUS EXPRESS.

Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres was bumped on a number of occasions as LIGHT YEARS CHARM endeavoured to obtain clear running to its inside.  Near the 50 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by EVERYONE’S STAR.
Near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from PATCH OF COSMO.
No report.

Near the 150 Metres became held up for clear running behind GRACIOUS EXPRESS and after being shifted to the outside of that runner after the 100 Metres was then checked when ARMOUR WAR EAGLE shifted in abruptly.

Near the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between LIGHT YEARS CHARM which shifted out slightly and made contact with SUPERB BOY and GRACIOUS EXPRESS which, after being initially bumped by EVERYONE’S STAR, was then taken in by that runner when EVERYONE’S STAR shifted in and away from ARMOUR WAR EAGLE when that runner became badly unbalanced.
Jumped only fairly.

Shortly after the start was momentarily crowded by ARMOUR WAR EAGLE which shifted in.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid FIND MY LOVE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1000 Metres was checked to avoid THUNDER BLINK which was taken out by RISING FROM ASHES when that runner was taken out by LIGHT YEARS CHARM (Z Purton).
Crowded near the 1000 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned behind ARMOUR WAR EAGLE and CHAIN OF GOLD.  After the event, B Shinn stated that his mount raced "flat” today.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Held up for a short distance near the 400 Metres.  Lay in over the final 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
In the early stages raced ungenerously and got its head up.  Near the 800 Metres again got its head up when being steadied away from CHANCHENG GLORY.
No report.

Near the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid VOYAGE BUBBLE.  For some distance after the 100 Metres was taken in by GALAXY PATCH (B Shinn) and near the 50 Metres was steadied away to avoid GALAXY PATCH.  B Shinn was reprimanded.
Raced keenly in the middle stages.

After the event, B Avdulla reported that after having a comfortable run in the lead his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On arrival at the Start, it was noted that BUNDLE AWARD had lost its left front plate.  This plate was refitted.  BUNDLE AWARD was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 500 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded between UP WITH CHARM and MIDORI FUJI which shifted out to improve.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When being shifted across behind runners in the early stages, SKY TRUST became unbalanced when it lowered its head.  After the event, H Bowman reported that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions as  SKY TRUST had performed well previously when being ridden in this manner and also in its most recent barrier trial conducted on 3 January 2025.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start.

Jumped only fairly.  When finishing the race off well was steadied approaching the winning post to avoid WINNING WING which shifted in slightly.  When questioned, A Atzeni stated that his mount, which was having its second race start, raced keenly and when positioned to the inside of SEASONS WIT near the 800 Metres, he elected to restrain his mount when SPANISH FLAME was reluctant to hold its position to the inside of SEASONS WIT.

Jumped awkwardly and then bumped with KA YING SUPERB.  From the 400 Metres to the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  Again approaching the 150 Metres became held up for clear running behind KA YING SUPERB which was giving ground and as a result could not be tested until near the 50 Metres.

After the event, C Y Ho stated that the instructions were to find cover on his mount as connections were looking to have the horse to settle with a view to stepping it up in distance for its next race start.  He said in the early stages after being crossed, PACKING POWER did not appreciate racing behind other runners and then in the Home Straight lay in whilst giving ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event, B Avdulla reported that near the 150 Metres his mount shifted out and as a result he was obliged to stop riding and straighten it.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the right side of its barrier.  Sent for sampling post-race.

At declaration time L Ferraris was erroneously declared as the rider of BRAVEHEARTS.  The Stewards acceded to a request by Trainer M Newnham soon after declarations to replace Jockey Ferraris with Jockey M F Poon as Jockey Poon had been engaged to ride the horse.  For this error, Mr Newnham was fined the sum of $5,000.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly.
Shortly after the start was bumped.
No report.

On jumping was bumped on the hindquarters.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, NOBLE PURSUIT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Near the 150 Metres, when giving ground, was bumped by SUPREME AGILITY which shifted out slightly. After the event, J McDonald could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ROMANTIC THOR was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, ROMANTIC THOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  The performance of NATURAL STORM, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, NATURAL STORM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

Bumped near the 600 Metres and was taken wider.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that with his mount down in grade tonight he was instructed to take up a forward position from its wide barrier.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 1000 Metres was bumped by ACCOLADE START which shifted in, resulting in PRIME MORTAR becoming unbalanced.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was crowded by LEAN MASTER which shifted in.  After the event, K C Leung stated that from an outside barrier, when caught wide in the early stages, he elected to continue forward to avoid racing wide.  He said as a result DRACO settled a little more forward than what had been expected.
No report.

On jumping was crowded by PRIME MORTAR which shifted in.  A Badel (ACCOLADE START) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that making the turn near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in and make contact with PRIME MORTAR, resulting in PRIME MORTAR being taken in onto SOLAR UP, resulting in SOLAR UP losing its rightful running and being checked.  A Badel was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 12 February 2025 at Sha Tin.  In addition, Jockey Badel was fined $17,500.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 3 and also considered his very good race riding record.
No report.

A Badel pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference making the turn near the 1000 Metres (see SOLAR UP).  Over the concluding stages lay in, resulting in its rider A Badel having to stop riding and straighten.  As a consequence, ACCOLADE START could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.

In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 800 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from BULB EMPEROR.  Again near the 600 Metres JUDY’S GREAT was steadied to avoid BULB EMPEROR and as a result shifted out and made contact with GOLDEN EMPIRE.  For a short distance near the 100 Metres raced tight when improving between LEAN MASTER and BULB EMPEROR.  After the event, H T Mo reported that his mount made an abnormal respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of ACCOLADE START.

On jumping shifted in and was then bumped by THE DOUBLE EAGLE which shifted out.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 250 Metres was inconvenienced when taken out slightly by ICONICAL which shifted out.   After the event, M Chadwick reported that with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time his mount did not travel well and as a result settled back in the field.  He said in the Home Straight BEAUTY THUNDER finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and making the turn near the 600 Metres lay out and made that turn wider.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
On jumping was bumped by DREAM WINNER which shifted out.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Crowded at the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After being placed into the starting gates reared, was removed and passed suitable to start.  Before being allowed to race again, AURIO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Shifted in abruptly on jumping and was bumped.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running behind HOLMES A COURT.  Leaving the 400 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of HOLMES A COURT to obtain clear running.

When being eased to allow SPEEDY FORTUNE to cross after the 600 Metres commenced to race keenly for some distance thereafter, shifted out and made contact with PHILOS.  Near the 100 Metres A Atzeni dropped his whip.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out after the 600 Metres and was bumped.  Near the 250 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of DAN ATTACK to obtain clear running.
Jumped only fairly.  After the 600 Metres was bumped by DAY DAY VICTORY which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 150 Metres was eased and shifted to the inside of WIND SPEEDER to continue into clear running when WIND SPEEDER shifted in slightly.
Near the 550 Metres was steadied to avoid GORGEOUS VITALITY.

Bumped at the start.  Leaving the 600 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.  Near the 550 Metres was then steadied when crowded between STRIVE FOR GLORY which shifted in and away from DAN ATTACK and PHILOS which was taken out by PLENTIFUL.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that after being crowded leaving the 600 Metres GORGEOUS VITALITY lost momentum and did not finish the race off after that.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was bumped.  After the event, H Bowman stated that he was given no specific instructions.  He said in the early stages when caught wide he elected to continue forward to take up a position outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.  He added that due to the wide barrier and having to make use of his mount to go forward the horse did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <23/1/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>DAN ATTACK, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. DAN ATTACK was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer J Richards this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to ace again, DAN ATTACK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, H T Mo reported that he was given no specific instructions but had expected to race in a more forward position.  He said WOOD ON FIRE failed to show sufficient pace to do so and as a result settled further back than intended.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Slow to begin.  In the early stages raced keenly and leaving the 600 Metres lay out and made contact with GORGEOUS VITALITY.  A short distance later PHILOS was then crowded between GORGEOUS VITALITY and PLENTIFUL which shifted out slightly when being eased to allow SPEEDY FORTUNE to cross.

Near the 500 Metres was eased to avoid PRINCE OF PORTY when PRINCE OF PORTY shifted out to improve.  After the event, M Chadwick reported that his mount failed to travel after crossing HOLMES A COURT in the middle stages and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was checked when crowded between FUN ELITE which was taken out by LADY’S CHOICE and AURIO which shifted in abruptly.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Near the 300 Metres was momentarily crowded between VICTORY SKY and STORMING DRAGON, both of which shifted ground slightly.  After the event, C Y Ho reported that he was not given any specific instructions.  He said when unable to obtain cover INVINCIBLE SHIELD raced very wide and without cover for the  majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of DREAM WINNER which shifted in when giving ground.
No report.

Reared after being placed into the starting gates and struck its head.  Acting on veterinary advice that HALO OF SUCCESS was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  The Stewards ruled that HALO OF SUCCESS will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in a barrier trial and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before allowed to race again.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the final 150 Metres lay out under pressure resulting in its rider M Chadwick having to stop riding and straighten his mount approaching the 50 Metres and again approaching the winning post.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Ove the final 50 Metres raced tight between SPIRIT OF PEACE and HAYDAY, both of which shifted ground.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between HAYDAY and GOLDEN LUCK, both of which shifted ground.
Bumped on the hindquarters at the start.  Near the 100 Metres raced in restricted room between FORTUNE WHISKEY and HAYDAY which shifted out.
Jumped only fairly.  Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid CRYSTAL POWERFUL and shifted out.  Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.

Shifted in at the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  In the early stages over-raced and making the first turn near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied in an attempt to obtain cover.  Near the 300 Metres made contact with SOVEREIGN FUND which shifted out slightly.

Shorty after the start was checked when crowded between GAMEPLAYER ELITE which shifted in slightly and SOVEREIGN FUND which was taken out by SANTORINI when that runner shifted out.  After improving to the inside of SANTORINI approaching the 1000 Metres was then steadied shortly after when SANTORINI was checked.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that after enjoying a comfortable run behind the lead CRYSTAL POWERFUL failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  A short distance later was then steadied when crowded by FORTUNE WHISKEY which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres was checked when crowded between SPIRIT OF PEACE and OUR LUCKY GLORY which shifted out when being steadied away from CRYSTAL POWERFUL when that runner was eased to avoid HAYDAY (M Chadwick) which shifted in when not quite clear.  M Chadwick was advised to exercise more care and to ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  After the event, K Teetan stated that as his mount was having its first race start at Happy Valley he was asked to settle the horse where comfortable and not to make use of it to hold a position.  He said as a result SANTORINI settled in a midfield position in the early stages.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions issued.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 1000 Metres was checked when crowded between GAMEPLAYER ELITE and SANTORINI which shifted out.  Shifted out slightly near the 300 Metres and was bumped.  Over the final 50 Metres could not be ridden out to the finish when improving into a narrow run between CRYSTAL POWERFUL and GAMEPLAYER ELITE which shifted in.
In the early stages raced keenly and making the first turn was taken wider by GAMEPLAYER ELITE.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shortly after the start raced tight between BEAUTY ALLIANCE and HANDSOME BOMB which shifted out slightly.  Shifted out after the 900 Metres and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay out making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and shifted in abruptly, resulting in its rider M L Yeung becoming unbalanced.  When questioned, M L Yeung stated that after responding to his riding in the early part of the Home Straight he felt that his mount became one-paced near the 200 Metres.  He said as a result he elected to change his whip from his left to his right hand but as he did so his whip became caught in his gloves and as a result he had difficulty pulling it through to his right hand for some distance thereafter which prevented him from fully testing his mount through that section of the race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, K De Melo reported that he was instructed to take up a forward position as connections felt that there was a lack of pace in the event.  Assistant Trainer H W Cheung confirmed the instructions issued.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 900 Metres was taken wider by AMAZING AWARD which shifted out to obtain a trailing position behind BEAUTY ALLIANCE.  In this incident, THESIS was bumped by AMAZING AWARD and then raced wide and without cover from that point.

Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.

A Atzeni (BEAUTY DESTINY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of THUNDER PRINCE, resulting in THUNDER PRINCE having to be checked when crowded between BEAUTY DESTINY and SUGAR SUGAR.   A Atzeni was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 5 March 2025 and to expire on Monday, 10 March 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Atzeni was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  THUNDER PRINCE, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley, raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and for some distance approaching the 600 Metres was steadied away from SUGAR SUGAR.  In this incident, THUNDER PRINCE shifted out and made the turn near the 600 Metres wider.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to settle his mount where comfortable, particularly as MULTIDARLING was reported a "roarer”.  He said making the Home Turn his first intention was to follow FLYING PHANTOM into the event but when that runner took a narrow run to the inside of HARRY’S HERO he elected to improve to the inside of FLYING PHANTOM to obtain clear running.  He said after balancing up near the 400 Metres he observed a run commencing to develop between WOODFIRE CHAMP and CALIFORNIA ICON but as he was of the opinion the run had not fully developed he encouraged his mount forward whilst not committing to the run until it had fully developed.  He added after the 200 Metres when he was satisfied the run had fully developed he placed MULTIDARLING under full pressure where it commenced to finish the race off reasonably well.  The Stewards advised Jockey Hewitson that, in their opinion, in the early part of the Home Straight there was an opportunity to encourage his mount to improve to be racing closer behind WOODFIRE CHAMP which would allow him the opportunity to immediately take advantage of the run when it presented.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in to ascertain whether SHINY RAPIDASH had been denied a fair start.  After taking evidence from Jockey A Atzeni and Starter, Mr A Speechley, the Stewards found that SHINY RAPIDASH had been fractious prior to the start being effected.  They further established that as the start was effected SHINY RAPIDASH turned its head across the inside barrier partition and as a result was slow to begin.  As the Stewards were satisfied that this incident occurred simultaneously to the start being effected the horse was declared a starter.  The Stewards ruled that SHINY RAPIDASH will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in consecutive barrier trials in Hong Kong before being allowed to race again.

The Stewards conducted an inquiry into the reason for FAST RESPONDER being able to improve to the outside of CHEVAL VALIANT near the 350 Metres when CHEVAL VALIANT shifted in and away from the outside rail.  Evidence was taken from Trainer D J Whyte, H Bentley, rider of CHEVAL VALIANT, and Apprentice P N Wong, rider of FAST RESPONDER.  Jockey Bentley stated that his instructions were to hold the lead and to carry his whip in his right hand as CHEVAL VALIANT has a tendency to lay in in its races.  He stated that when he first asked CHEVAL VALIANT to improve from the 600 Metres it commenced to lay in and for this reason approaching the 450 Metres he took his hand from his left rein to regather his mount and attempt to straighten it.  He said at the same time he shifted his weight in the saddle towards the outside to further prevent CHEVAL VALIANT from shifting in.  When questioned regarding his left arm extending out and away from CHEVAL VALIANT, Jockey Bentley stated that it was a common trait in his riding that his left arm would extend away from his horse when performing similar actions.  Apprentice Wong confirmed that she was given no instruction in relation to the positioning of CHEVAL VALIANT, however, she was aware that having previously ridden the horse before that CHEVAL VALIANT does have a tendency to lay in in its races and potentially a run may become available on the stand rail.  After considering all the evidence, the Stewards were satisfied that CHEVAL VALIANT had shifted in due to its own racing manners and that Jockey Bentley had endeavoured to prevent his mount from shifting in but was unable to do so which resulted in FAST RESPONDER obtaining a clear run to its outside.

Jumped only fairly.  Shortly after the start raced in restricted room between SPARKLING FELLOW and SKY CAP which shifted out.  When questioned, M Chadwick stated that after following SPARKLING FELLOW into the race from the 300 Metres he became held up when positioned behind that runner.  He said he initially contemplated shifting to the inside of CRIMSON FLASH to obtain clear running but was prevented from doing so due to AWESOME TREASURE being positioned to his inside.  He said as a result he elected to follow SPARKLING FELLOW into the event but when that runner did not continue to improve he became badly held up behind SPARKLING FELLOW over the final 200 Metres and as a consequence could not ride his mount out to the finish of the event.
