A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, A Atzeni reported that after commencing well GRAND NOVA was unable to obtain cover in the early stages and as a result did not finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was found to be lame in its left front leg on arrival at the Start.  Acting on veterinary advice that SILK ROAD GLORY was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, SILK ROAD GLORY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  In the early stages raced keenly and got its head up when being shifted across behind runners from a wide barrier.

After the event, A Hamelin advised that his instructions were to settle his mount where comfortable.  He said MUST GO commenced well and he allowed it to stride forward in the early stages to avoid racing wide.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 100 Metres obtained a narrow run between MUST GO and YOUNG BRILLIANT when there was doubtful room and as a result made contact with YOUNG BRILLIANT shortly after.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Near the 100 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.

After the event, K C Leung reported that his mount travelled comfortably with the pace of the race being run inside of standard time throughout the early and middle stages.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight SUPER UNICORN initially responded to his riding before becoming one-paced over the final 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Near the 150 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned to the inside of SUPER UNICORN.
No report.
No report.

Making the first turn near the 1500 Metres was steadied to avoid GLORIOUS SUCCESS which made the turn awkwardly and shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Shortly afterwards was steadied when crowded between WONDERSTAR and SWAGGER BRO, both of which shifted ground.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 100 Metres was eased to avoid THE BOOM BOX which shifted in.

Near the 150 Metres was crowded for room between CHATEAUNEUF and FRANCIS MEYNELL (M Chadwick) which shifted out.  As a result, AERIS NOVA could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.  M Chadwick was advised to exercise more care.
Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 350 Metres.
Bumped on the hindquarters at the start and became unbalanced.  Near the 100 Metres was bumped.

From the 400 Metres until the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.  After the 100 Metres endeavoured to obtain a tight run between ENDUED and GIANT LEAP which shifted out after making contact with KARATE EXPRESS.  As a result, LIFELINE EXPRESS raced tight for some distance thereafter.
On jumping was bumped heavily by MATTERS MOST, resulting in ENDUED shifting in, making contact with GIANT LEAP and having to be checked.  For some distance near the 100 Metres was bumped.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped heavily.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between MATTERS MOST and AERIS NOVA which shifted in and away from CHATEAUNEUF (Z Purton) when that runner shifted in.   Z Purton was advised to exercise more care.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and blundered shortly after the start.  After the 200 Metres became held up for clear running between FLYING ROMANTIC and FALCON COURT.  Near the 100 Metres improved into a tight run between those two runners and as a result made contact with FALCON COURT before securing clear running shortly afterwards.  M Chadwick was advised to ensure that there is sufficient room when improving into runs.  Shifted out over the concluding stages and became unbalanced when it made contact with FALCON COURT.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages shifted in and made contact with FALCON COURT approaching the winning post.

Jumped only fairly.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration as to whether there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection on behalf of FALCON COURT.  After viewing the patrol films, the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds for a protest/objection due to FALCON COURT being crowded over the concluding stages as WIND SPEEDER and HO HO STAR were shifting ground and FALCON COURT was shifting ground also.  When no protest/objection was lodged by connections, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Near the 100 Metres became unbalanced when bumped on the hindquarters by HO HO STAR. Briefly held up near the 300 Metres. Over the concluding stages shifted out and away from HO HO STAR and as a result approaching the winning post made contact with WIND SPEEDER (M L Yeung) which shifted in and shortly afterwards was crowded between WIND SPEEDER and HO HO STAR (M Chadwick) when that runner shifted out and away from FLYING ROMANTIC.  B Thompson, M L Yeung and M Chadwick were advised to exercise more care.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded by WIND SPEEDER which shifted in slightly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

For a short distance near the 100 Metres H Bowman had his whip caught behind the leg of H Bentley, the rider of WINNING HEART.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. Unable to be ridden out over the concluding stages when positioned behind WIND SPEEDER.

After the event, H Bentley reported that he was obliged to make some use of his mount in the early stages and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when placed in restricted room between SPEEDY SMARTIE and THE CONCENTRATION which shifted in.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  After the 100 Metres was steadied when crowded by THE CONCENTRATION (J Melham) which shifted in.  J Melham was reprimanded.

After the event, Z Purton stated that after obtaining a position outside the lead in the early stages STERLING WONGCHOY finished the race off only fairly.  He added that, in his opinion, STERLING WONGCHOY is still somewhat immature.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, C Y Ho reported that after settling back in the field his mount found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight, particularly under its top weight of 134 lbs.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Held up for clear running for a short distance approaching the 300 Metres.  Shifted out approaching the 50 Metres and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind CLUB ACE.
Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 150 Metres was shifted to the inside of MASTER PHOENIX to obtain clear running.

Bumped on two occasions shortly after the start.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed that the instructions from a wide barrier were to ride ISLAND BREEZES conservatively in the early stages and to ensure that the horse obtained cover.

Had its right hind plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Approaching the 50 Metres was bumped by MASTER PHOENIX which shifted out to improve.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded by HAPPY TANGO which shifted out slightly.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when positioned close to CLUB ACE.  After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount raced greenly throughout the event and making the first turn near the 800 Metres shifted out and blundered when positioned close to the heels of ISLAND BREEZES.
Shortly after the start shifted in slightly and bumped ISLAND BREEZES and soon after bumped with ISLAND BREEZES again.

Shortly after the start shifted out and bumped with SAVVY TWINKLE.  Approaching the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running and near the 200 Metres was eased when momentarily crowded between PANDA and BLAZING BEAM which shifted in slightly.  Over the concluding stages had some difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned close to BLAZING BEAM.
Jumped only fairly.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, K C Leung reported that it was not his intention to lead the event but was obliged to continue forward in the early stages to avoid racing wide.  He added in the Home Straight SAVVY TWINKLE gave ground when placed under pressure.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong reported that HAPPY TANGO made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

MULTISUPER, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 30.1.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore).  Before being allowed to race again, MULTISUPER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was bumped by D STAR which shifted in slightly.  For a short distance near the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Lay in over the concluding stages.  After the event, K Teetan stated that his instructions were to take up a more forward position than its most recent start.  He said after commencing well SUNDAY’S SERENADE was able to hold a position behind the lead.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions on the basis that there did not appear to be strong pace in the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

When the pace steadied near the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from SILVER UP.  For a short distance after the 400 Metres was held up for clear running.  Near the 100 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between ORIENTAL SMOKE and SUNDAY’S SERENADE which lay in.  As a result, SWEET SMILE was held up for clear running between the 100 Metres and the 50 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped only fairly.  K C Leung (ONLY U) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he shifted ONLY U to the inside of SILVER UP where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in ONLY U shifting in and crowding the running of FOREVER FOLKS which was checked and lost its rightful running.   K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 19 February 2025 and to expire on Monday, 24 February 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Leung was fined $110,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very poor race riding record.
Raced keenly in the middle stages and after the 900 Metres was steadied away from SUNDAY’S SERENADE.

Jumped only fairly.  Held up for clear running behind SILVER UP near the 400 Metres.  A short distance later was shifted to the inside of SILVER UP when there was not sufficient room and was checked.  K C Leung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 300 Metres (see FOREVER FOLKS).

Lay in when under pressure in the Home Straight.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that his instructions were to hold a more forward position but despite riding his mount along in the early stages it failed to show sufficient pace to do so.
No report.

Kicked a rail in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  When giving ground in the Home Straight lay in.  After the event, L Ferraris could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied when crowded between CIRCUIT MIGHTY and SUNSTRIDER (H Bowman) which shifted out to improve.  H Bowman was severely reprimanded.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 28.1.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left eye injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter JUMBO FORTUNE.  Before being allowed to race again, FLAGSHIP WARRIOR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that his mount settled slightly further back in the field than anticipated and in the Home Straight finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For a short distance after the 400 Metres was held up for clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Approaching the 100 Metres was steadied when crowded between STUNNING PEACH and FIVE G PATCH (B Avdulla) which shifted out to improve.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between ENCOUNTERED and HAPPY TOGETHER (A Badel) which shifted in and away from ENSUED.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 100 Metres raced tight between DROMBEG BANNER and AURORA LADY which shifted in and away from HEALTHY HAPPY.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A Badel was warned in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle on two occasions near the 50 Metres.
Bumped on jumping.
In the early stages raced ungenerously when being shifted behind TOURBILLON PRINCE to obtain cover.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Over the concluding stages raced tight between YOUNG CHAMPION and MR ASCENDENCY which shifted out slightly.

After the event, J Melham reported that her mount failed to run out the 1400 Metres of today’s event, particularly in the circumstances where the early stages of the race were run inside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have an epiglottic entrapment. <3/2/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>AURORA LADY, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse was found to have an epiglottic entrapment. AURORA LADY was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P C Ng last Saturday morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, AURORA LADY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
On jumping was crowded between HEALTHY HAPPY and GREEN N WHITE which shifted out.
Shortly after the start was eased when crowded between ARDEN and VIEW ALL THINGS which got its head up and shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
Crowded at the start.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded by DRAGON SUNRISE which shifted in.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when held up for clear running between INVINCIBLE LUCKY and KING OBERON.

After the event, B Avdulla advised that he was given no specific instructions.  He said when his mount jumped awkwardly and was positioned to the outside of DRAGON SUNRISE when that horse lost ground due to its rider losing his iron, he was obliged to steady INVINCIBLE LUCKY to shift in behind DRAGON SUNRISE which resulted in his mount settling towards the rear of the field.
Bumped on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start got its head up, shifted in and was bumped.  Near the 450 Metres was taken wider by YEE CHEONG GLORY when that runner shifted out to improve.

ARDEN, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, raced ungenerously and near the 1000 Metres became unbalanced when being steadied to allow VIEW ALL THINGS to cross.  ARDEN continued to race ungenerously for some distance thereafter.
No report.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  On jumping the right iron used by L Hewitson became detached from the saddle which resulted in Jockey Hewitson completing the course without the use of his irons and DRAGON SUNRISE taking no competitive part in the event.  After inspecting Jockey Hewitson’s gear after the race, it was identified that the buckle had come loose more than likely due to DRAGON SUNRISE making contact with SUNNY Q at the start.  The inspection of the gear also identified that it was in good condition.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, B Shinn stated that he was given no specific instructions as to where to settle his mount other than to find a position where DIVANO was comfortable.  He said from the outside barrier when the pace in the early stages was run inside of standard time he elected to allow DIVANO to settle in a position behind midfield.  He said when the pace of the race continued to be run inside of standard time he then positioned DIVANO behind JOHANNES BRAHMS but was of the opinion he would have had to make some use of his mount to hold a position behind that runner and for this reason he elected to allow DIVANO to settle at the rear of the field where it was comfortable.  He added making the Home Turn he elected to improve to the inside of MICKLEY to save ground where he then encouraged his mount to improve into the event in the early part of the Home Straight.  He said for some distance near the 300 Metres he was not able to fully test DIVANO as he was waiting for a run to fully develop between TOP GUN and CALL ME GLORIOUS.  He said when that run developed near the 250 Metres he was able to place DIVANO under full pressure whereby his mount finished the race off well.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the manner in which DIVANO was ridden.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Shinn were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 100 Metres was bumped by PACKING HERMOD which shifted out slightly.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  K C Leung (MARKWIN) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 350 Metres he directed his mount  to the inside of CAP FERRAT where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in MARKWIN making heavy contact with MICKLEY between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres and resulting in MICKLEY and MARKWIN becoming badly unbalanced between that distance as a result of the contact.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 5 March 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 13 March 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 1 and also considered his very poor race riding record.
No report.
No report.
In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid LUCKY GOLD.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 300 Metres when placed under full pressure shifted in towards the running rail and became badly unbalanced.  A short distance later again shifted in and struck the running rail.  SKY DEEP then continued to race greenly to the finish of the event.  Having regard to the horse’s previous racing manners, the Stewards determined that SKY DEEP must barrier trial satisfactorily on consecutive occasions in Hong Kong from an inside barrier where it will be required to be ridden out in the Home Straight before being permitted to race again.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Y L Chung (LUCKY BLESSING) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of ATOMIC BEAUTY, resulting in ATOMIC BEAUTY being taken in onto PHOENIX LIGHT which was checked and lost its rightful running and also resulting in LUCKY GOLD which was racing to the inside of PHOENIX LIGHT being crowded for room.  Y L Chung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 23 February 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

Shifted in abruptly at the start and was bumped.  Y L Chung (LUCKY BLESSING) pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see PHOENIX LIGHT).  Near the 300 Metres was hampered when taken out by SKY DEEP.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection against SKY DEEP.  Having regard to the beaten margin between the two horses and the manner in which they finished the race off, the Stewards declined to lodge a protest/objection on behalf of LUCKY BLESSING and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.

Steadied near the 900 Metres when crowded.  Near the 500 Metres lay out slightly and then was steadied when momentarily crowded by CHARMING BABE (K Teetan) which lay in when racing to the inside of HARMONY N HOME.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied to avoid BRILLIANT EXPRESS (H Bowman) which shifted in.  H Bowman was reprimanded.
Bumped at the start.

On jumping bounded and lost ground.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid BRILLIANT EXPRESS.  Over the final 100 Metres could not be fully ridden out to the finish when it improved behind SKY DEEP.
In the early stages was shifted across behind runners.  Near the 100 Metres was taken out slightly by LUCY IN THE SKY which shifted out slightly when giving ground.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  K C Leung (MARKWIN) was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres (see MICKLEY).  Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres was buffeted for room and held up for clear running when it endeavoured to improve between MICKLEY and CAP FERRAT when there was not sufficient room to do so.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, MARKWIN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, C Y Ho stated that his mount was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover for the majority of the race and as a result finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping shifted out and made contact with PACKING HERMOD.

Near the 250 Metres M Barzalona dropped his whip.  After the event, M Barzalona advised that after improving to the outside on straightening his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 1000 Metres was taken wider.

Near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid FLYING AKEED.  Near the 650 Metres was steadied away from LESLIE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a laceration to the right hind leg.
Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when positioned tight to the inside of LUCKY BLESSING which shifted in slightly.

After the event, Z Purton stated that, in his opinion, ATOMIC BEAUTY is better suited racing at the Happy Valley circuit.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

On jumping was bumped by LUCKY BLESSING which shifted in abruptly, resulting in FLYING AKEED becoming unbalanced.  In the early stages raced keenly and leaving the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from LESLIE for some distance.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position and lead if his mount was able to do so comfortably.  He said in the early stages SKY HEART did not travel strongly when positioned towards the rail and as a result did not show early pace to hold the front.  He said when NEW FUTURE FOLKS was positioned wider on the track and in advance of him, he did not contest the lead and allowed NEW FUTURE FOLKS to cross as he would have had to make use of his mount to prevent that runner from shifting in.  He added that his decision to do so was also influenced by the fact that he felt at the horse’s most recent start it had lacked concentration when it was in the lead in the Home Straight.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions were to hold a more forward position as the connections were of the opinion that it was an advantage to race on pace today.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from LEGEND ST PAUL’S.
No report.
After passing the winning post went amiss when it sustained an injury to the left shoulder, resulting in its rider L Ferraris dismounting a short distance later.  Samples were taken from the horse.
No report.

In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 800 Metres was steadied away from SKY HEART.  Over the final 450 Metres was held up for clear running behind HUGE WAVE and as a result could not be tested in the Home Straight.  When questioned regarding his riding, K C Leung stated that the instructions were to find cover behind the expected leader SKY HEART.  He said as a consequence he allowed that runner to cross him in the early stages.  He said when SKY HEART was then crossed by NEW FUTURE FOLKS, his mount was obliged to settle further back in the field than what had been intended.  Trainer F C Lor confirmed the instructions issued.
Over the final 150 Metres was held up for clear running behind EMBRACES and as a result could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.
No report.

Raced keenly in the early stages.  After the event, M F Poon advised that the instructions were to hold a more forward position but after commencing only fairly and then racing tight to the inside of PACKING TURBINE which shifted in shortly after the start, his mount settled further back than intended.
Was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping was bumped by ANOTHER ZONDA which shifted in.  Near the 100 Metres was shifted to the outside of LO PAN SPIRIT to continue into clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 350 Metres was eased when momentarily crowded by YOUNG SUPERSTAR which shifted in when commencing to give ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Knuckled over on jumping and became unbalanced.  After improving to the inside of OFFROAD MASTER near the 1000 Metres then got its head up when being steadied a short distance later when OFFROAD MASTER (M Chadwick) commenced to shift in slightly.  M Chadwick was advised to exercise more care.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with LO PAN SPIRIT, became unbalanced and lost ground.

Near the 300 Metres became unbalanced when improving into a narrow run between KING MILES and ANOTHER ZONDA.  In this incident, PACKING POWER made contact with ANOTHER ZONDA and then lay in for the remainder of the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on PACKING POWER at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING POWER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Had difficulty obtaining clear running for a short distance approaching the 300 Metres.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Bumped near the 300 Metres.

After the event, C Y Ho reported that his mount raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and he was not too disappointed with the horse’s performance in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

YOUNG SUPERSTAR, which was fractious in the barrier, jumped awkwardly.  After the event, Y L Chung stated that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead and as a result did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bounded on jumping and lost ground.  Near the 250 Metres was disappointed for clear running between OFFROAD MASTER and MID WINTER WIND which shifted in slightly.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead and as a result did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, K Teetan stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position.  He said as a result from the outside barrier he encouraged his mount forward in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  He said after travelling a short distance his mount commenced to race keenly which resulted in it racing wide and without cover outside the lead for the majority of the event where it continued to race keenly.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1500 Metres was bumped by SMASHING EXPRESS which shifted in.  Briefly held up for clear running after the 400 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 1400 Metres shifted out when being corrected by its rider K Teetan, resulting in SUPERB MOVE then racing wide and without cover until near the 1200 Metres.
Shifted in near the 1500 Metres and was bumped.  After the 100 Metres was steadied to avoid PODIUM (M F Poon) which shifted in when not quite clear.  M F Poon was advised to exercise more care.

After the event, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to obtain cover as SUPER BABY had been racing out of form when it led its last two starts.  He added when the pace of the event increased approaching the 500 Metres when RUNNING AHEAD moved forward, SUPER BABY was not suited by having to be ridden along at that stage.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start raced in restricted room between SUPERB MOVE and PARTY WARRIOR.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of A Badel, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.
When caught wide in the early stages was allowed to stride forward and obtain a position outside the lead near the 950 Metres.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Shifted in near the 200 Metres and was bumped.  When questioned regarding his riding from the 700 Metres when he commenced a forward move, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said after following SMASHING EXPRESS near the 700 Metres RUNNING AHEAD commenced to race keenly which resulted in him having to shift out and away from SMASHING EXPRESS.  He said as he did so RUNNING AHEAD continued to race keenly which resulted in him commencing a forward move shortly after.  He added as he approached RED MAVERICK to his inside near the 600 Metres, that runner shifted out, resulting in  RUNNING AHEAD being obliged to race four wide and without cover thereafter when his mount did not show enough speed to cross that runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, RUNNING AHEAD will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <6/2/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>RUNNING AHEAD, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse was found to have bled from both nostrils. RUNNING AHEAD was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer T P Yung this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, RUNNING AHEAD will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

After the event, K H Chan stated that his mount would be better suited by being ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, YOU’REMYEVERYTHING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.

Jumped only fairly.  Shifted out near the 600 Metres to commence a forward move and raced wide and without cover thereafter.  Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight and near the 200 Metres was bumped by RUNNING AHEAD which shifted in slightly.
Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded between SOLID WIN and TAMRA BLITZ which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied to avoid SOLID CAR.  Between the 350 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of PACKING ANGEL.
Bumped at the start.  Raced keenly in the early stages and near the 1200 Metres was steadied away from ANOTHER WORLD.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 600 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from LUCKY COMBINATION.
After the event, B Avdulla confirmed the instructions were to hold an on-pace position.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover back in the field and as a result did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Over the final 100 Metres was held up for clear running and as a result could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.

When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions from a wide barrier were to endeavour to obtain a position with cover behind midfield.  He said KAHOLO ANGEL jumped well today and he then immediately endeavoured to comply with his instructions to obtain cover.  He said as he did so in the early stages KAHOLO ANGEL raced too keenly and when left racing wide he elected to allow KAHOLO ANGEL to stride forward where it was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The Stewards inquired into the reason for J Melham being declared as the rider of LUCKY COMBINATION when she was unable to fulfil that engagement due to travel commitments.  As such permission was given for A Badel to be substituted as the rider of LUCKY COMBINATION.  After interviewing Jockey Melham and Trainer F C Lor, they were both advised that they should make all proper enquiries to ensure that the engagements are able to be fulfilled.  On jumping made contact with the right side of its barrier and shortly after shifted in and bumped THE ABSOLUTE.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start and bumped HAYDAY.

Jumped only fairly.  After the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid INNO CENTURY when that runner shifted out after being awkwardly placed close to HAYDAY which gave ground after being crossed by SPICY KNUCKLES.
On jumping shifted in slightly and bumped SOLAR RIVER.
After the 700 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from HAYDAY.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  After the 200 Metres C L Chau dropped his left rein for a number of strides.  After the event, C L Chau reported that from his wide barrier he was obliged to race wide and without cover in the early stages.  He said as a result after the 800 Metres he allowed his mount to stride forward to race outside the leader to avoid having to race wide.  He added as a consequence SOLAR RIVER was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

After the event, L Ferraris reported that his intention was to lead but when SPICY KNUCKLES and SOLAR RIVER went forward in the early stages he was obliged to allow those runners to cross when the pace of the event was being run inside of standard time.  He added as a result COLONEL did not finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight and he was of the opinion that COLONEL races best when being able to dictate the lead.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the advice of Jockey Ferraris.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that his instructions were to go forward and lead if the pace was not too strong.  He said in the early stages when caught wide SPICY KNUCKLES raced keenly and as a result he elected to continue forward to cross runners to his inside to avoid racing wide.
Bumped at the start.  Making the first turn after the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied to allow MEGA BONUS to cross.  Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance near the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.  When placed under pressure thereafter lay in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind GLORY B.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that his instructions from a wide barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He added he was given no specific instructions thereafter as to where to position SKY JEWELLERY.  He said as a result from a wide barrier he elected to settle SKY JEWELLERY towards the back of the field in the early stages in accordance with his instructions.  He said from the 600 Metres his intention was to improve to the outside of COSMO NAVIGATOR to follow PRIME MORTAR with the view to shifting to PRIME MORTAR’S outside in the Home Straight, to ensure his mount was given clear and uninterrupted running.  He said as he commenced to shift out from the 500 Metres PRIME MORTAR which had raced very wide and without cover commenced to give ground which resulted in SKY JEWELLERY then being positioned to the inside of PRIME MORTAR making the Home turn and unable to shift to that runner’s outside.  Jockey Bowman added that on straightening he then attempted to obtain clear running between GOOD PROSPECT and GREAT SPIRIT, however, when GOOD PROSPECT shifted out he was then obliged to shift to that runner’s inside where he was able to commence to ride his mount along.  He said after the 250 Metres SKY JEWELLERY then became badly held up behind TAIHANG SCENERY and as a result did not obtain clear running until after the 100 Metres where it ran home strongly.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to shift out near the 500 Metres to follow PRIME MORTAR before that runner commenced to give ground, Jockey Bowman stated that having regard to his mount being inexperienced and carrying top weight of 135 lbs, he was reluctant to do so.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards advised Jockey Bowman that, in their opinion, leaving the 500 Metres he would have been advantaged by immediately shifting to the outside of COSMO NAVIGATOR to follow PRIME MORTAR which would have prevented SKY JEWELLERY from improving to the inside of PRIME MORTAR and providing clear running in the Home Straight.  However, the Stewards were not of the view that his riding after the 500 Metres was unreasonable having regard to the explanation that he provided.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was eased when taken out by SUPER CHARIZZARD.  THE PRIME was then shifted across behind runners from its wide barrier in the early stages.
Raced wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.

When questioned regarding his riding, L Ferraris stated that his instructions were to take up a position outside the expected leader MEGA BONUS.  He said in the early stages he was obliged to make some use of SUPER CHARIZZARD to cross runners to his inside and as a result SUPER CHARIZZARD was positioned slightly in advance of MEGA BONUS when he obtained a position outside the lead near the 800 Metres.  He said as he was positioned slightly in advance of MEGA BONUS he elected to allow SUPER CHARIZZARD to continue forward to cross that runner as he felt it would be a disadvantage to remain racing slightly in advance of MEGA BONUS.  He said after crossing MEGA BONUS he then encouraged his mount to improve from that point and after initially responding gave ground in the Home  Straight.  After considering his explanation, Jockey Ferraris was advised that, in the opinion of the Stewards, his best option would have been to remain racing to the outside of MEGA BONUS and secondly that once he allowed SUPER CHARIZZARD to stride forward of that runner, he should have provided his mount with the opportunity to travel comfortably at that stage rather than continuing to urge his mount forward.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.

Bumped at the start.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 1000 Metres got its head up when racing in restricted room between COSMO NAVIGATOR and GLORY B which shifted out slightly.  After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and refused to settle.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight TAIHANG SCENERY hung in and did not finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.

After the event, Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to go forward but his mount did not show sufficient pace to cross runners to his inside.  He said as a consequence PRIME MORTAR raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 200 Metres raced in restricted room between FLAMINGO TRILLION and HELENE FEELING for a short distance.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the middle stages and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve forward to the outside of RED HARE KING to prevent that runner taking him wider, H Bentley stated that as his mount was coming back slightly in distance and races best when able to build momentum, he was reluctant to encourage his mount forward approaching the 1000 Metres to race in advance of RED HARE KING.  He said the decision not to do so was also influenced by the fact that HELENE FEELING was up in weight tonight carrying 133 lbs and he felt the most important factor when riding the horse was to ensure that it travelled comfortably and was able to build momentum into the race.  He said for this reason making the turn near the 1000 Metres HELENE FEELING was taken wider by RED HARE KING and when SENOR TOBA then improved to the inside of RED HARE KING, his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.
No report.
No report.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions and stated that he issued such instructions as MOMENTS IN TIME had raced too keenly at its last start and had performed well when ridden in a conservative manner on 4 December 2024.  Both Mr Shum and Jockey Purton advised that MOMENTS IN TIME was disadvantaged by settling back in the field when the early stages of the race was run outside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that his mount enjoyed a comfortable run during the race but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <6/2/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>RED HARE KING, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. RED HARE KING was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer A S Cruz this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, RED HARE KING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly and then was slightly crowded by TELECOM FIGHTERS which shifted out.  After the event, C Y Ho could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  Trainer C Fownes stated that the horse had pleased him leading into tonight’s race but could offer no explanation for the performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
M F Poon pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the concluding stages (see CIRCUIT DUFFY).  Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event, Z Purton confirmed that from a wide barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 250 Metres improved into a narrow run between BULB EMPEROR and ROARING BEBE and as a result made contact with ROARING BEBE.  Over the final 100 Metres was taken in by FORTUNE WHISKEY.

Bumped on jumping.  Near the 250 Metres was hampered when taken in by CIRCUIT DUFFY.  Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of GALVANIC when that runner was taken in by FORTUNE WHISKEY.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Near the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between IRON LEGION and SWEET DIAMOND which was taken in by CIRCUIT DUFFY.

On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by TOGEPI which shifted out.  Approaching the 1000 Metres was bumped by ROARING BEBE which shifted in.  KA YING POWER then raced keenly for some distance thereafter.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.  Approaching the 200 Metres again became held up for clear running behind SWEET DIAMOND and as a consequence was unable to be ridden out over the final 200 Metres.

M F Poon (FORTUNE WHISKEY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift in when  not clear of GALVANIC, resulting in GALVANIC being taken in across the rightful running of CIRCUIT DUFFY, resulting in CIRCUIT DUFFY having to be steadied to avoid GALVANIC.  M F Poon was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 5 March 2025 and to expire on Monday, 10 March 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly, shifted in and made contact with SWEET DIAMOND.  Approaching the 1000 Metres shifted in and was bumped.  Bumped near the 250 Metres. <6/2/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>The Veterinary Officer reported that ROARING BEBE was lame in its right front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, ROARING BEBE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages and for a short distance soon after the start raced tight between IRON LEGION and FORTUNE WHISKEY.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, Y L Chung reported that his instructions were to take up a forward position.  Trainer A S Cruz confirmed the instructions and stated that he issued similar instructions at the horse’s first start when it settled further back after commencing only fairly.

Withdrawn on 4.2.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (right front tendon injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter KA YING POWER.  Before being allowed to race again, POLARIS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  For some distance after the 150 Metres raced in restricted room between NORTHERN BEAST and DRAGON STAR when improving between those two runners.
Shortly after the start raced tight to the outside of KINGLY DEMEANOR which shifted out.
No report.
No report.
No report.
No report.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early part of the Home Straight lay in when being shifted to the outside.  After the event, C Y Ho reported that his mount was disadvantaged when the pace steadied in the middle stages and as a result found it difficult to run on in the Home Straight from back in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Approaching the 1400 Metres was steadied to avoid DRAGON STAR (C L Chau) when that runner shifted in when not quite clear.  C L Chau will be advised to exercise more care.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and lost ground.  Shortly after the start raced in restricted room between DRAGON DELIGHT and AMAZING AWARD which shifted out.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that his mount did not travel well at any stage and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  He added that in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with the run, particularly as TAKE ACTION was not beaten too far from the placegetters.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Noted to have sustained a cut to the left hind leg after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the Home Straight hung in and proved difficult to ride out.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that with the pace of the event being run outside of standard time, near the 750 Metres his mount commenced to race keenly and was awkwardly placed close to the heels of I CAN.  He said as a result he was obliged to shift to the outside of I CAN which resulted in IVY LEAGUE racing wide and without cover thereafter. He added over the final 200 Metres he could not fully test his mount when he was obliged to correct IVY LEAGUE to prevent it from shifting in.  A warning was placed on the racing manners of IVY LEAGUE.
Noted to have lost its right hind plate after the race.

When questioned, Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to find cover as the horse races best in this position.  He said as a result in the early stages he allowed SOLEIL FIGHTER to cross LOVERO in order to comply with his instructions.

Slow to begin.  Near the 200 Metres was checked when crowded between I CAN which was taken in by IVY LEAGUE when that runner hung in despite the efforts of its rider and DEFINITIVE which, after shifting out and away from LOVERO (Y L Chung), was then taken out by that runner.  Y L Chung was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with GLORIOUS JOURNEY.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of H Bowman, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped by DEFINITIVE which shifted in.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.
Bumped on jumping.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Passing the 200  Metres Apprentice E C W Wong dropped his whip.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 600 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from VON BAER.
Shifted in shortly after the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Over the final 100 Metres lay out under pressure.
Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between RED ELEGANCE and FUN ELITE.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was shifted to the outside of ETERNAL FORTUNE to obtain clear running.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
After the 200 Metres was bumped by CHEVAL VALIANT which shifted in.
Approaching the 200 Metres was bumped and taken wider by EASON.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of SUPER JOY N FUN to obtain clear running and as a result made contact with GALLANT VALOUR.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.  Leaving the 500 Metres was taken wider by HAROLD WIN.

Slow to begin.  Leaving  the 500 Metres was steadied away from KYRUS DRAGON.  Approaching the 150 Metres raced tight to the inside of KYRUS DRAGON.  Was then briefly held up for clear running behind HAPPY FAT CAT approaching the 100 Metres before shifting to that runner’s inside to secure clear running.

When the pace steadied leaving the 500 Metres commenced to race keenly and was checked away from HAPPY FAT CAT.  A Hamelin (HAPPY FAT CAT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift out whilst riding it along, contributing to GUSTOSISIMO being badly crowded for room and losing its rightful running.   A Hamelin was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 23 February 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2, also considered his very good race riding record and the contribution from SUPER JOY N FUN shifting in.  C L Chau (SUPER JOY N FUN) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift in whilst riding it along, contributing to GUSTOSISIMO being badly crowded for room and losing its rightful running.   C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 5 March 2025 and to expire on Monday, 10 March 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2, also considered his very poor race riding record and the contribution from HAPPY FAT CAT shifting out.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was bumped.  Near the 200 Metres lay in and was bumped.  After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount is better suited racing at Sha Tin down the Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was crowded between CHEVAL VALIANT and YOUTHFUL SPIRITS which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider L Ferraris.
No report.
A Badel was fined a sum of $5,000 for using the whip on his mount when it was out of contention and not responding to his whip use.
Leaving the 500 Metres was steadied away from GUSTOSISIMO.  Over the final 200 Metres was unable to obtain clear running when positioned behind and to the inside of GUSTOSISIMO.

Raced keenly when being shifted in to obtain cover in the  middle stages.  After the event, Z Purton stated that he was given on specific instructions but from a wide barrier he was obliged to settle slightly back in the field to obtain cover behind WINGS OF WAR.  He added that, in his opinion, VIEW OF THE WORLD was not suited by the backing up from its last start on 22 January 2025 and performs best when its runs are spaced.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Leaving the 500 Metres was hampered when GUSTOSISIMO shifted out.  Between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres raced in restricted room between SUPER JOY N FUN and GUSTOSISIMO which shifted out to improve.

After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover for the  majority of the event and as a result did not run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

No report.

In the middle stages raced keenly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  For some distance after the 200 Metres then raced in restricted room between JOYFUL LIFE and LAPRAS which shifted out slightly.  When questioned, Apprentice P N Wong stated that from the outside barrier her instructions were to ride her mount with cover in the early stages.  She said after commencing awkwardly SO AWESOME was shifted across behind runners in the early stages when positioned at the rear of the field.  Assistant Trainer W H Ip representing Trainer K L Man confirmed the instructions were to obtain cover but advised that SO AWESOME settled further back in the field than expected when it commenced awkwardly.  Noted to have blood in the mouth after the race.

Near the 1000 Metres raced in restricted room between LUCKY MAN which was racing tight to the inside of JOYFUL LIFE and GO HERO which shifted out slightly.  Near the 50 Metres was bumped by CALIFORNIA ICON which shifted out.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed that from a wide barrier the instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 1200 Metres got its head up and refused to settle. Held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 250 Metres.  Again approaching the 150 Metres was held up for clear running behind FUN TOGETHER for some distance.

Lay in in the Home Straight and between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when held up for clear running behind KA YING SUPERB.

Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the early stages and near the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid GALE SAGA.

On jumping bumped with LITTLE SQUID and blundered shortly after.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

No report.
Made contact with a running rail on the way to the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

On jumping blundered badly, became unbalanced and lost ground.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  Near the 400 Metres raced greenly when racing in restricted room between KING ALLOY and DO YOUR PART.

On jumping was crowded between SUMMIT CHEERS and DIVINE MOONLIGHT which shifted in.  After the event, C L Chau reported that his mount would be better suited by being stepped back up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Stumbled on jumping, shifted in and was bumped.  When questioned, H Bentley stated that his instructions were to lead the event but after jumping awkwardly his mount settled further back in the early stages.  He said near the 800 Metres when positioned to the outside of SUMMIT CHEERS he elected to allow that runner to cross him as he felt he would have had to make too much use of his mount to hold that position.  He added that the decision to allow SUMMIT CHEERS to cross was also influenced by the fact that DIVINE MOONLIGHT had given ground in the Home Straight after being ridden to lead its first race start.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Whilst proceeding to enter the racecourse dislodged its rider Apprentice P N Wong.  KING VICTOR then refused to proceed to the Start and was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, KING VICTOR will be required to undergo a parade test.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Just prior to the start being effected became fractious and as the starting gates opened reared and lost ground.  As AUTUMN VIBES was placed 3rd and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 12(19), the Stewards were unable to consider as to whether AUTUMN VIBES should be declared a non-runner as Rule 12(19) states, "No horse which is declared first, second, third or fourth place in a race shall be so declared a non-runner”.  The barrier manners of AUTUMN VIBES were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, AUTUMN VIBES will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 600 Metres was bumped and taken wider by KA YING POWER which shifted out.

Shifted out near the 600 Metres and was bumped.  After improving to the outside of VIGOR ELLEEGANT near the 450 Metres was then steadied when crowded between GREAT STATE and VIGOR ELLEEGANT (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted out.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when racing tight between GREAT STATE and AUTUMN VIBES.

After the event, M L Yeung stated that his mount was able to lead but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and he could offer no explanation for its performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Slow to begin.  Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight.  After the 100 Metres when being ridden along shifted out, resulting in its rider A Badel having to stop riding and straighten near the 50 Metres. After being crossed by KA YING RESILIENCE near the 900 Metres raced keenly for some distance thereafter.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong reported that his mount raced greenly during the race and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found the horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  Before being allowed to race again, VIGOR ELLEEGANT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, B Thompson stated that the instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He said in the early stages he elected to ride his mount forward to take up a position outside the lead to avoid being taken wider by VIGOR ELLEEGANT.
Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced wide and without cover after the 700 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding out over the concluding stages, M Chadwick stated that leaving the 50 Metres he felt contact with his mount’s hindquarters and shortly afterwards his mount became unbalanced when there appeared to be further contact on the horse’s left hind leg.  He said as a result he looked to his outside to ascertain the reason for this and did not fully test his mount  out to the finish of the event.  Notwithstanding his explanation and whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of M Chadwick, 4th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless advised that, wherever possible, he should endeavour to ride his mounts out to the finish of the event.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 800 Metres was steadied away from RISING FROM ASHES.  Near the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving behind BRIGHT DAY before shifting to that runner’s inside near the 200 Metres.

H Bowman pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see RISING FROM ASHES).  Had difficulty obtaining clear running for a short distance near the 400 Metres.

Checked near the 900 Metres when crowded between RISING FROM ASHES and HONG LOK GOLF. From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and approaching the 800 Metres was shifted out, resulting in ALSONSO racing very wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.
Approaching the 800 Metres was checked when crowded between ALSONSO and REZEKI which shifted out when being checked.

H Bowman (BRIGHT DAY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of RISING FROM ASHES, resulting in RISING FROM ASHES being checked and shifting out, resulting in REZEKI being crowded between RISING FROM ASHES and HONG LOK GOLF and also having to be checked.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 19 February 2025 at Happy Valley.  In addition, Jockey Bowman was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
On jumping was crowded between PRAY FOR MIR and FORTUNATE SON.
In the early stages raced keenly.  Near the 150 Metres was hampered when taken wider.

Near the 350 Metres was bumped and taken wider by LEGEND ST PAUL’S (Y L Chung) which shifted out.  Y L Chung will be interviewed.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of the fallen LEGEND ST PAUL’S.
Near the 150 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of LO RIDER.

Approaching the 450 Metres FORTUNATE SON (L Hewitson) improved into a run between LUPO SOLITARIO and ENTHRALLED when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in ENTHRALLED being bumped heavily by FORTUNATE SON and taken wider.  L Hewitson was reprimanded and advised that he must ensure that there is sufficient room when improving.  Near the 150 Metres was checked to avoid the fallen LUPO SOLITARIO.

Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Near the 150 Metres was severely checked to avoid the fallen LUPO SOLITARIO.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and the reason he elected to shift out, L Hewitson stated that he felt his best option was to improve to the outside of LUPO SOLITARIO to follow the favourite in the event SILVERY BREEZE.  He said as he endeavoured to do so LUPO SOLITARIO shifted out slightly which resulted in his mount then being held up for clear running behind LUPO SOLITARIO and having to make contact with ENTHRALLED to shift out.  He added whilst he had observed a run may be available to his inside to follow PACKING TURBINE, he felt his best option was to endeavour to follow SILVERY BREEZE.
Shortly after the start raced in restricted room between STAR CONTACT and LUPO SOLITARIO which shifted in slightly.  Near the 150 Metres was checked and shifted to the inside of PRESTIGE GOOD.

Approaching the 300 Metres was hampered and taken wider by PRESTIGE GOOD.  Near the 150 Metres was severely checked to avoid fallen horses.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Contacted heavily near the 150 Metres and as a result fell, dislodging its rider M L Yeung.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have blood in the left nostril.  An endoscopic examination conducted on LUPO SOLITARIO found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled. <10/2/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>LUPO SOLITARIO, which fell near the 150 Metres, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse was found to have blood in the left nostril. An endoscopic examination conducted on LUPO SOLITARIO found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled. LUPO SOLITARIO was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer F C Lor this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, LUPO SOLITARIO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 150 Metres was contacted heavily by the fallen LEGEND ST PAUL’S, resulting in SILVERY BREEZE falling and dislodging its rider Z Purton.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have blood in the right nostril.  An endoscopic examination conducted on SILVERY BREEZE found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 400 Metres was disappointed for clear running to the inside of CALIFORNIATOTALITY.  LEGEND ST PAUL’S was then shifted to the outside of CALIFORNIATOTALITY to obtain clear running.  Near the 150 Metres went amiss in its left front leg and fell, dislodging its rider Y L Chung.  In this incident, SILVERY BREEZE was contacted heavily by LEGEND ST PAUL’S, resulting in SILVERY BREEZE falling and dislodging its rider Z Purton.  LUPO SOLITARIO, which was following, then fell, dislodging its rider M L Yeung when it was also contacted heavily by SILVERY BREEZE.  An inquiry into this incident was adjourned to a date to be fixed to allow the Stewards to interview riders Y L Chung, Z Purton and M L Yeung who was all taken to hospital for medical treatment.  Samples were taken from the horse.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in as they were of the opinion that an incident occurred over the concluding stages which cast doubt as to whether SKY TRUST should be declared the winner of the race.  Subsequently K Teetan, the rider of WINNING GOLD, 2nd placegetter, lodged a protest/objection against SKY TRUST being declared the winner alleging interference over the concluding stages.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found that over the concluding stages SKY TRUST (H Bowman) shifted out whilst being ridden along and as a result made contact with WINNING GOLD, resulting in WINNING GOLD becoming unbalanced and its rider K Teetan also becoming slightly unbalanced.  As the Stewards were satisfied that had the interference not occurred that WINNING GOLD would have finished in advance of SKY TRUST, the protest/objection was sustained and the placings amended to read No. 5, WINNING GOLD, 1st; No. 2, SKY TRUST, 2nd; No. 14 POWER KOEPP, 3rd; and No. 7, MORGAN SUCCESS, 4th.  At a subsequent inquiry  H Bowman was advised that in similar circumstances he must stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground before initiating contact.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Relegated to second on protest/objection (see WINNING GOLD).  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 300 Metres shifted out and away from LOST CHILD, resulting in its rider L Hewitson having to stop riding and straighten.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FUNG, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FUNG will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, H Bentley reported that his mount did not respond to his riding in the early stages and became detached from the field.  He attributed this to ISLAND GOLDEN racing on the All Weather surface when it was rated "Wet Slow”.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ISLAND GOLDEN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ISLAND GOLDEN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
