When questioned, H Bowman stated that after commencing well, when caught wide in the early stages he elected to shift RELIABLE PROFIT across behind runners to avoid racing wide in accordance with its usual racing pattern.  He said throughout the middle stages RELIABLE PROFIT did not travel strongly and he was required to make some use of it through that section of the race to hold its position.  He said when BABY SATELLITE commenced to improve near the 600 Metres he elected to ride his mount along to follow that runner into the event at which point his mount dipped but then responded to his riding soon after and commenced to improve on the Home Turn.  He added in the Home Straight RELIABLE PROFIT did not finish the race off and raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of RELIABLE PROFIT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RELIABLE PROFIT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  The performance of BABY SATELLITE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BABY SATELLITE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  The performance of TO INFINITY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, TO INFINITY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of ACE WAR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ACE WAR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The performance of MULTIBINGO, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MULTIBINGO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered as to whether SNOWALOT had been denied a fair start.  After taking evidence from Trainer D A Hayes, rider Apprentice P N Wong and the Starter Mr A Speechley, the Stewards found that as the start was effected SNOWALOT lowered its head when being assisted by a starting gate handler.  This then resulted in SNOWALOT jumping awkwardly and Apprentice Wong being dislodged from the horse.  As the Stewards were satisfied that this incident occurred as the start was being effected, SNOWALOT was declared a runner.  The barrier manners of SNOWALOT were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SNOWALOT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Subsequently Apprentice Wong was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil her remaining race riding engagements.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered as to whether ALL ARE MINE had been denied a fair start.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found that ALL ARE MINE bounded as the start was effected and became badly unbalanced, resulting in its rider A Badel being dislodged.  As the Stewards were satisfied that ALL ARE MINE was given full opportunity to start with the field, it was declared a runner.  The barrier manners of ALL ARE MINE were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ALL ARE MINE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Subsequently A Badel was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding along the Back Straight and the reason he shifted away from the rail, A Badel stated that after riding his mount along in the early stages he was unable to hold a more forward position.  He said when the early stages of the event was run inside of standard time he was reluctant to remain racing on the rail as he felt the leaders may give ground and for this reason he elected to shift out and race three wide following HAKKA RADIANCE.  He added that this move was also influenced by the fact that HAPPY HERO has performed well when making an early move from the back of the field.  He further stated that from the 800 Metres he shifted to the outside of HAKKA RADIANCE where his mount commenced to improve into the event behind DEVILDOM, but in the Home Straight HAPPY HERO did not respond to his riding.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Badel were reasonable in the circumstances.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the manner in which Jockey Badel rode the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He added CERVIN was not suited by racing in this position and gave ground under pressure in the Home Straight. Before being allowed to race again, DEVILDOM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On jumping bumped with GAMEPLAYER ELITE and became unbalanced.  Noted to have lost its left hind plate and sustained a laceration to its right hind leg after the race.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in whilst they considered if SWAGGER BRO had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from Jockey M L Yeung, Trainer D A Hayes and Deputy Starter Mr C McMullen, it was established that as the start was effected Jockey Yeung had his right arm positioned on the barrier partition whilst he adjusted his right stirrup.  As the Stewards were satisfied that SWAGGER BRO was unable to jump with the field as a consequence, they determined that the horse was denied a fair start and as such was declared a non-runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

B Avdulla (BUNDLE AWARD) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 400 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out whilst riding it along, resulting in BUNDLE AWARD making heavy contact with ANOTHER WORLD on two occasions and taking ANOTHER WORLD from its rightful running.  B Avdulla was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 5 March 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  Near the 250 Metres made contact with BUNDLE AWARD.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
No report.

Approaching the 400 Metres became unbalanced when it shifted to the outside of SKY HEART and made contact with ANOTHER WORLD on two occasions.  B Avdulla pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 400 Metres (see ANOTHER WORLD).  Near the 250 Metres raced tight between ANOTHER WORLD and SKY HEART when endeavouring to continue to improve between those runners.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Thompson stated that at its last start his mount was able to dictate terms without being pressured in front.  He said today NEW FUTURE FOLKS was pressured in the lead by SKY HEART which resulted in the horse not finishing the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The Stewards considered an application made by Trainer F C Lor that the horse be declared a non-runner on the basis that it had been denied a fair start.  After taking evidence from the Starter Mr A Speechley, Jockey K C Leung and Mr Lor, the Stewards established that EVERYONE’S STAR reared as the start was effected when being assisted by a starting gate handler.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence occurred simultaneously to the start being effected, EVERYONE’S STAR was declared a runner.  Before being allowed to race again, EVERYONE’S STAR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Near the 200 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of DRAGON JOY to obtain clear running.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 300 Metres lay in when being directed to the inside of WRITTEN CASA to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced ungenerously.
No report.
No report.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Over the final 100 Metres lay in under pressure and near the 50 Metres made contact with SNOWTHORN.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1150 Metres was steadied to avoid MOTOMAN which shifted out and way from NEBRASKAN.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration as to whether there were grounds for a protest/objection against POWER KOEPP being declared the 4th placegetter when POWER KOEPP shifted in approaching the 50 Metres.  As the Stewards were satisfied that BEAUTY THUNDER had not established clear running to the inside of POWER KOEPP, they declined to lodge a protest/objection when there were not sufficient grounds to do so.  Approaching the 50 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of POWER KOEPP when disappointed for clear running.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by LUCKY ARCHANGEL which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.

Passing the 50 Metres was bumped by POWER KOEPP (M Chadwick) which shifted in whilst being ridden along.  M Chadwick was reprimanded.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that making the turns near the 1000 Metres and after the 600 Metres his mount lay out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Making the first turn lay out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the event, M F Poon stated that with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time his mount was under pressure throughout the race and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SOLAR UP will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, L Ferraris stated that his instructions were to take up a forward position and lead if possible.  He said he was also given instructions not to make too much use of his mount to do so.  He said after ONE FOR ALL commenced well he expected the horse to show its natural early pace to cross runners to its inside but when POWER KOEPP and NEBRASKAN held their positions to his inside ONE FOR ALL was obliged to race very wide making the first turn.  He added as a result he elected to obtain cover behind NEBRASKAN along the Back Straight, however, making the Home Turn ONE FOR ALL became awkward in its action and when under pressure in the Home Straight he was concerned there may be something amiss with his mount.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions were to lead and advised that he expected ONE FOR ALL to be able to lead without being pressured to do so as there did not appear to be strong pace in the race.  He added as such he had instructed Jockey Ferraris not to make too much use of his mount in the early stages as he felt the horse would have sufficient pace to cross runners to its inside.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 1400 Metres made contact with HAPPY DAILY when racing tight to the inside of PERFECTO MOMENTS.  Approaching the 700 Metres was momentarily crowded between YOUTH POWER which shifted out slightly and PERFECTO MOMENTS which shifted in.  Over the concluding stages brushed with COURIER MAGIC due to both runners shifting ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of HAPPY DAILY.  For a short distance after the 200 Metres raced greenly.  Near the 100 Metres lay in, resulting in its rider H Doyle having to stop riding and straighten her mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages brushed with THESIS due to both runners shifting ground.
Bumped approaching the 1400 Metres.
On jumping bumped with YOUTH POWER and became unbalanced.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 1400 Metres raced in restricted room to the inside of FIREFOOT when that runner was taken in slightly by WAH MAY WAI WAI which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  Approaching the 250 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by HIGHLAND RAHY which shifted out when being checked away from WAH MAY WAI WAI.
After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount raced "flat” tonight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 400 Metres became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of HIGHLAND RAHY.  After the event, L Ferraris confirmed that his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages as SMART FIGHTER was stepping up in distance from the 1200 Metres in order to allow it to run out the 1650 Metres of tonight’s event.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions and the reason why such instructions were issued.

After the event, A Badel stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and this was the reason why it did not run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that his mount raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages.  He added in the Home Straight he was held up for clear running behind WAH MAY WAI WAI before being checked away from that runner approaching the 250 Metres.  He said as a result his mount finished the race off only fairly thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced very wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that from a wide  barrier he was obliged to make too much use of his mount in the early stages to cross to race outside the lead and this was the reason it gave ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight, resulting in its rider L Ferraris changing his whip through to his right hand near the 200 Metres.
Leaving the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between GRAND NOVA and CHAMPION METHOD (A Atzeni) which shifted out.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned, T Marquand stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position and lead if possible.  He said with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time ALLGREEKTOME did not show sufficient pace to allow him to comply with the instructions and as a result settled further back than anticipated.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, T Marquand stated that when positioned to the inside of NOTTHESILLYONE and behind HAPPY UNITED, he was unable to shift out and after the 300 Metres he then elected to shift to the inside of HAPPY UNITED to secure clear running.  He added as he commenced to shift in HAPPY UNITED lay in which resulted in him having to continue to shift in to that runner’s inside in order to obtain clear running.  He said near the 200 Metres when HAPPY UNITED continued to shift in he contemplated shifting to its outside but when Jockey L Ferraris pulled his whip through to his right hand he was of the opinion that runner would straighten.  He said approaching the 150 Metres ALLGREEKTOME was then checked when disappointed for clear running to the inside of HAPPY UNITED when that runner continued to shift in.  T Marquand agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect his better option would have been to shift to the outside of HAPPY UNITED near the 200 Metres to secure clear running.
No report.

When commencing to finish the race off well was disappointed for clear running between NOTTHESILLYONE and CHAMPION METHOD near the 100 Metres and as a result could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.
After travelling a short distance was bumped by PRECIOUS HILL which shifted out and away from PARENTS’ LOVE.
Near the 450 Metres was steadied when taken wider by PRECIOUS HILL which shifted out when giving ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped after travelling a short distance.  After the event, C L Chau stated that his mount raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and lay out making the Home Turn before giving ground in the Home Straight.  He added, in his opinion, he felt there may be something amiss with PRECIOUS HILL.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, PRECIOUS HILL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Kicked a rail in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  Approaching the 200 Metres lay out, resulting in its rider B Thompson having to stop riding and straighten his mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and was then crowded between WINNING STEPS and SAMARKAND which shifted out abruptly.  When placed under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight lay in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.

Shifted out abruptly at the start.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of H Doyle, 5th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, she was nonetheless reminded of her obligation to ensure that she fully rides her mounts out to the finish of the race.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that his mount travelled only fairly throughout the event which he attributed to the horse carrying the top weight of 135 lbs.  He said when under pressure in the Home Straight FLAMINGO TRILLION finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.
No report.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between KARATE EXPRESS and GOKO WIN which shifted out and away from HAYDAY.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Shortly after the start was hampered and taken wider by KING OF FIGHTERS.

After the event,  A Badel stated that when caught wide in the early stages he elected to stride forward to avoid racing wide, particularly in the circumstances where the early pace of the event was run outside of standard time.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping was bumped by HAYDAY which shifted out.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Approaching the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid THUNDER PRINCE (A Badel) which shifted in when not clear.  A Badel was severely reprimanded.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that his mount travelled only fairly throughout the event and did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping was bumped by HAPPY FAT CAT which shifted in slightly.  Near the 150 Metres became slightly unbalanced when it attempted to jump a plastic bag which was blown on the track during the running of the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, K Teetan stated that the instructions were to hold an on-pace position and lead if possible.  He said prior to the start being effected SOLEIL FIGHTER became a little fractious in the starting gates and as a result was slow to begin.  He said soon after SOLEIL FIGHTER was crowded to the inside of NEW FOREST and as a result he was obliged to settle in a midfield position.  He added that near the 500 Metres when  QUANTUM PATCH improved to his outside he was reluctant to commence a forward move at that stage as his mount was carrying the top weight of 135 lbs.  He added when QUANTUM PATCH improved past his mount SOLEIL FIGHTER commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from VIVA GRACIOUSNESS passing the 500 Metres.  He further stated that after improving to the outside in the Home Straight SOLEIL FIGHTER responded to his riding, however, in his opinion, its run peaked passing the 100 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For some distance near the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.

Was found to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Approaching the 100 Metres was shifted to the inside of NEW FOREST to obtain clear running and as a result made contact with MIGHTY COMMANDER.  After the event, K De Melo stated that from his wide barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions and advised he issued such instructions to offset the wide barrier and to avoid DEVAS TWELVE racing wide.

The tongue tie was refitted on arrival at the Start.  Raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from NEW FOREST.  Bumped near the 100 Metres.  After the event, A Badel stated that his mount raced keenly behind the lead and as a result did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Dislodged its rider A Badel without incident on entering the track.  Jockey Badel quickly remounted before proceeding to the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.
No report.
Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied to allow GUSTOSISIMO to cross.
Slow to begin.  Near the 1100 Metres was hampered when taken wider by TURF PHOENIX.

Approaching the 1100 Metres was checked when crowded between YOUNG ARROW which shifted out slightly and GIANT LEAP which, after being taken in by GUSTOSISIMO (B Avdulla), then shifted in and away from that runner.  B Avdulla was advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to make a greater effort to straighten his mounts sooner than what he did on this occasion.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping shifted out and made contact with AWESOME TREASURE when that runner shifted in slightly.  As a result, ETERNAL FORTUNE became unbalanced and lost ground.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the  majority of the event and as a consequence was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Shortly after the start bumped with GUSTOSISIMO which shifted in.   After the 1100 Metres was steadied when racing in restricted room to the inside of GUSTOSISIMO which lay in when being corrected by its rider B Avdulla.  Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres got its head up and over-raced.  GIANT LEAP continued to race keenly throughout the middle stages.

Jumped only fairly.  In the early and middle stages raced keenly.  Near the 1100 Metres was steadied and shifted out to avoid ENDUED.  Making the first turn lay out and was steadied when racing behind GIANT LEAP.

After the event, B Shinn stated that he had expected to take up a position in the lead.  He said when the early stages of the event were run inside of standard time he elected to ride his mount with cover where it was comfortable.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on JAMES TAK at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, JAMES TAK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  After the 300 Metres was directed to the inside of a number of runners where it obtained clear running near the 200 Metres.

K Teetan (HEALTHY HEALTHY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 300 Metres he endeavoured to obtain a run between JAMES TAK and WHIZZ KID where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in HEALTHY HEALTHY making contact with WHIZZ KID and then WHIZZ KID being unnecessarily crowded and becoming unbalanced when it was bumped on a number of occasions between the 250 Metres and the 100 Metres and further resulting in HEALTHY HEALTHY having to be checked after the 100 Metres when disappointed for clear running between WHIZZ KID and JAMES TAK which shifted out slightly.  As a result, STELLAR EXPRESS was checked near the 50 Metres when HEALTHY HEALTHY shifted in.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 5 March 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

K Teetan pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching and after the 300 Metres (see WHIZZ KID).  After the 300 Metres improved into a run between JAMES TAK and WHIZZ KID where there was not sufficient room, resulting in HEALTHY HEALTHY bumping with WHIZZ KID between the 250 Metres and the 100 Metres and being checked after the 100 Metres (see WHIZZ KID).

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, H Bowman could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.

Near the 50 Metres was checked when crowded between BOTTOMUPTOGETHER and HEALTHY HEALTHY which shifted in.  When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages.  He said near the 200 Metres when momentarily tightened between JAMES TAK and BOTTOMUPTOGETHER, his mount was reluctant to hold its position between those runners.  He further stated that over the concluding stages when crowded for room STELLAR EXPRESS then continued to be reluctant to hold its position and in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with the performance of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the final 50 Metres could not be ridden out when racing tight to the inside of MIGHTY COMMANDER.
No report.
Near the 200 Metres was steadied to avoid CAPITAL LEGEND when that runner shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from YEE CHEONG RAIDER.  SOUTH STAR then continued to race keenly in the middle stages and lay out.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the 300 Metres was held up when disappointed for clear running between GALE SAGA and SKY JEWELLERY.  LUCKY SAM GOR was then shifted to the outside of SKY JEWELLERY to obtain clear running near the 250 Metres.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  After the 900 Metres became unbalanced when buffeted for room between JOLLY RULER and SOUTH STAR, both of which shifted ground slightly.  For some distance after the 700 Metres raced in restricted room between JOLLY RULER and SOUTH STAR which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider when racing keenly.

Near the 900 Metres became unbalanced when it shifted away from the running rail.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Approaching the 150 Metres raced tight between YEE CHEONG RAIDER and CALIFORNIA BLITZ when both runners shifted ground slightly and as a result could not be fully ridden out until passing the 100 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 1100 Metres improved to the inside of PEARL OF PANG’S when racing keenly and as a result was then checked when PEARL OF PANG’S shifted in slightly.

Bumped at the start.  After the 400 Metres endeavoured to obtain clear running between SHINE BRIGHT and HAROLD WIN where there was not sufficient room, resulting in YEE CHEONG RAIDER being held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  Again near the 150 Metres YEE CHEONG RAIDER had some difficulty obtaining clear running.  After the race, the Veterinary Surgeon reported that YEE CHEONG RAIDER had bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, YEE CHEONG RAIDER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, R Kingscote stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and after making contact with NEVER TOO SOON near the 800 Metres did not travel well thereafter before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  Held up for clear running between the 500 Metres and the 400 Metres.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, B Thompson stated that the instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages from its wide barrier. He said after SHINE BRIGHT jumped well he was obliged to allow it to continue forward to avoid racing wide which resulted in SHINE BRIGHT unexpectedly leading the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up when being shifted to the outside of RED LION to obtain clear running.

Shortly after the start was steadied when racing in restricted room between GALE SAGA and PEARL OF PANG’S, both of which shifted ground slightly. Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.  When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer W Y So stated that at the horse’s last start it had failed to run out a strong 1600 Metres when it obtained a forward position from an inside barrier.  He said following that run he sent the horse to his Conghua stable where it barrier trialed well on 14 February 2025.  He said as a result he had expected CARRYON SMILING to run reasonably well today.  He said he also issued the same instructions today to Jockey K De Melo as he did to the horse’s rider on 29 December 2024 when the horse ran well when ridden in a conservative manner from the outside barrier and this, in his opinion, was the principal reason for the horse’s improvement today.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded by CALIFORNIA SPANGLE which shifted in.

Jumped only fairly and then bumped with AHREN which shifted out slightly.  In the Home Straight hung in and proved difficult to ride out when racing greenly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with CROSSBORDERPEGASUS.  Near the 500 Metres was bumped by BIENVENUE and as a result shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, L Hewitson could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, A Badel stated that the instructions were to take up a forward position but to find cover if possible.  He said in the early stages when caught wide he allowed ETALON OR to stride forward but when FLYING WROTE did not cross to the rail he was obliged to race wide and without cover.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight and as to whether there was an opportunity to place his mount under full pressure sooner, A Badel stated that as ETALON OR had endured a wide run and was carrying 132 lbs, he was reluctant to place his mount under full pressure too soon as he was mindful that its effort in the early stages may have an impact on its ability to finish the race off.  He said as a result between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres he encouraged ETALON OR into the event where it travelled reasonably well.  He added near the 250 Metres he then placed the horse under full pressure where it initially responded to his riding before the winner CARRYON SMILING was able to improve past his mount near the 100 Metres.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions were to take up a slightly more forward position but was of the opinion that Jockey Badel could have placed pressure on his mount sooner in the Home Straight.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Badel were reasonable in the circumstances.

Shifted in at the start, made contact with DREAMING WINNER and shortly after was crowded by LAKESHORE HERO which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  After the 300 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SHAMUS STORM to obtain clear running.

Leaving the 500 Metres was steadied when it endeavoured to obtain a narrow run between HAPPY UNIVERSE and TOP PEAK.  In this incident, MANAPHY made contact with TOP PEAK.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, MANAPHY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <24/2/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> MANAPHY, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse had bled from both nostrils. MANAPHY was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer W K Mo this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, MANAPHY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration as to whether MULTISUPER had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from Jockey D McDonogh, Trainer T P Yung and Starter Mr A Speechley, the Stewards found that as the start was effected the starting gate handler attempted to straighten the horse’s head to allow it to jump with the field.  As he did so, MULTISUPER lowered its head, resulting in the horse jumping awkwardly and losing ground.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence occurred as the start was being effected, MULTISUPER was declared a runner.  The Stewards ruled that MULTISUPER will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in consecutive barrier trials before being allowed to race again.

PATCH OF STARS then lay in for the remainder of the event.
