Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Making the Home Turn was shifted to the outside of JOYFUL TREASURE to secure clear running and in this incident made contact with SIGHT DREAMER.  For a short distance near the 250 Metres raced tight between SIGHT DREAMER and JOYFUL TREASURE.
Shortly after the start was crowded, bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.
Bumped on jumping and became unbalanced.

Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between THE HEIR and SIGHT DREAMER which shifted out when giving ground.  As a result, THUNDER BLINK could not obtain clear running until near the 150 Metres.

On jumping was crowded between THE HEIR and THUNDER BLINK which shifted out.  After the event, R Moore stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He said after racing in restricted room between SPECIAL HEDGE and PATCH OF STARS near the 300 Metres his mount then gave ground from that point.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded on jumping between THE HEIR and SUNNY DARLING.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by SPECIAL HEDGE.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  In the early stages raced keenly when being restrained to obtain cover behind THE HEIR.

Bumped near the 250 Metres.  B Avdulla was warned in relation to his celebratory gesture passing the winning post which resulted in his mount shifting in, giving ground and hampering JOHANNES BRAHMS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start raced in restricted room to the inside of MICKLEY.  Over-raced in the early stages.  After the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of STUNNING PEACH.  In this incident, JOHANNES BRAHMS made contact with RUBYLOT near the 250 Metres.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 250 Metres was directed to the inside of NOISY BOY to continue into clear running.
No report.
Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
No report.

After the event, C Williams stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to hold a forward position.  He said after commencing well he made some use of his mount in the early stages to cross runners to his inside where CAP FERRAT then travelled well in the early and middle stages.  He added that due to the pace of the event being run inside of standard time in the early stages CAP FERRAT did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions were to hold an on-pace position with cover if it commenced well.
Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded by JOHANNES BRAHMS which shifted in.

Jumped awkwardly.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  Near the 1200 Metres was shifted to the outside of STUNNING PEACH when awkwardly placed close to that runner’s heels.  As a result, SKY TRUST raced wide and without cover thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that he had to make some use of the horse in the early stages to cross and lead the event from a wide barrier.  He added in the Home Straight NOISY BOY failed to respond to his riding and was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1200 Metres was hampered when taken wider by SKY TRUST.  After the event, R Moore could offer no explanation for the horse’s failure to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

ROMANTIC THOR, Standby Declared Starter, was withdrawn on 1.3.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right hind).  Before being allowed to race again, ROMANTIC THOR  will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded between SILVER KING and ESCAPE ROUTE.  In the middle stages raced keenly.
Approaching the finish post could not be fully ridden out when it improved close to SHANGHAI STYLE.
Lay out on the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight.
No report.

Near the 150 Metres, LUCKY BANNER, which was giving ground, was steadied when crowded by LUCKY TOUCH (J McDonald) which shifted in.  J McDonald was reprimanded.  After the event, J Moreira stated that in the early stages he had to make some use of his mount to cross runners to his inside and take up a position outside the lead.  He added in the Home Straight LUCKY BANNER gave ground and after being crowded near the 150 Metres did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From the 1000 Metres raced wide and without cover.

At declaration time, B Avdulla was declared as the rider of both BRAVE WITNESS and LAKESHORE HERO.  It was established that B Avdulla had a firm commitment to ride BRAVE WITNESS.  As such, the Stewards permitted H Bowman to be substituted as the rider of LAKESHORE HERO.  For this declaration error, Trainer D J Hall was fined $2,000.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Throughout the early and middle stages raced keenly and refused to settle.  The performance of CALIFORNIA STAR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA STAR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a minor abrasion to the left front pastern.
Shortly after the start was crowded between RIGHTEOUS ARION and CRIMSON FLASH which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.

Shortly after the start was hampered when crowded by BLAZING WIND which shifted out.  In this incident, CRIMSON FLASH then shifted out and away from BLAZING WIND, made contact with FAST NETWORK and became unbalanced.
Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.
On jumping was bumped by CALL ME GLORIOUS which shifted out.
Near the 900 Metres, when racing keenly, got its head up when being steadied to avoid CRIMSON FLASH (L Hewitson) which shifted in when not clear.  L Hewitson was reprimanded.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, A Badel stated that his mount did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position and was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added in the Home Straight RIGHTEOUS ARION finished the race off in a one-paced manner.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 250 Metres shifted in and away from FAST NETWORK and then was steadied away from WONDERSTAR when that runner shifted out before being corrected by its rider Y L Chung.  After the event, M F Poon stated that his mount travelled keenly during the race and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that his mount did not travel well at any stage of the event and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  He added that he had concern with the horse’s action during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MEOWTH, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MEOWTH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (fever).  Before being allowed to race again, SAVVY BRILLIANT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped at the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  B Avdulla pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 200 Metres (see SHARPEN BRIGHT).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

B Avdulla (ENTHRALLED) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 200 Metres he shifted his mount to the outside of DEFINITIVE when not clear of SHARPEN BRIGHT, resulting in SHARPEN BRIGHT having to be steadied to avoid the heels of ENTHRALLED.  B Avdulla was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 26 March 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
No report.
Shortly after the start was bumped by ENTHRALLED.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Near the 1500 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from THE BEST PEACH.

After the event, C Williams stated that the intention was to find cover.  He said when caught wide in the early stages and when the pace of the event eased after the 1600 Metres he allowed MIDORI GIANT to stride forward to avoid covering additional ground.  He added, in his opinion, this may not have suited the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind TALENTS AMBITION.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the final 100 Metres was held up for clear running between TALENTS AMBITION and SPANISH FLAME.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event, T Marquand stated that his mount enjoyed a comfortable run during the race but did not finish the race off when under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then was badly crowded on jumping between PRAY FOR MIR and THE BEST PEACH, both of which shifted ground.  When the pace steadied near the 1500 Metres raced keenly for some distance thereafter.  In the Home Straight hung in and proved difficult to ride out.

Withdrawn on 1.3.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right hind).  Before being allowed to race again, ROMANTIC THOR  will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Withdrawn on 27.2.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (fever).  Before being allowed to race again, FAMILY JEWEL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of its barrier and lost ground.  After the 1600 Metres was steadied away from SUPER HONG KONG.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was crowded between GOLDEN FAIRY and ON THE LASH.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Approaching the 1500 Metres was steadied away from GOLD TACK when it was racing keenly.  After the event, R Moore could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, A Badel stated that his mount gave ground when under pressure in the Home Straight and he could offer no explanation for its performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GOLDEN FAIRY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GOLDEN FAIRY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 1600 Metres raced keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from GOLDEN FAIRY.  After the event, L Ferraris expressed some concern with his mount’s action and as a result did not fully test it over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of FRUITY WARRIOR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FRUITY WARRIOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 4.3.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left front tendon injury).  Before being allowed to race again, FURY AND GOLD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the first turn near the 1000 Metres shifted in and away from HARMONY N HOME and made contact with the running rail.  After the 200 Metres became held up for clear running behind KING GLORIOSO and did not obtain clear running until near the 50 Metres when it improved into a narrow run between KING GLORIOSO and E UNIVERSE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance near the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of COLONEL which lay in.
Near the 100 Metres K De Melo lost his whip when it made contact with BOWSER as that runner improved into a tight run.
Near the 100 Metres was contacted on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the early stages when being shifted across behind runners from a wide barrier.  Near the 150 Metres became held up behind INNO CENTURY and shortly after shifted to the outside of that runner to obtain clear running and made contact with HAPPY UNITED.

Near the 100 Metres was steadied when crowded between ACCOLADE START and REWARDING TWINKLE (M L Yeung) which shifted out after being steadied away from INNO CENTURY.  M L Yeung was reprimanded.  When questioned, H Bowman stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to ride HAPPY UNITED in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said HAPPY UNITED jumped awkwardly and then got its head up in the early stages whilst he was complying with his instructions.  He said in the Home Straight HAPPY UNITED hung in and proved difficult to ride out and after being crowded near the 100 Metres HAPPY UNITED then raced tight between REWARDING TWINKLE and ACCOLADE START and as a result he could not fully test his mount out to the finish of the event.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued but advised that HAPPY UNITED had settled slightly further back than what he had expected.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when it improved close to E UNIVERSE.

After the event, J Orman stated that his instructions were to obtain an on-pace position preferably with cover.  He said when KING GLORIOSO jumped well tonight it raced in a slightly more forward position.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event, A Badel stated that from the outside barrier he was obliged to settle back in the field.  He said GIMME FIVE was obliged to race wide and with cover but found it difficult to make up ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Under pressure in the Home Straight lay in, resulting in its rider L Ferraris having to stop riding and straighten his mount near the 200 Metres.
Near the 1200 Metres shifted in and made contact with the running rail.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 450 Metres made contact with AESTHETICISM when shifting to the outside of GLORIOUS SUCCESS to commenced to improve.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Was bumped near the 450 Metres.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of SAMARKAND to continue into clear running.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position and lead if the pace of the event allowed him to do so.  He said whilst SAMARKAND jumped well, when several runners drawn to his outside went forward, he elected to allow those runners to cross and settle slightly further back than had been anticipated.
After the event, R Kingscote stated that the instructions were to take up an on-pace position with cover.  He said when IVY LEAGUE commenced well it led without being pressured to do so.
No report.

Had its right hind plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.  After the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when endeavouring to improve between M UNICORN and EXCELLENCE VALUE.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, Y L Chung could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1200 Metres was steadied to avoid DEVAS TWELVE.  After the event, M L Yeung stated that the only explanation he could offer for the disappointing performance was that the horse may appreciate having more time between race starts.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of FLAMING RABBIT to obtain clear running.
No report.
No report.
Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Near the 100 Metres became held up for clear running behind LADY’S CHOICE and could not be tested until the concluding stages.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position if possible but not to pressure his mount to do so as it has previously been reported as a "roarer”.  He said as a result when caught wide in the early stages he elected to ride his mount in a conservative manner in accordance with the instructions issued.
After the 500 Metres lay in as it endeavoured to improve to the outside of DANCING CODE.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount hung in under pressure in the Home Straight and responded only fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Lost its right front plate whilst proceeding to the Start.  Was replated behind the starting gates, inspected by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to take up a forward position but FLAMING RABBIT did not show sufficient pace to cross runners to her inside which resulted in the horse racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  She added under pressure in the Home Straight her mount did not respond to her riding and did not fully stretch out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Making the turn after the 600 Metres lay out and was awkwardly placed close to HONG KONG HALL.  Near the 350 Metres made contact with HEALTHY HEALTHY when that runner raced tight to the inside of HONG KONG HALL.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to hold his position, particularly with the race being run inside of standard time.  He added in the Home Straight HEROIC MASTER finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a small wound to its right front leg.
Near the 350 Metres was bumped when racing tight to the inside of HONG KONG HALL and became unbalanced.
Slow to begin and shortly after the start was crowded by MAJESTIC EXPRESS which raced tight to the inside of HARMONY N BLESSED.  Lay out on the Home Turn and in the Home Straight.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters.  After the event, A Badel stated that with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time he was unable to cross runners to his inside and as a result MAJESTIC EXPRESS raced wide and without cover.  He added in the Home Straight due to the wide run MAJESTIC EXPRESS was unable to finish the race off strongly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out slightly at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event, L Hewitson stated that for some distance approaching the 100 Metres SWAGGER BRO had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of DRAGON FOUR SEAS.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 150 Metres was hampered and shifted to the outside of SANTORINI to continue into clear running.  When questioned, R Moore stated that after shifting to the outside of SANTORINI near the 200 Metres to obtain clear running he then commenced to ride his mount along.  He said near the 50 Metres ENDUED became positioned close to the heels of TELECOM POWER and when TELECOM POWER (H Bentley) shifted out slightly he became awkwardly placed close to that runner.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to continue to shift to the outside of TELECOM POWER, R Moore stated that as he was concerned he would be placed in more difficulty should TELECOM POWER continue to shift out, he elected to steady and shift to that runner’s inside where he obtained clear running approaching the winning post.  H Bentley was advised to exercise more care.

Shortly after the start was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the event, L Ferraris stated that after making contact with SOMETHING JONAH shortly after the start his left foot became awkwardly positioned in his stirrup.  He said for this reason near the 850 Metres he was obliged to reposition his foot in his left stirrup to ensure that it was safely positioned.

Had its left hind plate adjusted in the holding stables, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 900 Metres was steadied when crowded by CHAMPION METHOD (H T Mo) which shifted in when not quite clear.  H T Mo was severely reprimanded.  In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 800 Metres was steadied away from CHAMPION METHOD.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SANTORINI.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when ENDUED shifted to the inside of TELECOM POWER.
No report.
Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between ENDUED and SUPER CHARIZZARD, both of which shifted ground.

Sustained a minor abrasion to the right hind leg whilst being transported to the course.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped near the 300 Metres.  Approaching the 150 Metres bumped with RIDING HIGH due to both runners shifting ground.

Shortly after the start was bumped by DRAGON FOUR SEAS which shifted out slightly.  Approaching the 300 Metres was shifted to the outside of DRAGON FOUR SEAS to obtain clear running and made contact with SANTORINI.  Approaching the 150 Metres bumped with SANTORINI due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that his mount had a comfortable run during the race but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and he could offer no excuse for the horse’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <6/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> RIDING HIGH, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. RIDING HIGH was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer A S Cruz this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, RIDING HIGH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Trainer D A Hayes confirmed that from a wide barrier he had instructed L Hewitson to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said he issued such instructions as AWESOME TREASURE had been racing disappointingly when ridden in a forward position at its most recent starts.  Noted to have blood in the mouth after the race.
On jumping H T Mo became unbalanced in the saddle for a short distance.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in as they were of the view that an incident which occurred over the final 100 Metres placed some doubt as to whether GOLDEN RISE should be declared the winner.  Subsequently Trainer A S Cruz and Jockey J Orman, rider and trainer of PRIME MORTAR, viewed the official patrol films to ascertain if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection.  When connections declined to lodge a protest/objection and the Steward were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds to do so due to the minor contact between GOLDEN RISE and PRIME MORTAR and having regard to the manner in which both horses finished the race off, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  Over the final 100 Metres was taken in by GOLDEN RISE and near the 50 Metres brushed with that runner.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the early stages got its head up when being shifted across behind runners and continued to race keenly in the early and middle stages.

Shortly after the start was bumped by MACANESE MASTER.  After the event, A Badel stated that from an inside barrier his instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.

Approaching the 50 Metres was eased when crowded between SILVER SPURS and PRIME MORTAR which, after shifting in and away from GOLDEN RISE, was then taken in slightly by that runner.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when racing tight to the inside of YOUNG HORIZON which shifted in.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped awkwardly.  Shortly after the start was crowded between STAR FIGURE and SILVER SPURS which shifted out after making contact with MACANESE MASTER.  Approaching the 1000 Metres improved to the inside of MACANESE MASTER (B Thompson) which then a short distance later shifted in when not clear, resulting in COLOURFUL WINNER being steadied.  B Thompson was severely reprimanded.

Had its right hind plate refitted in the holding stables.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Shortly after the start was bumped by STAR FIGURE.  After the event, L Hewitson explained that his mount had difficulty obtaining clear running over the final 200 Metres.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the turn near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from STAR FIGURE.  Again approaching the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from STAR FIGURE and raced keenly for some distance thereafter.

Shortly after the start was bumped and became unbalanced.  Over the final 100 Metres could not be ridden out when COLOURFUL WINNER (M L Yeung) shifted in.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Bumped at the start.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Lay out over the concluding stages.  When questioned, A Badel stated that his instructions were to allow his mount to settle to ensure that it finished the race off.  He said from barrier 2 BEAUTY INFINITY jumped well and obtained a more forward position than expected without having to be pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Making the first turn hung in, resulting in its rider A Hamelin having to correct his mount.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  When questioned, A Hamelin stated that his mount hung in throughout the event.  He added that in the Home Straight he was placed at a disadvantage when NORDIC DRAGON continued to hang in and proved difficult to ride out.
No report.

After the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between ROMANTIC SON (H Bentley) and NORDIC DRAGON (A Hamelin), both of which shifted ground slightly.  Both H Bentley and A Hamelin were advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <6/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> After the race, YOUNG EMPEROR was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. YOUNG EMPEROR was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer D Eustace this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG EMPEROR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

After the event, R Moore stated that his mount jumped only fairly and despite riding it along was unable to take up a more forward position.  He said SUNNY DA BEST did not travel well throughout the event and responded only fairly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight which he attributed to the racing surface in his opinion being loose due to the race being run in light rain.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of  its barrier and lost ground.  Near the 600 Metres was briefly tightened by SUNNY DA BEST which shifted in and away from NORDIC DRAGON.  MIGHTY COMMANDER then continued to race tight to the inside of SUNNY DA BEST for a short distance thereafter.  In the Home Straight lay in.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 300 Metres lay in and made contact with TOY SOLTERO.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
The tongue tie was replaced on arrival at the Start.
The Veterinary Surgeon reported that HAKKA RADIANCE had sustained a small abrasion to the left hind leg.
Approaching the 500 Metres was checked to avoid ROMANTIC FANTASY when that runner gave ground quickly.  Briefly held up making the Home Turn.
No report.
Approaching the 500 Metres was taken wider by CAN’T GO WONG.

Jumped awkwardly.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed that from a wide barrier the instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said he issued such instructions as QUICK QUICK WIN had been racing disappointingly when taking up a forward position and to offset the wide barrier to assist QUICK QUICK WIN in finishing the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid ROMANTIC FANTASY which was giving ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 300 Metres became unbalanced when MISSION STRIKE made contact with the hindquarters of TOY SOLTERO when TOY SOLTERO shifted out slightly and MISSION STRIKE lay in.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to steady his mount to avoid racing wide and as a consequence TOY SOLTERO settled further back than what had been intended.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of TOY SOLTERO, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, TOY SOLTERO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped at the start.  The performance of ROMANTIC FANTASY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ROMANTIC FANTASY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and shortly after was checked when crowded between HAPPY DAILY and WAH MAY WAI WAI which shifted in after being crowded by SKY VINO.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in and proved reluctant to shift to the outside of SKY VINO to continue into clear running.
When being shifted in to obtain cover behind JUMBO FORTUNE approaching the 1500 Metres was steadied away from JUMBO FORTUNE when that runner shifted out and away from TURIN WARRIOR.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early part of the Home Straight when placed under pressure raced greenly.  Between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.  After the event, J Orman advised that from an inside barrier the instructions were to hold a more forward position.  He said TURIN WARRIOR jumped well and was able to obtain a position behind the lead without being pressured to do so.
Crowded at the start.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

When questioned, A Badel stated that when the pace of the event was run outside of standard time he elected to make a forward move from the 1000 Metres to take advantage of its light weight.  He said when EN PERFECTO did not show sufficient pace to cross to lead the event, this resulted in the horse being obliged to race wide and without cover for the remainder of the race.

On jumping was checked when badly crowded between TURIN WARRIOR and THE DOUBLE EAGLE which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  After the 300 Metres was shifted to the inside of THE DOUBLE EAGLE to attempt to obtain clear running.  A short distance later was steadied when disappointed for this run when THE DOUBLE EAGLE lay in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped heavily.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid SUGAR SUGAR.

After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount travelled only fairly throughout the race which he attributed to the racing surface which, in his opinion, had become a little loose due to some rain that had fallen during the  meeting.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start became unbalanced when bumped by LEGENDARY IMPACT which was taken out by SWEET BRIAR.
Crowded shortly after the start.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, M L Yeung stated that his mount settled back in the field and raced keenly due to the race being run outside of standard time and as a result was unable to make ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Making the Home Turn was taken wider by A AMERIC TE SPECSO which shifted out to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
In the early stages raced keenly as its rider K Teetan endeavoured to obtain cover.  TOP THRONE was unable to obtain cover and raced wide and without cover for the majority of event.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that from a wide barrier he had no specific instructions where to settle.  He said when his mount jumped only fairly he elected to allow AUTUMN VIBES to settle with cover behind midfield.  He said making the Home Turn AUTUMN VIBES, which was hanging in, made contact with MOUNT EVEREST when he shifted to the outside of GOLDEN LUCK.  He said in the Home Straight AUTUMN VIBES then continued to hang in and proved reluctant to improve between TOP THRONE and MOUNT EVEREST.  He added AUTUMN VIBES would derive benefit from today’s race experience and may also appreciate being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of H T Mo, 6th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in, made contact with HAPPY TANGO and lost ground.

After the event, J Orman stated that his instructions were to either lead or hold an on-pace position.  He said despite riding his mount along in the early stages GOLDEN LUCK did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 500 Metres was bumped by GALLANT CROWN which shifted out to improve.  After the 200 Metres commenced to lay in, resulting in its rider Apprentice P N Wong changing her whip through to her right hand.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.

Jumped only fairly.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, SWEET SMILE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

After the event, R Kingscote stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a midfield position in the early stages.  He said from his wide barrier he was obliged to settle slightly further back to avoid racing wide.
Bumped at the start.  After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages.
Near the 550 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by TOP THRONE which lay in when racing greenly despite the efforts of its rider.

On jumping was bumped by DRALA which shifted out slightly.  After the event, K De Melo stated that when he was concerned there was something amiss with his mount in the Home Straight he did not ride it out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, FOXHUNTER KING will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

After arriving at the starting gates was examined by the Veterinary Officer, found to be lame in the left front leg and was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice INVINCIBLE LUCKY was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, INVINCIBLE LUCKY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

M L Yeung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1100 Metres (see GALLANT CROWN).  After the event, M L Yeung reported that his mount, in his opinion, would be better suited by being dropped back to 1400 Metres for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 1100 Metres was steadied when racing in restricted room to the inside of BEAUTY LIVE.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

M L Yeung (KINGLY DEMEANOR) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of NAMJONG KINGDOM, resulting in NAMJONG KINGDOM being taken in and crowding GALLANT CROWN, resulting in GALLANT CROWN being checked away from the heels of NAMJONG KINGDOM.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 23 March 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to obtain cover. He said his mount raced keenly in the early and middle stages before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Eased near the 1100 Metres when crowded.  When giving ground near the 400 Metres was eased when momentarily crowded between GALLANT CROWN and BABY SATELLITE which shifted out and away from KINGLY DEMEANOR.   After the event, H Bowman stated that from a wide barrier he was given the option of obtaining a more forward position.  He said when NAMJONG KINGDOM commenced well he elected to allow that runner to stride forward and race towards the lead.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NAMJONG KINGDOM was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, NAMJONG KINGDOM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on veterinary advice when it was found to be distressed prior to entering the Parade Ring.  Before being allowed to race again, LITTLE SQUID will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 8.3.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY AGAIN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped by AKASHVANI which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between SURUGA BAY and ISLAND BUDDY which shifted in slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was bumped by SUNNY DARLING which shifted out.  Between the 450 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running when being shifted to the outside of FLASH CURRENT.
No report.

After the event, K De Melo stated that under pressure in the Home Straight ALWAYS FLUKE hung in and proved difficult to ride out. <10/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> The Veterinary Officer reported that ALWAYS FLUKE was lame in its left hind leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, ALWAYS FLUKE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  When questioned, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to hold an on-pace position or lead if possible.  She said in the early stages when she observed a number of runners to her outside go forward she elected to allow ISLAND BUDDY to cross her mount leaving the 1000 Metres.  She said shortly afterwards SUNNY DARLING commenced to race keenly and as a result she was obliged to shift to the outside of ISLAND BUDDY to avoid that runner’s heels which resulted in SUNNY DARLING making contact with COMMANDING MISSILE and SUNNY DARLING then being obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter when it improved to the outside of SEA EMERALD.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to hold a position to the inside of ISLAND BUDDY, Apprentice Wong agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect this would have been a better option for her.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, K Teetan stated that his mount was disadvantaged when it settled behind midfield with the early and middle stages of the event being run outside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Knuckled over on jumping and shortly afterwards was crowded by COMMANDING MISSILE which shifted out.

Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event, D McDonogh stated that his mount hung out throughout the race and proved difficult to control.  The racing manners of BEAUTY FORMULA were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY FORMULA will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong.

Near the 900 Metres SUNNY DARLING (Apprentice P N Wong) commenced to race keenly after being crossed by ISLAND BUDDY.  As a result, SUNNY DARLING was shifted to the outside of ISLAND BUDDY to avoid that runner’s heels and as a result made contact with COMMANDING MISSILE which became unbalanced.  COMMANDING MISSILE was then steadied to obtain cover behind SUNNY DARLING to avoid racing wide and without cover.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running behind CALIFORNIA ICON.
No report.

Jumped only fairly, shifted out, made contact with SUPER BABY and as a result lost ground.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, L Hewitson stated that after placing his mount under pressure near the 450 Metres he then elected to shift in to follow MULTIDARLING with a view to improving to that runner’s inside near the 300 Metres.  He said his decision to do so was influenced by the fact that SUPER BABY and WISDOM STAR were not improving into the event and if he followed those runners his mount may not have obtained clear running.  He added after improving to the inside of MULTIDARLING near the 250 Metres his intention was to obtain clear running inside JOYFUL LIFE but when that runner shifted in after the 200 Metres he was obliged to ease and shift to the outside of JOYFUL LIFE where his mount obtained clear running after the 150 Metres and finished the race off reasonably well thereafter.

Over the final 150 Metres lay in, resulting in its rider M Chadwick changing his whip through to his right hand near the 100 Metres.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that after settling back in the field as expected PERFECT PEACH found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight, particularly with the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.  Lay in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed that from the outside barrier he had instructed Jockey A Hamelin to ride LAPRAS in a conservative manner in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  After the event, D McDonogh expressed concern with his mount’s action during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping and became unbalanced.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her mount did not travel strongly during the event and when placed under pressure in the Home Straight gave ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER BABY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with LOOKS OUTSTANDING.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.
Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Crowded at the start between CHILL KAKA and JOLLY COMPANION, both of which shifted ground.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping made contact with the left side of its barrier, became unbalanced and lost ground.  After the event, J Orman explained that when his mount jumped away awkwardly it settled further back than what had been intended.
Crowded at the start by FORTUNE WARRIOR which shifted in.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by VULCANUS which shifted out, resulting in JUDY’S GREAT becoming unbalanced.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on JUDY’S GREAT at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, JUDY’S GREAT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned, M Chadwick stated that his mount travelled fairly in the early stages.  He said near the 600 Metres he placed OFFROAD MASTER under pressure but it did not respond to his riding and in the Home Straight he eased it down when he felt that there may be something amiss with his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right front leg and also to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, OFFROAD MASTER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.  When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer Y S Tsui stated that today’s win had come as a surprise to him.  He said the only explanation he could offer for the improved performance was that THE AUSPICIOUS was suited by settling back in the field when the middle stages of the event was run inside of standard time and being advantaged by coming to the outside and receiving clear running in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of GALLANT EPOCH.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After the event, H Bowman stated that he was given the option of holding an on-pace position.  He said after commencing well and when caught wide he elected to continue forward to race outside the lead rather than covering additional ground.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After being crossed by ETALON OR approaching the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from that runner.  A Badel pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see WROTE A NEW PAGE).
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a minor laceration to the right hind cannon.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Crowded at the start by JOLLY JUMPER which shifted in.  A Badel (JOLLY JUMPER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of WROTE A NEW PAGE, resulting in WROTE A NEW PAGE being crowded for room for some distance after the 200 Metres and having to be checked.  A Badel was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 26 March 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
Jumped awkwardly and got its head up.  Leaving the 200 Metres was eased to avoid THE AUSPICIOUS (M L Yeung) which shifted in.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care.

For some distance near the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of WROTE A NEW PAGE and made contact with that runner leaving the 200 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid BOMBUS.  For some distance approaching the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  Leaving the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between STRATHPEFFER and WROTE A NEW PAGE.  Approaching the 150 Metres was then steadied when disappointed between SUNNY Q and WROTE A NEW PAGE and as a result was not able to be tested until near the 50 Metres.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with BOMBUS.  After the event, B Thompson stated that from an inside barrier and his mount stepping up in distance he was given the option of holding a more forward position.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Fractious in the starting gates.  Before being allowed to race again, RICH HORSE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Crowded on jumping by THE AUSPICIOUS which shifted in after making contact with STELLAR SWIFT.
Bumped at the start.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, K De Melo stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position and lead if the pace was not too strong.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the inside of SELF IMPROVEMENT, the rider of SELF IMPROVEMENT Apprentice P N Wong showed intent on continuing forward to cross.  He said he was of the opinion that had he continued to persist to hold the lead this would result in the pace being too fast and therefore he elected to allow SELF IMPROVEMENT to cross.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions issued and stated that given the early stages of the event were run outside of standard time he would have preferred for MASK RIDER to hold the lead.  After considering Jockey De Melo’s explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by him were reasonable in the circumstances.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Fractious in the barriers, removed and passed suitable to race.  Before being allowed to race again, SHINYU KOKOROE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Jumped only fairly.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount lay out in the middle stages rounding the turns.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
No report.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
After the race, the Veterinary Surgeon reported that CALL TO COMMAND was a "roarer”.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount finished the race off in a one-paced manner under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M Chadwick reported that from the outside barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said, in his opinion, MAGIC CONTROL did not run out a strong 1200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between DROMBEG BANNER and LUCKY WITH YOU which shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After being crossed by DROMBEG BANNER near the 900 Metres got its head up.  Over the concluding stages raced tight between TAJ DRAGON and MAGIC CONTROL which shifted in slightly.

Approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind GRACIOUS EXPRESS before improving to that runner’s outside leaving the 300 Metres, resulting in ARMOUR WAR EAGLE making contact with C YEAH.  L Hewitson pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 300 Metres (see LIGHTNESS OF BEING).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 100 Metres lay in under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Prior to declaring weighed-in K Teetan viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were grounds for a protest/objection against MAGNIFICENT NINE.  When Jockey Teetan declined to lodge a protest/objection and the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds to do so, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Over the final 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of MAGNIFICENT NINE which shifted in slightly and near the winning post brushed with MAGNIFICENT NINE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 200 Metres lay out under pressure.
Blundered shortly after the start. Between the 400 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 300 Metres was taken wider by LOST CHILD.

After the event, J Orman stated that his mount was one-paced when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and, in his opinion, may be better suited by being ridden more conservatively in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
Near the 200 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of FREE PONY to continue into clear running.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied to avoid LIGHTNESS OF BEING.  After the event, M L Yeung stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.

Approaching the 300 Metres was bumped by ARMOUR WAR EAGLE which shifted out and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, R Kingscote stated that the instructions were to obtain an on-pace position.
Jumped only fairly and then bumped with LIGHTNESS OF BEING.
No report.

Bumped shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  L Hewitson (ARMOUR WAR EAGLE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 300 Metres he shifted his mount to the outside of GRACIOUS EXPRESS when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in ARMOUR WAR EAGLE making contact with C YEAH, resulting in C YEAH becoming unbalanced and being taken out across the running of LIGHTNESS OF BEING, resulting in LIGHTNESS OF BEING having to be checked.  L Hewitson was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 26 March 2025 and to expire on Monday, 31 March 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 50 Metres brushed with LO RIDER due to both runners shifting ground.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Bumped on jumping.  In the early stages raced keenly.  For a short distance near the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind WINNING DRAGON.

Near the 250 Metres was crowded by FASHION LEGEND when that runner shifted in.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount jumped well from the inside barrier and was able to obtain a more forward position without being pressured to do so.

Shortly after the start raced tight between RUN YES RUN and GAMEPLAYER ELITE which shifted in slightly.  Near the 900 Metres was momentarily crowded by GAMEPLAYER ELITE (H Bowman) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  Over the final 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of GAMEPLAYER ELITE and approaching the winning post was steadied when crowded by GAMEPLAYER ELITE.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded between RACINGRACE and RUN YES RUN which shifted in slightly.  From the 300 Metres until near the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.  Over the concluding stages was steadied when crowded between MOTOMAN (J Orman) which shifted out slightly and YEE CHEONG SPIRIT which raced tight to the inside of GAMEPLAYER ELITE (H Bowman) which shifted in.  H Bowman was severely reprimanded.  J Orman was reprimanded.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, R Kingscote stated that his instructions were to take up a forward position if possible.  He said he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to comply with the instructions which resulted in FASHION LEGEND being unable to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  Trainer D Eustace confirmed the instructions issued.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded between LUCKY GENERATIONS and FASHION LEGEND, both of which shifted ground slightly.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount came under pressure leaving the 600 Metres and finished the race off only fairly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Between the 300 Metres and the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.
Bumped on jumping.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Crowded shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that the instructions were to hold an on-pace position with cover.  He said after being crowded shortly after the start RUN YES RUN settled further back than anticipated.

Fractious in the starting gates and momentarily got its right front leg over the barrier partition.  Was removed and examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was suitable to race.  Before being allowed to race again, IRON LEGION will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded by ICONICAL which, after improving to the inside of FASHION LEGEND (R Kingscote), was taken in by that runner.  R Kingscote was severely reprimanded and advised he must stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between VON BAER and KARATE EXPRESS, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.

After the event, H Bentley stated that the intention was to hold a slightly more forward position but despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to do so.  He added that after being held up between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres RUN RUN TIMING finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after the start became badly unbalanced, got its head up and lost ground after being contacted on the hindquarters.

When questioned, R Kingscote stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He said after jumping awkwardly and being badly crowded by SPICY SO SMART which shifted out abruptly, his mount lost ground.  He said having regard to his instructions he allowed KING ALLOY to go forward in the early stages and entering the Back Straight his intention was to endeavour to cross CHAMPION METHOD.  He said when his mount failed to show sufficient pace to do so it was left racing very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  R Kingscote agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he would have been better suited by riding his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages after receiving interference at the start.

Near the 750 Metres shifted in towards GLORY B and shortly after was steadied away from that runner when GLORY B shifted out slightly.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover until near the 500 Metres and raced a little keenly with blinkers being applied for the second time.  He added CHAMPION METHOD may be better suited by being dropped back in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.
No report.

Near the 1100 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of INTREPID WINNER when INTREPID WINNER went amiss.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
In the early stages raced ungenerously when being steadied in an attempt to obtain cover behind INTREPID WINNER.

Approaching the 1300 Metres was steadied to avoid THE AZURE.  Near the 1100 Metres was checked to avoid INTREPID WINNER when INTREPID WINNER went amiss. <13/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> The Veterinary Surgeon reported that SMART CITY was lame in its right front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, SMART CITY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Slow to begin.  Near the 1300 Metres became unbalanced when crowded by AMAZING AWARD which, after improving to the inside of THE AZURE (L Ferraris), was then taken in by THE AZURE before THE AZURE was corrected by its rider.  A short distance later, SUPER TREASURE (Y L Chung) shifted in, resulting in THE AZURE then racing tight to the inside of SUPER TREASURE.  Both L Ferraris and Y L Chung were advised to exercise more care.  Near the 1100 Metres was steadied away from INTREPID WINNER when INTREPID WINNER went amiss.
Jumped awkwardly.  Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight.

Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For some distance after the 300 Metres raced tight to the inside of RUN RUN SMART when that runner shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  Passing the 150 Metres EASON raced tight to the inside of ABSOLUTE HONOUR.  Near the 100 Metres H Bowman dropped his left rein.  Over the concluding stages raced tight to the inside of YOUTHFUL SPIRITS.
Bumped at the start.
No report.
Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with PRINCE OF PORTY.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was bumped by CIRCUIT JOLLY.
For some distance approaching the 200 Metres Y L Chung dropped his left rein.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.    A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  Making the Home Turn was bumped by CHATEAUNEUF and shifted in when it became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when racing in restricted room between CHATEAUNEUF and LUCKY EIGHT.

The Stewards inquired into an incident making the Home Turn where CHATEAUNEUF shifted to the outside of SPORTS LEGEND and made contact with BEAUTY INFINITY for some distance thereafter.  After considering all the evidence, the Stewards determined that H Bowman, the rider of CHATEAUNEUF, was entitled to improve to the outside of SPORTS LEGEND and as he did so CHATEAUNEUF and BEAUTY INFINITY made contact which then resulted in BEAUTY INFINITY shifting in and crowding the running of CHATEAUNEUF shortly after.  CHATEAUNEUF then raced in restricted room between SPORTS LEGEND and BEAUTY INFINITY between the 300 Metres and the 100 Metres where it was steadied when crowded between SPORTS LEGEND (H T Mo) and BEAUTY INFINITY (B Avdulla), both of which shifted ground.  Both H T Mo and B Avdulla were advised to exercise more care.  Over the concluding stages was then not able to be ridden to the finish when placed close to the heels of BEAUTY INFINITY.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Approaching the 100 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of CHATEAUNEUF to continue into clear running.

After the event, A Atzeni stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued and stated that with WRITTEN CASA stepping up in class tonight he was of the opinion that from a wide barrier this was the best option for the horse to allow it to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with BEAUTY INFINITY.  Near the 700 Metres was eased when being crossed by LUCKY EIGHT.  Near the 200 Metres was disappointed for clear running between YOUNG ARROW and POSITIVE SMILE, both of which shifted out slightly.

After the event, M Chadwick stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the lead but gave ground when under pressure in the Home Straight and he could offer no explanation in relation to its performance.  Trainer W K Mo stated that, in his opinion, CALIFORNIA TOUCH was not suited by SPORTS LEGEND being positioned to its outside throughout the early and middle stages of the event, particularly with the race being run slightly inside of standard time through those sections of the race.  He also stated that CALIFORNIA TOUCH may have been disadvantaged by this being its second start after a long break from racing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of CALIFORNIA TOUCH was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA TOUCH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <13/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> CALIFORNIA TOUCH, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. CALIFORNIA TOUCH was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer W K Mo this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. As previously advised, CALIFORNIA TOUCH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1150 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of NEBRASKAN.
Near the 100 Metres was directed to the inside of NEBRASKAN to continue into clear running.

Jumped awkwardly and shortly afterwards was bumped by GLORY CLOUD which shifted out.  Passing the 50 Metres was momentarily crowded between NEBRASKAN and FIND MY LOVE which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

H T Mo (THE DOUBLE EAGLE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that shortly after the start whilst riding his mount along he permitted THE DOUBLE EAGLE to shift out when insufficiently clear of TELECOM DRAGON, resulting in TELECOM DRAGON being crowded out onto LUCKY ARCHANGEL and resulting in LUCKY ARCHANGEL having to be checked when crowded between TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR and TELECOM DRAGON.  H T Mo was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 26 March 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.   After the event, M F Poon stated that the instructions were to endeavour to hold an on-pace position but after being crowded shortly after the start his mount was unable to maintain a more forward position.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Hung out making the first turn.  B Avdulla was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 800 Metres (see KA YING POWER).  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover from the 600 Metres and as a result did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was crowded between LUCKY ARCHANGEL and THE DOUBLE EAGLE which shifted out.  Near the 550 Metres was bumped by KA YING POWER.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of FIND MY LOVE to continue into clear running.  Passing the 200 Metres was shifted to the inside of GLORY CLOUD to continue into clear running.

B Avdulla (GLORY CLOUD) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 800 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of KA YING POWER, resulting in KA YING POWER having to be checked to avoid GLORY CLOUD and losing its running.  After considering the evidence, the Stewards found Jockey Avdulla to be guilty of the charge but having regard to the circumstances of the incident and the low range of carelessness B Avdulla was reprimanded.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that although his mount was crowded near the 900 Metres it was still disappointing in its failure to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Making the first turn got its head up when racing keenly.

H T Mo pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference shortly after the start (see LUCKY ARCHANGEL).  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of THE DOUBLE EAGLE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, THE DOUBLE EAGLE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

WINNING STEPS was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P C Ng this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right hind leg. Before being allowed to race again, WINNING STEPS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when it lay in whilst being shifted to the outside of LEATHER MASTER to obtain clear running.

Jumped awkwardly and then from a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For a short distance near the 450 Metres was held up behind MR GOOD VIBES.

After the event, M Chadwick confirmed that from a wide barrier and with his mount stepping up in distance he was requested to lead if possible.  He said when his mount did not show sufficient pace to cross RED MAVERICK he elected to obtain a position outside that runner in the early stages before giving ground in the Home Straight.  He added that SILVER DESTINY would be better suited by being dropped back in distance for its next race start.

Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race. As this was the second occasion that RED MAVERICK had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
