On jumping was hampered when taken out by SILVER DESTINY.  From the outside barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, H Bowman stated that when under pressure in the Home Straight he had some concern with the action of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount came under pressure in the middle stages, did not finish the race off thereafter and was eased down in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MR GOOD VIBES, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MR GOOD VIBES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted in at the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  When questioned, L Ferraris stated that the instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He said in the early stages he was obliged to make some use of his mount to cross runners to his inside which resulted in WORLD HERO leading and racing a little keenly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 50 Metres was directed to the outside of WORLD HERO to continue into clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then from the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight, K Teetan stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said after settling back in the field near the 500 Metres he elected to remain racing behind GALLANT GOODY with a view to following that runner into the race and obtaining a run to the inside of URBAN TRIUMPH which he had expected to give ground.  He stated that his decision to do so was influenced by the fact that SUPER EAGLE was racing first up for 101 days and he did not wish to expose his mount too soon.  He added that when URBAN TRIUMPH continued to respond to its rider’s efforts he then became held up behind GALLANT GOODY between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres and once he shifted to the outside of URBAN TRIUMPH his mount finished the race off well.  After considering his explanation the Stewards advised Jockey Teetan that, in their opinion, his better option would have been to shift to the outside of GALLANT GOODY near the 500 Metres to follow URBAN TRIUMPH into the event to provide SUPER EAGLE with clear running sooner than what it obtained on this occasion.

Between the 400 Metres and the 150 Metres raced tight to the inside of FAIRY HORSE as it endeavoured to obtain a narrow run to that runner’s inside.  After the event, R Kingscote reported that after beginning only fairly ALMIGHTY KICK settled slightly further back than anticipated.

Shortly after the start was crowded between BULB EMPEROR and WORLD HERO which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
Jumped awkwardly and became unbalanced.  Trainer K L Man advised that the instructions were to take up a midfield position with cover.
After travelling a short distance became unbalanced when racing in restricted room between THE CONCENTRATION and BULB EMPEROR.
Slow to begin.

After the event, A Badel stated that his mount was disadvantaged by racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, C L Chau reported that after being crowded at the start his mount travelled satisfactorily during the race.  He said when he placed the horse under pressure in the Home Straight it failed to respond to his riding and when not in a competitive position he eased it down over the final 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, BULB EMPEROR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount did not handle the "Good to Yielding” track conditions. Before being allowed to race again, EXCEL WONGCHOY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 200 Metres was momentarily crowded by KAHOLO ANGEL which lay in. The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, IGOT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued and stated that SHINY RAPIDASH had been slow out of the starting gates at its previous race starts and was able to take up a more forward position today when it jumped well.

No report.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount, which was having its first race start, raced greenly throughout the event and hung out before giving ground over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners of GO GENERAL were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GO GENERAL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial.

On jumping was bumped by NOBLE DELUXE which shifted in.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily during the early and middle stages but when asked for an effort near the 250 Metres did not respond to his riding and gave ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on jumping.  Lay out in the Home Straight and near the 150 Metres shifted out, resulting in its rider H Bentley having to stop riding, straighten and pull his whip through to his left hand.  After the event, H Bentley reported that with his mount starting from an inside barrier he was given the option of holding a more forward position.  He said when HONG LOK GOLF commenced well and the early stages of the race were run outside of standard time he was able to lead the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the Home Straight lay in.  Near the 200 Metres shifted in, resulting in its rider B Avdulla having to stop riding and straighten.  Again near the 100 Metres B Avdulla was required to stop riding and straighten when SKY JEWELLERY continued to lay in.  Over the concluding stages B Avdulla dropped his right rein.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier, became unbalanced and lost ground.  In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 650 Metres was steadied when positioned close to REZEKI.
No report.
No report.
On jumping was bumped on the hindquarters by SKY TRUST and became unbalanced.

Shifted out at the start and got its head up when being corrected by its rider.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SKY TRUST.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
On jumping was crowded between FIGHTING MACHINE and AMAZING VICTORY.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with HONG LOK GOLF.  After the event, L Ferraris stated that his mount raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and as a result did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded at the start.  After the event, L Hewitson confirmed that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.

After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between CALIFORNIA MOXIE and SOLAR GOGO, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Had its left front plate refitted in the holding stables, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Over the final 200 Metres shifted out under pressure, resulting in its rider L Hewitson changing his whip through to his left hand near the 100 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Made the Home Turn awkwardly, shifted out and brushed with CALIFORNIA MOXIE.  Near the 300 Metres CALIFORNIA MOXIE and VERBIER made contact due to both runners shifting ground, resulting in VERBIER becoming unbalanced.  After the event, L Ferraris confirmed that from the outside barrier and with his mount stepping up in distance he was instructed to ride it in a forward position.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued and said VERBIER had performed well in its most recent barrier trials when ridden in the lead.
Approaching the 1400 Metres became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of SOLAR GOGO which shifted in and away from HARRY’S HERO.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.

Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.  Near the 300 Metres shifted in slightly, made contact with VERBIER and became unbalanced.  When commencing to give ground near the 50 Metres shifted in slightly and made contact with WINDICATOR FAMILY when that runner shifted out under pressure slightly.  After the event, H Bowman reported that his mount was able to obtain a position outside the lead in the early stages but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded shortly after the start.
When caught wide in the early stages was shifted across behind runners.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover until near the 700 Metres.

Jumped awkwardly.  Approaching the 200 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of SOLAR GOGO to continue into clear running.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount did not travel well during the race and did not run on in the Home Straight.

After being placed in the starting gates reared and got its right front leg over the front gates for some period of time.  Acting on veterinary advice that MR ALADDIN was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  The Stewards ruled that MR ALADDIN will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in a barrier trial and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left hind cannon injury).  Before being allowed to race again, SUPERB MOVE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that leaving the 600 Metres his mount shifted out and became unbalanced when reluctant to hold its position to the inside of SAL.  He added that near the 350 Metres his mount again became unbalanced when reluctant to hold its position to the inside of HEROIC MASTER and as a result lost ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The racing manners of SPARKLING FELLOW were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPARKLING FELLOW will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong from an inside barrier and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with WATCH THIS ONE.  Leaving the 600 Metres shifted out and away from SPARKLING FELLOW and was steadied to avoid HEROIC MASTER.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with EXCELLENT PEERS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Approaching the 300 Metres was held up when it lay in and was reluctant to shift to the outside of MY DAY MY WAY.  As a result, GOOD PROSPECT was held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.  GOOD PROSPECT continued to lay in when placed under pressure over the final 200 Metres.  After the event, K C Leung reported that his mount shifted in on jumping, made contact with the right side of its barrier and lost ground.  He added that this resulted in his foot shifting in his right stirrup and near the 150 Metres he was obliged to reposition his foot in his stirrup using his right hand.

Jumped only fairly and made contact with VIGOR ELLEEGANT.  Near the 250 Metres was briefly held up when obtaining a tight run between MY INTELLIGENT and VIGOR ELLEEGANT which shifted in and away from LUCKY BLESSING.  Leaving the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between MY INTELLIGENT and LUCKY BLESSING which, after being taken in by MY DAY MY WAY (C L Chau), then shifted in and away from that runner slightly.  C L Chau was reprimanded and advised he must stop riding and straighten his mounts sooner than what he did on this occasion.
Bumped at the start.
Leaving the 150 Metres was crowded by MY DAY MY WAY.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when racing tight to the inside of GOOD PROSPECT which shifted in.
Near the 1000 Metres was eased when momentarily crowded by BRAVE JOY which shifted in slightly.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

On jumping was bumped by GOOD PROSPECT.  When questioned, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said when complying with his instructions approaching the 1000 Metres YOUNG HORIZON got its head up and was eased when racing in restricted room to the inside of GOOD PROSPECT.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight Apprentice Wong stated that when he observed NEVER TOO SOON shift out on the Home Turn he then immediately elected to shift to that runner’s inside to obtain clear running.  He said as he was improving to the inside of NEVER TOO SOON that runner shifted in, resulting in YOUNG HORIZON being taken in and being held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.  He added near the 200 Metres his mount then became held up behind MY INTELLIGENT and after being crowded by NEVER TOO SOON near the 100 Metres did not obtain clear running thereafter.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Apprentice Wong were reasonable in the circumstances.
Near the 600 Metres was eased to avoid BEAUTY THUNDER (A Hamelin) which shifted in when not clear.  A Hamelin was reprimanded.

On jumping made contact with NEVER TOO SOON and became unbalanced.  After the event, M F Poon reported that from a wide barrier he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to lead and as a result VIGOR ELLEEGANT did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found the horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  Before being allowed to race again, VIGOR ELLEEGANT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  For a short distance near the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind SUPER CONTENTED.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Trainer C S Shum confirmed that from the outside barrier he had instructed M F Poon to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages to avoid racing wide.

Near the 1500 Metres, when laying in, was steadied when crowded between NINJA DERBY and RED MAJESTY (H Bowman) which was racing tight to the inside of PANDA LEGEND (K Teetan) which shifted in.  Both H Bowman and K Teetan were reprimanded and advised that they should make a greater effort to prevent their mounts from shifting in when not clear of CASA ROCHESTER.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that his mount lay in in the early stages.

Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of H Bowman, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.
Approaching the 1200 Metres was eased when  momentarily crowded by RED MAJESTY (H Bowman) which shifted in when not clear.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped heavily by PANDA LEGEND which shifted out slightly, resulting in BLUE BARON becoming unbalanced and losing ground.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
Near the 1300 Metres momentarily raced tight to the inside of CASA ROCHESTER which continued to lay in.
No report.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped heavily.  When commencing to give ground approaching the 250 Metres lay in and was steadied away from RED MAJESTY which shifted out slightly.  After the event, K Teetan advised that his instructions were to take up a forward position.  He added that, in his opinion, PANDA LEGEND was not suited by him having to make use of his mount in the early stages to comply with his instructions which resulted in PANDA LEGEND giving ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions to allow PANDA LEGEND to follow RED MAJESTY across to offset the wide barrier as RED MAJESTY was an expected on-pace runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was crowded between GOLDEN RISE and GALLANT VALOUR and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out shortly after the start and made contact with SUPER JOY N FUN.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running between HAYDAY and SUPER JOY N FUN.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Trainer C Fownes confirmed that from the outside barrier Apprentice E C W Wong was given the option of going forward if SUGAR SUGAR jumped well.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and bumped with CALIFORNIA DEEPLY.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer W K Mo stated that at its most recent start the horse was disadvantaged when it jumped only fairly and the rider was obliged to make use of SPICY SPANGLE in the early stages.  He said tonight SPICY SPANGLE was advantaged by drawing an inside barrier and being able to trail the lead without being pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Crowded on jumping.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Leaving the 600 Metres was taken wider when PLENTIFUL shifted to the outside of FUN N FUN TOGETHER.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with SUPER SIXTY.

Between the 150 Metres and the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of PLENTIFUL (M F Poon) which lay in.  Near the 100 Metres FUN N FUN TOGETHER was then steadied to avoid PLENTIFUL which continued to shift in.  M F Poon was reprimanded and advised that he is required to make a greater effort to prevent his mounts from shifting in when not clear.

After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to hold a more forward position but after jumping only fairly his mount did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.
No report.

Bumped on jumping.  Approaching the 250 Metres was disappointed for clear running between REGAL GEM and GALLANT VALOUR, both of which shifted ground.  In this incident, NORDIC DRAGON made contact with GALLANT VALOUR and became unbalanced.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shifted in shortly after the start despite the efforts of its rider and made contact with GALLANT VALOUR.  Raced keenly in the early stages.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with NORDIC DRAGON.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shortly after the start was crowded between HAYDAY which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider and SUPER JOY N FUN which shifted out and away from GOLDEN RISE.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped by NORDIC DRAGON and became unbalanced.  After the event, B Avdulla could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 900 Metres improved to the inside of GALLANT VALOUR and shortly afterwards was steadied when momentarily crowded by GALLANT VALOUR which shifted in.  PRAWNS ELEVEN then raced keenly for some distance thereafter.  After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount was unable to cross runners to its inside in the early stages and as a result settled further back than what he had anticipated.  He added that in the Home Straight PRAWNS ELEVEN did not respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, PRAWNS ELEVEN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Crowded at the start between STORM RIDER and SUGAR SUGAR, both of which shifted ground slightly.

After the event, M L Yeung stated that the instructions were to hold a forward position but when unable to cross runners in the early stages his mount raced wide and without cover throughout the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Apprentice E C W Wong (HARMONY N BLESSED) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of BRAVE STAR, resulting in BRAVE STAR being taken in onto GUSTOSISIMO, resulting in GUSTOSISIMO being badly crowded for room, becoming unbalanced and making contact with STELLAR EXPRESS, also resulting in STELLAR EXPRESS being crowded for room.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 30 March 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.   Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Bumped on jumping.  In the Home Straight lay in under pressure.  Near the 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a tight run between SUPERB CAPITALIST and HARMONY N BLESSED.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Apprentice E C W Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1000 Metres (see GUSTOSISIMO).
Jumped awkwardly.
Shortly after the start was bumped by FULL CREDIT.

Shortly after the start was crowded between SUPERB CAPITALIST and SON PAK FU, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Near the 1000 Metres was crowded between GUSTOSISIMO and BUNDLE OF CHARM.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, L Hewitson stated that from barrier 7 with the anticipated fast early pace he was given the option of riding the horse in a conservative manner if it did not jump well and show sufficient pace to cross runners to its inside.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued and stated that FULL CREDIT was disappointing in its failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.

After the event, A Badel stated that from a wide barrier he was obliged to make some use of his mount in the early stages to go forward.  He said as a result BRAVE STAR finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
For some distance in the early part of the Home Straight lay in and was held up when reluctant to shift to the outside of CASHISCASH.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, C L Chau stated that the intention was to hold a midfield position.  He said from barrier 1 ZETTA FORCE jumped well and travelled strongly in the early stages due to it not racing since 31 January 2025.  He said as a consequence his mount raced more forward than had been intended.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 100 Metres K De Melo dropped his whip.
Approaching the 400 Metres was held up when positioned close to the heels of TURIN WARRIOR.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by CASHISCASH which shifted out.  R Kingscote was issued with a warning for presenting to scale to weigh out with the incorrect saddle cloth number.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 200 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when endeavouring to improve to the outside of SUPER EXPRESS.

On jumping was crowded by DRALA and ALWAYS MY FOLKS, both of which shifted ground.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Briefly held up behind THE HEIR near the 400 Metres.  Between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  Passing the 200 Metres was shifted to the inside of ICONICAL to secure clear running.  Then over the final 50 Metres could not be fully ridden out when positioned close to CASHISCASH.

Near the 400 Metres was hampered when taken wider by FORTUNE BOY.  After the event, H Bentley stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to find a position midfield with cover if possible.  He said when TOP DRAGON was caught wide and without cover in the early stages he was obliged to restrain his mount to race towards the rear of the field to avoid covering additional ground.  He added that under pressure in the Home Straight TOP DRAGON responded only fairly to his riding and he attributed it to the horse settling further back in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of TOP DRAGON was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP DRAGON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.

After travelling a short distance was bumped by TURIN WARRIOR which lay out despite the efforts of its rider.  After the 400 Metres was hampered when bumped by THE HEIR (J Moreira) which shifted to the outside of TURIN WARRIOR to improve.  J Moreira was advised to exercise more care.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
After travelling a short distance lay out and made contact with STORM RUNNER.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For a short distance near the 1000 Metres raced keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from PACKING HERMOD.  Near the 900 Metres raced tight to the inside of HEALTHY HAPPY.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of PACKING HERMOD.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that the instructions were to hold a midfield position with cover.  He said at the start DANCING CODE jumped well and when he observed the expected leader in the race HEALTHY HAPPY to not show early speed he elected to allow DANCING CODE to cross runners to his inside to avoid racing wide.  He said after crossing CHIU CHOW SPIRIT near the 1100 Metres DANCING CODE raced keenly and despite his efforts ran inside of standard time between the 1200 Metres and the 400 Metres of the event.  He added that although he was aware DANCING CODE was setting a fast pace he felt in the circumstances he had made sufficient effort to set a more sustainable pace but did not want to apply further pressure as DANCING CODE is light-mouthed and may have over-reacted to further pressure.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with Apprentice Wong’s decision to go forward when caught wide in the early stages.  He added whilst he recognized that DANCING CODE did have a light mouth, he agreed with the Stewards that he felt in the circumstances Apprentice Wong could have made a greater effort to reduce the pace in the middle stages to allow DANCING CODE the opportunity to finish the race off.
Leaving the 1100 Metres was eased to avoid DANCING CODE (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when not clear.  Apprentice Wong was reprimanded.
Jumped only fairly, blundered shortly after the start and lost ground.
No report.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to lead.  She said after beginning only fairly and when the pace of the early stages was run inside of standard time HEALTHY HAPPY did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HEALTHY HAPPY was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, HEALTHY HAPPY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

As the start was effected knuckled over badly, resulting in its rider R Moore becoming badly unbalanced in the saddle and SPIRIT OF PEACE losing significant ground.  As SPIRIT OF PEACE had finished 3rd in the event, acting under the provisions of Rule 12(19) which says no horse which is declared 1st, 2nd, 3rd or 4th shall be so declared a non-runner, the Stewards could not consider the horse had been denied a fair start and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Before being allowed to race again, SPIRIT OF PEACE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  Leaving the 300 Metres was crowded between KINGLY DEMEANOR and DOUBLE WIN.  Near the 50 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of HAROLD WIN and as a result could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Near the 600 Metres became unbalanced when racing tight between LESLIE and SMART FIGHTER.  Held up making the Home Turn.  Over the concluding stages became unbalanced when racing in restricted room between SMART FIGHTER (K Teetan) and LESLIE, both of which shifted ground slightly.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.
Over the concluding stages became unbalanced after initially shifting in slightly and making contact with ANOTHER ZONDA and then racing tight to the inside of SPIRIT OF PEACE which shifted in.
No report.
No report.

Approaching the 150 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between ISLAND BREEZES and LUCKY SAM GOR, both of which shifted ground.  KINGLY DEMEANOR was then held up behind LUCKY SAM GOR for a short distance thereafter.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between LESLIE and ANOTHER ZONDA which was taken in by SMART FIGHTER (K Teetan).  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, J Moreira stated that his mount did not travel well during the event, failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and gave ground over the final 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Leaving the 300 Metres became held up behind ISLAND BREEZES and as a result could not be ridden out for the remainder of the event.

Leaving the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between LESLIE which, after improving to the outside of KINGLY DEMEANOR, was taken out slightly by that runner and CIRCUIT MIGHTY (A Atzeni) which shifted in when laying in.  A Atzeni was reprimanded and advised he must stop riding and straighten his mounts when they commence to shift ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Leaving the 800 Metres was eased when it lay in towards YEE CHEONG SPIRIT when that runner shifted to the outside of KING SHOW.  Near the 100 Metres C L Chau dropped his left rein for a number of strides.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.
No report.

Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out to the finish when racing in restricted room between PARTERRE and ENJOY GOLF, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Near the 200 Metres was eased when crowded between PARTERRE and TEAM HAPPY which shifted in and away from ENJOY GOLF.
Jumped only fairly.

In the middle stages raced keenly.  Near the 900 Metres was steadied away from ENJOY GOLF.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  For some distance near the 150 Metres then raced tight between TEAM HAPPY and GOLDENTRONICMIGHTY which lay in.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, R Moore reported that his mount lay out throughout the middle stages and near the 800 Metres was steadied when it shifted out towards ELEGANT LIFE.
After the 200 Metres shifted in and away from ENJOY GOLF and made contact with QUICK CONTRIBUTION.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground and was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.  Near the 350 Metres was briefly held up for clear running between MAJESTIC DELIGHT and KING SHOW.  Over the final 150 Metres AMAZING RUN then did not secure clear running and as a result could not be fully ridden out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event, C Soumillon reported that his mount did not appreciate the "Good to Firm” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, L Hewitson stated that after the blindfold was removed from the horse in the starting gates it was given full opportunity to jump but reared as the start was effected.  He said as a result ARMOUR WAR EAGLE settled back in the field.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight, L Hewitson stated that when following EVERYONE’S STAR he elected to remain racing behind that runner as he was of the opinion that he would not be able to secure clear running between POPE CODY and TAMRA BLITZ.  He said when POPE CODY commenced to give ground near the 300 Metres he was able to improve to that runner’s inside and obtain clear running to the outside of EVERYONE’S STAR near the 200 Metres where ARMOUR WAR EAGLE finished the race off well.  Having considered his explanation in respect of his riding in the Home Straight the Stewards were satisfied that the option that Jockey Hewitson had taken was reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Bumped at the start.

After being crossed by SOLID IMPACT near the 800 Metres raced keenly for some distance thereafter.  After the event, J Moreira stated that the instructions were to obtain a position midfield with cover.  He said after commencing well and when caught wide in the early stages he elected to continue to improve forward to avoid covering additional ground.  He said as a result EVERYONE’S STAR raced in a more forward position than intended.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded by TAMRA BLITZ which shifted in slightly.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages BEAUTY VIVA then did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  Near the 200 Metres was held up for clear running when endeavouring to obtain a narrow run between SOLID IMPACT and EVERYONE’S STAR.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, TAMRA BLITZ will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, A Badel confirmed that from the outside barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position due to the perceived lack of early pace in the event.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions and the reasons as to why such instructions were issued.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  For some distance near the 500 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from SUNNYVALE and hung out making the Home Turn.
No report.
Hung out making the Home Turn.
On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by DEAL COMPLETED which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that after being badly held up on the Home Turn and then being crowded to the inside of DEAL COMPLETED near the 450 Metres MISTER DAPPER did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 450 Metres MISTER DAPPER (B Avdulla), which was racing keenly, became positioned close to the heels of DEAL COMPLETED when that runner commenced to give ground.  When DEAL COMPLETED then shifted out slightly making the Home Turn MISTER DAPPER improved to the inside of that runner and shortly after raced in restricted room between DEAL COMPLETED and THUNDER BLINK which shifted out slightly.  A short distance later MISTER DAPPER was then taken to the fence by DEAL COMPLETED, resulting in HAPPY DAILY having to be severely checked and GALE SAGA, which was following HAPPY DAILY, also being checked.  As the Stewards were satisfied that B Avdulla had not intentionally positioned his mount to the inside of DEAL COMPLETED and that MISTER DAPPER had improved to the inside of that runner due to it travelling keenly and DEAL COMPLETED initially shifting out as it made the Home Turn, no action was taken.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the event, M Chadwick stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages having its first run for Trainer K L Man.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  After the event, D McDonogh stated that his instructions were to ride his mount along in the early stages to hold a forward position.  The performance of DEAL COMPLETED, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DEAL COMPLETED will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Trainer M Newnham confirmed that from the outside barrier the instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Veterinary Officer reported that the horse had sustained a bone injury to both knees after racing.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING ANGEL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  The Stewards inquired into an incident which occurred in the middle stages where RUBYLOT was positioned tight to the inside of NOISY BOY.  After taking evidence from B Avdulla and C Soumillon, rider of NOISY BOY, the Stewards were satisfied that whilst NOISY BOY had kept RUBYLOT tight during the middle stages of the event, Jockey Soumillon had not ridden outside the requirement of the Rules, however, he was advised, wherever possible, he should ensure that runners positioned to his inside have comfortable racing room.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.  STEPS AHEAD then raced tight between MICKLEY and JOHANNES BRAHMS until near the 150 Metres when it shifted to the inside of MICKLEY to obtain clear running.

He added that due to the wide run in the early stages and the fact that the horse had a hard run at its most recent start on 2 March 2025, NOISY BOY gave ground under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, R Moore stated that the intention from an outside barrier was to ride MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE in a conservative manner.  He said today MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE was reluctant to jump and as a result settled at the tail of the field.  He added that MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE travelled satisfactorily during the event and as he was positioned back in the field he elected to take an inside run making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight.  He added after being briefly held up near the 200 Metres MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE finished the race off well.  He said, in his opinion, MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE may be better suited with a gear change for its next race start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

L Ferraris (MONDIAL) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 1600 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of PACKING TURBINE, resulting in PACKING TURBINE being taken in onto MIDORI GIANT and causing PACKING HURRICANE to be checked.  After assessing the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and having regard to his excellent race riding record, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty to be a reprimand.  After the event, K Teetan advised the intention was to hold a more forward position but after jumping only fairly and his mount being crowded near the 1600 Metres it settled further back in the field than intended.
No report.

When questioned, H T Mo stated that his instructions were to hold a handy position with cover.  He said in the early stages his mount was hampered when PACKING HURRICANE shifted out slightly which resulted in WINNING WING settling further back than intended.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, H T Mo stated that near the 400 Metres he endeavoured to obtain clear running between PACKING HURRICANE and SOLID WIN, however, when SOLID WIN shifted in slightly, he was obliged to check his mount near the 300 Metres when disappointed for this run.  He added near the 200 Metres he then directed his mount to the outside of SOLID WIN but again was obliged to check his mount passing the 200 Metres which resulted in WINNING WING losing significant momentum and becoming unbalanced before being able to obtain clear running near the 100 Metres where it finished the race off reasonably well.  The Stewards advised Jockey Mo that in the early part of the Home Straight he had been positioned too close to the heels of PACKING HURRICANE and he should ride his mounts with better judgement in future.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  After the 1600 Metres was steadied to avoid WINNING WING.
For some distance near the 1600 Metres raced tight to the inside of PACKING TURBINE.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event, H Bowman reported that his mount blundered near the 1200 Metres and he was not then satisfied with its action thereafter.  He added after placing SKY HEART under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight, when he was concerned that his mount was not responding and there may be something amiss with SKY HEART, he then eased it down from the event over the final 300 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The Stewards determined that before being allowed to race again, SKY HEART will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments. <26/3/2025 23 March 2025 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 10 (533)> As part of the official veterinary examination process the horse has undergone diagnostic imaging which has revealed minor changes to both front fetlock joints that will be managed under veterinary supervision.  SKY HEART will continue to be monitored and will undergo an additional assessment by a Veterinary Officer later in the week.

After the event, Y L Chung advised that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead by PRAY FOR MIR and as a result did not finish the race off when asked for an effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

L Ferraris pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 1600 Metres (see PACKING HURRICANE). After the event, L Ferraris advised that with blinkers being applied today he was instructed to take up a more forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 20.3.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter SKY HEART.  Before being allowed to race again, JOY OF SPRING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped at the start.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 950 Metres shifted out when being steadied to avoid FREE PONY.  INVINCIBLE SHIELD continued to race keenly for some distance thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

No report.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and was bumped.  When questioned, C Soumillon stated that the instructions from an awkward barrier were to endeavour to find cover.  He said SUPER LEGENDS jumped awkwardly and became unbalanced and as a result his mount was positioned midfield in the early stages.  He said when MAGNIFIQUE held its position to his inside he elected to endeavour to follow that runner but when caught wide to the outside of BASIC INSTINCT he was obliged to come further back to comply with his instructions to find cover.  He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight SUPER LEGENDS finished the race off well.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued and emphasised that he required Jockey Soumillon to obtain cover to avoid racing wide.

On jumping was bumped by SUPER LEGENDS which shifted in.  When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his instructions were to take up a forward position.  He said MAGNIFIQUE, which had been unusually fractious in the barriers, was hampered at the start when it made contact with SUPER LEGENDS.  He said in the early stages he was obliged to make use of MAGNIFIQUE to go forward and comply with his instructions and the horse did not show its usual speed in the early stages.  He added in the Home Straight MAGNIFIQUE immediately came under pressure and when SUPER INFINITY and INVINCIBLE SHIELD shifted ground slightly near the 200 Metres his mount did not respond to his riding and gave ground from that point.  Trainer D J Hall advised that MAGNIFIQUE had pleased him leading into today’s race and in particular had barrier trialed well at Sha Tin on 11 March 2025.  He added that he had expected MAGNIFIQUE to perform well today and could offer no explanation for the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MAGNIFIQUE was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, MAGNIFIQUE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding, A Atzeni stated that the intention was to settle back in the field as is its usual racing pattern.  He said making the Home Turn he considered shifting to the outside of CALL TO COMMAND to secure clear running.  He added when he was of the opinion CALL TO COMMAND would give ground he elected to improve to that runner’s inside and follow FREE PONY.  He said when LEGENDARY IMPACT then shifted out he was disappointed for clear running between that runner and CALL TO COMMAND and as a result was held up until near the 300 Metres.  The Stewards advised Jockey Atzeni that, in their opinion, he would have been better suited by being shifted to the outside of CALL TO COMMAND on entering the Home Straight to provide his mount with clear and uninterrupted running.
No report.
