Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found suitable to race.   After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her mount raced tight in the middle stages to the inside of GIMME FIVE but did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  She added, in her opinion, FUN N GLORY may be better suited on the turf surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 750 Metres was taken wider by TAIHANG SCENERY.  JOLLY JUMPER then raced wide and without cover thereafter.  Near the 350 Metres was bumped by VULCANUS which shifted out.  After the event, K C Leung reported that his mount, which was having its first race start on the All Weather surface, did not appreciate the kickback.

Near the 750 Metres was steadied to avoid GIMME FIVE.  After the event, C L Chau reported that in the Home Straight his mount did not respond and did not fully stretch out under pressure.  The Veterinary Officer reported that TAIHANG SCENERY made an abnormal respiratory noise after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.
On jumping was crowded between CALL ME GLORIOUS and GLORY ELITE.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Knuckled over on jumping and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Approaching the 400 Metres was held up for clear running.
Bumped on jumping.

After the event, K Teetan stated that his mount did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses but gave ground under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MASK RIDER was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, MASK RIDER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
After the event, M L Yeung reported that his saddle slipped back at the start, placing him at some disadvantage during the race.
After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount did not appreciate the kickback during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, C L Chau stated that his mount was disadvantaged by racing on the pace with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time.  He said as a result SPORTS LEGEND gave ground in the Home Straight but was still disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SPORTS LEGEND was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, SPORTS LEGEND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned regarding the horse’s improved performance as compared to its last start on 26 February 2025, Trainer Y S Tsui stated that on that occasion TELECOM FIGHTERS was disadvantaged after making contact with the running rail near the 350 Metres and as a result gave ground thereafter.  He said tonight TELECOM FIGHTERS was able to lead the event and run the middle stages outside of standard time which allowed it to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance near the 1200 Metres raced keenly when being steadied away from NEVER PETER OUT.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Held up making the Home Turn.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped at the start.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

When giving ground near the 350 Metres was eased when crowded between TURIN MASCOT and ALLCASH which shifted out.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that ARIEL did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  She said after the pace steadied in the middle stages, when it increased from the 800 Metres ARIEL was unable to finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ARIEL, a last start winner, was considered disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, ARIEL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, H Bentley stated that after jumping only fairly his mount settled slightly further back than intended.  He said with the pace of the event being run outside of standard time in the middle stages FIGHTING MACHINE found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Trainer W K Mo confirmed that with the horse stepping up in distance and having sheepskin cheek pieces applied he had instructed Jockey K C Leung to go forward and lead if he was able to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Bumped near the 500 Metres when it shifted out to improve.  Approaching the 400 Metres was hampered when taken wider by SEA EMERALD.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in under pressure, resulting in its rider B Thompson having to correct his mount on a number of occasions.
Approaching the 400 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of KA YING GLORY to obtain clear running when KA YING GLORY hung out.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Under pressure in the Home Straight raced greenly and lay in.
On jumping was bumped by JUBILANT WINNER which shifted out.  Near the 400 Metres was hampered when taken wider by ROBOT KNIGHT.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1000 Metres got its head up and became unbalanced when being steadied away from YIU CHEUNG VICTORY.  SUPER SICARIO then continued to race keenly in the middle stages.  Leaving the 600 Metres was eased when momentarily crowded by RUNJEET which lay in and away from DEVILDOM.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped only fairly and was bumped by MID WINTER WIND.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced wide and without cover throughout the event and near the 900 Metres was hampered when taken wider by KA YING GLORY which hung out.  Near the 500 Metres was bumped when taken wider by JUBILANT WINNER which shifted to the outside of SEA EMERALD to improve.  Approaching the 400 Metres was hampered when taken wider by JUBILANT WINNER.

When questioned Z Purton stated that after being placed in the starting gates his mount became stirred up and was fractious.  He said KA YING GLORY jumped reasonably well and was able to hold an on-pace position in the early stages.  He said approaching the first turn near the 900 Metres he endeavoured to obtain a position with cover behind JUMBO TREASURE and as he did so KA YING GLORY hung out badly and made the first turn wider.  He added from this point KA YING GLORY continued to hang out and shifted a number of horses wider making the Home Turn before weakening in the Home Straight.  Trainer D A Hayes advised that KA YING GLORY had pleased him leading into today’s race and he had expected it to run well.  He said, in his opinion, KA YING GLORY raced on the wrong lead leg which resulted in it hanging out and racing in an uncompetitive manner thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.  The racing manners and performance of KA YING GLORY were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING GLORY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial around a bend in Hong Kong and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
After obtaining a position behind BOTTOMUPTOGETHER near the 800 Metres commenced to race keenly, resulting in HARMONY N BLESSED then being obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.

Jumped only fairly, shifted in and dipped shortly after the start when it made contact with FAST NETWORK.  After the event, L Ferraris reported that after settling back in the field he placed his mount under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight.  He added under pressure MID WINTER WIND lay in and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Stood flat-footed as the start was effected and lost ground.  Before being allowed to race again, MANAGEMENT FOLKS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Near the 1800 Metres improved to the inside of ACE WAR and was steadied when briefly crowded.  For some distance approaching the 500 Metres shifted to the outside of MIGHTY STRENGTH to obtain clear running and as a result raced tight.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by FIREFOOT which shifted out.  Near the 300 Metres bumped with MISSION STRIKE.  After the event, B Thompson stated that from a wide barrier the intention was to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said when ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT commenced well and he saw an opportunity to hold a more forward position he elected to allow the horse to continue forward to take up a position behind the lead in the early stages.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, L Ferraris stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages.  He added in the Home Straight MISSION STRIKE lay in and proved reluctant to shift to the outside of FIREFOOT when endeavouring to obtain a narrow run between FIREFOOT and ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT.  He said after making contact with ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT, MISSION STRIKE continued to lay in and was reluctant to improve between runners and finished the race off only fairly.  In this incident, L Ferraris dropped his right rein for a number of strides.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

D McDonogh was severely reprimanded for failing to ride his mount out to the end of the race.  In assessing penalty the Stewards were satisfied that his actions had not affected his finishing position in the race.  After the event, D McDonogh confirmed that from the inside barrier the instructions were to lead the event.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions as YOUTH POWER had a tendency to race keenly at its previous race starts and he was of the opinion that it may settle better in front.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover from near the 800 Metres.  Approaching the 500 Metres was bumped by SERANGOON and became unbalanced.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of GOOD GOOD.  For some distance after the 600 Metres raced tight between KASA PAPA and MANAGEMENT FOLKS which shifted to the outside of MIGHTY STRENGTH to improve.

After the event, H Bowman stated that when caught wide and without cover in the early stages his mount raced keenly.  He said near the 1200 Metres he allowed ACE WAR to stride forward where it obtained a position outside the lead passing the 1000 Metres.  He added due to the manner in which it raced in the early stages ACE WAR was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Avdulla reported that his mount obtained a favourable position throughout the early and middle stages of the event but failed to respond to his riding when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer J Size advised the he had been satisfied with the horse leading into today’s race but having regard to its performance it would now receive a let-up before its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GOOD GOOD was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, GOOD GOOD will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  The performance of AFFORDABLE was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, AFFORDABLE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on AFFORDABLE at the request of Trainer D A Hayes.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, A Hamelin reported that from an inside barrier he was instructed to hold a handy position.  He said when his mount commenced well he was able to obtain a position behind the lead without being pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, C L Chau stated that from the inside barrier he was asked to ride the horse where comfortable as at its pervious race starts it had not finished the race off when ridden forward from wide barriers.  He added as a result TOP PEAK settled in a midfield position where it travelled comfortably.

Jumped only fairly and shortly afterwards was steadied when crowded between WITH A SMILE and DO YOUR PART which jumped awkwardly and shifted in.  For some distance near the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between SKY CAP and WITH A SMILE, both of which shifted ground slightly.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with BIENVENUE.
No report.

<31/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> The Veterinary Officer reported that WINNING MACHINE was lame in its right hind leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, WINNING MACHINE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 100 Metres was shifted to the inside of SKY CAP in an attempt to obtain clear running but shortly afterwards was steadied when disappointed between TOP PEAK and SKY CAP which shifted in, resulting in HAPPY FOR ALL not being able to be fully tested to the finish of the event.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY FOR ALL will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, D McDonogh stated that he was obliged to settle back in the field from his wide barrier and in the Home Straight TACTICAL COMMAND finished the race off only fairly, however, he was not too disappointed with its effort over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event, M F Poon reported that his mount, which was wearing a norton bit for the first time, did not appear to race comfortably with that gear and he recommended to connections to experiment with a gear change prior to its next race start.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race. <31/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> DASHING PAL, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. DASHING PAL was again examined by the Veterinary Surgeon at the stables of Trainer W K Mo this afternoon and found to have sustained a tendon injury to both front legs. Before being allowed to race again, DASHING PAL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 800 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from MOMENTS IN TIME.  When questioned Z Purton stated that after entering the Home Straight he had expected RED LION to continue to improve into the race and as a result he attempted to obtain clear running between RED LION and MOMENTS IN TIME which he had expected to commence to give ground.  He said when RED LION did not improve as he had expected and MOMENTS IN TIME shifted in slightly, he was obliged to check his mount to avoid RED LION and as a result GALAXY PATCH was held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  He added leaving the 300 Metres he directed his mount to the inside of HAPPY TOGETHER where it secured clear running.  Z Purton was advised to exercise more care and to ensure that there is sufficient racing room when he is improving into similar positions.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  The Veterinary Surgeon reported that CIRCUIT JOLLY had sustained a bone injury to its left hind fetlock after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, CIRCUIT JOLLY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with CIRCUIT JOLLY.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded shortly after the start between MARVEL AND GOLD and AURORA PATCH which shifted in slightly.  Bumped near the 150 Metres.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 250 Metres became unbalanced when crowded for room between FLYING TING LOK and AURORA PATCH (M F Poon) which shifted out.  M F Poon was reprimanded.  In this incident FAST RESPONDER lay out and away from AURORA PATCH and contributed to the interference.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages J Orman stated that he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages as FAST RESPONDER had not finished the race off when ridden on the pace at its last start.  He said near the 700 Metres when positioned to the outside of FLYING TING LOK he allowed LA FORZA to cross his mount to comply with his instructions and also to provide FAST RESPONDER with a  horse to follow into the race.

Near the 150 Metres lay out and made contact with STAR PERFORMER which shifted in slightly.  After the event, M Chadwick stated that whilst he was able to obtain cover during the race behind CIRCUIT JOLLY he was of the opinion that HORSEPOWER was disadvantaged by having no runner positioned to his inside as he believes HORSEPOWER races best when able to improve between runners as it did at its most recent start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Blundered on jumping.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

For some distance approaching the 400 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a doubtful run between RED LION and BEAUTY JOY and as a result made contact with RED LION.  HAPPY TOGETHER did not obtain clear running until after the 300 Metres.  For a short distance approaching the 150 Metres raced tight between RED LION and BEAUTY JOY which shifted out slightly and as a result made contact with RED LION.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.

B Avdulla pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1300 Metres (see LA CITY BLANCHE).  Near the 900 Metres was contacted on the hindquarters, taken wider and became badly unbalanced.  After the event, B Avdulla stated that it was not his intention to take up a forward position.  He said when BEAUTY JOY commenced to race keenly near the 1200 Metres he allowed it to stride forward to avoid having to restrain his mount unnecessarily.

J Orman pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 900 Metres (see CHANCHENG GLORY).  Passing the 400 Metres HAPPY TOGETHER endeavoured to obtain clear running between RED LION and BEAUTY JOY when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in HAPPY TOGETHER making contact with RED LION and RED LION becoming unbalanced as its rider J Orman endeavoured to hold its position.  A Badel, rider of HAPPY TOGETHER, was reprimanded and advised he must ensure that there is sufficient racing room where he is improving.  A short distance later HAPPY TOGETHER was taken out when BEAUTY JOY shifted out before being corrected by its rider, resulting in HAPPY TOGETHER making further contact with RED LION.  Bumped approaching the 150 Metres.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight when being shifted to the outside of CHANCHENG GLORY to obtain clear running.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid BEAUTY ETERNAL.

J Orman (RED LION) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 900 Metres he permitted his mount to shift out when not clear of NIMBLE NIMBUS, resulting in NIMBLE NIMBUS being taken out across the running of CHANCHENG GLORY, resulting in CHANCHENG GLORY being checked when crowded between NIMBLE NIMBUS and BEAUTY JOY and also BEAUTY JOY being contacted on the hindquarters and becoming unbalanced.  J Orman was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 16 April 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 900 Metres was checked to avoid CHANCHENG GLORY.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

B Avdulla (BEAUTY JOY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1300 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in when not clear of LA CITY BLANCHE, resulting in LA CITY BLANCHE striking the heels of BEAUTY JOY and blundering badly.  B Avdulla was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 16 April 2025 at Happy Valley.  In addition, Jockey Avdulla was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <31/3/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> LA CITY BLANCHE, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. LA CITY BLANCHE was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer A S Cruz this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. Before being allowed to race again, LA CITY BLANCHE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Shortly after the start raced tight between STAR PERFORMER and PACKING BOLE which shifted out.  After the event, Y L Chung stated that his mount did not respond to his riding in the early stages and became detached from the field.  He added that MARVEL AND GOLD would be suited by being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 28.3.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right hind).  Before being allowed to race again, CARROLL STREET will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Raced keenly in the middle stages after being crossed by KA YING RISING.
No report.

After the event, B Avdulla reported that his mount responded only fairly in the Home Straight after leading and he had some concerns with the manner in which it finished the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA SPANGLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages, however, approaching the Home Turn commenced to race keenly.  He said in the Home Straight MAGIC CONTROL did not respond to his riding which he attributed to the horse not running out the 1200 Metres in Group 2 company.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

H Bowman was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1000 Metres (see SUNNY DA BEST).  Hung in in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in when placed under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight.
Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.
Leaving the 1000 Metres, when racing ungenerously, blundered.  C L Chau pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the concluding stages (see CHATEAUNEUF).

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After the event, M F Poon confirmed that his instructions were to lead the event and ride his mount in a similar manner to when it was successful in a barrier trial on 11 March 2025.

H Bowman (CROSSBORDERPEGASUS) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of SUNNY DA BEST, contributing to SUNNY DA BEST having to be checked when crowded for room by CROSSBORDERPEGASUS.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 20 April 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.   After the event, Z  Purton stated that although his mount was interfered with near the 1000 Metres it finished the race off only fairly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

K Teetan was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  Bumped at the start.  C L Chau (PACKING POWER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of CHATEAUNEUF, resulting in CHATEAUNEUF having to check when it lost its rightful running.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 20 April 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 24 April 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Chau was fined $30,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his poor race riding record.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shortly after the start got its head up and became unbalanced when bumped by KA YING VICTORY which shifted in.

After the event, L Ferraris stated that his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and over the concluding stages he was concerned there may be something amiss with MOJAVE DESERT.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MOJAVE DESERT was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, MOJAVE DESERT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Trainer F C Lor advised that the instructions were to hold a midfield position but SOUTH STAR began well and was able to hold an on-pace position without having to make too much use of the horse to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event, A Badel confirmed that his instructions were to lead the event, similar to the manner in which it  barrier trialed on 21 March 2025 where it led and won.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Shortly after the start was bumped by ENDUED which shifted in and away from HE WAS YOU.  Bumped approaching the 1300 Metres.  Approaching the 200 Metres rider C L Chau fumbled his whip and after his whip accidentally made contact with K C Leung, rider of ONLY U, he was able to regather it a short distance after.
No report.
No report.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Approaching the 1300 Metres shifted in, made contact with WROTE A NEW PAGE and got its head up when being steadied by its rider.  ENDUED then continued to race keenly in the early and middle stages.

Approaching the 100 Metres was eased when momentarily crowded between CALIFORNIA BLITZ and BLING BLING GENIUS (K Teetan) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  K Teetan was reprimanded.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he elected to take a run to the inside of HAPPY UNIVERSE, H Bowman stated that after being taken wider near the 600 Metres when HAPPY UNIVERSE commenced to improve, CAPITAL LEGEND came under pressure and was responding only fairly to his riding at that point.  He said after following HAPPY UNIVERSE into the Home Straight he elected to improve to that runner’s inside to avoid having to make more use of CAPITAL LEGEND to continue to shift out.  He added CAPITAL LEGEND commenced to finish the race off reasonably well approaching the 100 Metres before being briefly crowded and its momentum haltered for a short distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  In the early stages got its head up and raced keenly when being shifted behind runners from the outside barrier.  After the event, L Ferraris stated that from the outside barrier he was obliged to settle back in the field.  He said when the pace in the early stages of the race was run inside of standard time his mount did not travel well and did not finish off when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Briefly crowded approaching the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid THE AUSPICIOUS when racing keenly.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, D McDonogh advised that in the Home Straight he was concerned with the action of the horse in front and as a result near the 150 Metres he eased it down from the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, VIRTUOUS PHANTOM will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, M L Yeung stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to hold a handy position.  He said after riding his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions, he was caught wide and as a result he elected to continue forward and cross to the lead to avoid covering additional ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
In the early part of the Home Straight lay in when being shifted to the outside of ACROSS DA UNIVERSE to obtain clear running.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned H Bowman stated that from a wide barrier he was given the instructions to endeavour to obtain a midfield position with cover if possible.  He said although CHARMING LEGEND began well, when YUEN LONG ELITE showed good pace to his inside, he endeavoured to obtain a midfield position as instructed.  He said when caught wide in the Back Straight and CHARMING LEGEND was racing keenly he elected to restrain his mount further to obtain cover behind SKY TRUST in order to encourage his mount to settle.  He said as a result CHARMING LEGEND was positioned at the rear of the field although it settled once it obtained cover.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, H Bowman stated that after placing his mount under full pressure near the 450 Metres CHARMING LEGEND responded well to his riding and when he was satisfied that CHARMING LEGEND was at its top he used the whip sparingly as it continued to respond to his hands and heels riding.  Trainer C S Shum was contacted in relation to the instructions issued.  Mr Shum confirmed that connections had requested the horse be ridden in a midfield position in the early stages as CHARMING LEGEND had not finished the race off at its previous race start when ridden in a forward position due to it racing too keenly.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start and shifted in.

No report.

Jumped only fairly and then raced in restricted room between FALLON and MONEY CATCHER shortly after the start.  For some distance after the 400 Metres raced tight to the outside of JUMBO LEGEND which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.

No report.

No report.

Near the 200 Metres L Ferraris dropped his right rein as he pulled his whip through to his right hand.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight.  After the event, R Kingscote confirmed that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions issued.

After the event, K Teetan advised that he was instructed to hold a midfield position but when positioned behind HARMONY GALAXY in the early stages he was obliged to settle further back when HARMONY GALAXY did not go forward.

Bumped at the start.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Briefly held up near the 400 Metres.

Near the 600 Metres was checked to avoid LUCKY GENERATIONS, resulting in WOODFIRE CHAMP commencing to race keenly and improving to the inside of LUCKY GENERATIONS where it was then placed in restricted room to the inside of that runner.

Z Purton (TALENTS SUPREMO) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 1000 Metres he directed his mount in when not clear of HOSS, resulting in TALENTS SUPREMO making contact with HOSS and HOSS becoming unbalanced when crowded for room and a short distance later HOSS having to be checked when it lost its rightful running.   Z Purton  was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 9 April 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.   Leaving the 500 Metres was steadied when crowded by WOODFIRE CHAMP which shifted in when being checked away from LUCKY GENERATIONS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 1000 Metres was eased when racing in restricted room between SWEET DIAMOND which was racing tight to the inside of SPEEDY SMARTIE and RAGNARR which shifted out slightly.

After the event, Z Purton stated that after settling towards the rear of the field VIVA CHALEUR failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Z Purton was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 1000 Metres (see HOSS). A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a large skin wound to the right hind leg.

When questioned, H Bentley stated that when holding an on-pace position in the early stages he was obliged to make use of his mount when caught wide in an attempt to go forward.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside he elected to restrain EVER SMART making the turn near the 1000 Metres to obtain a position with cover.  When questioned regarding his riding rounding the turn and in the early part of the Home Straight and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of WINNING HEART, H Bentley stated that given the hard run that his mount had sustained in the early stages, he was reluctant to improve around runners on the Home Turn and for this reason he remained racing behind WINNING HEART.  He added when WINNING HEART shifted out approaching the Home Straight he then attempted to obtain clear running to the inside of WINNING HEART and to the outside of ISLAND GOLDEN.  He said when that run closed EVER SMART was held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres.  Jockey Bentley agreed with the Stewards that he had made an error of judgement on the Home Turn by not shifting to the outside of WINNING HEART to obtain clear running.

Near the 600 Metres was checked to avoid ISLAND GOLDEN.  For some distance approaching the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind SPEEDY SMARTIE and near the 200 Metres was checked and made contact with ISLAND GOLDEN when disappointed for clear running to the outside of SPEEDY SMARTIE.

B Thompson (SWEET DIAMOND) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 600 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of ISLAND GOLDEN, resulting in ISLAND GOLDEN having to be steadied and LUCKY GENERATIONS and WOODFIRE CHAMP, which were following, having to be checked.  B Thompson was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 27 April 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 1 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Approaching the 200 Metres was crowded for room between WINNING HEART which shifted in slightly and LUCKY GENERATIONS (L Ferraris) which shifted to the outside of SPEEDY SMARTIE where there was not sufficient room to do so.  L Ferraris was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure there is sufficient racing room when improving into runs.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

B Thompson pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 600 Metres (see ISLAND GOLDEN).  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SWEET DIAMOND will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Sent for sampling post-race. <3/4/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> The Veterinary Surgeon reported that NEBRASKAN was lame in its right hind leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, NEBRASKAN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
On jumping was bumped on the hindquarters by EVERSTAR.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event, C L Chau reported that, in his opinion, his mount slipped behind as the start was effected.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
Over the final 250 Metres was held up for clear running and as a result could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 450 Metres became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of GROOVY FEELING.
Raced keenly in the early stages.  Over the concluding stages raced in restricted room between KA YING POWER and SWAGGER BRO.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being checked to avoid INNO CENTURY.  REWARDING TWINKLE continued to race keenly in the middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in to give consideration as to whether HAPPY SHOOTER had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from Starter A Speechley, Assistant Trainer K O Lai and Jockey Z Purton, the Stewards found that HAPPY SHOOTER reared soon after the start was effected and as a result got its left front leg over the starting gates, became cast and took no part in the event.  As the Stewards were satisfied that HAPPY SHOOTER had been afforded a fair start, the horse was declared a runner and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Having regard to its previous history at the starting gates, the Stewards ruled that HAPPY SHOOTER will be required to perform satisfactorily in consecutive barrier trials before being allowed to race again.

Withdrawn on 1.4.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter INNO CENTURY.  Before being allowed to race again, COLONEL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
K De Melo pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 350 Metres (see SANTORINI).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 200 Metres shifted in to obtain a narrow run between FOREMOST TEDDY and TOP TIME and as a result made contact with FOREMOST TEDDY and had difficulty obtaining clear running for some distance thereafter.

Held up making the Home Turn.  Approaching the 200 Metres was again held up for clear running behind THE HEIR and did not obtain clear running until approaching the 150 Metres.  For a short distance near the 100 Metres HAPPY DAILY then raced tight between THE HEIR and RED MAJESTY.
Bumped at the start.
Held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 100 Metres.
Slow to begin.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of SANTORINI to avoid that runner.

In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1200 Metres was steadied away from RED MAJESTY.  Held up making the Home Turn.  B Thompson (COURIER MAGIC) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he endeavoured to force a run between SMART FIGHTER and THE HEIR where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in COURIER MAGIC having to be severely checked when disappointed for this run and also making heavy contact with THE HEIR, resulting in THE HEIR becoming badly unbalanced.  B Thompson was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 9 April 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 17 April 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.

Near the 200 Metres was bumped heavily on the hindquarters by COURIER MAGIC and became badly unbalanced.  After the event, B Avdulla reported that he was instructed to take up a forward position.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a minor laceration to the right hind cannon.

Trainer P F Yiu stated that from the outside barrier he had instructed M Chadwick to go forward as he felt that it was a disadvantage from the outside barrier with the rail in the C+3 position to go back as it would be difficult to make up ground from back in the field.

When questioned, Z Purton was unable to offer any explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  Trainer A S Cruz stated that, in his opinion, VIVA GRACIOUSNESS races best when able to dictate in front and this was the only explanation he could offer for the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of VIVA GRACIOUSNESS was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, VIVA GRACIOUSNESS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  K De Melo (TOP TIME) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 350 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out to the outside of FOREMOST TEDDY when not clear of SANTORINI, resulting in SANTORINI having to be checked when it lost its rightful running between SOARING BRONCO and TOP TIME.  K De Melo was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 13 April 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 31.3.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (fever) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter FOREMOST TEDDY.  Before being allowed to race again, COMET SPLENDIDO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and the reason he endeavoured to shift out to obtain clear running, M F Poon stated that his instructions were to endeavour to shift to the outside to obtain clear running in the Home Straight.  He said as a consequence after following COLOURFUL PRINCE he then elected to shift to that runner’s outside with a view to obtaining clear running to the outside of HAPPY UNITED.  He said his decision to do so was influenced by his instructions and also that he had expected both COLOURFUL PRINCE and HAPPY UNITED to shift back in towards the rail after running wide on the Home Turn.  He said when HAPPY UNITED maintained its position away from the rail he became disappointed for clear running between HAPPY UNITED and CRYSTAL POWERFUL approaching the 300 Metres which resulted in him having to shift PLENTIFUL back to the inside to secure clear running near the 250 Metres.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed that the preference was for Jockey Poon to shift to the outside in the Home Straight and in the circumstances he was satisfied with the tactics adopted by Jockey Poon.  The Stewards also found the tactics adopted by Jockey Poon were reasonable in the circumstances having regard to his instructions.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Shortly after the start blundered when crowded by E UNIVERSE which shifted in slightly.
On jumping shifted out and made contact with HEROIC MASTER.
Lay in over the concluding stages and proved difficult to ride out to the finish.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 600 Metres was crowded by SERGEANT PEPPER which shifted in after making contact with E UNIVERSE.

Jumped only fairly.  Shortly after the start then bumped with SERGEANT PEPPER which shifted in slightly.  Near the 250 Metres was shifted to the outside of DECRELOT to obtain clear running.  Near the 100 Metres became held up for clear running behind SERGEANT PEPPER and after shifting to that runner’s inside near the 50 Metres then could not be ridden out to the finish when held up behind HAPPY UNITED.

Approaching the first turn near the 1000 Metres shifted in and away from DRAGON FOUR SEAS, made contact with the running rail and became unbalanced.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when awkwardly placed close to the heels of MEGA BONUS.

Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when placed in restricted room between STAR BROSE and PRIME MORTAR which shifted out. Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY PARK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Made contact with the right side of its barrier on jumping, shifted out and bumped with LEAN HERO.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1400 Metres was steadied when crowded by MIGHTY COMMANDER which was taken in by LOVERO (Y L Chung) which shifted in when not clear.  Y L Chung was reprimanded.  Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres. Raced keenly in the middle stages and refused to settle. For some distance near the 1200 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from LOVERO.
Knuckled over at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, H Bowman stated that near the 1000 Metres his mount commenced to race keenly and for this reason he elected to allow it to stride forward.  He said M UNICORN then did not show sufficient pace to cross runners to its inside and as a result was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.  He added as a consequence of being caught wide and racing keenly M UNICORN gave ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of M UNICORN was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, M UNICORN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres lay out.  Near the 900 Metres was then steadied when momentarily crowded by KING OF FIGHTERS which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.
No report.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that the instructions were to go forward and endeavour to lead if possible.  He added that KING OF FIGHTERS finished the race off only fairly and, in his opinion, may be better suited by being ridden in a more conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY INFINITY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Noted to have lost its left hind plate after the race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned, L Hewitson stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said after settling back in the field, making the Home Turn he elected to follow VIEW OF THE WORLD into the race as he felt this runner would provide him with the best opportunity to improve into the event.  He said when VIEW OF THE WORLD did not improve as he had expected he became held up for clear running behind that runner and unable to improve between VIEW OF THE WORLD and TAI VICTORY when he was of the opinion there was not sufficient room to do so.  He said as a result KING MILES was held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres and after shifting to the outside of TAI VICTORY he was able to ride his mount along for a short distance.  He added after improving behind FIND MY LOVE near the 150 Metres he elected to commence to improve to that runner’s inside to secure clear running but when FIND MY LOVE shifted in, he became awkwardly placed behind that runner and as a result he was obliged to steady his mount and shift to the outside of FIND MY LOVE where it secured clear running passing the 100 Metres.  After considering L Hewitson’s explanation, the Stewards found the tactics that he adopted were reasonable in the circumstances.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied and shifted in to avoid VIEW OF THE WORLD.
In the early stages raced keenly when being steadied to obtain a position with cover.  Near the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when held up behind BEAUTY INFINITY.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 900 Metres was hampered when taken wider by VIEW OF THE WORLD.  After the event, H Bentley stated that he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages to offset the wide draw.  He said after being forced wider by VIEW OF THE WORLD near the 600 Metres his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover thereafter and as a result was unable to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and shifted out abruptly when being steadied away from TAI VICTORY.  The performance of VIEW OF THE WORLD, which failed to respond to the riding of Z Purton in the Home Straight, was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, VIEW OF THE WORLD will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and then was bumped by SKYEY BLUE.  C L Chau was fined the sum of $5,000 for using his whip in a manner where his whip arm was raised above shoulder height on a number of occasions over the concluding stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by ORIENTAL TYCOON which jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  As a result, SUPER HONG KONG was awkwardly placed close to GOLDEN FAIRY.  When caught wide in the early stages to the outside of ORIENTAL TYCOON was steadied near the 1600 Metres to obtain cover behind that runner.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 100 Metres was crowded between CHATEAU LE PECHE and LEATHER MASTER which was taken out by JOYFUL CHAMPION (M L Yeung) which shifted to the outside of GOLDEN FAIRY to obtain clear running.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, J Orman stated that his mount was under pressure from the 600 Metres and finished the race off in a one-paced manner in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on SKYEY BLUE at the request of Trainer C W Chang.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SKYEY BLUE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event, B Thompson stated that his mount enjoyed a good run during the race but did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight and may not have run out a strong 2000 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped near the 450 Metres.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with SUPER HONG KONG.  Near the 1800 Metres raced in restricted room between CHILLI BABA and SUPER HONG KONG.  After the event, A Hamelin stated that his instructions from a wide barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said ORIENTAL TYCOON raced keenly during the early and middle stages before failing to run on in the Home Straight.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions and advised such instructions were issued to allow the horse the opportunity to run out the 2000 Metres of today’s race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 5.4.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left hind) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter JOYFUL CHAMPION.  Before being allowed to race again, ON THE LASH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Lay out in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.  Passing the 200 Metres shifted in, resulting in its rider B Avdulla having to stop riding and straighten.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 150 Metres was disappointed for clear running between MANYTHANKS FOREVER and REGENCY HAPPY STAR which shifted out.  FAMILY FORTUNE was then shifted to the inside of REGENCY HAPPY STAR to obtain clear running.

After traveling a short distance was steadied when crowded between BEAU GOSSE and SONIC BOOM which shifted in and away from SO AWESOME after racing tight to the inside of that runner.  Raced keenly in the early stages.

After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount raced too keenly during the race and as a result did not run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to lead the event to take advantage of its light weight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After travelling a short distance was crowded by SO AWESOME and then shifted in, made contact with FLYING PHANTOM and became unbalanced.  After the event, K Teetan reported that when giving ground in the Home Straight he was concerned there may be something amiss with his mount.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, SONIC BOOM will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the 150 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between GOOD LUCK BABE and SPECIAL HEDGE.

After the event, K C Leung reported that from a wide barrier his instructions were to settle where comfortable.  He said after commencing well SPECIAL HEDGE showed sufficient pace to hold a position outside the lead without having to be pressured to do so.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, TIMES TABLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found suitable to race.  Stood flat-footed as the start was effected and lost ground.  Before being allowed to race again, BEATO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with BEAUTY VIVA.  In the early stages raced keenly and making the first turn after the 900 Metres hung out.
