Before being allowed to race again, LITTLE SQUID will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Was fractious in the starting gates. Was removed, examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.  The barrier manners and performance of VICTORY PATCH, which finished tailed out, were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, VICTORY PATCH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of POCHETTINO and as a result made contact with SMART ENGINEER.  When questioned, L Ferraris stated that his mount lay in under pressure in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the event.  He said for this reason when racing tight to the outside of PEJIBAYE after the 200 Metres he used the whip in a forehand manner forward of the saddle as he was unable to make contact behind the saddle.  Jockey Ferraris was fined the sum of $5,000 for using the whip in this manner.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards took into consideration that Jockey Ferraris had been warned on a number of occasions this season in respect to using the whip in this manner.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  In the early part of the Home Straight raced greenly and near the 200 Metres lay out, resulting in its rider M L Yeung having to correct his mount.

Near the 950 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from SMART ENGINEER.  Near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid BULL ATTITUDE when racing keenly.  When questioned, K De Melo stated that he was instructed to take up a midfield position with cover and when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to settle further back in the field to obtain cover.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight K De Melo stated that when positioned behind MOUNT EVEREST he was unable to test his mount approaching the 400 Metres when MOUNT EVEREST shifted out.  He added as MOUNT EVEREST was then inclined to shift ground, between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres he was unable to fully test his mount until MOUNT EVEREST shifted out near the 250 Metres where he was able to obtain clear running to its inside.

When questioned, M F Poon stated that from a more favourable barrier draw today he was asked to hold an on-pace position preferably with cover.  He said after commencing well AMAZING GALAXY showed sufficient pace to race in a position outside the lead but raced keenly through the early and middle stages.  He added over the concluding stages AMAZING GALAXY changed stride and shifted ground which resulted in him becoming unbalanced in the saddle and not being able to ride his mount out to the finish of the event.
In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from RUN RAN RUN.  For some distance after the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of DAZZLING FIT.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Near the 100 Metres was bumped by KING OBERON which shifted in slightly.
Leaving the 1000 Metres was taken wider by SHINY RAPIDASH.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Raced ungenerously in the early stages when being shifted across behind runners from its wide barrier.

In the early stages raced keenly when being crossed by AMAZING GALAXY.  As a result, near the 1000 Metres SHINY RAPIDASH shifted out when being steadied.  C L Chau was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see MAGNIAC).
No report.

On jumping was crowded between MAGNIAC and DAZZLING FIT which shifted in and away from POCHETTINO.  Leaving the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly when being steadied to avoid MAGNIAC.  Near the 550 Metres was again steadied to avoid MAGNIAC and as a result lost ground.

On jumping was bumped by SMART ENGINEER on the hindquarters.  Leaving the 300 Metres was bumped by RUN RAN RUN which shifted out and away from SHINY RAPIDASH.  C L Chau (SHINY RAPIDASH) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of MAGNIAC, resulting in MAGNIAC having to be checked when crowded between PEJIBAYE and SHINY RAPIDASH.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 27 April 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 1 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Chau was fined $25,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very poor race riding record.  The penalty was further mitigated due to SHINY RAPIDASH initially shifting out and away from MOUNT EVEREST and PEJIBAYE shifting in slightly when racing tight to the inside of DAZZLING FIT.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, B Avdulla stated that his instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages and to endeavour to improve along the rail.  He said in accordance with his instructions he allowed WINNING DRAGON to settle towards the rear of the field in the early stages but when positioned to the outside of SNOWFIELD he elected to restrain his mount to obtain a position on the rail.  He added that in the Home Straight he initially improved to the inside of THE GOLDEN SCENERY with a view to then improving to the inside of WOODFIRE BRO which had shifted out slightly entering the Home Straight.  He said when WOODFIRE BRO shifted back in WINNING DRAGON was briefly held up before being shifted to the outside of WOODFIRE BRO approaching the 350 Metres.  He further stated that approaching the 250 Metres the intention was to improve between C P BRAVE and HELENE FEELING but when those two runners shifted ground slightly he was obliged to continue to shift to the outside of HELENE FEELING where he secured clear running after the 150 Metres and his mount found the line well.  Trainer A S Cruz confirmed the instructions issued and stated that with WINNING DRAGON dropping back in distance to 1600 Metres he did not believe the horse would have sufficient pace to hold a more favourable position from its awkward barrier.  He added that he was satisfied with the tactics adopted by Jockey Avdulla in endeavouring to improve along the inside as, in his opinion, the racing pattern of today had favoured runners being ridden in this manner.  Mr Cruz said as WINNING DRAGON steps up in distance it will be the intention to hold a more forward position if the pace of the event allows it to do so.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 200 Metres lay out, resulting in its rider L Hewitson having to stop riding and straighten and shortly after changed his whip through to his left hand.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
Shortly after the start was bumped and became unbalanced.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in abruptly and made heavy contact with SUNNY SING SPIRIT.
Was left racing wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.

Crowded on jumping.  After the event, H Bentley stated that whilst his mount was obliged to race three wide it had cover.  He said when asked for an effort in the Home Straight FLASH CURRENT lay in and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

K C Leung was required to dismount from the horse on two occasions when LUCKY KING proved reluctant to proceed to the Start.  LUCKY KING was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  The Stewards determined that LUCKY KING would be subject to a parade test which would include the horse to be required to be ridden to the starting gates.  Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between FLASH CURRENT and GOLDEN LUCK which shifted out.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped. Lay out in the Home Straight and near the 150 Metres was awkwardly placed close to the heels of EXCELLENT DADDY before shifting to that runner’s inside to continue into clear running.

On jumping became unbalanced when crowded between SUNNY SING SPIRIT and AFFIRM which was taken out by LUCKY ARCHANGEL.  Lay out making the first turn when racing keenly and made contact with SUNNY SING SPIRIT.  EXCELLENT DADDY continued to race keenly for some distance thereafter and was steadied away from LUCKY ARCHANGEL.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on EXCELLENT DADDY at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found the horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  Before being allowed to race again, EXCELLENT DADDY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
On jumping was bumped by BRAVE OF FRIENDS which shifted out.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

On jumping was badly crowded for room between EXCELLENT DADDY and STAR FIGURE which jumped awkwardly and shifted in abruptly.  Near the 900 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid AFFIRM and shortly after was then bumped by EXCELLENT DADDY which lay out on the first turn.

The tongue tie was replaced at the Start.  Crowded on jumping.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position and with the option of leading if circumstances permitted.  He said after holding a position behind the leaders AFFIRM travelled only fairly, came under pressure from the 600 Metres and weakened in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of AFFIRM was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, AFFIRM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, H Bowman stated that his mount was not suited by the early and middle stage of the event being run outside of standard time.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shifted in on jumping and made contact with WONDERSTAR.  Then raced tight to the inside of WINNING OVATION for some distance thereafter.  After travelling a short distance was crowded between WINNING OVATION and WONDERSTAR which shifted out.  Lay in under pressure over the final 150 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  For a short distance approaching the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Shortly afterwards was steadied when crowded between FREE PONY and TARGET AUDIENCE which was taken out by WONDERSTAR.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped at the start.  After the event, J Orman advised that his mount travelled satisfactorily in an on-pace position and came under pressure on the Home Turn before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.
No report.

Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards (inadvertent treatment).  An inquiry into the matter was adjourned to a date to be fixed to allow Trainer W K Mo to attend who was not currently present in Hong Kong.  Before being allowed to race again, LEGENDARY IMPACT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <9/4/2025 Adjourned Inquiry – 6 April 2025 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 6 (567)> The Stewards today conducted an inquiry into the withdrawal of LEGENDARY IMPACT from the said race. Evidence was taken from Trainer W K Mo, Assistant Trainer K H Lam, Work Riders S L Lee and C K Sze, and Dr B S Forbes, Head of Veterinary Regulation, Welfare and Biosecurity Policy. After considering all the evidence, the Stewards established that despite having systems in place to prevent the administration of treatment on raceday, subsequent to LEGENDARY IMPACT working on the morning of 6 April 2025, it was inadvertently treated with Swede Clay, a topical treatment which does not contain any prohibited substances and is the usual treatment for the horse post track work. The Stewards were satisfied that the treatment was an oversight and not intentional conduct. Mr Mo pleaded guilty to a charge under Rule 155(29) for causing the application of the raceday treatment in that he did not have proper processes in place to prevent such treatment occurring. Mr Mo was fined the sum of $20,000. A report will be made to the Stables Management in relation to the conduct of the above staff members.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  A Badel was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see ALWAYS MY FOLKS).  After the event, A Badel stated that from a wide barrier the instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Mr Y K Lau, Acting Assistant Trainer, confirmed the instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from CARRYON SMILING.  Near the 200 Metres was briefly inconvenienced by FUN TOGETHER when FUN TOGETHER shifted out slightly.  L Hewitson was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see ALWAYS MY FOLKS).  When questioned, L Hewitson stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages to allow the horse to finish off.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued and said at its last start SHAMUS STORM was not suited by being ridden forward and had barrier trialed well on 14 March 2025 when it was ridden in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the 400 Metres.
No report.
Near the 400 Metres was bumped by RAGING RAPIDS which shifted out to improve.
Near the 200 Metres was checked when crowded between ALWAYS MY FOLKS which was taken in by ETALON OR and SHAMUS STORM which shifted out.
In the Home Straight raced greenly and lay in, proving difficult to ride.
Sent for sampling post-race.

L Hewitson, rider of SHAMUS STORM, and A Badel, rider of ETALON OR, were found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres they permitted their mounts to shift ground when not clear of ALWAYS MY FOLKS and CARRYON SMILING, contributing to those horses having to be checked.  After considering their pleas and the circumstances of the incident, both Jockeys Hewitson and Badel were severely reprimanded.

After the event, M F Poon stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount to hold the lead but was disadvantaged by being pressured by FUN TOGETHER.  He added that as a consequence in the Home Straight KA YING SUPERB gave ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that his mount jumped awkwardly and as a result lost ground and settled at the tail of the field.  He said in the early stages AUTUMN VIBES raced keenly and was steadied away from SHAMUS STORM near the 1000 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, Z Purton stated that after improving to the inside of SHAMUS STORM on entering the Home Straight he commenced to place his mount under pressure, however, when VIEW ALL THINGS commenced to give ground quickly he became held up behind that runner between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres.  He added after improving to the outside of VIEW ALL THINGS, he was then placed close to the heels of SHAMUS STORM for some distance thereafter.  When questioned regarding his vigour from near the 200 Metres, Z Purton stated that, in his opinion, AUTUMN VIBES was under pressure and laying in and for this reason he did not fully test his mount through this section of the race as he was of the opinion the horse was not responding to his efforts.  Trainer J Richards stated that if AUTUMN VIBES commenced well the option was to take up a more forward position but accepted that on jumping AUTUMN VIBES commenced awkwardly and settled back.  He added whilst acknowledging AUTUMN VIBES had been held up in the early part of the Home Straight he felt there was an opportunity for Jockey Purton to place more pressure on his mount from near the 200 Metres.  After considering his explanation the Stewards advised Jockey Purton that, in their opinion, he should have ridden his mount with more vigour after the 200 Metres to fully demonstrate that the horse was unable to respond further to his riding and in such circumstances to ride his mounts in such a manner to leave no room for query.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of AUTUMN VIBES was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, AUTUMN VIBES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from MIGHTY STEED.  SPORTIC WARRIOR then raced wide and without cover thereafter.

After the event, M L Yeung stated that from an inside barrier he was able to obtain a more forward position today.  He said, in his opinion, VIEW ALL THINGS would be better suited ridden in a conservative manner in the early stages to allow it to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of VIEW ALL THINGS was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, VIEW ALL THINGS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 5.4.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter ROMAN CROWN.  Before being allowed to race again, MISSION VOICE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 200 Metres was bumped by SUPERB MOVE and became unbalanced.  Shifted to the inside of TRADITION near the 150 Metres to continue into clear running.
Trainer P C Ng confirmed that from a wide barrier the instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages to offset the wide barrier.

After the event, K De Melo reported that his mount lay in throughout the event and as a result proved difficult to ride out in the Home Straight.  He added that over the concluding stages he was unable to ride CERVIN to the finish when it shifted in towards CASA LEGEND which required him to stop riding and correct his mount.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 250 Metres made contact with SMASHING EXPRESS as it endeavoured to obtain clear running to the outside of WINDICATOR FAMILY.  During this incident, WINNING SEVEN was held up for clear running between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that his mount came under pressure leaving the 700 Metres and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped near the 250 Metres.
After the event, A Atzeni confirmed that from the inside barrier his instructions were to hold a more forward position to take advantage of barrier 1.
Approaching the 200 Metres shifted in and made contact with STRONGEST BOY.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 250 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SPICY SPANGLE when that runner shifted to the outside of NORTHER FIRE BALL to obtain clear running.  In this incident, GIDDY UP made contact with TEAM HAPPY.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, H Bowman stated that from an inside barrier his instructions were, if possible to hold a slightly more forward position.  He said LOVEISINTHEAIR jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and as a result settled a little further back than intended.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight H Bowman stated that LOVEISINTHEAIR, which was having its third race start, did not appreciate racing amongst horses and as a result he was reluctant to force his mount to improve between NORTHERN FIRE BALL and SPICY SPANGLE.  He said when he observed NORTHERN FIRE BALL to shift out away from the rail near the 200 Metres he then considered allowing his mount to improve to the inside of NORTHERN FIRE BALL as it was already shifting in towards the running rail.  He said when NORTHERN FIRE BALL did not leave sufficient room for LOVEISINTHEAIR to improve to its inside he was obliged to stop riding with the whip and direct LOVEISINTHEAIR to the outside of NORTHERN FIRE BALL approaching the 50 Metres to ensure his mount obtained clear running to the finish.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.
Over the concluding stages was eased when crowded between LOVEISINTHEAIR and GIDDY UP (B Avdulla) which shifted in.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.
No report.

After the event, A Atzeni reported that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
When caught wide and without cover in the early stages was ridden forward near the 600 Metres to cross ORIENTAL SURPRISE and race outside the lead.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped by GIDDY UP.

Leaving the 1100 Metres made contact with MASTER OF HUMOR and became unbalanced as it was being shifted behind that runner to obtain cover.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount raced too keenly in the early and middle stages and as a result did not respond to his riding when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer C S Shum stated that TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR was disadvantaged by racing keenly throughout the event which restricted its ability to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong reported that with blinkers being applied to the horse he was asked to take up a more forward position.
Approaching the first turn near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR when racing keenly.
On jumping was bumped by ORIENTAL SURPRISE.  After the 1100 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 50 Metres shifted in, resulting in its rider B Thompson having to stop riding and straighten.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards gave consideration as to whether there were grounds for a protest/objection when THE BOOM BOX was hampered by EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS which shifted out near the 50 Metres when being corrected by its rider B Thompson.  Having regard to the margin of a half length between the two horses at the finish of the event, the Stewards declined to lodge a protest/objection and declared weighed-in on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Near the 50 Metres bumped with THE BOOM BOX.

After the 200 Metres AURIO was steadied and shifted to the inside of RIDING TOGETHER to obtain clear running. Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between SOLID IMPACT and SUPERB BOY which shifted out.  Approaching the 800 Metres, when racing keenly, improved to the inside of SOLID IMPACT and was steadied.

Before being allowed to race again, SOLID IMPACT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Shortly after the start was bumped by YOUTH POWER which shifted out and away from ME TIME.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was bumped by YODA’S CHOICE which shifted in.  CAN’T GO WONG then raced tight between YODA’S CHOICE and FIREFOOT shortly after the start when FIREFOOT shifted out.   Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Slow to begin.

Near the 600 Metres shifted out and bumped TOY SOLTERO.  After the 200 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by ME TIME and became momentarily unbalanced.  Near the 150 Metres then raced in restricted room between HARMONY GALAXY and TOY SOLTERO which shifted out.

On jumping was crowded between HARMONY GALAXY and ME TIME which shifted out.  Approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind CHARMING STEED.  When being shifted to the outside of CHARMING STEED then continued to be held up between CHARMING STEED and CAN’T GO WONG.  As a result, YOUTH POWER did not obtain clear running between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres.  Over the final 100 Metres could not be fully ridden out  when unable to obtain a narrow run between FIREFOOT and CAN’T GO WONG.  After the event, M L Yeung stated that the instructions were to hold a more forward position but YOUTH POWER failed to show sufficient pace in the early stages to do so.

Near the 300 Metres was steadied when held up for clear running behind CAN’T GO WONG.  BRAVE WITNESS was then held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres when it was positioned behind CAN’T GO WONG and racing tight between YOUTH POWER and TOY SOLTERO.  After the event, K Teetan stated that his mount stumbled on jumping and as a result lost ground.  He said in the early stages he did not ride his mount along when he was ensuring that BRAVE WITNESS had not sustained any issue from this incident.

After travelling a short distance was bumped by HARMONY GALAXY which shifted out.  From the 800 Metres commenced a forward move and raced wide and without cover thereafter.  Near the 600 Metres TOY SOLTERO was bumped by FLOOF when that runner shifted to the outside of FIREFOOT.  Approaching the 50 Metres was checked when crowded between FLOOF which shifted in and away from HARMONY GALAXY despite the efforts of its rider and BRAVE WITNESS which was taken out by YOUTH POWER (M L Yeung) when after improving into a narrow run to the outside of FIREFOOT (J Orman) was then taken out by FIREFOOT.  M L Yeung was advised to exercise more care and to ensure there is sufficient room where he is improving.  J Orman was advised to exercise more care and to stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Leaving the 500 Metres improved into a tight run between FLOOF and CAN’T GO WONG and raced tight between those two runners thereafter.  Near the 350 Metres ME TIME, which continued to race tight, was checked when crowded between FLOOF and CAN’T GO WONG (M F Poon) which shifted to the outside of CHARMING STEED.  M F Poon was severely reprimanded.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight, A Atzeni stated that near the 250 Metres he observed FLOOF to shift out slightly and TOY SOLTERO to lay in.  He said as a result he placed his mount under pressure with a view to improving between those two runners.  He added when TOY SOLTERO then commenced to give ground and shift out, he was obliged to check his mount leaving the 200 Metres when disappointed for clear running between FLOOF and TOY SOLTERO.  He said as a result ME TIME did not obtain clear running thereafter.  Notwithstanding the fact that TOY SOLTERO shifted out when giving ground, A Atzeni was advised that he should ensure there is sufficient room when improving into runs.

After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount raced keenly when positioned outside the leader YODA’S CHOICE and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After the event, L Ferraris stated that his mount was able to lead but during the running of the race made a respiratory noise.  He added that he endeavoured to increase the tempo on YODA’S CHOICE from the 600 Metres as is its usual racing pattern but the horse did not respond and gave ground under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer P C Ng advised that, in his opinion, YODA’S CHOICE is better suited racing on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of YODA’S CHOICE, a last start winner, was considered disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, YODA’S CHOICE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
After the event, Y L Chung advised that from the inside barrier and his mount stepping up slightly in distance he was requested to take up a more forward position than its previous race starts.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 300 Metres L Hewitson dropped his whip.  After the event, L Hewitson advised that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position with his mount stepping up in distance from a favourable barrier.

After being shifted to the inside of DRAGON JOY to obtain clear running near the 450 Metres then became held up behind GHORGAN between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.

He said from barrier 1 and when GOOD PROSPECT commenced well and the early stages of the race were run slightly outside of standard time he was able to take up a more forward position without pressuring his mount to do so.  Trainer T P Yung confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was steadied when crowded between SUPER SICARIO and VICTORYTHIRTYTHREE, both of which shifted ground.  After travelling a short distance blundered.  Lay out making the first turn and approaching the 800 Metres got its head up and shifted out when being steadied away from HARMONY N HOME.  Near the 600 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by GAMEPLAYER ELITE which shifted out when being steadied away from CIRCUIT FIERY.  The racing manners and performance of KING VICTOR were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, KING VICTOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After travelling a short distance was steadied to avoid GALLANT EPOCH which shifted out abruptly.  Held up for a short distance near the 350 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 800 Metres improved to the inside of KINGLY DEMEANOR and was momentarily crowded.  Held up making the Home Turn.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.
Held up making the Home Turn.
Near the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid OCEAN IMPACT when held up behind that runner.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between FLYING SILVER which shifted out slightly when giving ground and THE AZURE.  Raced tight between FLYING SILVER and THE AZURE near the 200 Metres when THE AZURE shifted in.  After the event, J Orman stated that his mount travelled only fairly during the race and he was obliged to make some use of OCEAN IMPACT to hold his position.  He added after racing tight in the Home Straight his mount finished the race off in a one-paced manner and would be better suited stepping up in distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Passing the 350 Metres became held up behind FLYING SILVER and did not obtain clear running until near the 150 Metres.

Was obliged to race wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.  After the event, K Teetan stated that after being  obliged to steady to avoid KINGLY DEMEANOR near the 800 Metres his mount then raced wide and without cover thereafter and as a result was not able to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 800 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of GALLANT EPOCH (L Hewitson) which shifted in when not quite clear.  KINGLY DEMEANOR (M L Yeung) then contested a position to the outside of GALLANT EPOCH and to the inside of SKY VINO but was prevented from shifting out as SKY VINO (Apprentice E C W Wong) improved forward and held its position.  L Hewitson was advised to ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  Both M L Yeung and Apprentice Wong were advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.
After the event, A Badel stated that the instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages from its wide barrier.

When questioned regarding his riding and the fast early pace his mount set throughout the early and middle stages, L Hewitson stated that his instructions were to take up a forward position but to ensure that his mount did not obtain cover as GALLANT EPOCH has raced best when able to dictate.  He said in the early stages he rode his mount along to comply with his instructions where he obtained a position outside the leader KINGLY DEMEANOR.  He said near the 1200 Metres he then urged his mount forward to cross KINGLY DEMEANOR which resulted in GALLANT EPOCH commencing to race keenly.  He added when positioned in advance of KINGLY DEMEANOR near the 1100 Metres he encouraged his mount forward to cross that runner but GALLANT EPOCH did not show sufficient pace to do so and as a result he was obliged to make further use of his mount entering the Back Straight where he eventually was able to cross KINGLY DEMEANOR near the 800 Metres.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued and stated that GALLANT EPOCH may have been disadvantaged by having its first race start at Happy Valley.  After considering the sectional times of the event which showed the early stages of the race being run well inside of standard time, L Hewitson was advised by the Stewards that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages by continuing to endeavour to go forward to cross KINGLY DEMEANOR.  He  was further advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to show better judgement than what he did on this occasion.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 400 Metres was briefly held up for clear running behind ABSOLUTE HONOUR.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that the instructions were to hold a midfield position.  He said when SUGAR SUGAR jumped only fairly and was caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to race further back in the field to avoid covering additional ground.
Made contact with a rail in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Shifted out at the start and made contact with SUPER JOY N FUN.
On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by STORM RIDER.

Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 300 Metres was crowded between GOLDEN RISE and CHARMING BABE which was taken out by STORM RIDER (B Avdulla).  In this incident, RISING FROM ASHES hung in and away from GOLDEN RISE which contributed to it having to be checked to avoid CHARMING BABE.  B Avdulla was severely reprimanded.

After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between PRESTIGE ALWAYS and SUPER JOY N  FUN.  In the early stages got its head up and raced keenly when being steadied to obtain cover.  After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount settled further back than intended after being crowded at the start.  He said YOUNG ARROW raced keenly with the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time which resulted in his mount being left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by RISING FROM ASHES.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  After the event, C L Chau stated that his mount raced "flat”.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and blundered shortly after the start.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Blundered near the 400 Metres.  After the event, K Teetan reported that his mount raced greenly and when placed under pressure in the Home Straight hung in for a short distance.
Jumped awkwardly.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.
Hung in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A Badel was warned in relation to using his whip in a backhand manner forward of the shoulder on several occasions in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and lost ground.  Hung out over the final 250 Metres and near the 200 Metres K C Leung was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount.

After the 400 Metres blundered.  Prior to declaring weighed-in, the Stewards considered as to whether there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection against PARENTS’ LOVE and ISLAND BREEZES.  The Stewards found that when LAHORE improved into a run where there was doubtful room and both ISLAND BREEZES and PARENTS’ LOVE had shifted ground slightly, they declined to lodge a protest/objection and declared weighed-in on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Approaching the 100 Metres improved into a tight run between PARENTS’ LOVE and ISLAND BREEZES.  A short distance later, both ISLAND BREEZES and PARENTS’ LOVE shifted ground slightly, resulting in LAHORE then racing in restricted room between those two runners for some distance thereafter and being buffeted.  In this incident, B Avdulla explained that when he became unbalanced his left knee extended out which was a method he used to maintain his balance.  After considering his explanation, B Avdulla was advised whilst it was accepted that his left knee extended away from his body to maintain his balance, he should, wherever possible, ensure that his limbs remain as close to his body as possible.
Near the 450 Metres briefly raced in restricted room between NOBLE DELUXE and ROBOT MASTER which shifted out slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping made contact with the right side of its barrier and as a result was slow to begin.  Approaching the 200 Metres was directed to the inside of NORTHERN BEACHES to secure clear running and then lay in when placed under pressure thereafter.
Jumped awkwardly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  Apprentice P N Wong was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see NORTHERN BEACHES).  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on ROBOT MASTER at the request of Trainer K L Man.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination found the horse to be a "roarer”.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  After the 400 Metres dipped.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between THRIVING BROTHERS and ALSONSO (A Badel) which shifted in when improving to the inside of PARENTS’ LOVE.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  After the event, A Hamelin reported that the instructions were to hold an on-pace position in behind the leaders.  He said when NOBLE DELUXE jumped well and showed good pace it was left racing without cover after being crossed by PARENTS’ LOVE.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 350 Metres raced tight between ROBOT MASTER and BEAU CADEAU (C L Chau) which shifted to the inside of NOBLE DELUXE.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  Apprentice P N Wong (ROBOT MASTER) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres she allowed her mount to shift out when not clear of NORTHERN BEACHES, resulting in NORTHERN BEACHES being crowded and having to be checked.  Apprentice Wong  was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 27 April 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered her good race riding record.  The penalty was further mitigated due to a slight shift in from BEAU CADEAU.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up when racing tight between NORTHERN BEACHES and NOBLE DELUXE.

After the event, M L Yeung stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position with cover.  He said when his mount commenced well and the pace of the event was run outside of standard time WIND SPEEDER led comfortably without being pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Crowded at the start between HO HO STAR and CIRCUIT TEN which jumped awkwardly and shifted in.

Shortly after the start got its head up when being shifted across behind runners from a wide barrier.  When questioned, M Chadwick stated that from a wide barrier the instructions were to endeavour to hold a midfield position but also to attempt to position himself close to the rail as HO HO STAR races best in this position.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the outside of MULTIDARLING he was obliged to settle slightly further back to avoid covering additional ground.  He added making the Home Turn HO HO STAR commenced to travel reasonably well and after entering the Home Straight he was reluctant to place his mount under full pressure as he wanted to give HO HO STAR the opportunity to work into the race.  He said approaching the 300 Metres after shifting to the inside of COMMANDING MISSILE he then placed his mount under full pressure where it finished the race off reasonably well.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to ride his mount with more vigour between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres M Chadwick stated that he felt HO HO STAR was travelling well at this point and had he commenced to ride it along too soon it would not have finished the race off as well as it did.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued and advised that in the circumstances there was the opportunity to ride HO HO STAR with more vigour than Jockey Chadwick did in the early part of the Home Straight.  After considering his explanation and also taking into account the early and middle stages of the event were run outside of standard time, the Stewards advised M Chadwick that, in their opinion, he had made an error of judgement in not riding his mount with more vigour in the early part of the Home Straight.

Near the 250 Metres was bumped by COMMANDING MISSILE.  After the event, Y L Chung stated that, in his view, CALIFORNIA ICON would be suited by being stepped up in distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Over-raced in the early stages and near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied to avoid PODIUM.  After the event, Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Slow to begin.
Near the 200 Metres was held up behind PODIUM before being shifted to that runner’s inside near the 50 Metres to obtain clear running.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the event, A Atzeni reported that from the outside barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned, Apprentice P N Wong stated that the instructions were to lead the event.  She said after commencing well and when positioned to the inside of AHREN she allowed LEAN MASTER to improve slightly to ensure that she maintained the lead near the 900 Metres.  She said as she did so LEAN MASTER then commenced to race keenly and set a faster pace than she had intended.  She added that from the 550 Metres she continued to encourage her mount into the race before LEAN MASTER gave ground in the Home Straight.  After considering her explanation, the Stewards advised Apprentice Wong that, in their opinion, she should have held her mount together from the 550 Metres to give it the opportunity to finish the race off better entering the Home Straight.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was then checked when crowded between ENJOY GOLF and LEAN MASTER, both of which shifted ground.  Z Purton pleaded guilty to a charge of improper conduct under Rule 155(5) in that after dismounting from HONEST WITNESS in the unplaced saddling area he struck the horse on one occasion with his whip in the area of the flank.  Having regard to Jockey Purton’s poor record in relation to similar conduct, he was fined the sum of $25,000 and placed on notice that the Stewards would consider a more significant penalty should he be found guilty of a similar conduct in future.

Difficult to load into the starting gates.  The barrier manners of MONTA FRUTTA were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MONTA FRUTTA will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between SAL and RATTAN GALAXY which shifted in and away from BILLION TWO.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance after the 900 Metres was steadied away from BILLION TWO.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Noted to have blood in the mouth after the race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned, K Teetan stated that his instructions were to lead the event.  He said as a result in the early stages he rode his mount along to comply with his instructions where his mount showed good pace to hold the front.  He said whilst he was aware that the pace of the event was fast his mount was travelling comfortably in the early stages to hold the lead.  He added when GLORY ELITE maintained its position to his outside near the 900 Metres and as its rider Z Purton showed intent on crossing LADY’S CHOICE he then elected near the 900 Metres to allow GLORY ELITE to cross LADY’S CHOICE as he was of the opinion the pace of the event was too fast.  He said after obtaining a trailing position behind GLORY ELITE, LADY’S CHOICE travelled only fairly and for this reason near the 500 Metres he elected to shift LADY’S CHOICE to the outside of GLORY ELITE to encourage it to maintain its position and to commence to improve into the event.  He said after entering the Home Straight he held his mount together for a short distance before commencing to ride it out to the finish of the event and LADY’S CHOICE continued to respond to his riding to the line.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Teetan were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding in particular the fast pace set in the early and middle stages, Z Purton stated that his instructions were to ensure that GLORY ELITE led as the horse performs best when ridden in this manner.  He said after riding his mount along in the early stages he continued to urge GLORY ELITE forward to cross LADY’S CHOICE.  He said when K Teetan, the rider of LADY’S CHOICE, maintained his position in the lead, he was obliged to make further use of his mount to cross that runner to comply with his instructions.  He said whilst he was aware that the pace of the event was being run inside of standard time he felt it was in the horse’s best interests to continue forward as GLORY ELITE had only won its races when being able to dictate from the front.  Trainer K H Ting confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the manner in which GLORY ELITE was ridden.  After considering his explanation and taking into account the racing history of GLORY ELITE which confirmed that the horse had won its three races from leading and Jockey Purton was riding to the instructions issued, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were in all the circumstances reasonable.  However, he was advised that, in the opinion of the Stewards, he would have been better suited by maintaining his position outside of LADY’S CHOICE in the early stages having regard to the fast pace set during the early and middle stages of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that from the outside barrier he was obliged to settle at the back of the field to avoid covering additional ground.  He said, under its top weight, in the Home Straight GORGEOUS WIN responded reasonably well to his riding, however, its run peaked after the 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 450 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of BEAUTY DESTINY when that runner commenced to give ground.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event, A Hamelin could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to run on strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils and also revealed that it was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  As this was the second occasion that BEAUTY DESTINY had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
The tongue tie was replaced in the Parade Ring.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Briefly held up near the 400 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Made contact with the running rail near the 900 Metres when racing tight inside ACE.
No report.

The Department of Veterinary Regulation Welfare and Biosecurity Policy (DVRWBP) have advised the Stewards that ZETTA FORCE, which finished 6th in the aforementioned race, was subject to an endoscopic examination after the race at the request of trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon advised this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  However, due to an administrative error, the finding was not reported to the Stewards during the racemeeting.  Subsequently, the DVRWBP have required ZETTA FORCE to pass an official veterinary examination prior to racing again, which was satisfactorily completed on Monday, 28 April 2025.  The DVRWBP have implemented remedial measures to ensure the accuracy of the process in future.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 900 Metres was steadied when racing tight between POSITIVE SMILE and ACROSS DA UNIVERSE, both of which shifted ground slightly.  A short distance later, GLUCK RACER was checked to avoid ACE when that runner gave ground.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event, J Orman stated that his mount raced greenly throughout the race and near the 900 Metres shifted in and away from C YEAH and made contact with LESLIE and then over-reacted to that contact.  As a result, ACE shifted out and was checked when awkwardly placed close to the heels of C YEAH which shifted in slightly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

As the start was effected reared simultaneously and as a result lost ground on jumping.  The barrier manners of DRALA were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DRALA will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

After the event, M F Poon reported that with the early and middle stages of the event being run inside of standard time his mount was under pressure throughout the race before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight, resulting in its rider C L Chau having to correct his mount approaching the 200 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

As the start was effected became fractious and as a result was slow to begin.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence was simultaneous as the start was effected, they determined that QUICK CONTRIBUTION to be declared a runner.  The barrier manners of QUICK CONTRIBUTION were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, QUICK CONTRIBUTION will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.

The tongue tie was replaced in the Parade Ring.  Near the 200 Metres HAROLD WIN (C L Chau), which was laying in, shifted in when not clear of BEAUTIFUL WIN, resulting in BEAUTIFUL WIN having to be steadied to avoid HAROLD WIN and further shifting in, crowding the running of NIGHT PUROSANGUE which was steadied when it was giving ground.  C L Chau was severely reprimanded and advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.
No report.
No report.
No report.
No report.
No report.

Steadied to avoid BEAUTIFUL WIN near the 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.
Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY HOLIDAY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shortly after the start was crowded by DROMBEG BANNER which shifted out.

In the Home Straight lay in.  After the event, Apprentice P N Wong stated that after being crossed by DROMBEG BANNER she was obliged to shift to that runner’s outside when her mount commenced to race keenly.  She said as a result INVINCIBLE SAGE continued to race keenly in the middle stages and was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.  Passing the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded by INVINCIBLE SAGE (Apprentice P N Wong) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  Apprentice Wong was reprimanded and advised that she would be expected to stop riding and straighten her mounts sooner than what she did on this occasion.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that DROMBEG BANNER was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead when INVINCIBLE SAGE improved to his outside in the middle stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the improved performance, Trainer F C Lor advised that the horse had a throat surgery on 26 September 2024 and since that date he had been satisfied with the performances of DREAM WINNER.  He said at its last start at Sha Tin on 15 March 2025 DREAM WINNER was not suited by the "Good to Yielding” track conditions and today he attributed the improved performance to the horse being able to race on a firmer surface.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 350 Metres and the 50 Metres was badly held up for clear running behind MAGIC HALLOW.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 300 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters.

Shortly after the start raced in restricted room between MAGIC HALLOW and STAR SATYR which shifted out and away from ONE MORE.  Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.
Passing the 400 Metres blundered.  Over the final 250 Metres was held up for clear running and as a result could not be ridden out to the finish.
Shortly after the start shifted out and was bumped.  Raced greenly throughout the event and lay in over the final 200 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Approaching the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between FUN ELITE which shifted in slightly and CELESTIAL COLOURS (H Bowman) which shifted out.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 1400 Metres was steadied to avoid WINNING GOLD when racing keenly.  Near the 300 Metres shifted out under pressure and made contact with FLYING LUCK.  Passing the 100 Metres made contact with FLYING LUCK due to both runners shifting ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in at the start and made contact with GOLD MASTER.  Bumped near the 300 Metres.  Passing the 100 Metres made contact with GOLD MASTER due to both runners shifting ground.  Over the final 50 Metres was taken out slightly by GOLD MASTER when that runner shifted out after the initial contact between the two runners.  L Ferraris was fined the sum of $7,500 for using the whip in a forehand manner forward of the saddle on a number of occasions in the Home Straight.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Knuckled on jumping.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 400 Metres was briefly held up for clear running.

On jumping knuckled over and became unbalanced, resulting in its rider Y L Chung also becoming unbalanced.  As a result, Jockey Chung’s right foot shifted in his stirrup which required him to reposition it shortly after the start.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, B Avdulla stated that after settling back in the field he was obliged to make a wide run making the Home Turn and ENTHRALLED finished the race off only fairly.  He said, in his view, ENTHRALLED is better suited by being ridden through the field towards the rail as it appears to finish its races off better when ridden in this manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on YOUNG BRILLIANT at the request of Trainer C H Yip.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG BRILLIANT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 10.4.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (wound to left front leg).  Before being allowed to race again, MASTER TRILLION will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid FLOOF.  Making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight was held up for clear running behind FLOOF.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped on jumping.  In the early stages raced keenly when being steadied to obtain cover.
Approaching the 500 Metres raced tight between FLOOF and MIDORI GIANT which lay in and away from MANAGEMENT FOLKS.

M Chadwick pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 750 Metres (see MIDORI GIANT). <17/4/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>The Veterinary Officer reported that PEGASUS GENERAL was lame in its left front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, PEGASUS GENERAL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Near the 350 Metres blundered.  Noted to have sustained a wound to the right front fetlock.

At declaration time L Hewitson was erroneously declared as the rider of MIDORI GIANT.  The Stewards acceded to a request by Trainer M Newnham soon after declarations to replace Jockey Hewitson with Jockey H Bowman as Jockey Bowman had been engaged to ride the horse.  For this error, Mr Newnham was fined the sum of $5,000.  Bumped on jumping.  M Chadwick (PEGASUS GENERAL) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 750 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out, resulting in MIDORI GIANT having to be checked to avoid PEGASUS GENERAL.  M Chadwick was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 4 May 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  After the event, H Bowman stated that after striking interference near the 750 Metres his mount did not run on in the Home Straight and, in his opinion, may not have run out the 2200 Metres of tonight’s event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1700 Metres was briefly crowded by ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT which shifted in when over-racing.  Leaving the 600 Metres lay in and made contact with the running rail.  After the event, Y L Chung stated that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the middle stages when CAPITAL LEGEND made a forward move and as a result ARTHUR’S KINGDOM did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned, Z Purton stated that from a wide barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position, similar to the manner in which his mount raced at its most recent start.  He said in the early and middle stages ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT raced keenly and refused to settle.  He added when CAPITAL LEGEND made a forward move  in the Back Straight his mount came under pressure and did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover until the 900 Metres where it commenced a forward move and was able to obtain the lead near the 700 Metres.

Was fractious whilst being transported to the course.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  For some distance shortly after the start made contact with DIAMOND SOARS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
L Ferraris pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 100 Metres (see SPICY SO SMART).  Lay out over the final 150 Metres.
In the early stages got its head up and raced ungenerously when being shifted in to obtain cover behind DAY DAY VICTORY.  PATCH OF WATCH then continued to race ungenerously in the middle stages.
No report.
Shortly after the start shifted out and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly and for some distance shortly after the start raced tight between DAY DAY VICTORY and HAPPY TANGO which shifted out slightly.  After the event, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that the instructions were to lead but after being crowded at the start DIAMOND SOARS settled further back than what had been intended.  Sent for sampling post-race.

L Ferraris (ACE TALENT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he permitted his mount to shift out when not clear of SPICY SO SMART, resulting in SPICY SO SMART losing its rightful running and having to be steadied to avoid ACE TALENT.  L Ferraris was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 30 April 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

On jumping was crowded between SOLAR UP and URBAN TRIUMPH which shifted out.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that despite being crowded at the start the instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages from a wide barrier.
Near the 100 Metres C L Chau dropped his whip.
On jumping was bumped and became unbalanced when positioned tight to the inside of ACE TALENT.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.

Slow to begin.  Making the Home Turn briefly raced tight to the inside of LEGENDARY IMPACT.  Near the 450 Metres became unbalanced when it made contact with LEGENDARY IMPACT. Near the 250 Metres was eased and shifted to the inside of KA YING ATTACK to secure clear running.
Over the final 100 Metres lay in under pressure and proved difficult to ride out.
Shortly after the start got its head up when being shifted across behind runners from a wide barrier.

Slow to begin.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  Near the 1100 Metres got its head up when being shifted in to obtain cover behind SPEEDY TRIDENT.  From the 400 Metres to the 350 Metres was held up for clear running behind LEGENDARY IMPACT.  After the event, L Hewitson stated that his mount responded only fairly to his riding in the Home Straight.  Trainer M Newnham stated that he would now give the horse a freshen-up before racing again.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, URBAN TRIUMPH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
In the middle stages raced keenly.
Jumped awkwardly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  For some distance near the 1000 Metres got its head up  when being steadied away from KA YING ATTACK.  Near the 450 Metres became unbalanced after making contact with REGAL GEM due to both runners shitting ground.
Near the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of REGAL GEM.
Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Making the Home Turn was held up behind BOWSER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

In the early part of the Home Straight was held up when unable to improve between BRAVE JOY and BEAUTY THUNDER.  As a result BOWSER was shifted to the outside of BEAUTY THUNDER where it obtained clear running near the 250 Metres.
No report.

Shifted in shortly after the start, made contact with CLUB ACE and became unbalanced.  In the Home Straight lay out, resulting in its rider Y L Chung changing his whip through to his left hand leaving the 200 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping was bumped heavily by CLUB ACE and then was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

On jumping was bumped heavily by RICH HORSE and then was crowded by TELECOM POWER which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  After the event, A Atzeni stated that his instructions were to allow his mount to settle where comfortable and not to make use of it in the early stages as CLUB ACE had not finished its races off at its most recent race starts when ridden in this manner.  He said after being crowded at the start CLUB ACE settled in a midfield position where it travelled comfortably.  He added in the Home Straight CLUB ACE finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, L Ferraris stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions and stated that he issued such instructions as SUPER CHARIZZARD did not finish the race off strongly when ridden forward from a wide barrier on 5 February 2025.
No report.

Trainer C Fownes advised that Jockey B Avdulla was given the option of taking up a forward position if his mount commenced well.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages GALVANIC did not show sufficient pace to hold a forward position and as a result was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Lay out making the Home Turn.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event, H Bowman stated that from an inside barrier when his mount commenced well he was able to take up a forward position without being pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the event, H Bentley stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Passing the 350 Metres was checked to avoid KA YING VICTORY and on straightening was shifted to that runner’s inside to secure clear running.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start bumped with POWER KOEPP and became unbalanced.  After the event, M F Poon stated that his mount jumped awkwardly and then did not travel well during the race.  He added, in his opinion, KA YING VICTORY may have been feeling the effects of the manner in which it jumped and he had concerns with its action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING VICTORY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <17/4/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>KA YING VICTORY, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time the horse was found to be lame in its right front leg. KA YING VICTORY was again examined by the Veterinary Surgeon at the stables of Trainer D J Hall this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to have sustained an injury to its right front tendon. As previously advised, KA YING VICTORY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Sent for sampling post-race.

He said after obtaining a position with cover behind the leaders SURE JOYFUL came under pressure along the Back Straight and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight. He said SMILING EMPEROR raced too keenly throughout the early and middle stages and after being crowded on the Home Turn when racing tight between THESIS and STORMI (C L Chau) which shifted out, his mount was unable to finish the race off thereafter.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced keenly in the lead in the early stages.  After the event, H Bowman stated he was given the option of going forward and leading if his mount commenced well. Before being allowed to race again, QINGYUAN STAR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Before being allowed to race again, UP WITH CHARM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Y L Chung (GOOD LUCK WIN) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1100 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in when not clear of CAMBRIDGE, resulting in CAMBRIDGE having to be checked to avoid the heels of GOOD LUCK WIN.  Y L Chung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 27 April 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 1 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Near the 450 Metres was briefly held up behind GOOD LUCK WIN.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied when held up behind OUTGATE which commenced to give ground.
Shortly after the start was bumped by SETANTA which shifted in.  After the event, K Teetan stated that instructions were to hold a midfield position.

Y L Chung (GOOD LUCK WIN) pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1100 Metres (see CAMBRIDGE).  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages, Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to endeavour to lead the event with the horse carrying a light weight.  He said in the early stages he endeavoured to comply with his instructions, however, when a number of runners held their position to his inside GOOD LUCK WIN was caught very wide.  He said having regard to his instructions he continued to urge his mount forward but when unable to cross he elected, approaching the 1100 Metres, to shift in behind the leaders to obtain cover.  The Stewards advised Jockey Chung that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages by persisting for too long in an endeavour to cross runners to his inside and he should have taken a position with cover behind the leaders sooner than what he did.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.
Sustained an abrasion to the right lip whilst being transported to Happy Valley, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.

Bumped at the start.  After the 500 Metres was hampered when taken wider by FLYING FORTRESS which shifted to the outside of IVY LEAGUE to improve.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He said with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time his mount did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  He added, in  his view, SUPER UNICORN may be better suited by being ridden in a conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Briefly held up for clear running near the 250 Metres when obtaining a narrow run between EVERSTAR and LOVING VIBES.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Had its left hind plate refitted in the holding stables, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

Leaving the 800 Metres lost ground when being steadied away from FATAL BLOW.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 1000 Metres, when being steadied to obtain cover behind SOLAR RIVER, commenced to race keenly, got its head up and became unbalanced.

Jumped only fairly.  Lay out making the first turn and approaching the 900 Metres got its head up when racing to the inside of LOVING VIBES.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
