He added that after settling back in the field LEAN HERO was unable to make up ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event, M F Poon stated that with his mount stepping up in distance and drawn well, he was asked to hold an on-pace position, similar to the manner in which the horse barrier trialed on 8 April 2025.  He said when SMART TRIO commenced well and showed good pace in the early stages he was able to lead without being pressured to do so.

Sustained a minor laceration to its left front leg whilst being transported to the course, examined and passed suitable to race.  Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the right side of its barrier and lost ground.
Approaching the 200 Metres was hampered when taken wider by FAMILY FORTUNE which shifted to the outside of TATTENHAM to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 200 Metres was held up for clear running before being shifted to the outside of TATTENHAM.  In this incident FAMILY FORTUNE made contact with MEEPMEEP.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event A Hamelin stated that the intention was to hold a midfield position.  He said when TATTENHAM jumped well and showed good pace in the early stages he continued to allow his mount to go forward and race outside the lead.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was checked when crowded between SUPER TREASURE and EN PERFECTO.  After the event M Chadwick stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but after being checked at the start his mount settled further back.  He added that in the middle stages SILVER DESTINY raced keenly and therefore near the 800 Metres he shifted his mount to the outside of MEEPMEEP to start a forward move.  He said as a result SILVER DESTINY then raced wide and without cover thereafter before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”

Badly crowded shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, EN PERFECTO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event M L Yeung stated that when the pace increased from the 700 Metres his mount came under pressure before it commenced to give ground in the Home Straight.  He added when he felt that there was something amiss with DECRELOT he did not continue to push it out over the final 200 Metres when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of DECRELOT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DECRELOT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

K Teetan (SHINE BRIGHT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 800 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of GOLDEN LUCK, resulting in GOLDEN LUCK having to be checked away from the heels of SHINE BRIGHT.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Saturday, 10 May 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

Jumped awkwardly and was bumped shortly afterwards.  Near the 50 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when attempting to improve into a narrow run between GOLDEN LUCK and JUBILANT WINNER.
Slow to begin.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Near the 400 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SILVER UP.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned B Avdulla stated that from the outside barrier his instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He said in the early stages he elected to remain racing wide so that he could assess if there was an opportunity to obtain a position in a three wide line with cover.  He said near the 1100 Metres when there was no opportunity to obtain cover he continued forward on MISTER DAPPER and as a result was obliged to make further use of his mount making the first turn to cross BEAUTY LIVE to avoid racing wide.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to remain racing to the outside of HE WAS ME rather than continuing forward of that runner, B Avdulla stated that as he was advised by Trainer D Eustace that MISTER DAPPER is one-paced, when HE WAS ME appeared to be under pressure he allowed MISTER DAPPER to continue to go forward and cross that runner to obtain a position on the rail so as to avoid holding his mount’s momentum.  He added after crossing to the rail he continued to ride MISTER DAPPER along from the 500 Metres in order to encourage the horse to finish the race off strongly.  Trainer Eustace confirmed the instructions issued and advised that having regard to the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time he felt that there was a brief opportunity for Jockey Avdulla to ride his mount with more patience from the 600 Metres.  After considering all the evidence the Stewards advised Jockey Avdulla that, in their opinion, he had made an error of judgement from the 600 Metres in continuing to ride his mount forward having regard to the use he had to make of MISTER DAPPER throughout the early and middle stages to obtain his position outside the lead.
No report.

Approaching the 400 Metres was briefly held up behind DOUBLE WIN.  J Orman (GALE SAGA) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he directed his mount in when insufficiently clear of THE AUSPICIOUS, resulting in THE AUSPICIOUS being crowded for room and being checked.  J Orman was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 14 May 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
No report.
No report.

He added when placed under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight STRATHPEFFER lay in and finished the race off only fairly thereafter.  Jockey Orman was warned in relation to using his whip in a forehand manner forward of the saddle on two occasions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on jumping.  After the event H Bentley stated that his mount raced greenly throughout the event and came under pressure when racing in restricted room to the inside of STRATHPEFFER near the 600 Metres.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by STRATHPEFFER which was taken out by GALLANT EPOCH.
Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.

Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind BLUE BARON.  After being shifted to the inside of BLUE BARON, DRAGON SUNRISE then lay in and away from that runner near the 200 Metres, shifted in and made contact with HE WAS ME.

Shortly after the start raced tight between SILVER UP and ETALON OR which shifted in.  GALE SAGA was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  J Orman was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 300 Metres (see THE AUSPICIOUS).  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight J Orman stated that after following BRIGHT INHERITANCE into the event he was of the opinion that runner was not improving and would not take him into the race.  He said for this reason near the 400 Metres he elected to shift to the outside of BRIGHT INHERITANCE in an attempt to secure clear running but soon after he did so HE WAS ME commenced to give ground and he was obliged to check to avoid that runner’s heels.  He added as a result he then shifted to the inside of HE WAS ME to secure clear running but as he did so he was again obliged to check his mount as he endeavoured to prevent causing interference to THE AUSPICIOUS.  He said after losing momentum at this point GALE SAGA did not finish the race off thereafter.  Jockey Orman agreed with the Stewards that he had made an error of judgement in the early part of the Home Straight by shifting to the outside of BRIGHT INHERITANCE.
No report.
Near the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between GALE SAGA and DRAGON SUNRISE which lay in.

Crowded shortly after the start.  After the event L Ferraris stated that following his mount receiving crowding at the start it settled further back in the field than what had been intended.  He said GOLDEN FRIENDSHIP, which was  having its first race start on the All Weather Track, did not appreciate racing on this surface and this was the principal reason for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.<22/4/2025 Additional Veterinary Reports>GOLDEN FRIENDSHIP, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. GOLDEN FRIENDSHIP was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer K H Ting yesterday morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, GOLDEN FRIENDSHIP will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shortly after the start shifted in and was bumped on the hindquarters. A Hamelin pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 100 Metres (see INCREDIBLE MOMENT).  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was bumped by SUNNY DARLING, resulting in INCREDIBLE MOMENT then shifting out and making contact with PRIME MORTAR.  K Teetan (TELECOM POWER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out, resulting in TELECOM POWER making heavy contact with INCREDIBLE MOMENT and INCREDIBLE MOMENT becoming badly unbalanced due to that contact.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 14 May 2025 and to expire on Monday, 19 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  A Hamelin (JOLLY RULER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of INCREDIBLE MOMENT, resulting in INCREDIBLE MOMENT having to be checked away from JOLLY RULER.  A Hamelin was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 18 May 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.

Sustained minor abrasions to the jaw and the right hock whilst being transported to the course.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. After the event L Ferraris stated that his intention was to lead but despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to hold out PARENTS’ LOVE.  He said throughout the event YOUTHFUL SPIRITS raced "flat” before making a respiratory noise when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer M Newnham stated that having regard to the manner in which YOUTHFUL SPIRITS raced tonight he would now give the horse a freshen-up before its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found it to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  The performance of YOUTHFUL SPIRITS was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUTHFUL SPIRITS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. Approaching the 1300 Metres was bumped by LUCK IS BACK and became unbalanced.  Approaching the 300 Metres was steadied to avoid NORTHERN BEAST when that runner commenced to give ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start shifted in and made contact with LEAN HERO.  Approaching the 1300 Metres shifted out and away from the rail, made contact with GOOD LUCK WIN and became unbalanced.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned K Teetan stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position from his wide barrier and he was given the option to allow NORTHERN BEAST to lead if the circumstances of the race permitted.  He said after riding his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions he was caught racing wide to the outside of GOOD LUCK WIN.  He said when he did not observe an opportunity to obtain a position with cover he continued to urge NORTHERN BEAST forward where he was able to cross to the lead near the 1200 Metres.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to set a slower pace between the 1200 Metres and the 800 Metres K Teetan stated that as NORTHERN BEAST was racing a little keenly due to the manner he was obliged to ride it to cross to the lead, he was reluctant to place too much pressure on the horse to reduce the pace as it was travelling comfortably.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions issued and stated that, in his opinion, NORTHERN BEAST was disadvantaged by setting too fast a pace in the early and middle stages of the event.   After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Teetan in going forward to lead were reasonable in the circumstances, however, he was advised that, in the opinion of the Stewards, he should have made a greater effort between the 1200 Metres and the 800 Metres to set a more sustainable tempo to give NORTHERN BEAST the opportunity to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
In the early stages raced keenly.  Over the concluding stages shifted out away from the winning post and as a result was obliged to be corrected by its rider K Teetan.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start raced tight between SMILING COLLECTOR and PING HAI COMET.  Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Passing the winning post was hampered when BEAUTY VIVA shifted out and away from YOUTH POWER.  H Bowman was warned in relation to raising his whip arm above shoulder height on one occasion near the 200 Metres.

In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 800 Metres was shifted to the outside of ORIENTAL SMOKE which resulted in PING HAI COMET racing wide and without cover thereafter.  In the Home Straight lay in under pressure.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Lay in over the final 100 Metres and approaching the winning post A Badel was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to BEAUTY VIVA.

Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to PING HAI COMET.  After the event J McDonald stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages.  He said near the 600 Metres VOLCANIC SPARK came under pressure and after being unable to secure a tight run between GLUCK RACER and ORIENTAL SMOKE on the Home Turn his mount finished the race off only fairly thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Lay out when under pressure in the Home Straight.  After the event H Bentley stated that he was instructed to hold an on-pace position and was given the option to lead as connections were of the view there was not strong pace engaged in the race.  He said after his mount jumped well and when runners to his inside did not show intent to lead he elected to allow SMILING COLLECTOR to stride forward to lead the event without having to apply pressure to his mount to do so.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded by ORIENTAL SMOKE (H Bowman) which shifted in when not clear.  H Bowman was reprimanded.

Approaching the 1200 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from PING HAI COMET.  After the event J Moreira stated that he was issued with no specific instruction other than to attempt to find cover.  He said in the early stages he was unable to comply with his instructions which resulted in MATSU VICTOR racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer K W Lui advised that the horse had pleased him leading into the race and attributed the disappointing performance to the horse experiencing a wide run during the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MATSU VICTOR was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, MATSU VICTOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running when being shifted to the outside of DIVANO.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, MARKWIN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race. <28/4/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>After the race, MARKWIN was found to have bled from both nostrils. MARKWIN was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer W K Mo this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg. As previously advised, MARKWIN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
No report.

On jumping made contact with MID WINTER WIND, shifted in and was then steadied away from DANCING CODE when that runner shifted out at the start.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.
K C Leung was warned in relation to using the whip forward of the saddle in a forehand manner on one occasion near the 100 Metres.
Approaching the 900 Metres, when racing tight to the inside of HEALTHY HAPPY, commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied.

Approaching the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between TAJ DRAGON (J McDonald) which shifted in slightly and MARKWIN (H Bentley) which shifted out.  J McDonald was advised to exercise more care.  H Bentley was reprimanded.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event B Avdulla stated that after settling back in the field his mount was disadvantaged when positioned behind TAJ DRAGON and MID WINTER WIND as those runners did not take him into the event.  He said in the Home Straight YOUNG CHAMPION finished the race off only fairly but in his opinion was not suited by having to race back in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Z Purton stated that DIVANO responded well to his riding in the early part of the Home Straight.  He added that near the 100 Metres he had some concern with his mount’s action and for this reason he did not fully test DIVANO out to the finish of the event when he felt there was something amiss with it.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, DIVANO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event J McDonald stated that although TAJ DRAGON raced wide and without cover, when under pressure in the Home Straight he had concern with his horse’s action and as a result he eased it down from the event when not in a competitive position in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of TAJ DRAGON was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, TAJ DRAGON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Crowded leaving the 1100 Metres.  Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1000 Metres lay in and away from DO YOUR PART and as a result made contact with WIN SPEED.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was badly held up for clear running when unable to improve between DEVILDOM and GOLDEN DARCI.  Noted to have sustained abrasions to the right hind fetlock after the race.
Near the 950 Metres was eased when being crossed by DO YOUR PART.

After the event L Ferraris stated that whilst he had been instructed to hold a forward position he did not expect to lead.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he allowed DO YOUR PART to go forward and race in the lead to avoid covering additional ground.

After the event K Teetan reported that from the outside barrier his instructions were to obtain a midfield position.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to come back and race at the tail of the field to avoid covering additional ground.
Bumped shortly after the start.

H Bentley (BLAZING BEAM) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 1100 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of PATCH OF STARS, resulting in PATCH OF STARS having to be steadied and taken in onto FORERUNNER, resulting in FORERUNNER being steadied and losing its rightful running.  H Bentley  was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Saturday, 10 May 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by PANDA LEGEND.

H Bentley was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 1100 Metres (see FORERUNNER).  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind MONTA FRUTTA which was giving ground.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 1000 Metres was bumped by SUPER EXPRESS.

Near the 350 Metres PANDA LEGEND (H T Mo) endeavoured to obtain a run between WIN SPEED and FORERUNNER when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in PANDA LEGEND having to be checked near the 300 Metres, shifting out and making contact with FORERUNNER.  H T Mo was reprimanded and advised he must ensure that there is comfortable racing room to improve into.
Bumped shortly after the start.

After the event A Badel stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He added as a result when his mount jumped only fairly he was obliged to make use of it in the early stages to comply with his instructions, but when unable to obtain a position closer to the rail MONTA FRUTTA raced wide and without cover before giving ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer A S Cruz confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of MONTA FRUTTA, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MONTA FRUTTA will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped on jumping.  Approaching the winning post shifted out, resulting in its rider M L Yeung having to stop riding and straighten his mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after the start was crowded between TIME TO FIRE and RAINBOW SEVEN.  Approaching the 300 Metres was disappointed for clear running to the inside of RAINBOW SEVEN which shifted in.  Approaching the 150 Metres was steadied to avoid RAINBOW SEVEN which shifted to the outside of AMAZING GALAXY to obtain clear running.   Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration if there were grounds for a protest/objection on behalf of LUCKY MY WAY against RAINBOW SEVEN being declared 2nd placegetter due to incidents that occurred approaching the 300 Metres and approaching the 150 Metres.  When the Stewards were satisfied there were not sufficient grounds having regard to the margin of 1 ¼ lengths between the two horses at the finish weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.
Bumped on jumping.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind TOP THRONE.
No report.
Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.
Bumped near the 550 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
In the Home Straight lay in and had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 400 Metres and the 100 Metres.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to cross runners to its inside and as a result was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event J Moreira stated that his mount did not run on in the Home Straight due to it racing wide and without cover.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 550 Metres was bumped and taken wider by BEAUTY MISSILE which shifted to the outside of AEROINVINCIBLE.

After the event K Teetan stated that from the outside barrier he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to take up a position outside the lead.  He said under its weight of 134 lbs TOP THRONE did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of TOP THRONE was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP THRONE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by INVINCIBLE SAGE which shifted in.

Approaching the 500 Metres was steadied away from SATONO REVE.  Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight.  After the event J McDonald reported that his mount was coughing post-race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <28/4/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>After the race, LUCKY SWEYNESSE was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. LUCKY SWEYNESSE was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer K L Man this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY SWEYNESSE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Trainer W K Mo confirmed that from a wide barrier he had instructed C Soumillon to go forward and lead.  He said he issued such instructions today as MAGIC CONTROL had raced in a disappointing manner over 1200 Metres when ridden conservatively in the early stages.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  In the early and middle stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres was checked to avoid KA YING RISING when being crossed by that runner.  BEAUTY WAVES then raced wide and without cover thereafter.
Near the 850 Metres was taken wider by BEAUTY WAVES.

After the event C Williams reported that his mount did not feel comfortable in its action behind when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.
On jumping was bumped by BEAUTY WAVES which shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Noted to have lost its left hind plate after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 450 Metres was steadied when crowded by TAI VICTORY (A Badel) which shifted out.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
After the event A Badel reported that from an inside barrier he was asked to take up a more forward position to make use of the favourable barrier.
Bounded on jumping and lost ground.

After the event M L Yeung stated that his instructions from the outside barrier were to ride his mount in a conservative manner.  Trainer T P Yung confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions as FREE PONY had raced in a disappointing manner when ridden in a forward position at its previous race starts in Hong Kong.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 1100 Metres was shifted out to avoid STRAIGHT ARRON which resulted in PROGNOSIS racing in a three wide position for a short distance thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned A De Vries stated that approaching the 900 Metres ENSUED improved to his outside which resulted in CALIF commencing to race keenly.  He said as a result he was obliged to severely check his mount to avoid the heels of MOMENTS IN TIME which resulted in his mount becoming unbalanced.
B Avdulla pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 300 Metres (see LIBERTY ISLAND).
C Williams pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1800 Metres (see MOMENTS IN TIME).

Slow to begin.  Near the 300 Metres was badly crowded for room.  Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration as to whether there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection to be lodged on behalf of the connections of RUBYLOT following RUBYLOT being badly crowded near the 300 Metres when ENSUED shifted out.  After considering the manner in which both horses finished the race off and the margin of a long head between the two horses at the finish, the Stewards declined to lodge a protest/objection.

C Williams (CAP FERRAT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1800 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when insufficiently clear of MOMENTS IN TIME, resulting in MOMENTS IN TIME having to be checked to avoid the heels of CAP FERRAT.  C Williams was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 18 May 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 22 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
No report.
Near the 300 Metres became unbalanced when buffeted for room between RUBYLOT and PROGNOSIS.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned Z Purton stated that in the middle stages EL VENCEDOR raced too keenly and refused to settle despite his efforts.  He said this was the reason why his mount was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

B Avdulla (ENSUED) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of LIBERTY ISLAND, resulting in LIBERTY ISLAND being badly crowded for room and taken out onto RUBYLOT, resulting in RUBYLOT also being crowded for room and GOLIATH becoming unbalanced when buffeted for room between RUBYLOT and PROGNOSIS.  B Avdulla was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 14 May 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 22 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Avdulla was fined $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his poor race riding record.  Near the 250 Metres went amiss when it sustained an injury to its left front leg and was eased down from the event.  When questioned Y Kawada stated that the horse travelled only fairly during the race, however, he had no concern with its action prior to the 250 Metres.  He said, in his opinion, whilst LIBERTY ISLAND was crowded near the 300 Metres this had no bearing on the horse going amiss near the 250 Metres.  Samples were taken from the horse.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Blundered on jumping.  The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in as they were of the view that an incident occurred over the concluding stages which cast doubt as to whether RED LION should be declared the winner.  Subsequently J McDonald, the rider of VOYAGE BUBBLE, 2nd placegetter, lodged a protest/objection against RED LION being declared the winner alleging interference over the concluding stages.  After considering the evidence the Stewards found that RED LION shifted out over the concluding stages, making slight contact with VOYAGE BUBBLE, however, they could not be comfortably satisfied that had the contact not have occurred that VOYAGE BUBBLE would have finished in advance of RED LION and therefore the protest/objection was overruled and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.
Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when being crossed by RED LION.
Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Near the 400 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of MR BRIGHTSIDE to obtain clear running.  BEAUTY JOY then had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 200 Metres was shifted to the inside of ROYAL PATRONAGE to continue into clear running.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly and then was steadied when crowded by SUNLIGHT POWER which shifted in.
No report.

Shortly after the start was crowded between HAPPY TOGETHER and MR BRIGHTSIDE, both of which shifted ground.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  After the event T Clark stated that his mount became worked up behind the starting gates, travelled only fairly during the event and did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event C Williams stated that his mount raced a little keenly during the race but was still disappointing in its failure to respond in the Home Straight and he could offer no excuse for the horse’s performance.  Trainer B Hayes stated that the horse settled a little further back than what had been anticipated and then was disadvantaged by racing too keenly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 150 Metres A Badel’s whip was knocked from his grasp by the whip of A Hamelin, rider of MULTIDARLING.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After travelling a short distance was steadied when crowded between GIMME FIVE and WINNING TURN, both of which shifted ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Held up making the Home Turn.  For some distance after the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

Near the 1000 Metres got its head up when crowded between MULTIDARLING which was taken out by WINNING TURN and WINNING HEART (A Badel) which shifted in.  A Badel was reprimanded.
Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with the hindquarters of JOYFUL LIFE.
After the event M F Poon reported that his mount failed to run out the 1200 Metres of tonight’s event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping.
Between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running when unable to improve between SPEEDY FORTUNE and JOYFUL LIFE.

After the event H Bowman stated that his mount travelled only fairly during the race and came under pressure approaching the 600 Metres before failing to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, ISLAND GOLDEN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced  keenly in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the final 250 Metres lay out under pressure.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight A Badel stated that after being challenged in the lead by EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS, BEAUTY GLORY came under pressure soon after entering the Home Straight.  He said as he commenced to ride his mount along BEAUTY GLORY hung out and this resulted in EVERYONE’S STAR being able to secure clear running to his inside.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 250 Metres was directed to the outside of EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS to continue into clear running.
Leaving the 100 Metres was steadied when crowded between HAROLD WIN (A Atzeni) and BEAUTY GLORY (A Badel), both of which shifted ground.  Both A Atzeni and A Badel were advised to exercise more care.
No report.

J McDonald pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 300 Metres (see CHARMING BABE).  After the event J McDonald stated this his mount raced "flat” today and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 300 Metres was eased to avoid CHARMING BABE.  After the event C Williams stated that his mount settled behind midfield and in the Home Straight when under pressure did not respond to his riding and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

J McDonald (CHARMING LEGEND) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of CHARMING BABE, resulting in CHARMING BABE being checked.  J McDonald was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 30 April 2025 and to expire on Monday, 5 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of UNIVERSAL HORIZON was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, UNIVERSAL HORIZON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 25.4.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter CHARMING BABE.  Before being allowed to race again, SILO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On jumping bumped with FAST SPEED. As a result MORGAN SUCCESS was held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.

Bumped approaching the 200 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, TURIN STARSPANGLED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Made contact with a rail leaving the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped on jumping. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Raced wide and without cover until near the 800 Metres when it was ridden forward to obtain a position outside the lead.  Sent for sampling post-race.
K De Melo was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference after the 300 Metres (see U S S CONSTITUTION).  Sent for sampling post-race.
M L Yeung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference after the 300 Metres (see U S S CONSTITUTION).
No report.
Taken out after the 300 Metres.

Near the 1200 Metres was steadied when crowded by ORIENTAL TYCOON (K C Leung) which shifted in when not quite clear.  K C Leung was advised to exercise more care.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages and if there was an opportunity to make more effort to hold his position to the inside of ORIENTAL TYCOON, Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He said when positioned to the inside of ORIENTAL TYCOON in the early stages he was reluctant to make too much use of his mount as YOUNG HORIZON has a sensitive mouth and if he was required to take corrective action this would result in his mount over-reacting to his efforts.  He said for this reason he rode YOUNG HORIZON in a neutral manner in the early stages which then allowed ORIENTAL TYCOON to cross him approaching the 1200 Metres.
Hampered when taken out after the 300 Metres.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  M L Yeung (MEDIC ELITE) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 300 Metres he directed his mount out when not clear of HARRY’S HERO, resulting in HARRY’S HERO initially being taken out and then shifting out away from MEDIC ELITE, resulting in FIRE BALL being taken out from its rightful running and also forcing ORIENTAL TYCOON to be taken out from its rightful running which resulted in U S S CONSTITUTION which was following ORIENTAL TYCOON having to be checked and also contributing to GOLD TACK having to be checked when disappointed for clear running between U S S CONSTITUTION and CERVIN.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 18 May 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  K De Melo (HARRY’S HERO) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after being taken out by MEDIC ELITE after the 300 Metres he permitted his mount to shift out whilst riding it along, resulting in FIRE BALL being taken out from its rightful running and also forcing ORIENTAL TYCOON to be taken out from its rightful running which resulted in U S S CONSTITUTION having to be checked away from ORIENTAL TYCOON  and also contributing to GOLD TACK having to be checked when disappointed for clear running between U S S CONSTITUTION and CERVIN.  K De Melo was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 21 May 2025 and to expire on Monday, 26 May 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
After the 300 Metres was checked when disappointed for clear running between CERVIN and U S S CONSTITUTION.
Jumped only fairly.

Near the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid CERVIN.  Near the 250 Metres was hampered when taken wider by CERVIN.  After the event L Hewitson stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He added SKY PROPHET raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and after being taken wider approaching the 800 Metres did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions and said he issued such instructions as SKY PROPHET was stepping up to 1650 Metres tonight and was racing at the Happy Valley circuit.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SKY PROPHET was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, SKY PROPHET will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 250 Metres was hampered when taken wider by GOLD TACK.  When questioned Z Purton stated that the instructions were to ride the horse in a midfield position to endeavour to obtain cover.  He said in the early stages when YOUNG HORIZON was steadied to avoid ORIENTAL TYCOON, CERVIN commenced to race fiercely and as a result was checked away from YOUNG HORIZON.  He added that CERVIN continued to race fiercely throughout the middle stages and as a result near the 800 Metres he shifted his mount out to commence a forward move and to provide it with clear running.  He further stated that as a result CERVIN failed to run on in the Home Straight.  Trainer W Y So confirmed the instructions and said such instructions were issued to attempt to provide CERVIN with the opportunity to finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of CERVIN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CERVIN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.  Over the concluding stages lay in.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the 250 Metres raced tight between THE AZURE and TURIN WARRIOR which lay out before being corrected by its rider.
Lay out after the 250 Metres, resulting in its rider H Bowman having to correct his mount.

After the event J Orman stated that the intention was to find a position outside the lead, but his mount raced keenly in the early stages and as a result ran inside of standard time in the lead during the early and middle stages.

After the event K De Melo reported that with the pace of the event being run inside of standard time his mount did not travel well during the early and middle stages and finished the race off only fairly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 600 Metres made contact with the running rail and became unbalanced.

Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with THE AZURE.  After the 1100 Metres lay in and away  from CONFRINGO and became unbalanced when it was positioned close to the running rail.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position. Noted to have lost its right hind plate after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event K Teetan stated that whilst he was obliged to race three wide he had cover behind LO PAN SPIRIT.  He said in the Home Straight SOLID CAR finished the race off only fairly when placed under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

K De Melo (GOLDEN EMPIRE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that shortly after the start he permitted his mount to shift in when not clear of CHARMING BABE, resulting in CHARMING BABE having to be checked.  K De Melo was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 11 June 2025 and to expire on Sunday, 15 June 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.
Approaching the 1100 Metres raced in restricted room between CHARMING BABE and SOLID CAR and as a result commenced to race keenly.

Was found to have skin disease after arriving at the Happy Valley Racecourse.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found not to be suitable to start.   Acting on this advice VICTORY MOMENTS was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, VICTORY MOMENTS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then made contact with DRAGON FOUR SEAS.
No report.
No report.
Bumped on jumping.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully tested when racing tight between KAHOLO ANGEL and SOVEREIGN FUND, both of which shifted ground slightly.
No report.
No report.

After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount did not travel comfortably when positioned inside of other runners close to the rail.  He added that in the Home Straight GOLDEN RISE did not respond strongly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event Z Purton stated that when caught wide in the early and middle stages his mount raced keenly.  He said as a result in the Home Straight ETERNAL FORTUNE did not respond to his riding and gave ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Approaching the 250 Metres shifted in when racing greenly and was steadied away from WARRIORS DREAM.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  From the outside barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  For some distance near the 600 Metres was steadied away from VICTORY SKY.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly approaching the 1400 Metres when being steadied to obtain cover behind DEFINITIVE.  Lay in when placed under pressure over the final 100 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned A Badel stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but in the early stages he was obliged to settle towards the rear of the field when caught wide.  He said entering the Back Straight leaving the 800 Metres he elected to commence a forward move on STURDY RUBY as he had anticipated the pace of the event to slow.  He said when the pace remained inside of standard time he was unable to continue forward and after being taken wider by SETANTA approaching the 400 Metres he was able to follow that horse into the Home Straight.  He further stated that under pressure thereafter STURDY RUBY finished the race off well.

After the 1400 Metres raced tight to the inside of FLYING FORTRESS when that runner was taken in slightly by STAR CONTACT.  A short distance later BEAUTY CRESCENT then commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from SKY HEART.

After the event Z Purton stated that when caught wide in the early stages he was required to steady his mount so that he could obtain a position closer to the rail with cover.  He said as a result HAMERON settled further back in the field than what had been intended.

After the event K Teetan reported that he was obliged to make some use of his mount in the early stages to hold an on-pace position after DEFINITIVE jumped only fairly.  He said in the early stages his mount was pressured by STAR CONTACT when that runner went forward and then when placed under pressure in the Home Straight DEFINITIVE finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its barrier.  After the event H Bowman stated that he was able to lead the event comfortably but his mount did not respond to his riding when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
After the event B Avdulla stated that from the outside barrier he was given the option to go forward if his mount commenced well.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued.
Passing the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of STAR CONTACT to continue into clear running.

Leaving the 600 Metres lay in and away from A AMERIC TE SPECSO and became unbalanced when positioned close to the running rail.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 300 Metres shifted in abruptly, resulting in its rider K Teetan having to stop riding and straighten his mount for a short distance.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.
Shortly after the start shifted in abruptly and made contact with WIN METHOD.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Near the 100 Metres was shifted to the inside of KIAMA to continue into clear running.  SPARKLE AND GOLD then lay in over the final 100 Metres.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.
No report.

After arriving at the starting gates was found to be coughing and have a nasal discharge.  Acting on veterinary advice that THE ALL OUT was unsuitable to race it was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  A subsequent endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, THE ALL OUT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 3.5.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right hind).  Before being allowed to race again, JUST FOLLOW ME will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Apprentice P N Wong pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 900 Metres (see WIND SPEEDER).  After the event Apprentice P N Wong confirmed that with the blinkers being applied for the first time she was instructed to lead on the horse from its wide barrier.  Noted to have a small abrasion to the left hock.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Checked leaving the 900 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Checked leaving the 900 Metres when the pace steadied.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event C L Chau stated that over the concluding stages his whip became entangled in his reins which restricted his ability to fully test his mount out to the finish of the event.
Jumped awkwardly.  Steadied leaving the 900 Metres to avoid SUPER EAGLE.  From the 400 Metres until the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Lay in in the Home Straight.

On jumping was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Apprentice P N Wong (CIRCUIT VICTORY) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that leaving the 900 Metres she allowed her mount to shift in when not clear of WIND SPEEDER, resulting in WIND SPEEDER being checked to avoid the heels of CIRCUIT VICTORY and also striking the heels of CIRCUIT VICTORY and further as she did shift in when not clear she steadied the pace which resulted in  EVER SMART which was following and also SUPER EAGLE having to be checked.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 25 May 2025 and to expire on Sunday, 1 June 2025 on which day she may resume race riding (2 Sha Tin racedays - as she is not eligible to ride at Happy Valley).  In addition, Apprentice Wong was fined $10,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered her neutral race riding record.

Slow to begin.  After the event H Bowman stated that with the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time FAIRY HORSE was unable to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
On jumping was bumped by CIRCUIT VICTORY which shifted out.

After the event A Atzeni stated that with the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time FLYING PHANTOM raced keenly.  He said after being steadied away from SPEEDY SMARTIE near the 600 Metres FLYING PHANTOM did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event B Avdulla stated that LUCKY MAN was forced very wide and without cover from the 800 Metres and as a result was unable to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Z Purton stated that after being checked leaving the 900 Metres SUPER EAGLE then raced keenly for some distance thereafter and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER EAGLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Jumped only fairly, shifted out and made contact with WIND SPEEDER.
Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount jumped only fairly and as a result was unable to lead as instructed.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Near the 1300 Metres was steadied to avoid STEPS AHEAD (L Ferraris) which shifted in when not quite clear.  L Ferraris was advised to ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  FLAMINGO TRILLION then raced keenly for some distance thereafter.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event M F Poon could offer no excuse for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Withdrawn by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice at 12:14 pm when it was found to have a skin condition in the stable.  Before being allowed to race again, ENCOUNTERED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded by CLUB ACE (B Avdulla) which shifted in.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.  Momentarily crowded near the 850 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of LUCKY SYMPHONY.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by KING OBERON which shifted in.  Near the 850 Metres shifted in and away from GOLDEN LUCK.
Jumped awkwardly, got its head up and became unbalanced.
Made contact with a running rail on entering the track, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 250 Metres was taken out by CLUB ACE.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between YIU CHEUNG VICTORY which shifted out and BULL ATTITUDE which shifted in and made contact with PERFECTDAY.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped only fairly.  Over the concluding stages made contact with BULL ATTITUDE due to both runners shifting ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 650 Metres was steadied away from CONCORDE STAR.  Over the concluding stages made contact with BETTER AND BETTER due to both runners shifting ground.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by CALL ME GORGEOUS.  Under pressure in the Home Straight lay in.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Near the 650 Metres was hampered when taken wider by BULL ATTITUDE which shifted out.

When questioned Z Purton stated that after entering the Home Straight when being placed under pressure CROSSBORDERPEGASUS commenced to hang in.  He said near the 250 Metres he then pulled his whip through to his right hand after which CROSSBORDERPEGASUS then hung in severely which restricted his ability to fully ride the horse out to the finish of the race as he was concerned it would shift in and interfere with runners positioned to his inside.  He added that over the concluding stages when he was satisfied CROSSBORDERPEGASUS was in a winning position he placed further pressure to his left rein to ensure that runners positioned to his inside had comfortable racing room and as a result was unable to ride his mount out to the finish.  Trainer J Size stated that he has endeavoured to improve the horse’s racing manners by placing a butterfly bit on CROSSBORDERPEGASUS to prevent it from hanging in.  He said, in his view, CROSSBORDERPEGASUS’ racing manners will improve with  further racing and by being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  After considering the matter the Stewards placed a warning on the racing manners of CROSSBORDERPEGASUS and advised Mr Size that the horse’s racing manners are now placed on notice and should it race in a similar manner in future where it compromises its placing in the field the Stewards may take further action against the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 200 Metres lay out when under pressure, resulting in its rider Y L Chung having to straighten on a number of occasions.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the first turn raced keenly when being crossed by ANOTHER ZONDA. Over the concluding stages lay in away from CROSSBORDERPEGASUS when racing tight to the inside of that runner.

After the event C L Chau stated that the instructions were to hold a handy position with cover.  He said in the early stages when positioned three wide to the outside of KA YING ATTACK he was obliged to allow ANOTHER ZONDA to go forward and race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.
Over the final 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when endeavouring to improve between ANOTHER ZONDA and SUPER FORTUNE.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by ALL ROUND WINNER which shifted out.
Jumped only fairly.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For some distance near the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between CARRYON SMILING and GALLANT EPOCH and made contact with GALLANT EPOCH when obtaining a narrow run.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start was then crowded by POCHETTINO which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Lay in over the final 200 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Slow to begin.  A warning was placed on the barrier manners of the horse.  Making the Home Turn and in the Home Straight lay out.  Approaching the 50 Metres was shifted to the outside of CARRYON SMILING to continue into clear running.

Approaching the 800 Metres was checked to avoid POCHETTINO and as a result was shifted out away from that runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded between HAPPY UNIVERSE and AMAZING VICTORY which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Crowded at the start.  After the event M F Poon stated that the intention was to find cover.  He said in the early stages when GALLANT EPOCH did not continue forward he was left racing without cover and unsuited by having GALLANT EPOCH race to his outside.  He said as a result HAPPY UNIVERSE did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 800 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid BEAU CADEAU when that runner was eased to allow GALLANT EPOCH to cross.

Near the 300 Metres was contacted by FORTUNE BOY.  After the event H Bowman stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to take up a forward position from his wide barrier.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside GALLANT EPOCH raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GALLANT EPOCH was considered disappointing as compared to its last start.  Before being allowed to race again, GALLANT EPOCH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Crowded at the start.  After the 800 Metres MUSANG KING improved to the inside of ETALON OR when that runner was taken wider.  ETALON OR (A Badel) then shifted back in to resume his position when not clear of MUSANG KING, resulting in MUSANG KING having to be checked.  A Badel was reprimanded and advised he must ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground to resume his position.
No report.
Eased approaching the 800 Metres.
For a short distance after the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by REZEKI.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out abruptly at the start and was bumped.
Jumped only fairly.

When questioned regarding her riding in the middle stages and the reason she improved to the outside of ACROSS DA UNIVERSE leaving the 700 Metres, Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to hold a forward position.  She said after being able to obtain a position with cover behind ACROSS DA UNIVERSE  she elected to shift to that runner’s outside leaving the 700 Metres as CIRCUIT MIGHTY has a tendency to race keenly and she wanted to give the horse an unimpeded run in the race.  She added that after being obliged to race four wide and without cover from the 700 Metres CIRCUIT MIGHTY responded well to her urgings in the Home Straight.  The Stewards advised Apprentice Wong that, in their opinion, she had made an error of judgement by shifting to the outside of ACROSS DA UNIVERSE too soon which resulted in her mount racing unnecessarily wide in the middle stages.
Near the 350 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of SIGHT DREAMER to continue into clear running.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by COLOURFUL WINNER which shifted out abruptly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Throughout the early stages raced keenly as its rider J Orman endeavoured to restrain his mount to find cover.  SIGHT DREAMER did not respond to his efforts and was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.
Near the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between ACROSS DA UNIVERSE and SHAMUS STORM (Z Purton) which shifted out to improve.  Z Purton was reprimanded.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
After the event B Avdulla stated that when his mount commenced well he elected to go forward to capitalise on its good start.

Made contact with the right side of the starting gate on jumping.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, C YEAH will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the 500 Metres was bumped and taken wider by BRAVEHEARTS which shifted out to improve.  After the event Z Purton stated that on jumping the horse made contact with the left side of its barrier, resulting in his left foot striking the starting gates and slipping in his stirrup.  He said as a result shortly after the start he was obliged to adjust his left foot in his stirrup using his left hand.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.  Shifted out after the 500 Metres and made contact with BUNDLE AWARD.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was bumped by PACKING TURBINE which shifted out.  After the event A Atzeni stated that the intention was to hold a handy position with cover.  He said when SENOR TOBA held its position to his inside in the early stages he elected to allow GOLD MASTER to stride forward and race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with WINNING WING.  Leaving the 50 Metres was shifted to the inside of LIVEANDLETLIVE to continue into clear running.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 600 Metres made contact with the running rail.

When questioned J Orman stated that the instructions were to hold a forward position but after AGENDA jumped only fairly and then was bumped by SENOR TOBA, his mount settled further back than intended.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight AGENDA hung in and over the final 150 Metres was very difficult to ride out when it continued to hang in.  J Orman was notified of his obligation under the Rules to report any occurrence during a race which might affect his ability to fully test his horse.  A warning was placed on the racing manners of AGENDA.
Near the 1900 Metres was bumped by PACKING HURRICANE which shifted in.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.
Shifted in near the 1900 Metres and bumped MIGHTY STRENGTH.
Trainer A S Cruz confirmed that with the horse stepping up to 2000 Metres for the first time he had instructed A Badel to ride LOVERO in a conservative manner in the early stages.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  After the event Z Purton stated that the connections had asked him to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages and to make a run from the 600 Metres.  He said in accordance with his instructions he commenced a move from back in the field near the 600 Metres which resulted in PACKING TURBINE having to make a wide run and being unable to finish the race off when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding from the 600 Metres and if there was an opportunity to follow FIGHT TIME into the event, H Bowman stated that his mount travelled well in a handy position behind and to the inside of FIGHT TIME.  He said leaving the 600 Metres he contemplated shifting out to follow FIGHT TIME into the race, however, when he became concerned that FIGHT TIME was under pressure, he elected not to do so as he also would have been required to come back slightly to provide himself with comfortable racing room to follow FIGHT TIME.  He added after committing to the inside of FIGHT TIME near the 550 Metres, that runner then unexpectedly improved to the outside of PEARL OF PANG’S which then resulted in MAX QUE having to be checked near the 350 Metres when disappointed for clear running between FIGHT TIME and PEARL OF PANG’S.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.

After the event H T Mo reported that after obtaining the lead in the early stages his mount raced too keenly which resulted in it running inside of standard time despite his efforts to restrain the horse and to set a more sustainable pace.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped by SPIRIT OF PEACE and became unbalanced.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 300 Metres was held up for clear running when endeavouring to obtain a narrow run between BLUE BARON and MIGHTY STEED.  In this incident SPIRIT OF PEACE made contact with MIGHTY STEED.  Over the final 100 Metres lay in, resulting in its rider B Avdulla having to correct his mount on a number of occasions.

Jumped awkwardly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running when endeavouring to improve into a narrow run between BLUE BARON which lay in and MAX QUE which shifted out.
On jumping became unbalanced when crowded between DAZZLING FIT and BLUE BARON.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Noted to have sustained speedy cuts to both hind legs.
On jumping was crowded by HANDSOME BOMB which shifted out.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event  C L Chau reported that his mount settled back in the field and with the early and middle stages of the event being run inside of standard time LUCKY COMBINATION did not travel well and in the Home Straight failed to run on when placed under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of LUCKY COMBINATION, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY COMBINATION will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event Apprentice E C W Wong stated that after being slow to begin his mount did not travel well throughout the event.  He added on the Home Turn his mount became unbalanced and when he was concerned there was something amiss he eased it down from the event near the 300 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of QUICK QUICK WIN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, QUICK QUICK WIN  will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Made contact with the left side of its starting gate on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start bumped with SAVVY WARRIOR.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight and approaching the 100 Metres made contact with BRILLIANT EXPRESS due to both runners shifting ground.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Lay out under pressure over the final 200 Metres and approaching the 100 Metres made contact with POPE CODY.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of SUPER INFINITY.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, LUPO SOLITARIO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
