Approaching the 50 Metres was steadied to avoid NEW FUTURE FOLKS (B Thompson) which shifted out when giving ground.  B Thompson was advised to exercise more care.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the middle stages raced keenly.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event Z Purton stated that his mount travelled only fairly throughout the race.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight THE BOOM BOX did not respond to his riding and after becoming awkward in its action near the 300 Metres he did not ride the horse out to the finish when he was concerned there may be something amiss with it.  Trainer W Y So advised THE BOOM BOX had pleased him leading into the race and he would now liaise with the connections to consider as to whether the horse should be given a let-up before its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of THE BOOM BOX was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, THE BOOM BOX will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

The performance of RAGGA BOMB was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RAGGA BOMB will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  After the event M Chadwick confirmed that from an inside barrier COOL BLUE was able to hold a more forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 300 Metres was bumped by THE PRIME which shifted out and away from HARRY’S HERO.  Bumped after the 200 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  When being shifted to the outside of COOL BLUE after the 200 Metres made contact with PODIUM.  For some distance after the 100 Metres raced tight to the outside of COOL BLUE which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Fractious in the starting gates.  Before being allowed to race again, TATTENHAM will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.
Bumped shortly after the start.

After the event K C Leung reported that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He added WOODFIRE CHAMP did not travel well throughout the event which he attributed to the visors being removed from the horse.  He said, in his view, WOODFIRE CHAMP would be better suited by being dropped back in distance and the reapplication of visors.  Trainer C W Chang confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was crowded between SUPER TREASURE and COOL BLUE which shifted out.  Bumped approaching the 300 Metres.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  J Orman was warned in relation to using his whip on a horse that was out of contention and not responding to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore).  Before being allowed to race again, THE KHAN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.

No report.

Approaching the 2000 Metres was steadied to avoid ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT which shifted out when racing fiercely.  After the event H Bentley reported that his intention was to be a little more forward but his mount jumped only fairly and settled further back.  He said in the Back Straight he endeavoured to start a forward move behind ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT but when that runner did not continue forward he was obliged to shift to that runner’s inside and was unable to ride his mount forward.  He added in the Home Straight SERANGOON finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running approaching the 300 Metres.  Over the final 100 Metres could not be ridden out when racing tight to the inside of MIDORI GIANT which shifted in slightly.
After the 700 Metres was bumped by MIDORI GIANT when MIDORI GIANT shifted out to commence a forward move.

Approaching the 2000 Metres was hampered when taken wider by SERANGOON.  After the event M F Poon advised that his instructions were to take up a midfield position.  He said when CAN’T GO WONG was caught wide in the early stages and when the pace of the event was being run outside of standard time he elected to allow his mount to stride forward to take up a position outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Z Purton stated that his instructions were to endeavour to find cover.  He said throughout the early stages of the event ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT raced fiercely, got its head up and refused to settle.  He added ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT continued to race keenly in the middle stages and after attempting to improve his position in the Back Straight ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT did not respond to his riding and commenced to give ground from the 500 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 300 Metres shifted out and made heavy contact with JUBILANT WINNER.  Over the final 200 Metres lay in when placed under pressure, resulting in its rider K Teetan changing his whip through to his right hand near the 150 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced keenly in the early stages after being crossed by RUN RUN TIMING.  After the event J Orman stated that he was given the option to ride his mount with cover if another runner showed intent to lead.  He said in the early stages when RUN RUN TIMING was ridden forward he elected to allow that runner to cross in accordance with his instructions.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when crowded between SATIRICAL FAN and AMAZING AWARD, both of which shifted ground.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

On jumping became unbalanced when crowded between SETANTA and MIGHTY COMMANDER.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running behind SMART TRIO.  When placed under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight lay in.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to SATIRICAL FAN.
No report.

Approaching the 300 Metres shifted in slightly when endeavouring to hold its position to the outside of AMAZING AWARD (K Teetan) which commenced to shift to the outside of MIGHTY COMMANDER.  As a result AMAZING AWARD made heavy contact with JUBILANT WINNER, resulting in JUBILANT WINNER becoming badly unbalanced and shifting out.  As the Stewards were satisfied that the shift in from JUBILANT WINNER had contributed to the contact between the two runners, K Teetan was severely reprimanded.

Bumped at the start.  After the event L Ferraris stated that the only explanation he could offer for the performance was that SETANTA did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the 300 Metres was held up when being shifted to the outside of JUBILANT WINNER to obtain clear running.
Jumped only fairly.

M L Yeung (SMART TRIO) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 300 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of ORIENTAL SURPRISE, resulting in ORIENTAL SURPRISE having to be checked when crowded between MIGHTY COMMANDER and SMART TRIO.  Having regard to the fact that his mount was hanging out and he had initially made an effort to prevent it from shifting ground, he was issued with a severe reprimand.

M L Yeung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 300 Metres (see ORIENTAL SURPRISE).  Trainer C W Chang confirmed that from a wide barrier the instructions were to take up a forward position.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Leaving the 100 Metres was eased to avoid MODEST GENTLEMAN (A Atzeni) when that runner continued to shift out.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 250 Metres was briefly held up when improving into a narrow run between LIFE OF STONE and WOOD ON FIRE.
Shortly after the start bumped with MODEST GENTLEMAN.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Between the 300 Metres and the 250 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a tight run between HAPPY TANGO and WOOD ON FIRE and in this incident made contact with WOOD ON FIRE.

Slow to begin.  After the 100 Metres was checked when disappointed for clear running between HAPPY TANGO and GUSTY FIGHTER which was taken out by MODEST GENTLEMAN (A Atzeni).  A Atzeni was severely reprimanded.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight M L Yeung stated that after placing his mount under pressure in the early part of the Home Straight he then observed a run develop between HAPPY TANGO and GUSTY FIGHTER after the 200 Metres.  He said as a result he then shifted his mount out with a view to taking that run, however, when that run closed after the 150 Metres he was checked when disappointed.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Bumped after the 250 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event K De Melo expressed concern with his mount’s action in front when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, LIFE OF STONE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event Apprentice E C W Wong advised that after travelling a short distance his saddle shifted back, resulting in SPEEDY FORTUNE bucking and being retired from the event.  The gear used by Apprentice Wong was inspected and found to be in good working condition.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event H T Mo stated that the instructions were to hold a forward position but when his mount was slow to begin it settled back in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Approaching the 300 Metres shifted out and made contact with MAJESTIC DELIGHT.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 800 Metres was briefly crowded by CIRCUIT DUFFY which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.

Leaving the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of ISLAND BUDDY.  Again near the 50 Metres was steadied when racing tight to the inside of ISLAND BUDDY (A Atzeni) which shifted in.  As a result VULCANUS could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.

Near the 400 Metres was steadied to avoid VULCANUS.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of TEAM HAPPY to continue into clear running.  After the event K C Leung reported that the instructions were to hold a midfield position.  He said when his mount jumped only fairly he elected to shift it across behind runners in the early stages to avoid covering additional ground.

Near the 800 Metres was steadied when crowded by FLYING AKEED (M L Yeung) which shifted in when not clear.  M L Yeung was reprimanded.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 300 Metres was bumped by GOKO WIN which shifted out to improve.  After the event K Teetan reported that his mount over-raced throughout the early and middle stages of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid TEAM HAPPY (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when not quite clear.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  After the event M F Poon stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position but despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to do so.
No report.

Near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid TEAM HAPPY (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when not quite clear.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Approaching the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid KING ALLOY (A Hamelin) which shifted in when not quite clear.  A Hamelin was severely reprimanded.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event Apprentice E C W Wong reported that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position but not necessarily lead.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to allow his mount to stride forward and lead to avoid racing wide.
Bumped on jumping.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Approaching the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid TELECOM POWER when racing keenly.  Approaching the 300 Metres was bumped and taken wider by MULTIDUTCH which shifted out.  After the event A Atzeni reported that he was instructed to hold an on-pace position.  He said despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show its usual early pace and as a result settled further back in the field than anticipated.

Leaving the 900 Metres ACE POWER shifted out and away from SUPER CHARIZZARD, resulting in LOVEISINTHEAIR, which was racing keenly, having to be checked.  After the event H Bowman stated that following his mount receiving interference leaving the 900 Metres it finished the race off only fairly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on jumping.  Leaving the 900 Metres shifted out and away from SUPER CHARIZZARD and was steadied.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out approaching the 300 Metres and was bumped.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration as to whether AURIO had been denied a fair start.  After taking evidence from Starter Mr A Speechley, rider Z Purton and Trainer D A Hayes, the Stewards found that AURIO reared simultaneously with the start being effected, resulting in it failing to jump with the field and its rider Z Purton being dislodged.  As the Steward were satisfied that such occurrence occurred simultaneously to the start being effected, AURIO was declared a runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained abrasions to its left hock and left hind fetlock.  Before being allowed to race again, AURIO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.

In the middle stages raced keenly and approaching the 800 Metres was steadied away from KING MILES.  For a short distance near the 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving behind SUPERB CAPITALIST.  After the event K C Leung stated that with the expected fast pace of the event he anticipated taking up a midfield position.  He said after beginning only fairly he elected to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages to avoid racing wide.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event A Atzeni stated that with the expected fast early pace he was instructed to endeavour to find cover.  He said as a result he rode his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages to comply with his instructions which resulted in FATAL BLOW settling midfield three wide with cover.
Raced keenly in the early stages.  Making the first turn got its head up when being steadied away from BEAUTY INFINITY.
In the Home Straight lay in, resulting in its rider Apprentice P N Wong having to stop riding and straighten on a number of occasions.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight when placed under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event J Orman advised that the instructions were to hold a midfield position.  He said BEAUTIFUL WIN commenced well today and then when it travelled strongly in the early stages he elected to allow it to stride forward and lead.
Jumped only fairly.
Near the 350 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a narrow run between LAPRAS and ACCOLADE START.  In this incident SUPREME WINNER made contact with ACCOLADE START.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with CHATEAU LE PECHE.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Taken out slightly near the 750 Metres.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 750 Metres was steadied to avoid WINNING TURN.

Near the 750 Metres was checked to avoid WINNING SEVEN when that runner was steadied when taken out slightly by WINNING TURN.  After the event L Ferraris confirmed that his mount raced keenly in the middle stages and this was the principal reason for the horse having to be checked near the 750 Metres.

After the event M F Poon stated that when the pace of the event eased in the middle stages CASA LEGEND then had difficulty in finishing the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start and then raced tight to the inside of SMART BEAUTY which shifted in slightly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event C L Chau reported that his mount was out-paced in the early stages due to it stepping back in distance and as a result did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped near the 350 Metres.  After the event K C Leung advised that with blinkers being reapplied he was instructed to hold a more forward position than its most recent starts.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Made contact with a rail on the way to the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event M Chadwick reported that he was obliged to make some use of his mount to lead and further was disadvantaged by being pressured by SUPERB CAPITALIST.  He added LUCKY PLANET did not stretch out in the Home Straight and attributed this to the racing surface which was showing some effects of light rain which had fallen during the meeting.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of LUCKY PLANET, a last start winner, was considered disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY PLANET will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being checked away from CHATEAUNEUF.
Raced wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.

After the event H Bentley stated that when he had concern with his mount’s action from the 600 Metres he eased it down from the event when he felt there may be something amiss.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of WOLF COMING, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, WOLF COMING will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on ZETTA FORCE at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, ZETTA FORCE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
After the event M L Yeung advised that he was instructed to hold a forward position and as a result in the early stages he rode his mount along to comply with his instructions.

Shortly after the start made contact with MAGIC BEANS.  After the event Apprentice P N Wong confirmed that from an inside barrier she was instructed to hold an on-pace position.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of Apprentice P N Wong, 6th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, she was nonetheless reminded of her obligation to ensure that she fully rides her mounts out to the finish of the race.
Jumped only fairly.

When questioned H Bowman stated that near the 300 Metres his mount was held up for clear running between I P O BROS and LUCKY STATEMENT.  He added after being able to commence to ride his mount along near the 250 Metres he then shifted to the outside of I P O BROS, however, near the 100 Metres was steadied when unable to continue forward when crowded between I P O BROS and ZETTA FORCE (C L Chau) which shifted in.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  H Bowman further stated that over the final 100 Metres he was unable to ride his mount out to the finish when held up behind ZETTA FORCE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Over the final 100 Metres could not be ridden out when held up between LUCKY STATEMENT and I P O BROS.
Near the 950 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by CHEVAL VALIANT which shifted out before being corrected by its rider L Hewitson.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bounded on jumping and lost ground.  Raced keenly in the early stages and near the 800 Metres was steadied and shifted in to avoid WINNING DIAMOND.  For a short distance after the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind LAHORE.  Approaching the 250 Metres shifted to the inside of LAHORE to obtain clear running.  For some distance near the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between LAHORE and MOON ROCKET.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.
Jumped awkwardly.
After travelling a short distance was hampered when taken out by LAHORE which shifted out.
Over the concluding stages was steadied when crowded between LAHORE which shifted out slightly and STRAIGHT TO GLORY (C L Chau) which shifted in.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.
Jumped awkwardly and shortly afterwards was steadied when crowded between LAHORE and ALLURING LAOS, both of which shifted ground.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Jumped only fairly and then raced tight to the inside of ZETTA FORCE which shifted in slightly.  Near the 400 Metres lay out and was steadied when positioned close to MAGIC BEANS.  EVERYONE’S CLASSIC was then shifted to the outside of MAGIC BEANS where it secured clear running approaching the 350 Metres.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced keenly in the middle stages and for some distance near the 900 Metres was steadied away from EXCEL WONGCHOY.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

After the event A Atzeni reported that his mount did not travel strongly throughout the event and, in his opinion, would be better suited by being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Slow to begin.
No report.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and then was steadied when crowded between PRECIOUS HILL and CALL TO COMMAND.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 250 Metres shifted out and made contact with SAMARKAND when attempting to improve to the outside of KEEFY.  As a result LUCKY TOUCH was briefly held up approaching the 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Approaching the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind QUANTUM PATCH and over the final 100 Metres could not be fully tested when positioned behind LUCKY TOUCH.
Approaching the 1400 Metres got its head up when being steadied to allow HIGHLAND RAHY to cross.  Approaching the 250 Metres was bumped by LUCKY TOUCH.
No report.
No report.
Jumped only fairly, shifted in and then was steadied to avoid KEEFY.

After the event Apprentice E C W Wong reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the left side of its starting gate.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced keenly in the early stages.  Lay out under pressure in the Home Straight and over the concluding stages its rider M Chadwick was obliged to continue to correct his mount which restricted his ability to fully ride DRAGON AIR FORCE out to the finish.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Shortly after the start was crowded between ALLCASH and BUNDLE OF CHARM.
No report.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the event Apprentice P N Wong stated that the instructions were to hold a forward position.  She said NORTHERN BEAST was able to lead the event but gave ground in the Home Straight and, in her opinion, did not appreciate racing on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event M L Yeung stated that the instructions were to attempt to find cover.  He said when caught wide and without cover in the early stages NEVER PETER OUT raced too keenly and as a result did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After being crossed by FORTUNE STAR approaching the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid that runner.  Briefly held up for clear running approaching the 350 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was bumped by FUN TOGETHER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres was held up for clear running.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Near the 300 Metres was shifted to the inside of LUCKY FIONN to obtain clear running.  ARDEN then lay out under pressure for the remainder of the event and approaching the winning post shifted out, resulting in its rider J Orman having to correct his mount.
Over-raced in the early stages.

After the event L Ferraris stated that it was not the intention to lead as he had expected a stronger early pace.  He said after jumping well he was able to cross runners to his inside which resulted in FORTUNE STAR leading without having to be pressured to do so.

Blundered on jumping and then shortly after became badly unbalanced when it bumped with E UNIVERSE.  Near the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from MAGIC COMBO.  When being steadied C L Chau fumbled his whip.  Near the 700 Metres was again steadied and shifted out when positioned close to the heels of MAGIC COMBO.  Near the 200 Metres bumped with SECOND TO NONE due to both runners shifting ground.

Had its right front plate refitted in the Parade Ring.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the early stages.

After the event A Atzeni stated that the intention was to obtain cover.  He said when the early and middle stages were run outside of standard time INNO CENTURY was positioned outside the lead without cover.  He added with INNO CENTURY stepping up to 1400 Metres it was then left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight which he attributed to the horse not being able to obtain cover.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight and near the 350 Metres was steadied when INNO CENTURY shifted out and away from PATCH OF STARS after initially being taken out by PATCH OF STARS (Z Purton).  Z Purton was advised to exercise more care.  After the event B Avdulla stated that from an inside barrier his mount was able to hold an on-pace position behind the lead.  He added that, in his opinion, NEVER TOO SOON may not have been suited by settling this close as it finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 200 Metres bumped with FUN TOGETHER due to both runners shifting ground.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the race L Hewitson reported that the horse was coughing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SECOND TO NONE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in, made heavy contact with FUN TOGETHER and became unbalanced.  When questioned Apprentice E C W Wong stated that the instructions were not to make too much use of his mount in the early stages as E UNIVERSE was stepping up to 1400 Metres today.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the outside of FORTUNE STAR and INNO CENTURY he was reluctant to continue to allow his mount to stride forward as he felt this would be contrary to his instructions.  He said as a result E UNIVERSE was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions but had hoped that E UNIVERSE would be able to lead the event and agreed that the horse was disadvantaged by being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After considering Apprentice Wong’s explanation and taking into account the times of the event which identified the race was run outside of standard time in the early stages, he was advised, in the opinion of the Stewards, he would have been better suited by allowing E UNIVERSE to continue forward to cross INNO CENTURY to avoid covering additional ground.

Shortly after the start was crowded between MOUNT EVEREST and GLACIATED which shifted out.  Trainer K H Ting confirmed the instructions were to hold a position forward of midfield preferably with cover.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages shifted in and away from ENJOY GOLF, resulting in its rider B Thompson having to straighten his mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 50 Metres shifted in and away from LITTLE PARADISE and as a result its rider Apprentice E C W Wong had to correct his mount.
No report.
Shifted out shortly after the start and bumped with LITTLE PARADISE.  Raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 900 Metres was steadied away from HAPPY PARK.
Bumped on jumping.  Shortly after the start was then bumped heavily by LITTLE PARADISE which shifted out after GLACIATED shifted out and away from ENJOY GOLF.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by SAL which shifted out.

After the event M F Poon reported that his mount lay in when under pressure In the Home Straight, got its head up and proved difficult to ride out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid ENJOY GOLF (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when not clear.  Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded.  After the event Y L Chung stated that his mount did not travel well during the event and he was disappointed with its finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event C L Chau stated that his mount attempted to buck shortly after the start and as a result he was obliged to take corrective action on the horse to prevent it from doing so.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of RUN RAN RUN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RUN RAN RUN will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of FASHION LEGEND to continue into clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.

When questioned A Atzeni stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position.  He said in the early stages when WONDERSTAR set a fast early pace he was awkwardly placed at the front of the main body of the field which made it difficult to judge the pace upon which the race was being run.  He said when WONDERSTAR continued to maintain its sizeable lead in the middle stages he encouraged his mount forward in an endeavour to make up some ground on that runner.  He said after considering the sectional times of the event and the times upon which FASHION LEGEND had run, A Atzeni agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he would have been better suited by riding his mount in a more conservative manner in the middle stages to provide FASHION LEGEND with an opportunity to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bounded on jumping and lost ground.  Lay out making the Home Turn and in the Home Straight.

When questioned C L Chau stated that the intention was to lead the event but not to push his mount in the early stages to do so as WONDERSTAR had raced too keenly in the lead at its most recent start.  He said after commencing well he allowed WONDERSTAR to obtain the lead without pressuring his mount to do so.  He said in the early stages WONDERSTAR then commenced to race keenly and whilst he was aware that his mount was running inside of standard time he was unable to set a slower pace as his mount was racing too keenly.  He added from the 800 Metres WONDERSTAR came under pressure before giving ground in the Home Straight.  He said he had recommended to connections to remove the blinkers from WONDERSTAR should the horse continue to race over the 1650 Metres.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

The performance of CONSPIRATOR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CONSPIRATOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  The performance of G LINER, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, G LINER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.

Jumped only fairly.  Shortly after the start was crowded by ANOTHER WORLD which shifted in.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
On jumping shifted in and made contact with the right side of its barrier.  Approaching the winning post lay in, resulting in its rider H Bowman having to correct his mount.

Jumped awkwardly.  Shifted out approaching the 350 Metres and was bumped.  After the event M F Poon advised that with his mount stepping up to 1400 Metres he was instructed to go forward from his wide barrier.
No report.

The tongue tie was replaced at the Start.  Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the barriers.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Near the 100 Metres shifted to the inside of TOP GUN to continue into clear running.
Jumped awkwardly.  Approaching the 350 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by MEOWTH which shifted out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 100 Metres was momentarily crowded by GENTLEMEN LEGACY which shifted to the inside of TOP GUN to obtain clear running.
Jumped only fairly.

When being steadied to obtain a position with cover in the early stages got its head up and raced keenly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, MR VIGOR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid TOMODACHI KOKOROE (L Ferraris) which shifted in when not quite clear.  L Ferraris was advised to exercise more care.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 350 Metres was shifted to the outside of WHIZZ KID to obtain clear running and as a result made contact with INVINCIBLE SHIELD.  Near the 250 Metres made contact with INVINCIBLE SHIELD due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event H Bowman reported that the horse made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have an epiglottic entrapment.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when it improved quickly behind LADY’S CHOICE.

Near the 350 Metres became unbalanced when bumped by FAST NETWORK.  Near the 250 Metres made contact with FAST NETWORK due to both runners shifting ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event B Avdulla advised that the instructions were to obtain a position with cover.  He said WUNDERBAR initially responded to his riding in the early part of the Home Straight but its run ended near the 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Slow to begin.  After the event K De Melo reported that the horse made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have an epiglottic entrapment.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between CALL ME GLORIOUS and REGAL GEM.
Approaching the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid AHREN (A Atzeni) which shifted in when not clear.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.  AERIS NOVA then raced keenly in the middle stages.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  On the Home Turn was hampered when taken wider by LIFELINE EXPRESS which shifted out.

After the event Z Purton stated that his mount was fractious in the gates and jumped only fairly.  He added ONE MORE raced too keenly and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start raced tight between REGAL GEM and SUPER LEGENDS which shifted out and away from AHREN.  Near the 1000 Metres shifted out and away from MARVEL AND GOLD when that runner shifted out.

After the event L Hewitson stated that after being ridden forward to race outside the lead in the early stages his mount gave ground in the Home Straight.  He added that REGAL GEM would derive benefit from additional racing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After being crossed by GENIUS BABY in the early stages commenced to race keenly and near the 1000 Metres was severely checked to avoid GENIUS BABY.  MARVEL AND GOLD then continued to race keenly and approaching the 800 Metres shifted out when being checked to avoid AERIS NOVA.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of COLOURFUL BARON which shifted in slightly.  In the Home Straight lay in, resulting in its rider A Hamelin having to stop riding and straighten on a number of occasions.  Near the 400 Metres was bumped by SILVER KING.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover until near the 700 Metres.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight.  A Atzeni was warned in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle in the forehand manner on one occasion after the 200 Metres.
After the 200 Metres raced in restricted room between LEATHER MASTER and GOLD TACK which shifted in.

Z Purton was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference leaving the 700 Metres (see YEABOI).  Approaching the 600 Metres was crowded and made contact with YEABOI after improving to the inside of TRADITION.  After the event Z Purton stated that his instructions were to hold a more forward position but his mount failed to show sufficient pace to do so and as a result settled further back than intended.
No report.

Near the 400 Metres was steadied to avoid SILVER KING.  After the event H Bentley reported that when his mount lost momentum near the 400 Metres when it was steadied away from SILVER KING it did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 1200 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid KINGLY DEMEANOR (M L Yeung) which shifted in when not clear.  M L Yeung was reprimanded.  When questioned L Hewitson stated that with the horse stepping back up to 1800 Metres tonight and returning to the turf surface it was able to obtain a more forward position than at its recent starts.  He added that COLOURFUL BARON raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages of the event.

Shortly after the start bumped with JOYFUL CHAMPION.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Z Purton (FLYING SILVER) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after the 800 Metres when YEABOI improved to his inside he allowed his mount to improve to the inside of TRADITION leaving the 700 Metres when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in YEABOI being badly crowded and losing its rightful running near the 600 Metres.  Z Purton was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 28 May 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.   After the event M Chadwick reported that his mount failed to travel well throughout the race and did not run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 400 Metres SILVER KING shifted out and made contact with GOLD TACK.  A short distance later SILVER KING was then checked when crowded between GOLD TACK and THE WAY WE WIN (Y L Chung) which shifted out.  Y L Chung was reprimanded.  After the event C L Chau stated that after being crowded and checked near the 400 Metres his mount did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was crowded between NIMBLE NIMBUS and CALIFORNIATOTALITY which shifted out.  When the pace steadied in the middle stages commenced a forward move near the 800 Metres. When unable to cross to the lead, C P BRAVE was then obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.
No report.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.

After the event Y L Chung stated that his mount was able to lead as expected but when placed under pressure in the Home Straight did not respond strongly to his riding which he attributed to the horse being up in grade tonight. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 100 Metres made contact with ETERNAL FORTUNE due to both runners shifting ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Making the Home Turn was hampered when taken wider by SEASONS WIT which shifted out to improve.  Near the 100 Metres made contact with SEASONS WIT due to both runners shifting ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with LOOKING BRIGHT.  Approaching the 100 Metres was bumped by HEALTHY HEALTHY.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and shortly afterwards was crowded between ETERNAL FORTUNE and PARENTS’ LOVE, both of which shifted ground.  Approaching the 150 Metres endeavoured to obtain a narrow run between STELLAR EXPRESS and PARENTS’ LOVE.  When PARENTS’ LOVE then shifted out slightly HEALTHY HEALTHY made contact with STELLAR EXPRESS and was held up for clear running over the final 150 Metres.  As a result HEALTHY HEALTHY could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.
After the event H Bentley reported that the instructions were to go forward but despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to do so.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event Z Purton reported that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, would derive benefit from tonight’s experience as it is still immature.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.

Withdrawn on 13.5.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore).  Before being allowed to race again, STAR PERFORMER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
M F Poon pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the final 100 Metres (see FOREVER GLORIOUS).  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Prior to declaring weighed-in Jockey H Bowman and Trainer D Eustace viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection against SURE JOYFUL being declared the winner due to MIDORI FUJI being contacted on a number of occasions over the final 100 Metres when FOREVER GLORIOUS was carried out by SURE JOYFUL.  When Jockey Bowman and Mr Eustace declined to lodge a protest/objection and the Stewards were satisfied that that there were not sufficient grounds to do so, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Sent for sampling post-race.

M F Poon (SURE JOYFUL) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the final 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out whilst riding it along when not clear of FOREVER GLORIOUS, resulting in FOREVER GLORIOUS being crowded for some distance and being checked approaching the winning post, resulting in FOREVER GLORIOUS also making contact with MIDORI FUJI.  M F Poon was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 8 June 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 12 June 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Jockey Poon was fined $55,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 3 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection against SURE JOYFUL being declared the winner after FOREVER GLORIOUS was crowded over the final 100 Metres and checked approaching the winning post.  Having regard to the manner in which both horses were finishing the race off and when the Stewards could not be comfortably satisfied that there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection, they declined to lodge a protest/objection and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Lay out in the Home Straight and near the 100 Metres made contact with SUPER SICARIO which shifted in when hanging.  Over the final 100 Metres COURIER MAGIC then made contact with SUPER SICARIO (K De Melo) on a number of occasions when that runner continued to hang in.  K De Melo was advised to exercise more care.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then was hampered when crowded by SUNNY DARLING which shifted out.  When questioned K De Melo stated that approaching the 1100 Metres when positioned to the outside of SUNNY DARLING he allowed his mount to shift in when positioned close to the heels of that runner.  He said as a result he was obliged to steady his mount to avoid SUNNY DARLING.  K De Melo was advised to exercise more care and provide his mounts with comfortable racing room when shifting ground.  He added that in the Home Straight SUPER SICARIO hung in, made contact with COURIER MAGIC over the final 100 Metres and proved difficult to ride out.  When questioned regarding his mount settling more forward, K De Melo stated that with the horse stepping up in distance he was given the option of taking up a more forward position if circumstances permitted.  He said after jumping well he continued forward and was obliged to make some use of his mount to cross BEAU CADEAU in the early stages.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied when disappointed for a run to the inside of ARTHUR’S KINGDOM which shifted in.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

After the event Y L Chung stated that the instructions were to hold a  forward position.  He said when the early stages of the event were run inside of standard time and his mount was caught wide in the early stages, he elected to steady WAH MAY WAI WAI to endeavour to obtain a position with cover.  He added that when FOREVER GLORIOUS held its position to his inside he was obliged to race wide albeit with cover behind BEAU CADEAU.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of WAH MAY WAI WAI, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, WAH MAY WAI WAI will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of BEAU CADEAU, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAU CADEAU will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount, which is relatively inexperienced, raced greenly throughout the event and would derive benefit from tonight’s race.  He added that he was satisfied with the finishing effort of the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  Shortly after the start raced tight between RISING PHOENIX and FORTUNE WHISKEY, both of which shifted ground slightly. He stated that CHAMPION METHOD did not show sufficient pace to comply with his instructions and he recommended to connections to step the horse up in distance for its next race start.

After the event C L Chau advised that from the outside barrier he was instructed to go forward.  Trainer T P Yung confirmed the instructions issued and stated that the horse, down in grade, he had asked Jockey Chau to follow the expected leader MEGA BONUS which had drawn next to FREE PONY across.

When questioned Z Purton stated that he had expected the lack of early pace in the event and for this reason he elected to ride his mount forward.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed that he had given Z Purton the option of taking up a more forward position.  Sent for sampling post-race.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start became unbalanced when bumped with RICH HORSE.

Approaching the 50 Metres shifted out when racing greenly and as a result was steadied to avoid BIENVENUE when that runner shifted in slightly.  The Stewards attributed the racing manners of INCREDIBLE MOMENT to be the principal reason for the horse being steadied.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied momentarily when INCREDIBLE MOMENT shifted out when racing greenly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Making the first turn approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when crowded between KNOW AT HEART which lay out slightly and HARMONY N HOME (Y L Chung) which shifted in before being corrected.  Y L Chung was advised to exercise more care.  Noted to have lost its left hind plate after the race.
Shortly after the start was checked when crowded between KNOW AT HEART and YODA’S CHOICE which shifted out.
M F Poon was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference making the first turn near the 1000 Metres (see SOLAR RIVER).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Steadied to avoid SOLAR RIVER making the first turn.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped at the start.  M F Poon (HAYDAY) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that making the first turn near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of SOLAR RIVER, resulting in SOLAR RIVER having to be checked to avoid HAYDAY.  M F Poon was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 28 May 2025 at Happy Valley. Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued.

After the event K C Leung reported that when the pace of the event steadied in the middle stages he commenced a forward move near the 800 Metres.  He said as he did so LEAN HERO was taken wider when EXCELLENCE VALUE shifted out near the 600 Metres to improve and did not finish the race off thereafter. Near the 1300 Metres was steadied to avoid SAMARKAND.  After the event B Thompson stated that with his mount stepping up in distance he was able to hold a more forward position tonight without being pressured to do so.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was bumped by CRIMSON FLASH which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He further stated that NORTHERN FIRE BALL may not have appreciated the step-up in class tonight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event M L Yeung reported that his instructions were to go forward. He said whilst his mount jumped reasonably well, when he rode it along from the starting gates it did not show any early pace and for this reason he elected to ride COMMANDING MISSILE in a conservative manner in the early stages to avoid covering additional ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of COMMANDING MISSILE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, COMMANDING MISSILE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A Hamelin pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 100 Metres (see ICONICAL).  Sent for sampling post-race.

A Hamelin (JUMBO FORTUNE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he endeavoured to improve into a run between IVY LEAGUE and ICONICAL where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in JUMBO FORTUNE then shifting in and crowding the running of ICONICAL, resulting in ICONICAL having to be checked and also ICONICAL shifting in, crowding LUCKY BANNER which was steadied to avoid ICONICAL.  A Hamelin was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Saturday, 31 May 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 5 June 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  Over the final 50 Metres was held up for clear running and could not be fully tested.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and then became unbalanced when it made contact with LUCKY BANNER which shifted out.  Raced keenly in the early and middle stages.  When questioned K Teetan stated that making the Home Turn he was held up for clear running behind BUCEPHALAS.  He said when that runner shifted away from the rail slightly he endeavoured to improve to its inside, however, near the 300 Metres was checked when disappointed for this run when BUCEPHALAS shifted back in.  K Teetan was advised he must ensure that there is sufficient racing room when he is endeavouring to improve into a run.  As a result CHILL MASTER did not obtain clear running until near the 250 Metres.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when crowded by LUCKY BANNER which shifted out and away from ICONICAL.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, BUCEPHALAS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding his riding over the concluding stages Z Purton stated that when he felt the horse had a comfortable margin over the second placegetter DOUBLE WIN, he did not continue to ride it out over the concluding stages.  He said as he did so ORIENTAL SMOKE came back underneath him quicker than he had anticipated and he agreed with the Stewards that in the circumstances he should have continued to encourage his mount to the finish to ensure the horse’s placing was not compromised.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid JOLLY COMPANION (Apprentice P N Wong) which shifted in when not clear as she also then reduced the pace.  Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded and advised she must be sufficiently clear when shifting ground and not to steady the pace too quickly as she does so.  In this incident WONDERSTAR was then shifted out to avoid JOLLY COMPANION and made contact with AURORA PATCH.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded between BLAZING WUKONG and ELEGANT LIFE which shifted out.

After the 400 Metres ELEGANT LIFE (C L Chau) and BLAZING WUKONG (A Atzeni) contested a position between CLUB ACE and COME FAST FAY FAY where there was not sufficient room for two horses to improve.  As a result ELEGANT LIFE became unbalanced when crowded between CLUB ACE and BLAZING WUKONG.  Both C L Chau and A Atzeni were advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  Approaching the 100 Metres was eased and shifted to the inside of WONDERSTAR to obtain clear running.
No report.

Before being allowed to race again, COME FAST FAY FAY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the 900 Metres was taken wider for a short distance when WONDERSTAR shifted out to avoid JOLLY COMPANION.  After the event Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event A Badel reported that his mount made an abnormal respiratory noise during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Lay out under pressure in the Home Straight.  Near the 200 Metres Apprentice P N Wong dropped her whip.  As this was the third occasion this season where Apprentice Wong had dropped her whip, she was issued with a warning.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

In the middle stages raced keenly and leaving the 1000  Metres got its head up when being steadied away from PAKISTAN LEGACY.  Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1400 Metres became unbalanced when it shifted in towards the running rail.  When questioned Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to lead if circumstances permitted.  She said TOURBILLON PRINCE jumped only fairly and she then rode it along to comply with her instructions.  She said when positioned to the inside of DEFINITIVE in the early stages she was reluctant to continue to urge her mount forward as she was concerned that TOURBILLON PRINCE may commence to race keenly and for this reason she held her mount together and allowed DEFINITIVE to cross in the early stages.  After considering her explanation and taking into account the sectional times of the race which showed the early and middle stages were run outside of standard time, Apprentice Wong was advised that, in the opinion of the Stewards, she had made an error of judgement in that she did not ride her mount in a more decisive manner to comply with her instructions to lead.  Trainer T P Yung confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, SAVVY TWINKLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.

H Bowman, the rider of 5th placegetter, MIGHTY COMMANDER, pleaded guilty to a charge under Rule 100(2) in that he failed to ride his mount out to the end of the race to the satisfaction of the Stewards.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Saturday, 28 June 2025 and to expire on Wednesday, 2 July 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty the Stewards were satisfied that his actions had compromised the horse’s finishing position.  When questioned H Bowman stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but his mount was bumped at the start and as a result he elected to obtain a trailing position behind JUMBO FORTUNE.  He added that in the early stages MIGHTY COMMANDER raced keenly and approaching the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from SIMPLE HEDGE.  After the race an endoscopic examination was conducted on MIGHTY COMMANDER at the request of Trainer C Fownes.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, MIGHTY COMMANDER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of MIGHTY COMMANDER to continue into clear running.

Approaching the 200 Metres was checked when disappointed for clear running between COSMO NAVIGATOR and DRAGON STAR, both of which shifted ground slightly.  As a result JUMBO FORTUNE shifted in, made contact with COSMO NAVIGATOR and did not obtain clear running until near the 100 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  Between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running between DRAGON STAR and ATOMIC BEAUTY.  After the event A Badel stated that whilst his mount was held up in the Home Straight, in his opinion, it would appreciate being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event K Teetan stated that his mount enjoyed a good run during the event, however, finished the race off in a one-paced manner in the Home Straight and he could offer no explanation for its performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <22/5/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>After the race, DRAGON STAR was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. DRAGON STAR was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer Y S Tsui this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to have sustained a left front tendon injury. Before being allowed to race again, DRAGON STAR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event Y L Chung stated that with his mount stepping up in distance tonight he was instructed to settle where comfortable.  He said when COSMO NAVIGATOR jumped well and raced keenly he allowed it to stride forward and lead.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  C L Chau was fined the sum of $10,000 for using his whip arm in a manner where it was raised above shoulder height on a number of occasions over the concluding stages.  Having regard to his record in respect to similar offences he was placed on notice that should he continue to offend in a similar way more significant penalties would be applied.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event K C Leung reported that he was instructed to hold a midfield position.  He said when his mount commenced well and when caught wide in the early stages he elected to allow PRESTIGE ALWAYS to stride forward to cross DRAGON JOY to avoid covering additional ground.  He added as a consequence his mount settled more forward than what had been intended.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and the reason he improved to the inside of EMBRACES, H Bowman stated that after following EMBRACES during the race, when that runner shifted out near the 400 Metres it did not improve into the event as he had anticipated it would.  He said as a result he allowed SKY TRUST to improve to the inside of EMBRACES as he was of the opinion that he was required to start to improve into the event.  He said after riding his mount along in the early part of the Home Straight and improving to the inside of KOLACHI, his mount then became held up for a short distance near the 200 Metres behind KING OF FIGHTERS before improving to that runner’s outside.  After considering his explanation, the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman were reasonable in the circumstances.  H Bowman, the rider of 4th placegetter (dead heat), SKY TRUST, was found guilty of a charge under Rule 100(2) in that he failed to ride his mount out to the end of the race to the satisfaction of the Stewards.  After considering matters in relation to penalty including that SKY TRUST had dead-heated with SUPER UNICORN for 4th placing, the Stewards issued a penalty of one Hong Kong racemeeting.  H Bowman was suspended from riding in races for the racemeeting to be conducted on Wednesday, 4 June 2025 at Happy Valley.

The tongue tie was replaced on arrival at the Start.  Shortly after the start bumped with EVERSTAR which shifted in.  Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection due to POWER KOEPP shifting in over the concluding stages and making contact with SOVEREIGN FUND.  When Jockey K Teetan declined to lodge a protest/objection and the Stewards were satisfied that there were not sufficient grounds to do so weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  A Badel, the rider of POWER KOEPP, was advised to exercise more care and to stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground and initiate contact with another runner.  He was also warned about using the whip in a forehand manner forward of the saddle on one occasion over the concluding stages.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the performance of SUPERB BOY H Bowman stated that the horse is better suited when it is able to either dictate in the lead or race without having its momentum haltered.  He said after allowing the expected leader HAPPY FAT CAT to cross his mount in the early stages SUPERB BOY was then disadvantaged when HAPPY FAT CAT did not improve into the race and this was, in his opinion, the reason why his mount did not run on strongly in the Home Straight.  He added in the circumstances he was not too disappointed with the horse’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
