Approaching the 100 Metres raced greenly when improving into a narrow run between QUICK MONEY and HYANNIS STAR.
Shifted in abruptly on jumping, became unbalanced and made contact with WINNING CHAMPION.  Near the 100 Metres made contact with LIGHT YEARS GLORY when commencing to give ground.

On jumping was checked when crowded between HYANNIS STAR which shifted out slightly and FIELD MARSHAL which shifted in abruptly despite the efforts of its rider.  In the Home Straight lay in and raced greenly and after the 50 Metres was held up behind FIELD MARSHAL and shifted to that runner’s outside to continue into clear running.
No report.

On jumping was crowded between WINNING CHAMPION and SPARKLE AND GOLD.  After the event L Ferraris reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover throughout the race.  He said HYANNIS STAR also raced greenly throughout the race and these were the reasons why the horse was not able to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Over the final 100 Metres lay in and could not be fully ridden out when improving to the outside of HYANNIS STAR.
After the event L Hewitson reported that his mount, which was having its first race start, raced greenly during the race.
Withdrawn on 23.5.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left hind).  Before being allowed to race again, KIAMA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 900 Metres was checked when crowded between AWESOME TREASURE (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in and DIVINE MOONLIGHT which shifted out after being steadied away from HONG KONG HALL (B Avdulla) which shifted in when not quite clear.  Both Apprentice Wong and B Avdulla were severely reprimanded.  In this incident, DIVINE MOONLIGHT, which was racing keenly, contributed to the interference to GOLDENTRONICMIGHTY.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and shortly afterwards was crowded between DIVINE MOONLIGHT and BULLISH PRIDE, both of which shifted ground.  M Chadwick (SHINE BRIGHT) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 700 Metres he directed his mount to the outside of BULLISH PRIDE, resulting in SHINE BRIGHT making contact with INVINCIBLE IBIS and taking INVINCIBLE IBIS from its rightful running and resulting in INVINCIBLE IBIS becoming unbalanced, shifting out and also resulting in CIRCUIT CENTURY being checked away from INVINCIBLE IBIS.  M Chadwick was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 11 June 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  Sent for sampling post-race.

M Chadwick was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 700 Metres (see INVINCIBLE IBIS).  After the event M Chadwick stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position with cover.  He said when his mount jumped only fairly and then was bumped by SUNNY SING SPIRIT it settled further back than intended.
Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.
No report.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running to the inside of BULLISH PRIDE which shifted in.  SUNNY SING SPIRIT was then shifted to the outside of BULLISH PRIDE to secure clear running.

Leaving the 900 Metres was checked to avoid GOLDENTRONICMIGHTY which shifted out when being checked.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, CALL ME GORGEOUS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Leaving the 400 Metres was shifted to the inside of AWESOME TREASURE to obtain clear running.  Leaving the 200 Metres BULLISH PRIDE was then disappointed for clear running between AWESOME TREASURE and KING ALLOY and as a result did not obtain clear running until leaving the 100 Metres.
No report.
Became fractious in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

Checked near the 700 Metres.  After the event L Hewitson reported that his mount raced greenly throughout the race and lay in in the Home Straight.  After the race the Veterinary Surgeon reported that the horse had sustained a cut to its right front leg.
No report.
In the early and middle stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres got its head up when being shifted behind BEAUTY MISSILE to obtain cover.
Near the 900 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid HONG KONG HALL.
Approaching the winning post shifted out, resulting in its rider K C Leung having to straighten his mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped after the 600 Metres.  Noted to have sustained cuts to the left front leg after the race.
Shifted out approaching the winning post and was bumped.
On jumping was bumped by LOVEISINTHEAIR and shortly afterwards was crowded by CALL TO COMMAND which shifted in slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid LOVEISINTHEAIR.  Over the concluding stages was bumped by AUDACIOUS PURSUIT which shifted out.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with HONEST WITNESS.  Approaching the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied to avoid AUDACIOUS PURSUIT.
Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of its barrier and lost ground.
Jumped only fairly and made contact with INNO SUPER which shifted in.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 700 Metres shifted out when checked to avoid CALL TO COMMAND.  After the 300 Metres was shifted to the outside of BILLION TWO to obtain clear running.

On jumping was bumped by COPARTNER FLEET which shifted in, resulting in INNO SUPER becoming unbalanced.  Leaving the 700 Metres was checked to avoid LOOKS OUTSTANDING which gave ground when being checked.
Steadied near the 700 Metres when racing tight inside BILLION TWO.

After the 600 Metres became unbalanced when it made contact with CIRCUIT VICTORY whilst racing tight to the inside of that runner.  In the Home Straight lay in and proved difficult to ride out.  Noted to have blood at the left nostril after the race.  An endoscopic examination conducted on BILLION TWO found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled.

Bumped at the start.  Leaving the 700 Metres GIDDY UP improved to the outside of LOOKS OUTSTANDING after LOOKS OUTSTANDING shifted to the rail.  A short distance later CALL TO COMMAND was eased when racing tight to the inside of BILLION TWO.  As a consequence LOOKS OUTSTANDING was then checked to avoid CALL TO COMMAND and shifted out to avoid that runner, resulting in GIDDY UP being badly crowded for room between LOOKS OUTSTANDING and LOVEISINTHEAIR and being severely checked.  As the Stewards were satisfied that the pace of the event easing during that section of the race and the racing manners of LOOKS OUTSTANDING and GIDDY UP were contributing factors with this incident no action was taken.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the lead in the early and middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid MICKLEY when racing keenly.
Slow to begin.

After the race L Ferraris stated that from the inside barrier he was instructed to utilise the good draw to race behind the lead. He said MID WINTER WIND raced keenly throughout the race, lay in under pressure in the Home Straight and did not finish the race off.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Crowded at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Noted to have blood in the mouth after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start became unbalanced when it shifted out and made contact with HE WAS ME.  For some distance near the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind YODA’S CHOICE.

After the event B Thompson stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position behind the leaders as connections had felt the horse would not show sufficient pace to lead the event.  He said after being crossed by DO YOUR PART in the early stages YODA’S CHOICE settled slightly further back than anticipated when DO YOUR PART was crossed by KA YING GLORY.
Over the concluding stages made contact with SUPER LOVE due to both runners shifting ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Over the concluding stages made contact with MONARCH COUNTY due to both runners shifting ground.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 200 Metres became unbalanced when crowded between MEOWTH which was taken in by MONARCH COUNTY (Apprentice E C W Wong) and BLING BLING GENIUS which was taken out by YODA’S CHOICE (B Thompson) which shifted out.  Both Apprentice Wong and B Thompson were reprimanded.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.   After the race the Veterinary Surgeon reported that BEAUTY LIVE had sustained a cut to the right hind leg.

Near the 200 Metres was steadied to avoid MONARCH COUNTY.  When questioned H Bowman stated that his instructions were to go forward and lead if circumstances permitted.  He said in the early stages he rode his mount along to comply with his instructions but MEOWTH did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position, particularly with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time.  He added in the Home Straight MEOWTH responded only fairly to his riding and after being crowded near the 200 Metres did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded by YODA’S CHOICE which shifted out.

Jumped awkwardly.  When being shifted across behind runners from a wide barrier got its head up and raced keenly in the early stages.  In the Home Straight hung in and for some distance near the 400 Metres proved reluctant to shift to the outside of SUPER LOVE.
Jumped only fairly and shortly afterwards was checked when crowded by SPEEDY TRIDENT which was taken in by DO YOUR PART which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.
No report.
On jumping bumped with BEAUTY LIVE and shortly after became unbalanced when it made contact with SUNNY Q.  Leaving the 1300 Metres was eased when crowded between BEAUTY LIVE and MONARCH COUNTY.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Was left racing wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.
Raced wide and without cover until near the 700 Metres.  Near the 300 Metres made contact with FLAGSHIP WARRIOR when that runner shifted out.
Near the 300 Metres was hampered and taken wider.

Approaching the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of MISTER DAPPER and in this incident made contact with WROTE A NEW PAGE.  After the event Apprentice E C W Wong stated that from the inside barrier and with the horse racing over 1600 Metres he was asked to hold an on-pace position during the race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Approaching the 300 Metres FLAGSHIP WARRIOR (Apprentice E C W Wong) shifted to the outside of MISTER DAPPER to obtain clear running and in doing so made contact with WROTE A NEW PAGE.  As a result WROTE A NEW PAGE was taken out, causing FIGHT TIME to be shifted to the outside of WROTE A NEW PAGE which further resulted in THE AUSPICIOUS being taken across the running of SETANTA which was steadied.  Apprentice Wong was reprimanded.
The tongue tie was replaced at the Start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied to avoid SETANTA.  After the event L Ferraris stated that, in his opinion, his mount was disadvantaged by settling back in the field and found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

Was a late withdrawal at the barriers when it kicked out behind, got both hind legs caught between the back gates and was found to have sustained multiple abrasions.  The Stewards ruled that FORTUNE BOY will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in a barrier trial and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
From the 700 Metres was left racing wide and without cover.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Making the turn leaving the 900 Metres hung out and lost ground when positioned close to MIGHTY STEED.

After the event A Hamelin stated that it was not his intention to be forward.  He said when FORERUNNER jumped well he elected to make use of his mount in the early stages to cross runners to his inside to avoid racing wide and this resulted in FORERUNNER holding an on-pace position.
No report.

Between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when held up behind SUNNY DARLING.  After the event T Marquand stated that from the inside barrier and with his mount stepping up to 1400 Metres he was asked to hold an on-pace position.  He said, in his view, GALVANIC was not suited by being ridden in this manner as he was required to make use of his mount in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Made contact with the left side of its starting gate on jumping and shortly after was then bumped by SPIRIT OF PEACE which shifted in.
No report.
After the event  M L Yeung advised that with the horse stepping up to 1400 Metres today he was instructed to ride his mount with cover.
Jumped awkwardly.  After the event L Hewitson stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Near the 250 Metres raced tight to the outside of BLAZING WIND.  Over the concluding stages became unbalanced when positioned close to the stand rail.
No report.
Bumped at the start.
Bumped on jumping.  Near the 300 Metres made contact with ALL ROUND WINNER when endeavouring to improve to the inside of NORTHERN FIRE BALL.
Jumped awkwardly and became unbalanced.
Knuckled on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Blundered at the start.

Shortly after the start shifted in and was bumped.  Leaving the 800 Metres was checked when crowded between SUPER FORTUNE and CELESTIAL HERO (L Hewitson) which shifted out.  A short distance later CELESTIAL HERO was unable to relieve the pressure when ALSONSO shifted out slightly.  In the circumstances L Hewitson was advised to exercise more care.  When questioned regarding his riding from the 700 Metres C L Chau stated that when he was of the opinion there was no position for him to improve he elected to shift in to the middle of the track to obtain clear running and ride his mount in a similar way to when it won on 13 April 2025.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event M Chadwick reported that his mount hung in away from the stand rail and proved difficult to ride out in the Home Straight.  Trainer C S Shum advised that BLAZING WIND had pleased him since its last start on 18 May 2025.  He added that, in his view, BLAZING WIND was not suited by racing on the stand rail as it hung in and he would in future avoid racing the horse over this course and distance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of BLAZING WIND was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, BLAZING WIND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event A Atzeni stated that the instructions were to take up a forward position.  He said JUSTIFYING failed to travel at any stage of the event and was under heavy riding throughout the race before giving ground over the concluding stages.  Trainer C Fownes could offer no excuse for the horse’s disappointing performance.  He added JUSTIFYING had pleased him leading into the race today and he had expected it to perform well.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.    The performance of JUSTIFYING was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, JUSTIFYING will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

When questioned T Marquand stated that after holding an on-pace position in the early stages, when ENSUED improved to his outside leaving the 1100 Metres he was content to allow that runner to cross him at that point.  He said when ENSUED did not continue forward of his mount this resulted in DUBAI HONOUR racing keenly despite his efforts to restrain his mount to come back which resulted in a fast pace being set from that point.  He added that in the Home Straight DUBAI HONOUR continued to respond to his riding and in the circumstances he was not disappointed with the horse’s performance.
Jumped only fairly.

Shortly after the start was checked when crowded by FIVE G PATCH which shifted in after being crowded by MOMENTS IN TIME and VOYAGE BUBBLE which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  When questioned regarding his riding Z Purton stated that he had anticipated holding a handy position.  He said after being checked at the start when crowded his mount settled further back in the field than intended.  He said with the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time he elected to commence a forward move from the 1200 Metres as ENSUED is a one-paced horse that requires momentum and he was confident with the horse’s ability to run out a strong 2400 Metres.  He added after improving to the outside of DUBAI HONOUR near the 1100 Metres that runner held its position to his inside and when ENSUED was unable to cross DUBAI HONOUR he was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to endeavour to obtain a position behind DUBAI HONOUR when unable to cross that runner Z Purton stated that as his mount requires momentum in its races he felt this was not in the best interests of the horse to ride it in this manner.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable in the circumstances.
Badly crowded shortly after the start.
No report.
No report.
Raced keenly in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  After the event B Avdulla stated that with blinkers being applied for the first time today he was instructed to hold a more forward position, similar to the manner in which it barrier trialed on 16 May 2025.  He added that ENTHRALLED raced keenly in the early and middle stages of the event.

Making the Home Turn made contact with MIGHTY STRENGTH when MIGHTY STRENGTH shifted out to improve.  After the event H T Mo stated that the intention was to settle in a more forward position but in the early stages he was caught wide and unable to comply with his instructions.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.
From the 200 Metres until the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.
Making the Home Turn shifted out to improve and bumped with WINNING WING.  Near the 200 Metres made contact with FAMILY JEWEL when racing tight to the inside of WINNING WING.

Approaching the 1300 Metres was checked to avoid WINNING WING when it commenced to race keenly.  As a result FAMILY JEWEL was then allowed to stride forward by its rider H Bowman which resulted in the horse racing wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.  After the event H Bowman stated that due to the wide run FAMILY JEWEL finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a superficial abrasion to its left hind leg.
Approaching the 1300 Metres commenced to race keenly when steadied away from AGENDA.
On jumping was crowded between MASTER TRILLION and FAMILY JEWEL.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event L Hewitson reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.   Before being allowed to race again, LEAN HERO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event M F Poon stated that his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of  MASTER TRILLION, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MASTER TRILLION will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

For a short distance near the 250 Metres raced tight to the inside of JOYFUL LIFE which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  After the event L Hewitson stated that from a more favourable barrier tonight DOUBLE SHOW was able to hold an on-pace position without having to make use of the horse to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres was eased when racing tight between WIND SPEEDER and SPEEDY SMARTIE which shifted out to improve.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of B Avdulla, 5th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.

After the event H Bentley stated that when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to allow EVER SMART to continue forward to cross runners to his inside to avoid racing wide.  He added that in retrospect EVER SMART may not have been suited by leading the event as it races best when able to make up ground from behind runners.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded between SKY PROPHET and ACCOLADE START which shifted in.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event M L Yeung stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but his mount did not show sufficient pace in the early stages to do so.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and he could offer no explanation for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
After the event A Hamelin could offer no excuse in relation to his mount’s disappointing performance.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced tight approaching the 900 Metres.
Crowded at the start.
Near the 400 Metres was held up for clear running behind SOUTH STAR.
No report.
Near the 900 Metres raced tight to the inside of SOUTH STAR which in turn was positioned tight to the inside of SUPER EXPRESS which lay in away from KING OF DUBAI.

Approaching the 200 Metres was eased and shifted to the outside of MASTER CHAMPION to obtain clear running.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when held up between KA YING SUPERB and AKASHVANI.  After the event B Thompson stated that his mount was slow to begin and as a result settled further back than what had been anticipated.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Slow to begin.

Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the right side of its barrier, resulting in its rider K C Leung also making contact with the barrier structure and becoming unbalanced.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was badly held up for clear running.
No report.
No report.

After the event J McDonald stated that with blinkers being applied for the first time today and his mount up in distance he was asked to take up a forward position.  He added when ANODE was unable to cross runners to its inside it raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event before being left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ANODE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ANODE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  After the event H Bentley stated that from a wide barrier he was asked to take up a forward position.  He said he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to comply with his instructions and as a result KING OF DUBAI gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of KING OF DUBAI, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, KING OF DUBAI will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <26/5/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> KING OF DUBAI, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. KING OF DUBAI was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer M Newnham this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right hind leg. As previously advised, KING OF DUBAI will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

Withdrawn on 24.5.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (blood abnormality) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter MASTER CHAMPION.  Before being allowed to race again, SILVERY BREEZE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in in the Home Straight.  For a short distance near the 100 Metres was positioned close to the heels of WOOD ON FIRE.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 1000 Metres improved to the inside of ORIENTAL SURPRISE and shortly afterwards was crowded when ORIENTAL SURPRISE shifted in.
Bumped at the start.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 600 Metres was bumped by CONCORDE STAR which lay out.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 600 Metres lay out and bumped with NOTTHESILLYONE.
Over the concluding stages shifted in slightly and was steadied to avoid RAGNARR.
Jumped only fairly.

When questioned H Bowman stated that he was given no specific instructions other than to settle his mount where comfortable.  He said in the early stages when caught wide he did not ride his mount forward as he felt this would be contrary to his instructions and as a result CAMP FIRE made the first turn wide.  He said entering the Back Straight he had expected WOOD ON FIRE to continue forward to lead which would have allowed SONIC BOOM to take up a position one-off and would have afforded CAMP FIRE the opportunity to shift closer to the rail albeit still wide and without cover.  He added that when WOOD ON FIRE maintained its position to the outside of SO AWESOME this resulted in CAMP FIRE being obliged to race very wide and without cover.  He said when he felt his horse was not travelling well enough to go forward and cross SONIC BOOM he was obliged to race very wide and without cover thereafter.   He further stated that from the 500 Metres CAMP FIRE did not respond to his riding and gave ground thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the event B Avdulla reported that his mount came under pressure in the middle stages of the event and failed to finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 150 Metres made contact with ROMANTIC FANTASY due to both runners shifting ground.  As a result, M L Yeung, the rider of PERFECT PAIRING, was obliged to stop riding and straighten for a short distance when his mount became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.  Near the 150 Metres made contact with PERFECT PAIRING due to both runners shifting ground.
No report.
Near the 50 Metres bumped with HAKKA RADIANCE which shifted out.

Near the 50 Metres shifted out and made contact with PERPETUAL POWER.  After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount was obliged throughout the early stages to take the field up to the leader which set a fast pace.  He said when LUCKY BANNER commenced to give ground near the 600 Metres his mount was then pressured in the lead by ROMANTIC FANTASY and as a result HAKKA RADIANCE finished the race off only fairly when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Over the concluding stages hung in and proved difficult to ride out.  As a result Y L Chung was restricted in his ability to fully test the horse.  After the event Y L Chung stated that he was instructed to go forward and lead if possible.  He said KINGLY DEMEANOR bounded on jumping and as a result settled further back than had been intended.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 100 Metres was eased and shifted to the inside of HAKKA RADIANCE to continue into clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
No report.

When questioned B Thompson stated that he had expected to lead the event from an inside barrier.  He said in the early stages as he was aware LUCKY BANNER can race keenly he did not push his mount to hold the lead and LUCKY BANNER was able to show its natural speed to obtain the front.  He said in the early stages LUCKY BANNER then commenced to race keenly and made the turn into the Home Straight on the first occasion awkwardly.  He added that whilst he was aware LUCKY BANNER was setting a fast pace inside of standard time throughout the early stages the horse would not respond to his efforts to restrain and set a more sustainable pace.  He said it was not until near the 1200 Metres that LUCKY BANNER responded to his efforts to come back and having regard to the way it raced in the early stages the horse was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  After considering his explanation and viewing the patrol films the Stewards were satisfied that Jockey Thompson had made his best endeavours to reduce the pace that the horse set in the early stages.
Bumped near the 600 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  In the middle stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 700 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from NEBRASKAN.
In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 800 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from MY INTELLIGENT.
No report.

Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight and near the 300 Metres was corrected by Y L Chung.  After the event Y L Chung stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said when PRIME MORTAR was obliged to race wide and without cover it raced too keenly and was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  Trainer A S Cruz confirmed the instructions issued.

Near the 600 Metres bumped with THRIVING BROTHERS.  After the event H Bowman stated that his mount finished the race off in a one-paced manner and would appreciate being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 300 Metres was steadied to avoid PRIME MORTAR when disappointed for clear running to the inside of PRIME MORTAR when PRIME MORTAR lay in despite the efforts of its rider.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Held up making the Home Turn.  After the event M L Yeung reported that his mount jumped only fairly and as a consequence settled slightly further back than anticipated.  He added in the middle stages when he was of the opinion that the pace steadied MY INTELLIGENT then commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from SUPER SIXTY and did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 600 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event C L Chau reported that from the outside barrier he was instructed to take up an on-pace position.  He said such instructions were issued as connections felt it was advantageous to race in a forward position tonight.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued and said he was of the view that there was not strong pace in the race and that MY DAY MY WAY had shown speed in its barrier trial on 20 May 2025 when it performed well.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.
No report.
No report.
Shifted in shortly after the start, made contact with RICH HORSE and became unbalanced.

Near the 100 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of CRYSTAL POWERFUL to continue into clear running.  After the event Y L Chung stated that with the horse receiving pressure in the early stages from CRYSTAL POWERFUL it did not appreciate racing inside that horse and as a result finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.

Shortly after the start was crowded between YOUNG ARROW and CALIFORNIA DEEPLY, both of which shifted ground.  After the event H Bentley reported that his mount travelled only fairly during the race and finished off in a one-paced manner in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then raced tight between TEAM HAPPY and TACTICAL COMMAND, both of which shifted ground slightly.
No report.
No report.
Stumbled on jumping and shorty after was steadied when crowded between SUPER PACE and NOBLE FANS which shifted in.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1400 Metres raced keenly when being  crossed by PRESTIGE GOOD.  Approaching the 1300 Metres was bumped by SUPER SICARIO which was positioned tight to the inside of SILVER UP.

Near the 1500 Metres got its head up when being steadied to avoid PRESTIGE GOOD.  Near the 1300 Metres was bumped when racing tight to the inside of SILVER UP.  In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from MULTIDUTCH.  Lay in in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Was obliged to race wide and without cover from the 900 Metres.  After the event A Badel stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but JOLLY JUMPER did not show sufficient pace to do so, particularly with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

After the event J Orman reported that his mount did not travel well throughout the race and failed to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1100 Metres made contact with MULTIDUTCH due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount was caught wide in the early stages and as a result he was obliged to make some use of SILVER UP near the 1000 Metres to go forward to cross MULTIDUTCH.  He said his mount came under pressure from the 600 Metres and then gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of SILVER UP was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, SILVER UP will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 1100 Metres made contact with SILVER UP due to both runners shifting ground.  Approaching the 250 Metres was steadied to avoid SILVER UP which shifted in when giving ground.  The performance of MULTIDUTCH, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MULTIDUTCH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  H Bowman pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the concluding stages (see AESTHETICISM).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

H Bowman (JUMBO LEGEND) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he permitted his mount to shift in when not clear of AESTHETICISM, resulting in AESTHETICISM having to be checked to avoid JUMBO LEGEND.  As Jockey Bowman is suspended from riding in races on 4 June 2025, 28 June 2025 and 1 July 2025, the Stewards substituted the one-meeting penalty to a $60,000 fine in accordance with standard practice.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
On jumping was crowded between WIN BEAUTY VIVA and ALLCASH which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event A Badel stated that he was given the option to hold a more forward position.  He said when LUCKY TOUCH jumped well he elected to ride forward to cross runners to his inside and was able to lead the event.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions issued.
Near the 100 Metres shifted in and made contact with ABSOLUTE HONOUR.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when held up between FLYING FORTRESS and SAMARKAND.
Near the 100 Metres was bumped by HAMERON.

Noted to have sustained abrasions to the left hip and the tail base on arrival at Happy Valley.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event Apprentice E C W Wong stated that his mount again made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Shifted in at the start and made contact with SAMARKAND.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of O’LINER which shifted in and away from SWEET BRIAR despite the efforts of its rider.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  Near the 350 Metres raced tight to the inside of ISLAND BUDDY when that runner shifted in and away from ALWAYS MY FOLKS.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight H Bowman stated that THUNDER PRINCE commenced to run on strongly after straightening.  He said his initial intention was to improve between O’LINER and GENIUS BABY, however, when he observed GENIUS BABY commence to shift out he was of the opinion that run would close and as his mount was travelling strongly he elected to immediately shift to the outside of O’LINER with a view to following BITS SUPERSTAR into the race.  He said after being steadied and shifted to the outside of O’LINER he was unable to continue out as he had ISLAND BUDDY positioned to his outside which resulted in THUNDER PRINCE being held up for clear running until near the 200 Metres after which it finished the race off well when improving to the inside of BITS SUPERSTAR.  After considering his explanation the Stewards were satisfied that the tactics adopted by Jockey Bowman in the Home Straight were reasonable in the circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Was left racing wide and without cover from the 750 Metres.
No report.
Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when racing tight between BITS SUPERSTAR and ALWAYS MY FOLKS.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  Leaving the 150 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running between GENIUS BABY and O’LINER.
Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of its barrier and as a result jumped only fairly.

Near the 200 Metres was shifted to the outside of ALWAYS MY FOLKS to continue into clear running.  COUNTRY DANCER then raced tight between ALWAYS MY FOLKS and SWEET BRIAR over the final 150 Metres.  Over the concluding stages COUNTRY DANCER could not be ridden out when it continued to race tight between ALWAYS MY FOLKS and SWEET BRIAR.

After the event K C Leung stated that with the horse dropping down in grade it did not appreciate carrying 133 lbs and as a result found it difficult to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the event Y L Chung stated that his mount hung out throughout the race and gave ground when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1300 Metres was steadied to avoid SATIRICAL FAN.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Noted to have sustained an abrasion to the right hock on arrival at Happy Valley.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Crowded at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 1000 Metres was taken wider when SATIRICAL FAN shifted out.  VIVA GRACIOUSNESS then raced wide and without cover for the remainder of the event.
No report.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and bumped with AMAZING AWARD.  In the early stages shifted in and away from AMAZING AWARD, made contact with I P O BROS and as a result was steadied.  Lay in over the final 200 Metres.  After the event L Hewitson reported that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said the instructions were issued to him on the basis that FORTUNE STAR had led at its most recent start and had performed in a disappointing manner.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid I P O BROS which was giving ground.  THE AZURE then raced tight between I P O BROS and AMAZING AWARD for some distance thereafter.  Near the 200 Metres was shifted to the inside of SATIRICAL FAN to continue into clear running.  Over the concluding stages THE AZURE could not be ridden out when held up behind RUN RUN TIMING.

After the event J Orman reported that his mount raced keenly and hung out throughout the early and middle stages and near the 1000 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from ICONICAL.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.
Fractious in the starting gates, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  The performance of QUICK QUICK WIN, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  As this was the second consecutive occasion that QUICK QUICK WIN had finished tailed out, the horse will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Reared after being placed in the starting gates and sat down behind.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said the horse was lame in its left hind leg and found not to be suitable to race.  Acting on this advice SWAGGER BRO was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  The Stewards ruled that SWAGGER BRO will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in a barrier trial and being subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of JOHANNES BRAHMS and lay in when being shifted to the outside of CHANCHENG GLORY.
Near the 450 Metres was taken wider when bumped by HAPPY TOGETHER which shifted out.
Bumped at the start.  Shifted out near the 450 Metres, made contact with SUNLIGHT POWER and became unbalanced.

After the event H Bowman advised that the intention was to lead.  He said when PRAY FOR MIR showed superior pace in the early stages he elected to allow that horse to cross, particularly having regard to the fact that his mount was carrying top weight of 135 lbs.  He added in the Home Straight RED LION responded fairly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount enjoyed a good run behind the lead in the early stages but was disappointing under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, JOHANNES BRAHMS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

After the event Z Purton stated that his mount was unable to make up any ground in the Home Straight after settling back in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in at the start, made contact with the right side of its barrier, became unbalanced and lost ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between SKY CAP and WUKONG JEWELLERY which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 1100 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start became unbalanced when bumped by BUNDLE OF CHARM.  Approaching the 200 Metres raced tight between WATCH THIS ONE and BUNDLE OF CHARM which shifted in slightly.
No report.
Shortly after the start was bumped and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event L Hewitson stated that the instructions were to go forward.  He said whilst his mount jumped well it did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event K Teetan reported that near the 600 Metres his mount became unbalanced when racing close to the running rail.  He added that again making the Home Turn his mount became unbalanced before giving ground under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed that from an inside barrier he had instructed K Teetan to take up a forward position, similar to the manner in which it barrier trialed on 20 May 2025 when it led and performed well.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  In the middle stages raced keenly.

Jumped only fairly and then bumped with WATCH THIS ONE which shifted out.  After travelling a short distance was checked when crowded by SPORTS LEGEND which shifted in and away from SPICY GOLD when that runner shifted in after being taken in by BUNDLE OF CHARM.  Leaving the 1100 Metres was steadied when crowded by VERY GRATEFUL which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider as VERY GRATEFUL was being eased away from SPICY GOLD.  WAVE GARDEN then raced ungenerously in the middle stages and became unbalanced when being steadied whilst racing to the inside of VERY GRATEFUL.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages.  Near the 750 Metres was then checked to avoid AMAZING GALAXY when that runner was being steadied to allow HAPPY PARK to cross.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by PRESTIGE HALL which shifted in.  For some distance after the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid DIRIYA.  Approaching the 600 Metres was checked to avoid DIRIYA, shifted out and bumped CLUB ACE.  After the race the Veterinary Surgeon reported that the horse had sustained a minor wound to its right front cannon.

Leaving the 700 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by AMAZING GALAXY which shifted in and away from KA YING WARRIOR when racing tight to the inside of that runner.  Between the 400 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 750 Metres was steadied to avoid PRESTIGE HALL.  Near the 650 Metres became unbalanced when crowded between PRESTIGE HALL and BETTER AND BETTER which shifted out.

Approaching the finish was steadied when crowded by PRESTIGE HALL (H Bowman) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on KA YING WARRIOR at the request of Trainer T P Yung.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING WARRIOR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly.

Between the 450 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind LUCKY SYMPHONY.  Over the final 200 Metres could not be fully tested when it continued to race close behind LUCKY SYMPHONY.  After the event K Teetan reported that his mount raced keenly and after the 700 Metres shifted in and away from KA YING WARRIOR when positioned tight to the inside of that runner.

After the event L Ferraris stated that the intention was to lead.  He said despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to do so and when unable to cross KA YING WARRIOR his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added that in the Home Straight his mount was left without a finishing effort and raced greenly.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on MAGIC COMBO at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, MAGIC COMBO will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  Held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  In the Home Straight lay in and near the 250 Metres shifted in, resulting in its rider M F Poon having to straighten his mount.  After the event M F Poon reported that he had some concerns with his mount’s action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in the left front leg due to sustaining a fetlock injury to that leg.  Before being allowed to race again, FLYING ROMANTIC will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied when racing tight to the inside of SMART BEAUTY (A Badel) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  LUCKY GENERATIONS then raced keenly for some distance thereafter.  Near the 100 Metres was shifted to the outside of CIRCUIT FIERY to continue into clear running.
No report.

Fractious in the starting gates.  Before being allowed to race again, TATTENHAM will be required to perform satisfactorily in a stalls test.  Jumped awkwardly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 1000 Metres raced tight to the inside of LUCKY GENERATIONS.
Bumped shortly after the start.

After the event A Atzeni reported that his mount raced three wide, however was able to obtain cover and he could offer no reason as to why POCHETTINO failed to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Shortly after the start was crowded between BRAVE OF FRIENDS and FUNG which shifted in slightly.  After the event H Bentley reported that from a wide barrier his mount settled back in the field.  He said GLUCK RACER raced keenly in the event and did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start shifted in and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Bumped approaching the 1000 Metres.  Approaching the 350 Metres was shifted to the outside of RIDING HIGH to continue into clear running.

When questioned Z Purton stated that he was given no specific instructions but COURIER ALADDIN settled back in the field when it jumped only fairly and did not show early pace.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight he said soon after straightening he elected to shift to the outside of LUCKY ARCHANGEL when that runner shifted in slightly but then near the 350 Metres became held up behind SUPER UNIVERSAL.  He said as a result he then leaving the 200 Metres shifted to the inside of SUPER UNIVERSAL and LUCKY ARCHANGEL where he was able to secure clear running thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea and also found the horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out, made contact with RIDING HIGH and lost ground.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from GLACIATED.
Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running before being shifted to the inside of COURIER ALADDIN where it obtained clear running at the 200 Metres.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shortly after the start was crowded between GLACIATED and LUCKY ARCHANGEL which shifted out slightly.

Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 1000 Metres, when racing keenly, shifted out and away from STRAIGHT TO GLORY and made contact with EMBLAZON.  After the event A Atzeni reported that his mount had some difficulty obtaining clear running near the 300 Metres.  He said when the run presented GLACIATED responded only fairly to his riding thereafter and, in his opinion, may be suited by being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in at the start, made contact with RIDING HIGH and became unbalanced.  After the event Y L Chung reported that the intention was to hold a more forward position but his mount did not show sufficient pace in the early stages to do so.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was then checked between SIGHT DREAMER which jumped awkwardly and shifted out and EURO ROCKS which shifted in.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  After the event M Chadwick reported that his instructions were to lead but after being checked at the start settled further back than intended.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event H Bowman stated that the instructions were to lead the event.  He said despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to do so and as a result was crossed by NEW FOREST in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  In the Home Straight lay in and approaching the winning post B Avdulla was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Made contact with the left side of its starting gate and became unbalanced.  Briefly held up near the 400 Metres.  Approaching the 100 Metres was held up behind FASHION LEGEND and was shifted to that runner’s outside to obtain clear running.  Over the concluding stages VIVA CHALEUR shifted to the outside of MEEPMEEP to continue into clear running and as a result made contact with CELESTIAL HARMONY.
No report.
Near the 1300 Metres was steadied to avoid LUCKY IMPACT.  Approaching the winning post was hampered when bumped by VIVA CHALEUR.
No report.

After the event Apprentice E C W Wong could offer no excuse for the horse’s failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event K Teetan stated that his mount settled back in the field and found it difficult to make up ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration to an application from Jockey Y L Chung that his mount had been denied a fair start.  After taking evidence from Starter, Mr A Speechley, Trainer A S Cruz and Jockey Chung, the Stewards found that ALL ARE MINE reared simultaneously to the start being effected and lost ground and as a result was assisted by the starting gate handler.  As the Stewards were satisfied that such occurrence occurred simultaneously to the start being effected the horse was declared a runner.  The barrier manners of ALL ARE MINE were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ALL ARE MINE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.
Had its right hind plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

Near the 1300 Metres was steadied to avoid FASHION LEGEND.  Making the Home Turn lay out and was eased when positioned close to REGENCY WIN WIN.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY IMPACT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Made contact with the left side of its barrier on jumping and lost ground.  Over the final 200 Metres lay out under pressure and proved difficult to ride out.
No report.

When questioned Z Purton confirmed the instructions were to endeavour to go forward.  He said despite riding his mount along in the early stages GALLANT EPOCH did not show any early speed and as a result settled further back than what had been intended.  Trainer K W Lui confirmed the instructions issued and advised that the horse would be better suited by being stepped up in distance again.
Near the 300 Metres was eased when crowded between DAZZLING FIT and MR COOL, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  The Veterinary Surgeon reported that the horse had sustained lacerations to the right hind pastern after the race.

Bounded on jumping.  The Veterinary Surgeon reported that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, VON BAER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Near the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid MR COOL when MR COOL gave ground when being shifted in to obtain cover.  The performance of MR JUSTICE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MR JUSTICE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned H Bowman stated that the instructions were to endeavour to find cover.  He said with the hood being removed from the horse today it jumped well and when caught wide in the early stages he was obliged to allow his mount to stride forward to cross to the lead.  He added, in his opinion, EXCEL WONGCHOY was not suited by being ridden in this manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, EXCEL WONGCHOY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 30.5.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left hind) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter KING LOTUS.  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIA STAR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the 300 Metres endeavoured to obtain a narrow run between LADY’S CHOICE and COPARTNER PRANCE.  When LADY’S CHOICE shifted out VICTOR THE WINNER then became held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.  Again over the final 150 Metres VICTOR THE WINNER could not be ridden out when held up between LADY’S CHOICE and COPARTNER PRANCE which lay in and away from PATCH OT THETA despite the efforts of its rider A Badel.
Near the 50 Metres was bumped by VICTOR THE WINNER.
No report.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Approaching the 150 Metres shifted in when improving to the inside of MAGIC CONTROL and as a result made contact with BEAUTY WAVES, resulting in MUGEN becoming unbalanced for some distance thereafter.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when racing tight to the inside of LADY’S CHOICE which shifted in and away from VICTOR THE WINNER.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 150 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by MUGEN and as a result became unbalanced when those two runners made contact for some distance thereafter.
Near the 50 Metres, when giving ground, was eased when crowded by LADY’S CHOICE which shifted in slightly.
Near the 250 Metres race tight between TIER FLY and RIGHTEOUS ARION which shifted out slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event L Ferraris stated that his mount hung in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A Badel was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.

Approaching the 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when attempting to improve into a narrow run to the inside of RIGHTEOUS ARION.  As a result STELLAR SWIFT could not be ridden out fully to the finish when it continued to race tight to the inside of RIGHTEOUS ARION.
Jumped awkwardly.  Crowded leaving the 600 Metres.
Approaching the 900 Metres was steadied when being shifted behind SAVVY BRILLIANT to obtain cover.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event Apprentice E C W Wong reported that the instructions were to endeavour to lead the event.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside in the early stages his mount settled further back than intended.  He added SUPER LEGENDS lay in in the middle stages and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A Atzeni was fined the sum of $2,000 for failing to present himself in the Parade Ring by the required time.  In the early stages raced keenly and approaching the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied to obtain a position behind REGAL GEM.  SAVVY BRILLIANT continued to race keenly in the middle stages.  Leaving the 600 Metres shifted in when racing tight to the inside of CHARMING BABE, made contact with KEMPES and became unbalanced.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Over the final 150 Metres was positioned close to KEMPES and as a result could not be fully ridden out.

Raced keenly in the early stages when being crossed by RIGHTEOUS ARION.
Shortly after the start bumped with SUPER LEGENDS and then was crowded by TIER FLY which shifted in.  In the Home Straight lay in.

After the event K C Leung confirmed that with the horse dropping back in distance he was instructed to ride it in a conservative manner in the early stages from the outside barrier.  He added that in the Home Straight his mount did not respond to his riding and was coughing.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, TURIN STARSPANGLED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <2/6/2025 Additional Veterinary Reports> TURIN STARSPANGLED, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in its trachea. TURIN STARSPANGLED was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P C Ng yesterday morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be swollen in its left front fetlock. As previously advised, TURIN STARSPANGLED will be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned H Bowman stated that he was given no specific instructions other than to settle where comfortable.  He said with the early stages of the event being run at a genuine pace CROSSBORDERPEGASUS settled further back than what he had anticipated.  He said when placed under pressure in the Home Straight, whilst his mount lay in, it responded to his efforts to shift to the outside of EVERYONE’S STAR.  He added when placed under pressure near the 200 Metres CROSSBORDERPEGASUS hung in and as a result he was not able to fully test the horse over the final 200 Metres.  Trainer J Size stated that he had applied blinker with one cowl to the horse today in an attempt to improve its racing manners and would now consider giving the horse a break from racing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The Stewards determined that as a warning was placed on the horse’s racing manners at its last race start it will now be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and ridden out in that barrier trial to demonstrate to the Stewards that its racing manners have improved prior to being permitted to race again.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
In the Home Straight hung in and proved difficult to ride out.

After being placed in the starting gates became fractious, lowered its head and a result was removed, inspected by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to start. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. He added the horse also appeared to race "flat” today.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. He said in the early stages WINNING GOLD did not travel strongly and was not travelling well enough to cross runners to his inside which resulted in WINNING GOLD racing wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added in the Home Straight WINNING GOLD responded fairly to his riding, however, he was not too disappointed with the performance having regard to the wide run that the horse endured during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then was steadied when crowded between GENTLEMEN LEGACY and MAGNIFICENT NINE which shifted out after being bumped by YOUNG BRILLIANT. For some distance in the early stages was crowded for room when racing tight to the inside of STORM RUNNER which was in turn racing tight to the inside of GO GO GO (A Atzeni).  A Atzeni was severely reprimanded and advised that he must provide sufficient racing room for runners to his inside.
Shifted out soon after the start and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover from near the 900 Metres when it commenced a forward move.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

M L Yeung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 450 Metres (see SUPER TREASURE).  Approaching the 450 Metres improved into a run where there was insufficient room and as a result became unbalanced when racing tight between STORM RUNNER and SUPER TREASURE.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind GO GO GO.
Jumped only fairly.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  M L Yeung (JOYFUL CHAMPION) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 450 Metres he improved into a position between STORM RUNNER and SUPER TREASURE where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in JOYFUL CHAMPION then racing tight to the inside of STORM RUNNER and resulting in SUPER TREASURE being checked when it lost its rightful running.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 25 June 2025 and to expire on Sunday, 29 June 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  The performance of SUPER TREASURE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SUPER TREASURE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
