Jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start was then steadied when crowded between ISLAND GOLDEN and LUCKY GOLD.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  For some distance after the 1000 Metres raced keenly when positioned tight to the inside of POCHETTINO which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between EVER SMART and SKY PROPHET (A Hamelin) which shifted in after bumping with FIRE BALL.  A Hamelin was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Approaching the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between YOUNG HORIZON which shifted out after securing clear running to the outside of THE CONCENTRATION and EVER SMART (A Badel) which shifted in.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied when crowded by TAIHANG SCENERY which shifted in and away slightly from RUBY SAILING (Apprentice P N Wong) which shifted in when not clear before being corrected.  Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded and advised she must ensure that she leaves sufficient racing room for runners to her inside.   Approaching the 700 Metres was checked to avoid TAIHANG SCENERY.  Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres had some difficulty obtaining clear running.  Over the final 150 Metres lay out under pressure.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the event Z Purton reported that his mount did not stretch out during the running of the race and he had some concerns with its action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a wound to its left hind leg.  Before being allowed to race again, MY FLYING ANGEL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  In the middle stages raced keenly and approaching the 800 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from MY FLYING ANGEL.  Near the 250 Metres rider C L Chau dropped his whip.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After being crossed by RUBY SAILING near the 800 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied away from RUBY SAILING.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event K Teetan could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event A Hamelin reported that his mount raced "flat”.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <9/6/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>SPICY SO SMART, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. SPICY SO SMART was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer W K Mo this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, SPICY SO SMART will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Fractious in the starting gates and jumped awkwardly.  After the event, M Chadwick reported that his mount failed to run on in the Home Straight and had a tendency to shy out away from the inside.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping was bumped by BRAVE WITNESS which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race. <11/6/2025  8 June 2025 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 4 (740)> The Stewards tonight questioned A Badel in relation to the tactics he adopted in the middle stages of the event when the winner PING HAI COMET was able to shift out and improve into the race near the 600 Metres. A Badel stated that ETALON OR settled closer than intended and raced keenly during the early and middle stages of the event. He said from the 700 Metres his mount came under pressure and when EVERYONE’S CLASSIC then improved forward and shifted out, he lost the position behind that horse. He added as a result PING HAI COMET was able to shift out near the 600 Metres and he felt at that stage his best option was to follow PING HAI COMET into the race as it was travelling strongly. The Stewards noted the explanation provided by Jockey Badel.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start was crowded when bumped by TEAM TEAM FOLKS which shifted in.
On jumping shifted out and made contact with WARRIORS DREAM.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.
Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.

Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  After the event K Teetan reported that his mount, which was having its second race start, raced greenly during the race and would derive benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

On jumping was bumped and became unbalanced.  After the event L Hewitson reported that his instructions were to take up a more forward position than its previous starts.  He said in the early and middle stages he was obliged to make use of his mount to endeavour to cross BRIGHT DAY and as a result WARRIORS DREAM was forced to race wide and without cover until near the 600 Metres.  Trainer D Eustace confirmed the instructions issued.

After the event L Ferraris reported that his instructions were to go forward.  He said in the early stages GALLANT REX got its head up when being steadied to allow WONDERSTAR to cross but then in the middle stages hung out making the turns and as a result ran wide.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners and performance of GALLANT REX, which finished tailed out, were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GALLANT REX will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Became fractious in the starting gates, resulting in its rider M L Yeung being dislodged.  M L Yeung was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his race riding engagement.  Leaving the 500 Metres was steadied when crowded between BRIGHT DAY and MIRACLE FIGHTER (Y L Chung) which shifted to the outside of PERFECTDAY.  Y L Chung was advised to exercise more care.  After the event, M L Yeung reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.  The performance of EVERYONE’S GALLOP, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, EVERYONE’S GALLOP will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Between the 550 Metres and the 450 Metres was held up for clear running behind ACE WAR when that runner commenced to give ground.
Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding from the 600 Metres and if there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of BRAVE WITNESS, K De Melo stated that he was given no specific instructions other than to settle where comfortable and give the horse a chance to run on in the Home Straight.  He said after following BRAVE WITNESS from the 600 Metres he was reluctant to improve to that runner’s outside as he felt it was too soon to do so as CARRYON SMILING races best when held up for a late run in the Home Straight.  He added that when BRIGHT INHERITANCE improved to his outside near the 500 Metres this then resulted in CARRYON SMILING being held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 400 Metres.  He said after the 400 Metres he then looked to improve to the inside of EVERYONE’S CLASSIC but when CARRYON SMILING did not respond to his riding and EVERYONE’S CLASSIC shifted in near the 300 Metres he was then obliged to ease and shift to the outside of EVERYONE’S CLASSIC to continue into clear running.  After considering his evidence Jockey De Melo agreed with the Stewards that in retrospect he should have shifted to the outside of BRAVE WITNESS approaching the 500 Metres to provide his mount with a clear opportunity to improve into the race sooner than he was able to.
No report.

Soon after the start shifted out and made contact with HAPPY UNIVERSE.  Shortly after then became unbalanced when racing tight between ACE WAR and HAPPY UNIVERSE which shifted in.  After the event M L Yeung stated that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to go forward from a wide barrier and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  After the event J Orman confirmed that he was instructed to hold a more forward position if possible.  He said in the early and middle stages TIMES TABLE was reluctant to improve to the inside of other runners.  He said after being held up for clear running near the 400 Metres when being steadied to avoid PEARL OF PANG’S, TIMES TABLE finished the race off only fairly.  He added that near the 100 Metres TIMES TABLE again was reluctant to improve between MATSU VICTOR and CALIFORNIA SUN and in this incident made contact with CALIFORNIA SUN when TIMES TABLE shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Leaving the 50 Metres made contact with TIMES TABLE which shifted out.  After the event M Chadwick reported that his whip was knocked from his grasp by the whip of K Teetan, the rider of PEARL OF PANG’S, near the 300 Metres.  After the event M Chadwick reported that the intention was to hold a more forward position but after his mount jumped only fairly and then shifted in and was eased to avoid ETALON OR, it did not show sufficient pace to do so.  He added in the Home Straight CALIFORNIA SUN finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

Bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, ACE WAR will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Crowded at the start.  After the event J Orman reported that his mount raced "flat” today.  Trainer K W Lui advised that he would now give the horse a let-up.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned L Ferraris stated that his instructions were to go forward.  He said in the early stages when positioned to the outside of DROMBEG BANNER he had initially expected that horse to go forward and cross DANCING CODE.  He said when DROMBEG BANNER did not continue forward he then commenced to urge his mount forward with a view to crossing DROMBEG BANNER.  He added as he did so DROMBEG BANNER was then ridden forward near the 900 Metres and as a consequence HEALTHY HAPPY was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Before being allowed to race again, TOP PEAK will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, GO GENERAL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Apprentice P N Wong (CHEVAL VALIANT) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that shortly after the start she allowed her mount to shift out when not clear of BINGO BABE, resulting in BINGO BABE having to be severely checked to avoid CHEVAL VALIANT.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Saturday, 28 June 2025 and to expire on Sunday, 6 July 2025 on which day she may resume race riding (3 Hong Kong racedays – as she is not eligible to ride at Happy Valley).  In addition, Apprentice Wong was fined the sum of $15,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered her poor race riding record.  Leaving the 600 Metres improved into a run when there was not quite sufficient room to do so and as a result was crowded shortly after when HAPPY ACTION shifted out.  Near the 500 Metres BINGO BABE was crowded by HAPPY ACTION which again shifted out.  As a result BINGO BABE could not be fully tested between the 500 Metres and the 300 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.

Passing the 1100 Metres was checked to avoid NUCLEOZOR when that runner lost ground quickly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
After the 1100 Metres shifted in and away from SUPER UNICORN and was corrected by its rider.
Bumped near the 600 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, DRAGON JOY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On jumping shifted out, made contact with SUPER UNICORN and became unbalanced. As a result VIEW OF THE WORLD then shifted in and away from SUPER UNICORN as VIEW OF THE VIEW was also being corrected by its rider C L Chau, resulting in THE ABSOLUTE then being badly crowded for room by VIEW OF THE WORLD and having to be checked and THE ABSOLUTE then shifting in, badly crowding NUCLEOZOR which was severely checked when it lost its running.  As the Stewards were satisfied that both M Chadwick and C L Chau had made their best endeavours to prevent their mounts from shifting in no action was taken.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

<9/6/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>The Veterinary Surgeon reported that SAL was lame in its left front leg on the morning after racing. Before being allowed to race again, SAL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

In the middle stages lay out, resulting in its rider B Thompson having to correct his mount on a number of occasions.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied when positioned close to THE ALL ROUNDER.  Over the concluding stages, when placed under pressure, then lay out and was steadied when positioned close to THE ALL ROUNDER.

Leaving the 600 Metres BINGO BABE (K Teetan) improved into a run between HAPPY ACTION and AMAZING FUN where there was doubtful room.  A short distance later HAPPY ACTION (B Thompson), which was having its first race start, lay out, resulting in BINGO BABE being taken out onto AMAZING FUN and causing DANCING CLASSICS to be severely checked when crowded by AMAZING FUN.  K Teetan was reprimanded and advised to ensure that he improves into runs where there is sufficient room to do so.  B Thompson was also reprimanded and advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to make a greater effort to straighten his mounts than what he did on this occasion.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a laceration to the right front cannon.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded for room between NOBLE DELUXE which shifted in and away from STRAIGHT TO GLORY and THE ALL ROUNDER which shifted out slightly.

Sent for sampling post-race.

Was examined by the Veterinary Officer at the Start and passed suitable to race.  On jumping was steadied when crowded between SOARING BRONCO and FORERUNNER which was taken out by RUN RUN TIMING.  After the event L Ferraris stated that his mount did not travel well during the event and failed to change its lead leg during the race. After arriving at the starting gates was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be lame in front and as such was not suitable to race.  Acting on this advice LESLIE was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, LESLIE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

Shifted out at the start and made contact with FORERUNNER.  When questioned A Atzeni stated that his mount gave him no concern when it was proceeding to the starting gates.  He said soon after the start he had concern with the action of RUN RUN TIMING and then when it failed to respond to his urgings to go forward and he was concerned there was something amiss with the horse he retired it from the event leaving the 1500 Metres.  Trainer C H Yip advised that the horse had pleased him in the lead up to the race and in particular it had worked well on Monday, 9 June 2025 when ridden by Jockey Atzeni who provided positive feedback following its gallop.  He said RUN RUN TIMING had not displayed any issues within the stable and he was surprised that Jockey Atzeni had identified concerns with the horse’s action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The Stewards ruled that RUN RUN TIMING will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to run again.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event L Ferraris reported that his mount raced "flat” during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Z Purton stated that with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time GLORIOUS JOURNEY found it difficult to run on in the Home Straight, particularly racing first up from a 119-day break and carrying top weight of 135 lbs.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of GLORIOUS JOURNEY was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race start.  Before being allowed to race again, GLORIOUS JOURNEY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start bumped with FOREVER GLORIOUS.

Bumped at the start.  After the event B Thompson reported that the intention was to hold an on-pace position.  He said in the early stages when caught wide and without cover to the outside of GLORIOUS JOURNEY he attempted to go forward and cross that runner after the 1000 Metres but his mount did not show sufficient pace to do so which resulted in YODA’S CHOICE having to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of YODA’S CHOICE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, YODA’S CHOICE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event Z Purton stated that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race and gave ground when under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer D A Hayes stated that from a wide barrier and with blinkers being applied for the first time he had instructed Jockey Purton to take up a forward position.  He added as a result Jockey Purton was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to comply with the instructions and as a result the horse was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  As this was the second occasion that TOP THRONE had raced in a disappointing manner, the horse will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped shortly after the start.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early part of the Home Straight Z Purton stated that after improving to the inside of FLAGSHIP WARRIOR approaching the 400 Metres he then elected to shift out to follow CALIFORNIA BANNER near the 350 Metres.  He said his decision to shift out was influenced by the fact that CALIFORNIA BANNER shifted to the outside of MISTER DAPPER and he had expected CALIFORNIA BANNER to improve into the race.  He added when CALIFORNIA BANNER did not quicken as he had expected he then eased his mount near the 300 Metres and shifted to the inside of CALIFORNIA BANNER where he secured clear running.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Purton were reasonable in the circumstances, however, the Stewards were of the opinion that his better option would have been to immediately follow MISTER DAPPER through to provide his mount with clear running sooner than it had obtained.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A Badel (SAVVY TWINKLE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 300 Metres he endeavoured to obtain a run between LAHORE and MEGA BONUS where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in SAVVY TWINKLE making heavy contact with LAHORE which became badly unbalanced and also resulting in SAVVY TWINKLE having to be checked when disappointed for clear running between MEGA BONUS and LAHORE and SAVVY TWINKLE then shifting in across the running of NEVER TOO SOON, resulting in NEVER TOO SOON having to be steadied to avoid SAVVY TWINKLE.  A Badel was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 16 July 2025 at Happy Valley.  In addition, Jockey Badel was fined $50,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Z Purton was reprimanded and advised that on this occasion he should have relieved the pressure being placed on STELLAR SWIFT sooner than what he did.  H Bowman was also interviewed in relation to his left arm extending from his body.  He stated that as he was required to place pressure on his left rein to prevent his mount being taken in, this resulted in his left elbow extending away from his body.  After considering the evidence and in particular the evidence of Jockey Purton who said he did not feel any contact from Jockey Bowman’s elbow in this incident the Stewards took no direct action, however, Jockey Bowman was advised that, wherever possible, he should ensure that his arms remain in the confines of his body. When questioned Z Purton stated that the instructions were to obtain a position with cover behind midfield.   He said after his mount commenced well he looked to comply with his instructions, however, when a number of runners positioned to his inside held their position he was left racing very wide in the early stages.  He said as a consequence he then elected to shift his mount behind runners leaving the 1000 Metres to avoid racing wide and to obtain a position with cover as instructed.  He said as a consequence SOLID IMPACT settled at the rear of the field and further back than he had intended.  He added making the Home Turn he improved to the inside of CONSPIRACY WITNESS but then became held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and leaving the 400 Metres behind ROMANTIC PARTY.  He said after the 400 Metres he was able to shift to the inside of ROMANTIC PARTY where SOLID IMPACT finished the race off well.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions and advised that the horse had settled further back in the field than had been intended.  Having regard to Jockey Purton’s explanation the Stewards found the tactics that he adopted in the early stages were reasonable to avoid having the horse cover additional ground. The performance of CIRCUIT DUFFY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CIRCUIT DUFFY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of ONE AND ONLY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ONE AND ONLY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and found to be lame in its left front leg.  Acting on this advice PRECISION GOAL was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, PRECISION GOAL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  When questioned M Chadwick stated that the instructions were from the outside barrier to endeavour to obtain a position with cover back in the field.  He said in the early stages he attempted to comply with his instructions but when runners to his inside held their position and his mount commenced to race keenly this resulted in LUCKY SAM GOR being caught very wide and without cover.  He added that passing the 1000 Metres as his mount continued to race keenly he attempted to obtain a position behind HANDSOME BLOND but when SUGAR BALL held its position to his inside LUCKY SAM GOR was then obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.

Making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight endeavoured to improve into a narrow run to the inside of KA YING GLORY where there was not sufficient room to improve.  As a result GOLDEN LUCK was held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres when it shifted to the outside of KA YING GLORY.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to LUCKY SAM GOR.

Leaving the 400 Metres was steadied to avoid RAGING RAPIDS when disappointed for clear running to that runner’s inside.  As a result  ONLY U was held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
On jumping was crowded between HANDSOME BLOND and BEAUTY MISSILE which shifted in.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid SUGAR BALL.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between AUDACIOUS PURSUIT and GOLDEN LUCK which shifted out.  Between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.
Jumped awkwardly and was then bumped shortly after by LUCKY SAM GOR.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped at the start.  After the event Z Purton stated that his mount raced too keenly in the early and middle stages and as a result gave ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer D A Hayes concurred with the views of Jockey Purton and also advised that KA YING GLORY was unsuited by the delay of the start of this race due to the late withdrawal of SECOND TO NONE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  The performance of KA YING GLORY was considered disappointing as compared to its most recent race start.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING GLORY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start. Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. The performance of HANDSOME BLOND, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HANDSOME BLOND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and found to be lame in its left front leg.  Acting on this advice SECOND TO NONE was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, SECOND TO NONE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 100 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a narrow run between NEBRASKAN and AMAZING AWARD.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Sustained a small abrasion to the right hip whilst being transported to Happy Valley.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event K Teetan stated that his mount was disadvantaged when it was unable to improve into the event from the 600 Metres due to NAMJONG KINGDOM commencing to give ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Making the Home Turn was taken wider when JUBILANT WINNER shifted out to improve.

Approaching the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between SATIRICAL FAN and WAH MAY WAI WAI  which was taken out by NEBRASKAN (A Hamelin).  A Hamelin was advised to exercise more care.  CHAIN OF GOLD then had difficulty obtaining clear running for the remainder of the event and could not be fully ridden out to the finish.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, CHAIN OF GOLD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Y L Chung stated that his mount did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position and as a result was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added as a result his mount gave ground under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover until near the 900 Metres.  After the event J Orman stated that when caught wide in the early stages he elected to allow the horse to stride forward to avoid covering additional ground which resulted in NAMJONG KINGDOM settling closer than expected.  He added in the Home Straight his mount gave ground quickly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NAMJONG KINGDOM, which finished tailed out on the second occasion in recent starts, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again,  NAMJONG KINGDOM will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event K C Leung reported that he was instructed to hold a midfield position.  He said from barrier 1 his mount commenced well and held an on-pace position without having any pressured applied to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned H Bentley stated that his instructions were to go forward and lead if possible.  He said whilst his mount commenced well, ARIEL, which was positioned to his inside, also jumped well and showed intent on holding a forward position.  He said making the first turn he was able to improve past ARIEL where he held an advantage on the horse and he considered continuing forward to cross that runner.  He said when he received a call from Apprentice E C W Wong, the rider of ARIEL, near the 1300 Metres he formed the opinion that runner would maintain its position to his inside and for this reason he did not continue forward to cross that runner as he felt this would result in the pace of the event increasing which would have been to the detriment of his mount.  He added that in hindsight, given the early stages of the event were run outside of standard time, he may have been better suited by continuing forward to cross ARIEL.
Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Slow to begin.
No report.
No report.

Throughout the early and middle stages raced keenly.  After the event M Chadwick reported that his mount did not appreciate the "Wet Slow” conditions on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Near the 500 Metres shifted out and made contact with NOBLE PURSUIT when improving to the outside of TURIN MASCOT.

After the event B Avdulla reported that with his mount stepping up in distance he was instructed to hold a more forward position.  He added that his mount did not appreciate the "Wet Slow” conditions on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Had its left front plate refitted in the Parade Ring.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event Z Purton reported that his mount did not appear to appreciate the "Wet Slow” track conditions and also may have come to the end of its preparation.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have an epiglottic entrapment.  The performance of CHILL KAKA was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, CHILL KAKA will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  Bumped near the 500 Metres.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 1100 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by TOP DRAGON and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  Near the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid TOP DRAGON.
On jumping made heavy contact with the left side of its starting gate, resulting in its rider H T Mo also making heavy contact with the starting gate and becoming unbalanced.

After the event J Orman stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position preferably with cover.  He said in the early stages he elected to continue forward to cross runners to his inside which resulted in his mount leading the event.
Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was crowded between WAVE GARDEN and RISING FROM ASHES, both of which shifted ground.
Was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between BEAUTY BOLT and WAVE GARDEN which was commencing to give ground.  After being shifted to the inside of WAVE GARDEN leaving the 400 Metres TOP DRAGON was then able to be ridden out until near the 250 Metres when it was steadied when disappointed for clear running between SUGAR SUGAR and FIND MY LOVE which resulted in TOP DRAGON being held up between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres.  Over the final 150 Metres TOP DRAGON could not be fully ridden out when awkwardly placed close to SUGAR SUGAR.  Z Purton was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1100 Metres he endeavoured to improve into a run where there was insufficient room to do so between RISING FROM ASHES and THE RED HARE, resulting in TOP DRAGON having to be checked when disappointed for that run and also resulting in BEAUTY ALLIANCE, which was following, having to be steadied to avoid TOP DRAGON.  In accordance with previous practices, Z Purton was fined the sum of $120,000 in lieu of a two-day suspension.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Near the 1100 Metres was steadied away from TOP DRAGON.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  Before being allowed to race again, MR BOLT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
On jumping was bumped by MR DESIRA which shifted out, resulting in BEAUTY THUNDER becoming unbalanced, shifting in and having to be corrected by its rider.
On jumping was crowded and became unbalanced.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind ROBOT LUCKY STAR.

Lay in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  After the event H Bentley stated that his mount jumped awkwardly, travelled comfortably in the early and middle stages but did not finish the race off when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start, made contact with the right side of its barrier and lost ground.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
After the event Apprentice E C W Wong could offer no explanation for his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

As the start was effected lunged forward when MULTIDUTCH became fractious, resulting in HAPPY ACTION making contact with the front gates of the starting gates as it jumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Had its right hind plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Shortly after the start was severely checked when crowded between EXTREME BOMB and BEAUTY THUNDER which shifted out abruptly despite the efforts of its rider A Badel after being bumped by MR DESIRA (H Bentley) which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  As the Stewards were satisfied that both A Badel and H Bentley had endeavoured to correct their mounts as soon as they shifted ground, no action was taken.
Shortly after the start was severely checked when crowded between NOBLE DELUXE and SUPERB GUY.

As the start was effected lunged forward, made contact with the left side of its barrier and as a result was very slow to begin.  The barrier manners of MULTIDUTCH were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MULTIDUTCH will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Briefly held up for clear running approaching the 400 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the finish raced tight between SPIRIT OF PEACE and CHINA WIN.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Crowded shortly after the start by LEATHER MASTER.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed that from a wide barrier the instructions were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Shortly after the start was then steadied when crowded by LEATHER MASTER (A Badel) which shifted in.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  In the early stages raced keenly when being eased to obtain cover.
Jumped only fairly.

Kicked a rail at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  After the event L Ferraris stated that from a wide barrier he was provided with the option of taking up a forward position and lead if the circumstances permitted.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and shifted out when being steadied to avoid GLORIOUS RYDER.  FLAGSHIP WARRIOR then continued to race keenly and near the 500 Metres again shifted out when being steadied away from BOWSER.
Bumped at the start.

Leaving the 500 Metres was eased when briefly held up behind LUCKY YEAR.  Near the 50 Metres made contact with LAKESHORE HERO due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event Z Purton stated that his mount would be benefited by being stepped back up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 1000 Metres raced keenly and was steadied when being crossed by MAGIC COMBO.  Near the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of MAGIC COMBO when MAGIC COMBO shifted out slightly.  After the event A Atzeni reported that his mount jumped only fairly and as a result settled further back than anticipated.  He added in the Home Straight the horse was unable to make up any appreciable ground when placed under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 50 Metres made contact with FORTUNATE SON due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event K De Melo reported that his mount made a respiratory noise after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, LAKESHORE HERO will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event K Teetan stated that his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the race and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <2/7/2025 Additional Veterinary Reports> BOWSER, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. BOWSER was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer P F Yiu this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. Before being allowed to race again, BOWSER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Near the 200 Metres was eased when racing tight to the inside of LEATHER MASTER.

Jumped only fairly.  Trainer Y S Tsui advised that the intention was to ride the horse in a more forward position.  After the event H T Mo stated that despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.

After the event M F Poon reported that after travelling comfortably in the lead his mount gave ground in the Home Straight and, in his opinion, did not run out the 1800 Metres of today’s race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start blundered badly when crowded by SUPER HONG KONG which shifted in abruptly despite the efforts of its rider K Teetan.  Passing the 50 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running to the inside of LAPRAS and as a result was shifted to that runner’s outside to obtain clear running over the concluding stages.

After the event J Orman explained that despite riding his mount along throughout the early and middle stages it did not respond to his efforts to hold a more forward position and failed to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

On jumping was bumped by U S S CONSTITUTION which shifted in.  After the event M L Yeung reported that his mount may have come to the end of its preparation.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <2/7/2025 Additional Veterinary Reports> JOYFUL CHAMPION, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. JOYFUL CHAMPION was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer C W Chang this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right hind leg. Before being allowed to race again, JOYFUL CHAMPION will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped. Lay in in the early part of the Home Straight, resulting in its rider Y L Chung changing his whip to his right hand approaching the 200 Metres.
Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.

After the event Z Purton stated that his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight when under pressure and made a respiratory noise.  Trainer M Newnham could offer no explanation for the horse’s performance but would now give the horse a break for the remainder of this racing season.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
B Thompson pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 100 Metres (see HERO SPARK).
In the early stages raced keenly.  Near the 300 Metres shifted in and made contact with SMART ENGINEER.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

On jumping was crowded between WONDERSTAR and MIRACLE FIGHTER which shifted in.  DIRIYA was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped near the 300 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages raced ungenerously and making the first turn hung out.  B Thompson (TURF PHOENIX) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift out when not clear of HERO SPARK, resulting in HERO SPARK losing its running and being checked.  In accordance with previous practices, B Thompson was fined the sum of $20,000 in lieu of a one-day suspension.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.

Just prior to entering the track slipped over, resulting in its rider H Bentley being dislodged.  JUDY’S GREAT was examined by the Veterinary Officer immediately after the incident and again upon arrival at the starting gates and passed suitable to race.  Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event H Bentley stated that his mount felt free in its action whilst proceeding to the Start and during the race but the horse did not appreciate the track conditions which, whilst still rated as "Good”, had effects of some light rain which had fallen during the meeting.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on the hindquarters by YOUNG CHAMPION near the 300 Metres.  As a result GUSTOSISIMO then lay in for some distance thereafter.
No report.

Held up from the 400 Metres to the 300 Metres. Approaching the 300 Metres improved into a narrow run between HEALTHY HAPPY and GUSTOSISIMO and as a result made contact with the hindquarters of GUSTOSISIMO.  YOUNG CHAMPION then raced tight to the inside of GUSTOSISIMO until near the 100 Metres.

Shifted in at the start, made contact with GUSTOSISIMO and became unbalanced.  Shortly after the start LO RIDER was then steadied to avoid GUSTOSISIMO when racing tight to the inside of TAJ DRAGON which shifted in after making contact with SWIFT ASCEND.  Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of YOUNG CHAMPION.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 200 Metres was steadied when crowded between SWIFT ASCEND which shifted in before being corrected by its rider M Chadwick and LO RIDER (H Bentley) which shifted out to improve when not quite clear.  H Bentley was advised to exercise more care.

After the event A Badel stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and did not travel well throughout the race before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event M F Poon stated that his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event when runners to his inside held their position.  He said this was the principal reason for the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

On jumping made contact with HEALTHY HAPPY, shifted in and then bumped with TAJ DRAGON.  After the event M Chadwick stated that the instructions were to hold a midfield position.  He said when his mount commenced well it settled in a more forward position in the early stages.  He added approaching the first turn he was obliged to make use of his mount to cross SOLEIL FIGHTER to avoid racing wide and as a consequence in the Home Straight SWIFT ASCEND did not respond to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between BRILLIANT EXPRESS and SWIFT ASCEND (M Chadwick) which shifted out and away from LO RIDER which shifted out.  M Chadwick was advised to exercise more care.

After the event K De Melo stated that his mount did not travel well throughout the race and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After being crossed by SOMETHING JONAH near the 1000 Metres then commenced to race keenly, got its head up and shifted out when being steadied away from SOMETHING JONAH near the 900 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Slow to begin.  Noted to have lost its right hind plate after the race.

Trainer D A Hayes stated that KA YING RADIANCE raced wide throughout the event and he would now give the horse a break for the remainder of this racing season. After the event M F Poon stated that he was instructed to hold a position forward of midfield as SOMETHING JONAH had been racing disappointingly when settling back at its most recent starts.

In the early part of the Home Straight hung in and had difficulty obtaining clear running when it proved reluctant to shift to the outside of MOTOR.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Leaving the 900 Metres was eased when being crossed by YOUNG FIGHTER.  Approaching the 500 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced when SUPER DRAGON  shifted to the outside of KING DANCE to commence a forward move.

Near the 150 Metres was eased when crowded between MOTOR and ALABAMA SONG which shifted out abruptly.  After the event M F Poon stated that the intention was to hold a midfield position.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to allow WINNING CHAMPION to continue forward to avoid covering additional ground.
No report.

After the event L Ferraris stated that the intention was to hold a midfield position but when his mount jumped only fairly it settled further back in the field.  He said approaching the first turn near the 900 Metres SUPER DRAGON, which was having it first race start, became badly unbalanced when reluctant to hold its position to the inside of JUST FOLLOW ME.  He said SUPER DRAGON then continued to race greenly for the remainder of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced greenly in the early stages and making the first turn lay out and shifted out and away from EMERGING STAR.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  A short distance later was steadied to avoid LIGHT YEARS GLORY (M Chadwick) which shifted in when not clear.  M Chadwick was severely reprimanded.  Approaching the first turn commenced to race keenly and shifted out when being steadied away from YOUNG FIGHTER.  EMERGING STAR then hung out making the first turn and as a consequence raced wide and without cover thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of YUEN LONG ELITE to obtain clear running and made contact with GOOD LUCK BABE.  After the event K Teetan stated that the instructions were to hold a more forward position but his mount did not show sufficient pace to do so despite riding it along in the early stages.
Made contact with a rail when entering the track, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passe suitable to race.  Approaching the 150 Metres was bumped by GLORIOUS SUCCESS.
Slow to begin.  Near the 100 Metres Z Purton was obliged to correct his mount when it shifted in towards SUPREME MASTERMIND.
Jumped only fairly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.

After the event B Avdulla reported that his mount enjoyed a comfortable run during the race but did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight and he could offer no explanation for its performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 150 Metres was checked when crowded between GOOD LUCK BABE which shifted out slightly after being bumped by GLORIOUS SUCCESS and FLYING LUCK (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in as it hung in.  After considering the evidence Apprentice Wong was reprimanded and advised whilst the Stewards were satisfied that he had made an endeavour to prevent his mount from shifting in, in the circumstances he should have made a greater effort to avoid crowding the running of WINNING GOLD.
Slow to begin.  Approaching the 100 Metres was checked when crowded between EXCELLENCE VALUE and FRANTANCK which was taken out by WINNING GOLD which shifted out after being checked.
Approaching the 500 Metres raced tight between GOOD LUCK BABE and WINNING GOLD which lay in.
Raced keenly after being crossed by KA YING SUPERB near the 1200 Metres.  Approaching the 100 Metres was hampered and taken out by WINNING GOLD.

After the event B Thompson reported that his mount raced too keenly in the middle stages and came under pressure prior to entering the Home Straight before giving ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, EIGHTY LIGHT YEARS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the event H T Mo reported that it was not the intention to lead but his mount raced keenly in the early stages and led without him pressuring the horse to do so.  He said due to the manner in which KINGDOM OF RICHES raced it set a faster tempo in the early stages than he had intended.  The performance of KINGDOM OF RICHES, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, KINGDOM OF RICHES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly and then raced tight between FLYING LUCK and GOOD LUCK BABE.  The performance of FIVEFORTWO, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FIVEFORTWO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Making the turn after the 600 Metres was bumped by TAIHANG SCENERY and became unbalanced when taken wider by TAIHANG SCENERY which shifted out when racing keenly.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 600 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from DOUBLE BINGO.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running when being shifted to the outside of FLYING PHANTOM.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between LUCKY GENERATIONS and TAIHANG SCENERY which shifted out.

No report.

The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, ISLAND GOLDEN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shortly after the start shifted out, made contact with ALL EYES ON ME and became unbalanced.

Jumped awkwardly, made heavy contact with the left side of its barrier and as a result lost ground. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTIFUL WIN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

He said as a result his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He said throughout the early and middle stages his mount did not travel comfortably and did not respond to his riding to attempt to hold a more forward position. He added on entering the Home Straight when he was concerned there may be something amiss with AEROVOLANIC when it again blundered, he then retired the horse from the event.  Trainer P C Ng stated that the horse had pleased him during the lead-up to today’s race and he expected it to perform well.  He said, in his opinion, the horse blundering soon after the start was the reason as to why its action may not have appeared to be right during the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of AEROVOLANIC was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, AEROVOLANIC will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

As a result HAPPY BOYS was held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres.
In the middle stages raced keenly.
No report.

After the event H Bentley advised that the intention was to take up a position with cover.  He said when he was complying with his instructions in the early stages LEAN MASTER raced keenly and near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid FORTUNE RACER, resulting in LEAN MASTER shifting out and racing wide and without cover thereafter.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions and said he issued those instructions as LEAN MASTER does not show sufficient pace over 1000 Metres to go forward and lead.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages got its head up when being shifted across behind runners from its wide barrier.

In the early stages raced keenly and approaching the 1100 Metres shifted out when being checked to avoid ACROSS DA UNIVERSE and as a result made contact with SMART TRIO and became unbalanced.  MEEPMEEP then continued to race keenly in the middle stages.  After the 200 Metres was shifted to the inside of GLORIOUS JOURNEY to continue into clear running.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between RED MAJESTY and MIGHTY STEED which shifted in after making contact with SMART CITY.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
Near the 1100 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by MEEPMEEP and as a result became unbalanced.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid MEEPMEEP.  After the event H Bentley reported that his mount was unsuited by the early stages of the event being run outside of standard time and as a result found it difficult to make up ground from back in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between WHIZZ KID and THE ALL OUT.  Near the 150 Metres LOOKING BRIGHT then raced tight to the inside of WHIZZ KID when that runner shifted in, resulting in LOOKING BRIGHT having difficulty obtaining clear running between the 150 Metres and the 50 Metres.

Bumped shortly after the start.  The Stewards opened an inquiry into Jockey C L Chau's riding of the horse and in particular the vigour he showed over the last 600 Metres of the event.  When questioned C L Chau stated that he was instructed to have the horse settle where comfortable and had anticipated taking up a midfield position.  He said making the turn after the 600 Metres his mount commenced to lay out and became awkward which he attributed to the horse having its first race start at Happy Valley.  He said as a result he was required to balance his mount through this section of the race which resulted in SIR CHARGE and THOUSAND SPIRIT improving past his mount.  He added that as he continued to make the bend after the 600 Metres it was necessary for him to balance the horse as it was still having difficulty making the turn and entering the Home Straight it took some time to fully balance up before he was able to fully ride his mount from near the 200 Metres.  He said over the final 200 Metres he continued to test the horse to the best of his ability in a hands and heels manner whereby his mount finished the race off strongly, particularly over the final 100 Metres.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions issued and stated that whilst the horse had numerous barrier trials leading into tonight’s race it had not barrier trialed at the Happy Valley circuit.  He said for this reason he had stressed to Jockey Chau to ensure that the horse was fully balanced before he applied full pressure to the horse in the Home Straight.  Mr Shum expressed satisfaction with the manner in which Jockey Chau rode FRIENDS OF SHAJING.  After considering the evidence the Stewards advised Jockey Chau that, in their opinion, he should have made a greater effort from the 600 Metres to hold his position to the inside of SIR CHARGE and in the Home Straight there was an opportunity for him to ride his mount with more vigour, particularly between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres after the horse had become fully balanced.  Jockey Chau was advised that he would be expected in future to ensure he rides in a manner so as to leave no room for query.
No report.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when held up behind CANDLELIGHT DINNER.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After improving to the inside of LOOKING BRIGHT making the Home Turn was then held up over the final 300 Metres and as a result could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.

After the event L Ferraris stated that his mount failed to show sufficient pace to cross runners to his inside in the early stages and as a result was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added that as a consequence YOUTHFUL SPIRITS did not respond strongly to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Blundered on jumping.  Near the 150 Metres became held up for clear running behind SUPERB CAPITALIST and then was bumped by LOOKING BRIGHT which shifted in.  THE ALL OUT then could not be ridden out over the final 150 Metres.  After the event B Thompson reported that his mount, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley, raced greenly before having difficulty obtaining clear running in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Y L Chung reported that his mount gave ground when under pressure in the Home Straight and raced like it had reached the end of its preparation.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

No report.

Leaving the 400 Metres endeavoured to improve into a narrow run between HAPPY PARK and WRITTEN CASA where there was doubtful room.  A short distance later WRITTEN CASA (M Chadwick) shifted to the outside of ENJOY GOLF to obtain clear running, resulting in COUNTRY DANCER having to be checked when disappointed for clear running between HAPPY PARK and WRITTEN CASA.  As the Stewards were satisfied that COUNTRY DANCER had not fully established clear running, they issued Jockey Chadwick with a severe reprimand for shifting out when not clear to do so.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres was badly held up for clear running behind HAPPY PARK which was commencing to give ground.

Bumped at the start.  Raced keenly in the early stages and near the 900 Metres was steadied away from COUNTRY DANCER.  Near the 100 Metres was shifted to the outside of ENJOY GOLF to obtain clear running and over the final 100 Metres raced tight between ENJOY GOLF and COUNTRY DANCER.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with PRIME MORTAR.  Near the 600 Metres shifted in and was steadied when placed in restricted room to the inside of FORTUNE WHISKEY.  Approaching the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between VIGOR ELLEEGANT and FORTUNE WHISKEY (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in after being bumped by BIENVENUE which shifted in slightly.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  As a result EXCEED THE WISH was held up for clear running between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres.

Near the 700 Metres made contact with HAPPY PARK due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event C L Chau stated that he went forward as instructed but his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a result weakened in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

After the event H Bowman reported that his mount came under pressure after entering the Home Straight and raced like it had reached the end of its preparation.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 700 Metres made contact with VIGOR ELLEEGANT due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event A Atzeni reported that his mount came under pressure on the Home Turn and gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HAPPY PARK was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY PARK will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 8.7.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen left front leg) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter EXCEED THE WISH.  Before being allowed to race again, SUMMIT CHEERS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Approaching the winning post was bumped by EMBRACES when that runner was taken in slightly by JUMBO LEGEND.  Z Purton pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 200 Metres (see PACKING HURRICANE).  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event K C Leung reported that his mount was pressured in the lead and as a result was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 250 Metres was bumped by CAMBRIDGE which lay in.  Z Purton (CAMBRIDGE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of PACKING HURRICANE, resulting in PACKING HURRICANE having to be checked to avoid CAMBRIDGE.  In accordance with previous practices, Z Purton was fined the sum of $120,000 in lieu of a two-day suspension.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings. <10/7/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> EVERSTAR, which performed disappointingly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings.  EVERSTAR was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer Y S Tsui this morning.  He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, EVERSTAR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
